reviews.text: I give one star out of 5 because of a few reasons. I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta (takeout since i had to wait 3 hours since they only had 3 tables available). When I got home, I tried it and it had no flavor. Literally no sauce. It was very bland and the pasta was stuck in a huge chunk. They didn&#39;t even give me any spoons or forks.
I had not been to The Cheesecake Factory in many years. I was not disappointed, the service was excellent and the food was delicious.<br>We would definitely visit again soon.

Sad to say, but the service was terrible &amp; my plate was salty. I normally love the Cheesecake Factory but this was my first time at this location at the grove. <br>Our server, Leonor, wasn&#39;t friendly or attentive. She forgot a beer, no big deal, but didn&#39;t apologize at any point. We waited 30 minutes for a beer, thats a little much. I ordered the Four Cheese Pasta &amp; it was really salty. I tried mixing it to maybe even it out, but it was almost unbearable. Leonor never checked to see how our food was. We also gave her our parking ticket to validate, she gave it back, but never actually validated it. Terrible service.

First of all, the wait for this location is a lot longer compared to other locations and like the other locations they do not take reservations. They used to have pagers that they gave you to tell you when your table is ready but they got rid of them because they would get lost. Apparently many patrons would put their name down, get handed a pager, would walk around and then decide not to wait leaving the pager whereever they were last. Because of this, they decided to go to a texting system where you leave your phone number and get a text when your table is ready. <br><br>There is balcony seating, which has been recently renovated to include booths that overlook the balcony...dinner with a view! Like all other cheesecake factory locations, the food has large portions and you will leave very satisfied. They also do provide parking validation, but I wouldn&#39;t come here just to eat. There are a lot of other locations with easier parking.

Love this location! Right inside the Grove, great place for groups. Went with a friend for Saturday brunch- yummy ! I made a reservation on Yelp the night before but it wasn&#39;t busy so you don&#39;t necessary need to make one if you go early. I usually get their cinnamon roll pancakes which are huge &amp; to dieeeee for but opted for the Cali omelette today and it was so flavorful! Large portion as it also came with breakfast potatoes and a bread side item (I got the English muffin with jam). Service was awesome as well. They validate 2 hours of parking. Fun fact- B&amp;N Wi-Fi reaches to cheesecake so my friend &amp; I were able to conduct our meeting with ease! Will definitely return.

Server was great to us, food was on point as usual - BUT- this visit was completely ruined when I had to watch the 3 kids (looked 18 , must have ordered drinks with fake ID) snort cocaine under the dining table in broad daylight. We were seated in the balcony deck and those kids were there for at least 2 hours, hadn&#39;t ordered any food yet. Has the Cheesecake Factory always been the daytime day care/ go-to for rich kids to snort cocaine under the table and in the bathroom?? Thank god i was born before 2000.

I most say the service here is not great. After a long day at work heading home wanted to order some food before they closed so I decided to call the order in and was place on hold for 15min. By the time I here and park my car and walk in to the restaurant I was still on hold talk to a manager and all he did was ask someone to take my and I even show him my phone that I was still on hold wow this is crazy.

Arielle, Thank you So Much For Such of Great Service.. Out of All The visits to CHEESECAKE Factory This Was Not Just A family Dinner You made this An Experience For all of Us.  We really Enjoyed Dinner But Your Customer Servise Was Incredible. I , my Husband, Mother , and Mothers Husband really Enjoyed Everything.   Thank you for the Recommendation on the Limonade/ iced tea. <br>         Thank you thank you.<br>              Happy Holidays
I love to go Cheesecake Factory my experience this time was so sad we are very hungry and wait time is 2:30 hours i wait but wen I get text I checked  in front desk but she said we are late

Great service. I ordered a cheesecake online for a birthday. I received a reminder call on the day of pick up, which was great. <br><br>The parking was free, no ticket needed (courtesy parking right now due to covid). I walked to the restaurant and the ladies at the bakery were so kind and friendly. They had my order ready in 1 min. I was in an out of the restaurant in 3 min. it was great! <br><br>Thank you for great service, and a beautiful cake. Just FYI got my hubby CARAMEL PECAN TURTLE CHEESECAKE it&#39;s his favorite. It&#39;s very rich and sweet incase anyone wants to order it prepare your self. lol. if your like me you&#39;ll just eat 1/3 of a slice at a time. He on the other hand was in heaven which was perfect since it was his birthday.

I placed an online order at 426pm  and it was suppose to be ready by 450pm. I arrived at location at 515pm and was told it wasn&#39;t ready yet then I was retold that they didn&#39;t even have an order for my name and was told I had to wait an additional fifteen minutes for a new replacement order.  Even had proof of an email saying I ordered and the time I ordered. Not even an apology or anything.  This is absurd and unacceptable for this company to have flaws in their online ordering system. I Get with everything going on but where&#39;s the customer service of apologizing. Very Disappointed

This is a super busy location. <br>Food is good. Service is fine. Our waiter couldn&#39;t hear us. Which is understandable- it&#39;s loud inside. <br>Food took awhile to come out. <br>Glad we came when it wasn&#39;t high season. We would have waited longer.

The manager (I use that title lightly) Cindy is a sorry excuse for a person who &#34;runs the show.&#34; Her words, not mine. <br><br>For someone that obviously has been in customer service for a number of years, she&#39;s appalling. Her staff sat us, and she yelled at them in front of us, then proceeded to try to remove us from our table. I tried to rationalize and talk about the situation, but she obviously cannot deal with stress. She literally got in my face and yelled at me. When I stood up for myself, she told me that I was &#34;out of control.&#34; People around us made comments about her erratic behavior because it was an extremely uncomfortable situation. Honestly, I was embarrassed for her, and myself for that matter, to even be talking to someone who clearly lacks any awareness of self. <br><br>To employ someone of her mental state is a concern. She is unstable, rude, and overall, not a great representation of who you want working there, let alone managing (again, using that term lightly). I&#39;m sad that I will not return to that location due to volatile staff.

This place is trashhhh! <br>There food has no taste, and the nachos are greasy AF! <br>They even messed up lemonade some how, like that&#39;s some talent right there!<br>I got a scampi shrimp &amp; they gave me 3 baby ass shrimps like..... what????<br>They also messed up the Mac n cheese, the Mac n cheese was watery ass hell! <br>JUST DONT COME HERE! ! !
They replied saying to contact them separately which I did, the same day. They have not replied but obviously they don&#39;t care what customers have to say.

What do you get for $176? 3 small portions of poorly served Jambalaya Pasta, chicken picatta with no capers, no complimentary bread, no butter (because there is no bread) and 4 slices of cheesecake. This was the second time that the order was a complete failure. Sad to say, there wont be a third time.

Cheesecake Factory always got me feelin some typa way. This one is probably the nicest one I&#39;ve ever been to. It&#39;s bougie and nice and a great date place.<br><br>I came here with a friend during lunch on a weekday, so there weren&#39;t many people, and we were attended to pretty promptly. You have to check-in at the first floor like a hotel (dang so extra LOL) and then come up the escalators to be greeted by a hostess. It&#39;s pretty spacious inside.<br><br>I ordered the Chicken Pasta off their Skinnylicious menu, so unfortunately didn&#39;t get the whole experience but let&#39;s be real, that entire menu is a blessing if you want to eat somewhat of a lean meal but still want great dining. Honestly though, I&#39;d come here for their bread alone. <br><br>Was impressed with the pasta, although wasn&#39;t anything super special; I probably could&#39;ve made it at home (and I&#39;m not really a great cook) HAHA. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory will always have a special place in my heart though, and it&#39;s one of the more reasonably priced places in the Grove so I&#39;ll inevitably be back.

Can&#39;t go wrong when choosing to eat at The Cheesecake Factory. This place has a variety of different cuisine to choose from and you can&#39;t go wrong with literally anything on the menu. I&#39;ve had it all and I cannot say I was ever disappointed. I crave their strawberry lemonade often and if it wasn&#39;t pricier then my budget at times I&#39;d come more often. Still a good place for a meal, and a slice of their amazing upside pineapple cheesecake! Yum!

Where do you go if you have a big group?  At The Grove, to meet some friends and family for a Sunday Funday late lunch.  First thing to do if you decided to eat here, is check in immediately and they will give you a gizmo that buzzes when your table is ready.  We roamed around for about 30-45 minutes to pass the time.   Catch-up, brows around, then in no time it buzzed and we were seated as soon as we checked back in.  <br>Food is consistent, services is excellent, they even brought a fudge for the birthday boy after we ate.  Plates are big so it&#39;s good for 2-3 people if you&#39;re not a big eater.  Ordered, 2-pasta dishes, salad and chicken dish with mash (oohhh super good) potatoes.  There were 6 of us and it was just perfect, even had some leftover.  The pumpernickel bread is the best.  Just don&#39;t overdo it, it&#39;s sooo good though when it comes out warm and soft.

I have been to many cheesecake factories and this one in particular has so many hidden gems within it! From the food to the view everything is amazing! Though I love this restaurant so much, i&#39;m sad to say that my last visit wasn&#39;t quite amazing, the service wasn&#39;t so great, as the wrong foods were coming to our table and our server was no where to be found. A game was playing on the television and you could see the servers and food runners standing next to the bar watching, as we were sitting there for an hour waiting for the food to arrive. Not only was the service not so great for us, but the neighboring tables ass well, as you can hear their  complaints mumbling throughout the restaurant. I have given them a 4/5 stars as this is the third time i have been to this location and the other times were phenomenal. Sad to say, hopefully next time this won&#39;t happen again.

Not a fan of this restaurant chain however their beyond burger was the beast vegan burger I have tasted so far. All dishes coma out at the same time and prepared as we asked. the service was a little slow however the restaurant was packed during lunch on a Saturday. Overall very nice experience.

Food was okay but I don&#39;t know too much about the people we dealt with. My husband and I love cheesecake But when ordering to go, when we asked if we could have extra bread, the man behind the counter said &#34;it depends on how much you spend&#34; and was keeping an eye on us just because we weren&#39;t dressed by Grove standards. The only nice person was the guy with the Gucci belt upstairs that showed enthusiasm and appreciation for our business. Everyone else was giving attitude over us asking for some extra bread like how is that even an issue ?? So rude.

I definitely recommend checking out their avocado egg rolls. They are vegetarian, and not so much on the healthy side since they are fried. However the rolls are very crunchy and flavorful. It comes with a dip sauce that I personally find too sweet.

First time to this location they are only seating patio area so limited. Got my usual Louisiana chicken pasta noticed their portions are super skimpy almost looked like less then lunch portion. I was there for dinner!

So it was my boyfriends birthday an we got some to go we both got the rib eye medium well . One was burned from the outside and the other one looked ok so I got the burned one since it was HIS BIRTHDAY LUNCH . Turned out his was super dry and mine was raw from he inside besides it being burned from the outside . We never have a problem with the cheesecake we actually love going to eat there but it&#39;s like they don&#39;t care about the to go orders and we didn&#39;t have time to wait the 2.5 plus hours wait time . So sad because this was suppose to be special since it was his birthday and it was a total fail !!! And I spend over 100 $ for two people !!!

I go to that restaurant every weekend for my favorite ricotta pancakes, Fresh OJ and cappuccino . I always seat at the bar most of times . The lady bartender is so sweet and great with her guests ! 5 star service ! Just one hops ! squeeze enough Fresh OJ on a Sunday morning :) ! At 11am run out long wait :( but nothing to do with the bartender because it is made in the back kitchen ! Lol squeeze more orange early on weekends :) thanks to be one of my favorite weekend 1st breakfast stop for years :) people drink fresh OJ :) <br>Overall the staff is always very friendly and professional ! The food consistently good !

Came here for a birthday dinner. Even though it was Wednesday there was still a 20 min wait but it went by quickly. We passed the time walking around the Grove. I got the chicken Marsala and mushroom. The mushrooms were really good and I enjoyed the meal overall. The portions are huge so only managed to eat half of it. Then we got dessert and I shared a red velvet cheesecake. I thought it was pretty decent cheesecake. Definitely on the heavier side. The food took a little while to get out but otherwise the service was very good.

Came last night with my boyfriend and our waitress was super put out to be helping us and had no enthusiasm what so ever. The food is always delicious but the service this time felt very disappointing. An experience I was saving up for and left unhappy

I would give this restaurant a 5 star review if it wasn&#39;t for their service when I went. I didn&#39;t mind the long wait time to get seated or the time it took for the food to come out (which was longer than normal), but the server I had was just so rude and didn&#39;t really check in with us during my family&#39;s time at the restaurant. Other than that, the food was great and their cheesecake is delicious!!

Started the meal out with the waiter YELLIN at my DEAF friend. EXTREMELY RIDICULOUS!! Bic couldn&#39;t hear him AT ALL. Second, they put a gummy snake on my flatbread??? Not even chicken leg bis? Just a big gummy snake? WTF

Love the Cheesecake Factory! From their enormous menu to their delicious cheesecake. This place is a favorite! However this location is crazy busy!! Tip: make a reservation on here while walking around. My kiddos love this place so it&#39;s a win win. I got my favorite Louisiana chicken dish while the kids got grilled chicken, mashed potato and roasted carrots while the other kid got corn dogs and fries. Everything was really yummy! For dessert we got the celebration cheesecake. It&#39;s three layers with funfetti cake. So soo good!
happy hour is always lite. <br>I love coming here for personal day lunches for myself .<br>the greek salad and shrimp scampi gets me right every time .

Ordered steak tacos, four mimi&#39;s served with rice and beans. Each taco had two small chunks of steak, one chunk of each of the tacos was actually gross gristle! Black beans had no flavor and only the rice was tolerable. <br>Service was interrupted while waiter took a break. Neither offered to refill our waters since that was our only drinks. <br>Receipt thrown on the table. Very noisy. <br>Will not return here.

ThIs is literally the best Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to and I have frequented quite a few around the country. My husband and I came for dinner and everyone was super pleasant from the host to the seating coordinator on the second floor. The wait was less than 10 minutes and we got a nice table on the balcony overlooking the grove and all of the Christmas decor. We started with the nachos and they were full of Mexican flavors, so delicious. They were rivaled only by the nachos at the Cheesecake Factory in Union Square, San Francisco. I had a small plate of taquitos and they were simply delicious and they never disappoint. My husband ordered the pasta Da Vinci for the first time and he was blown away by the outstanding sauce on the pasta. The waiter was very attentive and he made sure that we were pleased with the food and his service.
I ordered a red velvet cheesecake at the weekend, it was ok, I already ate better at the store.

Somebody recently gave me a gift card and so I have revisited the cheesecake factory at the Grove. The first day we had the Avocado Toast &amp; the Flat Bread w Everything on it. We took the Cuban Sandwich to go w a piece of Cheesecake as we were going to the Hollywood Bowl &amp; besides the FILTHY menu, we were happy. The sandwich was good!<br><br>The following day we returned and my friend had a Shrimp dish which was good. I ordered the Carne Asada plate &amp; REGRET it. They couldn&#39;t get it right. I was asked how I wanted the meat prepared &amp; I said medium rare but it clearly came well done. I asked them to just cook that part of the meal over so as not to wait for an entire meal and I am so glad I did because  they brought the meat back but raw rare! At this point and manager stepped in to try to fix the problem and she took the meat back and never returned. <br><br>I think when you go to this place you should only order pasta dishes and cheesecake. Please see

Only the best variety on a menu ever! Whenever you&#39;ve had a day of shopping and want a ton of variety for your food options-- this is the place! <br><br>I came here with an old coworker to eat breakfast and work. <br><br>AMENITIES<br><br>The WiFi is so-so, I wouldn&#39;t make video calls, edits, or do any previews. The WiFi accessibility is more for basic connection. <br><br>Also they seem to want to turn tables over real quick so not suggested for work. <br><br>ATMOSPHERE<br><br>Restaurant is upstairs so I would highly recommend the patio seating instead of the darkened indoors. Also you can people-watch so it makes the balcony even more attractive.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here for dinner during a free concert for Andy Grammar. It was a magical night, so this place can really deliver if at the right time.<br><br>FOOD<br><br>It&#39;s Cheesecake, you cant go wrong here everyone knows that. It&#39;s like the healthy Friday&#39;s of life. <br><br>I got a Cuban sandwich, it was just like home from what I remember growing up around Cubans in Miami :). Also was just as amazing if not better, heated up, the second day.  <br><br>My friend ordered a burger and thought it was so-so. Of all the places in LA to eat an amazing burger, here is not a spot I recommend sorry Cheesecake!! My tummy still loves you endlessly!<br><br>SERVICE <br><br>At this location in particular is okay. Usually busy so expect to ask for items you requested repetitively. It is what it is. This isn&#39;t a private chef you pay in your home so be easy on them.<br><br>PARKING<br><br>Make sure to get your parking ticket validated at the desk but the main doors when you exit. It is good for 2 hours.
I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake Factories, this one by far has the best view.<br><br>This is a more upscale location and the managers know how to cater and care for all of their customers.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this location at all costs.<br>My friend and I went on Christmas Eve for dinner. (Yeah it&#39;s been almost half a year, but i&#39;m just getting around to writing all my reviews.) Clearly it was a pretty busy time, so we weren&#39;t very surprised when our wait of 1 hour got pushed to 1.5 hours. <br><br>It was poor prediction on their part and there were many hangry, aggravated guests due to the wait time. Not the restaurant&#39;s fault though. Even up until then, my friend and I were understanding. <br><br>We just didn&#39;t realize just how much worse our experience was about to get. <br><br>1. I ordered the Hibachi Steak. It&#39;s supposed to come with tempura asparagus as a side. It never came, so when we told the server, he brought over a tiny bowl with a few pieces. Okay, I guess that&#39;s fine?<br><br>2. In the same plate, I found a green piece of plastic in my mashed potatoes. I was halfway through my steak. Okay, this really isn&#39;t fine now. We told the waiter who took the entire plate saying they would replace it. Then the manager came asking what happened so we explained. Then I shit you not, the manager goes &#34;So what do you want us to do about it?&#34; Like in a super condescending tone. That&#39;s just how I heard it but we&#39;re just like, well I don&#39;t know, what will you do about it? <br>So they said they would replace the entire plate free of charge as if that was a huge favor they would be doing for us. <br><br>Now it gets really fun! My friend finished the rest of her food while I began losing my appetite as time ticked on. It must have been at least 30 minutes before we decided this was enough. I waved our server down and asked if we would even be getting a replacement. He didn&#39;t know what was going and told us, &#34;Now I really wish I knew that because then I would have gotten that for you right away.&#34;<br><br>Wow! Now he&#39;s blaming us for not letting him know something that they were supposed to care of half an hour ago!<br><br>The guy left and returned like 5 minutes later saying that he could literally see the food right on the serving window and he&#39;d bring it back right away. Time ticks by, and before we know it, it&#39;s been another 15 minutes. <br><br>So far, nothing has been going well during my visit at all, and I get fed up. Nobody has even checked in on us to see how our meal is going, and I&#39;m done with this place. <br><br>I just pulled out cash after guesstimating our bill and got up to leave. And guess what? NOW our server wants to pay attention to us. How so very thoughtful.<br><br>&#34;I&#39;m sorry is there a problem?&#34;<br><br>&#34;Yeah, nobody came to check up on us during the time we were here. Our replacement food never came. This is a waste of my time. The money&#39;s on the table.&#34;<br><br>&#34;Well, if you let me know that there was a problem, then I could have handled it right away. And I already asked you if you needed anything else. I can still literally see your food on the window right now, I can go get it for you now and take the steak off your bill.&#34; (Wow seriously dude? You checked up on us as we were getting up to leave and if you can &#34;literally see the food right now&#34; then why didn&#39;t you get it 15 minutes ago when you literally saw it the first time??!!! And if it&#39;s been that long, doesn&#39;t that mean the food&#39;s all cold already? Like WTF?)<br><br>&#34;If you didn&#39;t know what was going on, that&#39;s not my fault and that&#39;s not my problem. Whatever problems with communication you have with your staff, you need to handle. We&#39;ve already wasted all this time already, and I don&#39;t want to wait longer.&#34;<br><br>&#34;Are you sure? I&#39;ll take it off your bill and you can take the food to go.&#34;<br><br>&#34;I don&#39;t care. I&#39;m just leaving now.&#34;<br><br>&#34;I&#39;m sorry but I can&#39;t let you leave until I close off your bill.&#34;<br><br>&#34;Ok fine.&#34;<br><br>So the guy brought up our bill and gave us the number. With tax AND tip, I had more than enough already on the table in cash. Now my time was wasted yet again because he thought we were just going to dine and dash.<br><br>Ahaha I am NEVER coming back to this Cheesecake Factory again. I could understand the wait time and their busy-ness, but I can not handle their blaming the customer for their own lapses in their business. That&#39;s just not how to handle customer service. <br><br>My experience was appalling to say the least. I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factories where the service was good even when it was ridiculously busy. Also, I have never in my life been blamed by a server for something that was not my fault at all. Hehehe seriously. There are much better options in this area if you are going to sit down for a nice meal.

The good: For a Friday nite at the Grove and Graduations happen all over the city, the wait was decent.<br>The con: Seems the overall food quality and taste seems to fall short in comparison to all other Cheesecake Factories.<br><br>My pet peeve for chain restaurants, is that it should be the same way, everyday if it&#39;s on the same menu. Service and taste should always maintain as a consistency. If a signature dish is missing a key component that makes it a signature dish, big fumble.<br>Jamaican Jerky Chicken, without the plantains?<br>An almost whole piece of potato in the mash potato another fumble.<br>Angel hair pasta with pasta still stuck together cause you didn&#39;t take the effort to stir is another failure.<br>Shrimp scampi that was over cooked, and under seasoned.<br>Keep in mind, these are the same dishes I&#39;ve ordered for the past couple of years at each Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. (1-2x per month)<br>So it&#39;s definitely not a case of a new dish that is unfamiliar.<br>Rock hard bread that was either over baked or stale. <br>On the plus, Service was good and on par. <br>Kitchen is definitely a bit of a disappointment.

We came here on a weekend.Very long wait but we were patient. We finally got seated. Our server was nice but seemed very busy. We ordered drinks right away.  Our bread came but our drinks or even water took forever.We finally ordered. I had a burger, never tried one at Cheesecake Factory. I regret my choice. the burger was very over done and underseasoned. The burger had a large bun but it did not compliment the burger at all. <br>Overall just very disappointing.Parking at the Grove was VERY VERY expensive even with the validation.

I had such a great experience at this cheesecake factory! I came on a Saturday evening with my boyfriend to celebrate my birthday. We put our names on the list around 5 and were told the wait was 20-30 minutes. They give you a pager so you can walk around and shop while you wait. Our table was ready in about 15 minutes. We sat down and were greeted quickly. I ordered the Georgia Peach cocktail and it was AMAZING. It tasted like a fresh peach. I will definitely be getting it again. For dinner I ordered the crispy chicken pasta. It was also delicious! Our food came out hot and fresh. <br><br>For dessert we got the ghirardelli chocolate cheesecake and it was so decadent and rich. Definitely a cheesecake to share! <br><br>Overall I had a great time here because the service and food were so good! The location is very busy because it is in the Grove, but I recommend putting you name on the waitlist before you get too hungry! Parking is expensive in their structure so come prepared! I will definitely be coming back!

Okay, so the day before Thanksgiving I go into this CF location to get dessert for the next day. I get it, y&#39;all are busy and Hollywood is a very populated location. But COME ON, how could you make me wait an EXTRA 50 minutes AFTER I&#39;ve already ordered just to give me the wrong order. It wasn&#39;t until the day of Thanksgiving that it was revealed at dinner that you made the mistake and gave me the WRONG order... and it wasn&#39;t even another cheesecake, but a regular cake. Who waits that long at Cheesecake Factory to get NOT a cheesecake. I drove all the way from West Covina for this.... thanks A LOT.

I am not going to lie I was pleasantly surprised by the food at the Cheesecake Factory. My friend got the spicy cashew chicken and another got the Thai chicken and both were delicious. I also tried the passionfruit mojito and the tiramisu cheesecake which were so good! My nachos came out cold but they immediately remade them for me and they were actually pretty delicious. All around a great experience. Would come back

Love this establishment and location. Came in for dinner and a movie nextdoor. <br><br>I dont know why but the brown bread from here is one of my favorite breads anywhere. <br><br>Grabbed the chicken sandwich, some drinks and thai lettuce wraps with avocado instead of chicken. They were really nice about subbing out the chicken.

I ordered a $9 egg white with white toast and some potatoes to go.  When I got my order, the server said they ran out of potatoes. I said, that&#39;s ok, and left. When I got home, there was very little egg in the container, covered by wheat bread. This is ridiculous. I didnt have time to go return this so I ate what egg there was, and it was super greasy. I couldn&#39;t even eat the wheat bread as I&#39;m allergic. $9 well spent. No quality assurance or effort whatsoever.

Cheesecake factory is a semi upscale restaurant that can please everybody, from the rich and famous, to the average everyday crowd.<br><br>Price range is a little higher on the average price range scale, but quality is on the higher end of the quality range too.  Located around Southern California,  but mostly around, up scale malls, and high traffic, touristy areas.<br><br>This one is located at the grove, also know as the famous farmers market.<br><br>Located upstairs, decorated beautifully.  A little dark with dimmed lights, which is great for a romantic dinner, but not for a lunch meeting.  Outdoor patio seating available which is a big plus.<br><br>Staff was very attentive, friendly and helpful.  Menu was big, many items to choose from, and oh yeah....those decadent cheesecake that they&#39;re famous for.<br><br>This place is definitely a couple of levels up from your everyday taco or burger for lunch or dinner.

Since my wife was hard at work trying to create the most amazing mother&#39;s day celebration for both of our mothers on Mother&#39;s Day, I told her that I would pick her up whatever she wants on Saturday night so she can have her own Mother&#39;s Day dinner.  She chose the Cheesecake Factory around the corner from our house, having no clue what we were in for.  We ordered avocado eggrolls, a chicken bellagio, and 3 slices of cheesecake, paid online, and received a notification telling us that our order would be ready for pick-up in 30 minutes.  <br><br>When I arrived I wasn&#39;t really sure what to do so I first parked in the parking spots reserved for Cheesecake Factory pick-up. After not getting any answer when I called the restaurant I noticed there was also a long line of cars in front of the restaurant, so I went ahead and got into that line instead. After about 15 minutes in line the server came up to my car and asked me if I had received a text message yet, and I said no, I wasn&#39;t aware of any text message. He said the restaurant would text me once my food was ready. I said okay, and that was about 45 mins after I placed my relatively small order that was supposed to be ready in 30 mins. I sat in the parking lot for another 45 mins before I received my text message, 90 mins total, and then spent another 20 mins in line again, for a grand total of 110 minutes, almost 2 hours, between placing my order and receiving it.<br><br>When I arrived home the hot food was cold, as I&#39;d imagined it would probably be, since it was probably sitting and waiting for me for at least 30-45 minutes. The chicken bellagio microwaved nicely, but fried avocado eggrolls aren&#39;t ideal for the microwave. So my wife ate her reheated &#34;special dinner&#34; at around 9:30pm.<br><br>I was watching everything happening while waiting, and it just looked like a complete mess, so I didn&#39;t have any intention of complaining in the moment and adding to the stress that the staff was already under. They were clearly either understaffed or had a very poor plan for implementation, or both. Servers were sprinting from the restaurant to the street, then people were giving them their credit card for them to run back into the restaurant to charge them and sprint back out to return them.  The wait staff was definitely earning their tips. But there are so many restaurants that can charge my card with a mobile touchscreen, doesn&#39;t Cheesecake Factory have the equipment to do that? <br><br>Overall I&#39;m upset that my wife had a less than stellar mother&#39;s day dinner after her bedtime and I&#39;d like for Cheesecake Factory to make it up to her by comping her another order of avocado eggrolls sometime. They&#39;re her favorite.

We came here for my daughter 7th birthday,she requested the Cheesecake Factory by the name,she in Kobe with it,we ordered the buffalo blast and dynamite shrimp as an appetizers and it was really delicious and good,then we got the jambalaya plate as per recommendations from everyone who came to the Cheesecake Factory,and I really liked it,my wife got the tia chicken plate and she loved it as well,overall the place has a good mood and kids friendly so we all loved it,the customer service is so good and I recommend this place to everyone,will come back soon...

One of the busiest Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve been to but also one of my favorites because it gives me a place to hang out and watch a game or chill at the bar while my wife walks around the Grove for hours at a time.<br><br>Not a big fan of their food but their cocktails are good.  Decent selection of draft beers.  And of course, their cheesecake is amazing!

It&#39;s hilarious how many folks consider this place fine dining.  Their dinner entrées are pretty lousy.  They remind me of Lean Cuisine meals from the microwave.  But I must warn you:  The grossest thing on the menu are the Cajun chicken littles.  (At least I think that&#39;s what they were.  It&#39;s been awhile.)  The chicken is shredded, then compressed and reformed into tenders, with Cajun seasoning added.  They are absolutely disgusting!  <br><br>The desserts and their namesake cheesecakes are fine.

Do people really wait hrs to dine here?!?! Wow what&#39;s wrong with America? Overworked staff! My poor waitress was so exhausted by 10:30 pm on Sunday night I could even tell you myself she should&#39;ve been cut long time ago! Happy employees will bring happy business.<br>This place needs to get it together.

I never get the same vegetables twice with the Evelyn&#39;s Pasta.  Today it was no different.  There were 3 slices of red bell peppers and zero anything else!!!!  Just plain old better pasta.  YUCK! Horribly disappointed and wont be ordering again from here!

Had a terrible experience at the Cheesecake factory but was saved by the manager who happened to be a very nice lady.  <br> <br>My order was mixed up a couple of times but just as I started to get riled up, the manager showed up and made it all better. I got my right order shortly after and I enjoyed it a great deal. <br> <br>They can be a little steep with the price and mix up your order but in the end the food is worth it.

We came to celebrate my niece&#39;s birthday as a family but were not seated together, even though there were empty and available tables to accommodate our small party of 9. When asked if we could be seated together they said no that those seats were reserved for a party of 12. Can someone please explain to me how a family celebration take place when we are literally seated in opposite ends of the restaurant. Needless to say that the Cheesecake Factory RUINED her birthday, I am so disappointed and embarrassed for suggesting this family restaurant to come and celebrate, how are we supposed to sign Happy Birthday!!<br>I would like to thank the Cheesecake Factory for such an awful and unforgettable experience that will be retold over and over for years to come.<br>This really deserves NO STARS, please be ashamed of yourselves.

This was the worst Cheesecake Factory experience EVER! I came here for my birthday meal and we were told that a group of 5 couldn&#39;t sit together, so I had to separate from the rest of my family!!! We were very Compliant due to COVID-19. HOWEVER!! At the end of our meal we a group of 5 sitting on the other side ! We were told no bc of &#34;health department regulations&#34; I guess that only applies to certain groups. Not only is that SO shady they aren&#39;t following COVID-19 regulations. Do not spend your money here! When we talked to the manager, Ronnie, he was extremely rude and refused to help us. Ronnie had no professionalism at all. He acted like it was a mistake, thanks for ruining my birthday Cheesecake Factory! Never coming here again.

Beautiful place - great restaurant, fantastic location. Very busy at 7pm Saturday night. We had a minor problem with everyone being served all at the same time, not getting dressing for the salad, not getting water when one of us asked twice  and the server did not act quickly on our follow up requests. It was too bad because we tip well for good service. The Manager rectified everything and was sweet about it but it&#39;s good for the server to learn GReAT customer service skills. Apologize, rectify quickly and move on with a smile. Don&#39;t avoid the customer. It was a special event for us and we are not the enemy. That being said, the food and cheesecake was very good!!

I am actually here right now. I NEVER post reviews because it&#39;s usually a great experience. Unfortunately today (right now) I am having a horrible one. My waiter Jamel K gave my husband and I such a rude greeting. *Backstory* We asked to move tables to get a cool view and our original waiter was really pleasant and said it was ok. We sat at the new table and when Jamel K greeted us he asked us &#34;Who sent us here?&#34; With such attitude and a face that gave such hate. Both my husband and I got a bad vibe ..just ordered dranks and left. My hisband just chugged his drink because he just wanted to leave. I have never felt like that EVER!...BAD SERVICE!!!<br><br>***UPDATE*** I was still so upset I called the restaurant and spoke to the manager on duty &#34;Daniel&#34;. He was very pleasant and apologized and offered for us to come back in. Neither my husband or I felt comfortable going back in. Daniel said he would send us a Gift Card for the trouble (which was super sweet and unexpected... and that&#39;s not why I called. I&#39;m sure we aren&#39;t the first ones who were treated like this by Jamel K). So I will keep you updated to see if I actually do receive something for such a bad experience. I won&#39;t go back to this location but I will try their establishment again.

VERY NOISY. In 30+ years of patronizing Cheesecake, this is the only one where guests can&#39;t hear each other--but it&#39;s the only one I&#39;ve gone to in years since it was built because it&#39;s closest. The server tells us, yes, others have complained but volume is controlled by corporate. You have to yell to have a conversation, so we only go on the balcony. No seating on balcony, we leave. I think it&#39;s to drive people out for turnover. Really awful.<br>        Every dish is excellent. My new fav is Bang Bang chicken and shrimp. I sub angel hair pasta for the rice, no charge. Must have spinach dip for appetizer. Husband likes burrito &amp; Fettuccine Alfredo. Because we go way back, we miss some past dishes, like fabulous Tex Mex but they couldn&#39;t get the best ingredients reliably. And the Heath Bar Cheesecake. Yum! But we still check for these every time we are there, like today. <br>        We always take visitors there and they always become big fans looking for Cheesecake Factories where ever they travel. <br>        We had some association with the original owners when it was a family business. One owner, a partner and their spouses would travel the country for a couple weeks eating at several restaurants a day, sampling specialties and finding extraordinary dishes to add to the menu. Now you know why everything is outstanding. I think they said something about hitting the gym after every food scouting trip :) <br>        So except for the truly awful noise, this is the best restaurant ever. Maybe it&#39;s only The Grove one. I can hope.

My friends from France came to LA to visit so of course they wanted to eat at Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve gone to CF many time before but haven&#39;t been in a long time. I was so surprised it has so many bad reviews, cause our experience was surprisingly really good. It was Thursday night and a wait was about 15 mins- not bad. We got seated and got greeted my wonderful waiter. She was very helpful and funny thru our visit. The food was really good; freshly made and just super delicious. We got chicken sliders and avocado rolls for appetizers! Sliders wasn&#39;t special but good but avocado rolls OMG so so tasty!!! The sauce is something else. For entrees we got jambalaya pasta which was bomb, amazingly spiced. Also we got fried shrimp platter which was good. We topped everything up with salted caramel cheesecake which was just like a dream; creamy and sweet. Mainly it was super cheap! $80 for 4 people is more than amazing; considering everyone were very full. So 4 stars for cheesecake!

This is my first time at this Location and I have to say that the service here is top notch. I had asked the server which pasta is on of her personal favorite. She had recommended the Louisiana chicken past that had a mild spice. I personal don&#39;t like spicy anything but since she said it would be mild I went ahead and placed the order. When it arrived I could smell the spicy flavor. I had one taste and I instantly knew I could eat it. I&#39;m super embarrassed at this point but I had them take the food back. I just ended up ordering my favorite pasta which is the Skinny pasta the Lemon garlic shrimp pasta. While I waited they gave me a small salad. They were super nice and brought out my pasta right away. It also happened to be my cousin birthday and I really appreciate that they sing happy Birthday. Overall great food and amazing service. Shoutout to our server Brittiney. Thank you!

I would only come to the bar or to get dessert form this spot . Had a pork chop was season cook to perfection . Juice soft very good friendly staff as soon as walk those stairs they have they great you

The cheese cake factory is my to-go place for American food. The food is so yummy, the plates are big, and the cheesecakes are heaven! I love the pasta Alfredo, the salads and the stake. And for cheesecakes it&#39;s just really hard to have a favorite they are all great!!

Saturday night the 29th we had a reservation at 9:30 showed up at the reception desk at 9 o&#39;clock I said hello I have a reservation and the young man with a beard very unprofessional Looked at me and said an hour and a half in a very nasty way like I was bothering him or something and I said but I have a reservation he said oh then go walk around and come back at 9:30 which wasn&#39;t really an option because I was with my grandmother who is very old and my pregnant wife so we just stood around luckily at 9:30 a different guy was with him I approached him he was much nicer I think his name was James very nice he send us to the second reception upstairs where we waited 15 minutes later we were seated .<br>The reception with this guy I just can&#39;t understand why you would have somebody like that I&#39;ve been in customer service customer relations my whole life and I just couldn&#39;t believe it<br>Don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be back

Love the Cheesecake Factory but this one particularly is not my favorite. They always make you wait to get a table and when you get called for your table and go up the escalator to the restaurant they make you wait again some more and say &#34;we&#39;re getting your table cleaned up.&#34; Its kind of a hassle getting a table at this location. The host was on her phone when we walked in and I had to say hello twice to her to get her attention, not professional at all. Food is ok, I liked my salad and the cashew vinaigrette  dressing that came with it. Our waitress was also accommodating and nice. Overall just getting a table was a hassle and Kind of killed the vibe. They don&#39;t take reservations either

I work at the grove, and we order from here all the time. But they&#39;re constantly late on your order, I shouldn&#39;t have to spend 20 minutes on my lunch waiting for something that was supposed to be ready already and then get attitude from a cashier that doesn&#39;t even know what he&#39;s doing. We had to show him our receipt for him to even find the transaction. I would understand if it was a busy weekend day but it&#39;s slow.

THE COOLEST CHEESECAKE FACTORY EVER! This Cheesecake Factory is a beautiful 2 story restaurant in the upscale Grove Shopping Center in Los Angeles. Despite the restaurant being very busy the night we visited,  the service was excellent. Our server was Marvin, and he was friendly and efficient. Like always, the food was delicious.  What sets this location apart from others is the opulent decor. When you arrive, there is a receptionist on the ground floor for check in. After your name is taken, you are directed towards the escalator that transports you to the second floor (see photo), where you check in with 2nd receptionist. There is seating both inside and outside patio sections.  We had a very nice dining experience, and will definitely go back again.

If you want slightly better than average cheesecake, Cheesecake Factory is the way to go.  I&#39;ve had the cream of the crop when it comes to cheesecake, so my standards are higher than most . The vanilla bean cheesecake was lacking in vanilla flavor and the cake it&#39;s self wasn&#39;t too appealing to my palate.  At 9-10 dollars a slice it&#39;s not satisfying . I want to eat a cheesecake and  crave each next bite. Rocco&#39;s or Harriet&#39;s is far superior and cheaper as well. If your craving cheesecake and Cheesecake Factory is your only option just know it&#39;s nothing special. I&#39;d hold off and save my money for a much more decadent experience elsewhere.

To be honest..I&#39;ve had really bad luck with my order being correct consistently yet my wife&#39;s food is perfect every single time.<br>On our most recent visit we had a waitress named Marí Anna and my wife thinks her name is Anna Marie...either way she is top notch...<br>Everything was perfect and the wifey and Mari struck up many conversations that  made our visit that much more pleasurable. More importantly my order was not only perfect for the first time It was served to me with a comfortable and friendly face<br>We are now regulars, without me constantly trying to override and object to her love for the Cheesecake Factory
Just grabbed a fork to start sharing the appetizer salad with my friend and saw this dirty nasty fork. Totally disgusting!!!

I got the chicken Caesar salad and the lettuce tasted old and I&#39;m pretty sure it was iceberg lettuce when a Caesar salad is supposed to be romaine. There was also almost no dressing on it and the chicken was chewy and dry and didn&#39;t have much flavor. The worst $20 salad I&#39;ve ever had. The service was slow and I  understand it was busy but  it took 25 minutes to get a box for our food. Wasn&#39;t a great experience

This is the Cheesecake Factory inside the grove shopping mall. <br>I came here on a Friday night for cheesecake and the place was packed. All I wanted to do was stop in for like 3 minutes and grab a plain New York cheesecake.<br>I got up to the Togo girls upstairs and stood there right in front of the cheesecake display trying to get help. Took like 2 minutes for them to help me out ( one of the girls wasn&#39;t even busy doing anything)  I kindly requested one slice of New York cheesecake. Again, it&#39;s like someone completely forgot that I existed..... couple minutes pass and I get rang up for my cake. $10 or something for a small ny flavored slice. <br>It was honestly a decent piece of cheesecake, I&#39;d eat that again. But I don&#39;t want to have to deal with crappy service again.

I just ordered the buffalo blasts. Used to be quite tasty and filling.<br>Now just over fried dough , barely anything inside.<br>It wasn&#39;t even thoroughly cooked.<br>Guess this is my punishment for going off of my diet.
Good food and service, but horrific bathrooms. It&#39;s such a simple thing to clean and stock the bathrooms. Hopefully they can step up their game.

This is the second time i came to this Cheesecake Factory and i love it because we have always asked to be seated in the balcony and last night was espectacular because all the Christmas decorations and the company of course.<br>We ordered the miso salmon, which i love it , it is one of my favorites plate; my boyfriend ordered the pork shop with mashed potatoes and it was good too, a little dry but it was ok.<br> I ordered cabernet the Cheesecake Factory which was good too and after that we ordered a tiramisu Cheesecake and hot latte but i dont know why they use glass instead of regular cup to serve the coffee, we don&#39;t like it in that, so i asked the waitress if he can bring me a regular cup and he said yes, so it is much better and easier to drink .<br>But everything is soooo good.

This location is very unique. You enter from the first floor and go up a long flight of stairs to the second floor where the bar and dining area are located at.<br><br>If you are fortunate like us, you will get seated in the patio area overlooking the shopping center where you get a view of the stores and people walking around.<br><br>As with every Cheesecake Factory location, the food is consistent. The service on the other hand, could be different from location to location. Luckily for us we didn&#39;t experience any issues with service that other Yelpers have experienced. The service was good as we expected.

This is the only Cheesecake Factory that the food actually taste good to us. Some days the service can be a bit slow and sometimes you get pretty fast service. This is the location I frequent the most so the 5 stars is because it&#39;s more good times than bad based on several other Cheesecake Factory locations I have been too. I have walked out of two locations after waiting for over 40 minutes and being served cold food. This location the food is always great and if it&#39;s not they will fix it right away. The wait can sometimes be insane. We came here during Christmas week at it was about 2 hours crazy so we went to the Beverly Hills location I wish I would have waited two hours at this location instead. I wrote a review for that location, overall this location has the best service and food for a chain restaurant.

My husband and I snuck out of the house last night for a date night and hit up the grove at around 4pm. We went straight to Cheesecake Factory because we were hungry and were tired of our usually Maggianos. The place was packed. We put our name on the list and were given a pager. I was told the wait would be around 45 minutes and the pager worked from the fountain down to Michael Kors. Okay, cool. <br><br>Well, the Madewell store is right next door. I browse their sale. Try stuff on and just waste time. We finally get a buzz that our table is ready an hour later. We are told we need to head upstairs and give another person our name. We do just that and still wait an additional 10-15 minutes. <br><br>Our server was wonderful. No complaints there. I just feel like, for being wedged like sardines in the restaurant, the quality of food is not worth the price. Over $20 for the four cheese pasta. It&#39;s pasta AND CHEESE?! Bro! They&#39;re cheesecake, however, is worth every penny. It never disappoints<br><br>Honestly though, for the wait, and price, I think it&#39;s hyped up and overrated. I would recommend eating somewhere else and making picking up a slice of cheesecake to go in the future.

The food was nice size portion and server was great.  But the factor that killed it was allowing a dog in the restaurant.  The table next to me had a pretty large sized dog and was pretty appalled that management let thE dog inside.  It&#39;s very unsanitary to say the least, especially if you don&#39;t know what may trigger a certain behavior or if the dog may interrupt the dine-in experience.
I&#39;m convinced this place is scared to season their food. I had to season my own chicken fettuccine alfredo. Other than that, it is okay.
Had a great time here. The food was really good. Me and my cousin both got pasta dishes. And of course the cheesecake was great. Also we had a lovely server who was so nice.

Dined here with bae. We were greeted with smiles. There was a 30 minute wait. As our hostess guided us to seating, a woman trailed the hostess in an attempt to claim our table. The hostess politely stated &#34;This table has not been reserved for you, please wait at the entrance &amp; I&#39;ll assist you further&#34;. Handled with class &amp; professionalism. Ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and traditional American burger ( needed one, it&#39;s been a while)

This Cheesecake Factory appears to be fancier than some of their other restaurant chains but don&#39;t expect anything extra from here. I believe they position themselves this way to be consistent with the upscale-ness of The Grove. <br><br>You can expect the typical Cheesecake Factory experience here which includes dim lighting, a bit of wait, subpar customer service and loud crowds. Nothing really surprised me in this particular restaurant. I&#39;ve been to a few different Cheesecake Factory and they all feel the same to me. Food is consistent and service is meh. I think people come here because it&#39;s a safe choice. They know what they&#39;ll get. My group happen to be one of those people on a Sunday Night.

I love coming to Cheesecake Factory , been here so many times and I always get good service , I really wish I remember my servers name. He never came to refill water or to check if we needed anything else and took forever to bring the bill. Besides the service, the food is good , I always get the factory nachos with chicken, it&#39;s pretty big so definitely can share. They have a good selection beer. There&#39;s always a long wait time but you can always walk around the grove while you wait.

I have to admit I absolutely loved the Cheese Cake Factory back in NC but here it seems it&#39;s all show with poor service on the side. <br><br>The place wasn&#39;t really crowded but with a few handful of open seats it still took 20-25 minutes to have us seated. In addition, you couldn&#39;t get a refill to save your life. <br><br>The food was fine but you just should not have to struggle to get decent service.<br><br>I will note that the bartender was phenomenal. Since we began by sitting there waiting for our seats she was attentive and kept our drinks going even the non-alcoholic ones. At one point I was so sick of waiting on our server I got up walked to the bar and she refilled my sprite. <br><br>So while not entirely bad if you are looking for a quite bar it&#39;s a nightmare if you going out to enjoy a quite dinner with quality service.

The cheesecake in the GROVE is the worst I have ever been to. I was told I  had to wait 1.5 hours, after 1 hour and 45 minutes of waiting the ladies who check you in, kept adding more and more time to my wait. I ended up leaving and driving to Redondo Beach Cheesecake where we were treated with respect and amazing customer service. Will NEVER visit that (in the GROVE) cheesecake EVER again! If I could give it zero stars, I WOULD!

I always love coming here but I hated the wait ... 30-45 minutes average, but they now have a reservation system! I was a bit wary but made the reservation, checked in and was instructed to go upstairs where another host was there to check me in. A minute later I was seated. I even arrived before my reservation time. 5 STARS ... always have wonderful food and service.

Let me just start by saying my waiters were great everything else was not. I waited 2 hours despite being told it&#39;s an hour wait. Then when I sat down they didn&#39;t have handicap friendly or baby friendly seating after I specifically said what my party consists off. The only edible decent plates were the steaks ordered. Other than that the vegan Cobb salad and fettuccine Alfredo was terrible. And the herb crushed salmon was cold. Everything lacked flavor and salt. Wasted 3 hours for nothing. Word of advice if they&#39;re busy leave. <br><br>One of your waiters did nothing to make it right. My first waiter was sweet. My second waiter didn&#39;t care at all. I voiced my complaints to the second waiter I had and he said what do you want me to do about it? He should of at least removed a plate or two off my bill. No way was I rude to him or made him feel he was at fault. I know it&#39;s the chefs fault but he showed no remorse or that he wanted to keep me as a customer.

Food and service was awful. Our waitress seemed stoned and we had to ask for everything including our bread and water. Never checked on us and my salad was missing a couple of ingredients that were in the description. Run from this place!

Terrible service. Waited like 3 hours for food. It tasted so bad too. I don&#39;t know why people are lined up for this. Not authentic at all. Don&#39;t come here. Go to a different restaurant. Buca de Beppo is good I heard.

I love, love this place. My daughter &amp; I eat here frequently &amp; the Hostess Sonia ALWAYS makes us feel right at home.  The servers vary from just okay to excellent, but Sonia&#39;s customer service is always Excellent.  Her welcoming smile is always a reason to come back.  The food is usually pretty good and I like the variety of the menu.  The atmosphere is always pleasant, and the music adds to the ambiance of the restaurant. The  bathrooms are always clean, which is always a plus for us.

This is Solely for the food, our waiter was great! Me and my friend went just before 6pm for an early dinner and we were craving the same dish we had last time which was the Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi, the 1st time we had it, it was full of creamy we&#39;ll balance ingredients, also we like medium rare steak,<br><br>So yesterday thought it would be a great choice again and it should be fresh, we were earlier than last time so should&#39;ve been better so we thought, but it was the complete opposite, the meat was way over cooked, the sauce to the shrimp scampi was not creamy just tasted like lemon juice with diced tomatoes and the scampi itself was just missing something...oh yeah Flavor!<br><br>The food we ordered was definitely not prepared the way it should&#39;ve been, it was over cooked and just thrown together without ingredients it should&#39;ve had! <br><br>We spend $100 every time we come and yesterday&#39;s food was a complete disappointment and most likely will never order that plate again! Very disappointed!! You should get what you pay for but whom ever the cooks were yesterday definitely dropped the ball and we had to pay for it!<br><br>And if you are a manager that&#39;s has to respond to this review please do not just say, please give us another try and next time let us know if something is wrong so we can fix it because clearly people did and nothing was done and no one wants something done to their food while it&#39;s back there PLUS you should actually offer something to replace the awful meal or service that was given!
I haven&#39;t tried too many things on their menu but I highly recommend their lettuce wraps! They&#39;re so tasty and healthy

We had the best experience here today! Everyone from the host to our waiter provided exceptional service. They went above and beyond with special details like high chairs for my child&#39;s doll and putting her name on her birthday brownie Sunday!! Exceptional attention to detail!

Front desk hostess are rude. Unprofessional, lack Custumer service and their greeting to clients requesting reservation is Unprofessional. Wait time is long 45min to an hour or more during peak hours. After all is the groove and you paid for the location. Food is good. The experience is whatever. I&#39;ve been to more exclusive places where the hostess are top notch  and the experience from entering the place to the dining experience is superb . Here is not the case for the Groove. Piazza next to the water fountain is better!!

Solid 3 star. Service- good. Cleanliness- good. Food - ok. Thats pretty much it. So many choices of food, but nothing really outstanding. Everything i ever tried here was just ok. Nothing to go crazy for.

I&#39;ve been to this establishment before so didn&#39;t expect today&#39;s service. This was probably the worst dining experience I&#39;ve ever had. Server came to take our order. Didn&#39;t bring straws for the drinks. Popped up once when appetizers came out. Never saw him again. Had to get up three times to get a refill, a to go bag, and the check. If I&#39;m gonna have to get up three times, you&#39;re lucky I leave any tip. Food was ok, but that service was just shitty. Last time I&#39;ll ever go back there when there&#39;s plenty of options at the Grove.

We stopped by for a quick dinner before our movie and enjoyed our meal. We got seated upstairs on the outer edge so we had a nice view. Our waiter was really helpful even though he seemed to be working the area alone. I wish I remembered his name because he was really doing his job above and beyond.

I have been to this location several times. On weekends expect at least a 30 minute wait. They will give you a pager so you can roam around while you wait, which is a good thing. On our last visit the waiter was real nice and quick to bring us things we asked for, such as extra butter and refills. <br>Cheesecake had a huge menu and there is something for everyone in there.  I also really love their breads...baked fresh and hot. If not too careful you can over eat and it will fill you up, but I can&#39;t resist.

If you don&#39;t mind waiting, because this branch is always full....to me it&#39;s worth the wait.  Their beeper allows you to roam around the Grove and amuse yourself so you don&#39;t notice the 30 minute wait.<br><br>Food is always hearty and good....if you leave enough room for dessert, you&#39;ll find out why they&#39;re called Cheesecake Factory - any flavor I&#39;ve tried it&#39;s always so good.<br><br>Servers are so nice, warm and efficient and it starts with their managers - particularly Daniel.  Thank you for your warm hospitality.

My friend and I went to this specific Cheesecake Factory a couple months ago ( i forgot to leave a review at the time) and the service was horrible they took more than an hour to attend us and what I noticed were letting what&#39;s considered &#34;white&#34; people in first and the rest who were waiting with us were mainly Hispanics and African American people I have never felt such discrimination

I had a compliant and I did an online review. The manager followed up with me right away. I will say the Shrimp bistro pasta is amazing- the shrimp, pasta, arugula was cooked to perfection. Now that I&#39;ve been to other cheesecake factory locations in Los Angeles I have to say I like this one a lot because they take pride in the food they serve. The presentation was awesome and taste just as good. I recommend especially for it to be a busy location they are quick and the food is good.

Do not go!!  Service is terrible. Waited 45 minutes after ordering and still no food - for a salad and sandwich!!!  People around us were served and finishing as we still waited. Too many to go orders and they can&#39;t handle the volume.

Definitely a nice vibe and an upscale looking restaurant. Walking in I was surprised to see that the entire restaurant is on the second level. I always thought they had two levels, but there&#39;s is in fact only one. They have an escalator and a staircase so take your pick on how you choose to get up there. Also, there is an elevator off to the left hand side if you would like to go that route. <br><br>We just came here for a few drinks and dessert so we sat at the bar. Nice low lighting ambiance and the service was great! Francisco was our server for the night. <br><br>He was attentive and made sure to get our drinks and desserts to us in a timely manner. I ordered the strawberry daiquiri and the White chocolate raspberry cheesecake to go along with it. Loved the drink! Tasted great and was made super quick. <br><br>The cheesecake was perfect. It wasn&#39;t too rich, the white chocolate didn&#39;t overpower the entire cheesecake so it was the perfect amount of sweet. Paired with my drink it was delicious! <br><br>Would definitely come back here for a drink or for dessert. I&#39;m not too fond of their dinner menu so I&#39;ll stick to the sweets and the alcohol!

I love The Cheesecake Factory,  however my experience at this particular location last Saturday was horrible.  We were told there was a 15-20 minute wait. The buzzer went off after about 25 minutes,  so we returned, back to the restaurant,  only to find out that we still had to wait another 10 minutes to be seated. When our food arrived,  both orders of taquitos were so burnt that they were inedible, and the pasta for the Crusted Chicken Romano was so undercooked that the noodles were hard and stuck together. The manager did try to make it right by taking off one order of taquitos and replacing the other.  He also replaced the pasta with another entree of our choice, and offered a free bowl of soup.  <br>Not sure if I&#39;ll visit this location again.

Make time if you&#39;re going to come to this location on a weekend. The Grove, as lovely as it is, is still a tourist trap and jammed on the weekends. They do validate, but I still had to pay $6 for 90 mins. <br><br>I came with a party of five and we had a 46-60 minute wait. Very small waiting area, so we waited outside in the summer heat. Once our buzzer was rang, we were instructed to go to the restaurant upstairs and check in at the left. We were seated in a booth but please note that this location is LOUD with echoes so it&#39;s very hard to hear and worse if your server can&#39;t hear you - because she didn&#39;t hear me ask for the additional $3.50 chicken in my super antioxidant salad. I wasn&#39;t mad, just not full! <br><br>The $10.95 antioxidant salad itself is mostly leaves and and broccoli. I think I counted three pieces of avocado and very little of anything else that was advertised on the menu (pears, grapes, blueberries, etc). I left disappointed with this choice, unfortunately. <br><br>The rest of my party seemed satisfied: the club (first we were under the impression it came with fries but does not), classic burger, BBQ Ranch chicken salad and chicken Thai coconut lime chicken seemed to be great. <br><br>So yes, I would be flexible to come be here if others want to, but not my first choice. Just very distractible ambiance wise which makes snafus prone to happen.
They don&#39;t validate so beware. They will tell you that they did it and the machine may say that your ticket is validated, but it won&#39;t be. So be prepared.

I believe Elizabeth was our waitress she&#39;s a Super STAR the BEST waitress l have ever had! &amp; look @ how many people she had to deal with, l will be there on the days she&#39;s there &amp; request her section what ever her plans our l will follow you we&#39;re ever you go! I wonder what what she&#39;s studying she looks like a Super Star thank you so much l truly appreciate all the love you put into our service I had the best time ever hanging out with my Best friends every one enjoyed their food. I had a cucumber martini excellent shrimp scampi pasta &amp; a cheesecake fabulous service was excellent l loved the food. Thanks for the good times CCF management

While sit-down food &amp; service may be good here (it is), delivery at home by DoorDash is not. Especially the strawberry cheesecake. It arrived disheveled, the whipped cream spread everywhere in its box and getting watery. It appeared to be less than a full slice. Mashed potatoes were hard and cold. Only saving grace was chicken Madeira, which continues to be delicious. No butter came with the bread. I don&#39;t think the Dasher (who arrived late) likes his job.<br> Buyer be cautious and DoorDash, wake up!

Surprisingly there wasn&#39;t a wait. I don&#39;t understand why they would take you to the patio without asking if it&#39;s ok, it isn&#39;t I don&#39;t like sitting there. Asked to be reseated and walked past many booths to be taken to the absolute furthest one. Waited quite a long time for one appetizer. Friends enjoyed their chicken maderia and miso salmon. My spicy chicken sandwich had zero spice, I wouldn&#39;t get it again.
Cheesecake Factory at The Grove was absolutely breathtaking, all the light, the decorations it was definitely Christmas in the air.

One word: Slow<br><br>Everything about this place is slow.<br>There are too many people coming to this location, so the wait is long.<br><br>Takes forever to get seated after you go up stairs.<br><br>Servers seem over worked because they take forever to take your order or get you anything.<br>Pretty much have to flag them down because they rarely have time to check up on you.<br><br>Food is standard Cheesecake Factory so it is good. Favorite was the Avacodo Egg Rolls<br><br>Overall pretty average.

I&#39;ve been a customer to this location for many many years. To be More accurate since my favorite dish the chicken Madeira was $15. Service has been for the most part great. I don&#39;t like visiting the restaurant on the weekends because waiting times are really long. Anyway this review is for my most recent visit which was one Tuesday October 22nd I was at the bar and I was tired from school and work ans just wanted to relax for a minute. I order an iced green tea. It&#39;s not my first time there so the green tea comes with a few mint leaves which makes it taste wonderful! The bartender didn&#39;t put any mint leaves so I asked him can i pls have some,mint leaves? He grabbed a handful of leaves and just tossed them into my drink!! I was are you Fricking kidding me?  I was not in the mood to be upset or make a big deal out of it because I was really drained and all I wanted was to refresh myself and eat because I had not eating anything throughout the day. I was not today Satan not today.One thing I really hate not just from this restaurant in particular but anywhere else is that if the food or the drink is supposed to come with a certain ingredient-s or it&#39;s supposed to be made a certain way PLEASE INSTRUCT YOUR EMPLOYEES TO DO IT THE RIGHT WAY EVERYTIME! Because usual customers like me know what to expect from our food or drink! And when you point it out to the server or whoever is handling the food they get mad, they get upset, they give you the stinky eye and your experience is not pleasant whatsoever for something they were supposed to do it right in the first place. Here are some pictures. This was not acceptable at all!!

This location keeps going downhill. Been going here for years &amp; it keeps getting worse every time I go. Not sure if they are under new management or what? Have had many bad experiences but this time decided to drop a review. Went there tonight &amp; was forced to wait 20 minutes downstairs at around 3:30 in the afternoon because they were &#34;booked solid&#34;. After waiting the whole time ended up going upstairs to a sea of empty tables. About 1/3 of the entire tables were empty. Then instead of seating us inside at one of the empty tables they forced us to sit outside in the freezing winter cold. The bread arrived cold, the soda was flat, the appetizer was cold &amp; even if anything was warm it would quickly be cold regardless due to the freezing cold temps outside. We told the hostess we didn&#39;t want to sit outside &amp; they refused to seat us anywhere else despite having 20 or so empty tables &amp; booths. <br><br>I ordered the fettuccini with chicken. It arrived with a few microscopic pieces of chicken in it &amp; literally 4 baby pieces of broccoli. For $25 a complete &amp; total rip off. My girlfriend ordered the four cheese pasta &amp; it was so bad we had to send it back. Our waitress was nice but took great offense when we said we wanted to send back the four cheese pasta. We also were never asked if we wanted anything else in exchange for the bad pasta. She just took it off &amp; walked off. <br><br>This is probably my 3rd or 4th bad experience in a row at this Cheesecake Factory. Probably won&#39;t be going here anymore. The server never asked us if we even wanted cheesecake or any desert at all. Never asked us how are food was. Forced us to sit outside despite asking not to. Done with this location

Came to this location for the very first time last night with my husband and we absolutely loved this place. Sonya&#39;s energy was so delightful. She greeted us with a warm smile and was very professional. I&#39;m all about good food and friendly vibes. I will definitely be coming back to this location soon thanks to Sonya&#39;s hospitality.
We gave them another try.....chicken parmigiana sandwich, Miso Salmon were awesome!  The veggie lasagna was inedible, overcooked unfortunately.

Once you&#39;ve been to one, you&#39;ve been to all of them (food wise). But service, the service we received was on point. <br><br>I feel bad for not remembering his name but he was on top of it. Very attentive. My friend wanted ranch and bbq sauce for her salad, he chimed in and mentioned how they have a bbq ranch salad dressing which is exactly what she was going to make at the table. <br><br>He continued to check on us throughout our dining experience. I ordered a couple of my favorite appetizers. Stuffed mushrooms and chicken wontons. Can&#39;t go wrong with that no matter the location. <br><br>Both items were perfect.

Hello,<br><br>We were very unsatisfied with the service we received. My boyfriend and I had reservations for 7:45PM. We arrived at the restaurant at 7:55PM and were told they had to give our table up when we were finally able to let the greeters know we had a reservation 5 minutes later because they were helping other people ahead of us. The greeter then proceeded to tell us we would have to wait 30 minutes because they only allowed for a &#34;10 to 15 minute grace period&#34; which we were well within. We were comprehensive and decided to wait but we were not seated until 8:35PM. We had a whole night planned including tickets to another event we could not make because our reservations weren&#39;t respected. We waited about an hour to be seated despite having reservations, which makes the concept of reservations at this restaurant useless if they will not be honored. I think you should update this system to avoid other customers having the same bad experience.<br>Thank you!
Great food and service<br>Creole shrimp<br>Tamale cake was amazing<br>Godiva chocolate cake Was delicious

We came here today on a Sunday evening around 7:30 pm. It was very crowded and we had to wait 45 minutes.<br><br>The table we were seated was very small and we had to constantly move our dishes and drinks from left to right so that everything fits on the table. Because the restaurant was so full, it was also very loud and hard to have a conversation. Maybe not the best choice to come here on a Sunday evening, at least not if you want to have a little bit more relaxed time.<br><br>We ordered the stuffed mushrooms, BBQ chicken pizza and the lemon raspberry cream cheesecake. The food was very delicious and our waitress Allison was friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back and also try out other dishes and other cheesecake factory locations.

I have been going to this restaurant for over 20 years and the taste and service is still perfect. Everything on the menu taste amazingly good and couldn&#39;t find anything to complain about. If you can&#39;t decide where to go for your get-together s or b-day dinner, this is a perfect place.

I have mixed feelings about this Cheesecake Factory. I mean the location is great! It&#39;s right inside The Grove, which makes it a great place to eat at after a movie or after shopping BUT the service is slow. It took our waiter forever to bring drinks for the kids at our table. Our waiter rarely checked up on us. He only made it a point to make sure we knew he was going on break. That was it. <br><br>Also, I find it disappointing that the other waiters wouldn&#39;t even help out. I know we&#39;re not in your assigned area, but we had two kids who were so thirsty and needed water. I wish they staff had a more team player approach.<br><br>Besides the slow service, the food was alright. I did really enjoy the calamari! That was tasty! Other than that nothing else stood out so if you plan on going, order the calamari!

Beware of the waiters here. The hostess are nice and kind but the waiters have a bad attitude. This location is the closest to us other than the smaller Beverly Hills one. Every time we go which is quite often, the service of the waiters is mediocre and rude. They barley check on the table and any request you have they will disregard or show you that they are unhappy with it. They basically want you just to order tip then and leave with nothing extra. Other locations are much better.

first of all- i found a mealworm or a type of worm in my green beans.totally disgusting.like what the heck!!! <br><br>second of all- i didint get any butter.not even a single drop!!! i have to ask for it every single time.and this time you would think they got their common sense back, nope not even.they act so stupid they wont even ask if you needed butter for the bread!!!

Poor poor poor customer service from the hostess to management the only people that had some customer care was the server <br>The food was mediocre compared to other cheese cake locations you&#39;d think since the grove is a popular destination they would be on there  &#34;A game&#34; apparently not <br><br>I do not recommend

$25 steak and shrimp take out. <br>This is unacceptable. I always get this from other Cheesecake Factory branches and never have I gotten this order like this. <br>Looks like it was done effortlessly and I expect more. <br>The supervisor did say that&#39;s the way they served their food. <br>The shrimp is greasy and the steak is over cooked <br>Mind you that they had also forgotten to add my cheesecake <br><br>Cheesecake Factory HQ would you guys promote this order (photo) for consumers?? <br>Would consumers buy this or give you business if you showed them this? <br><br>I&#39;m very unsatisfied and disappointed.
