The Manager had called me and even sent me a letter saying that she was going to talk to her employees.  Since then, we have gone back twice and both times have been way more pleasant.  We had Samantha one time and she was pretty good and would check in on us.  We would actually go back now if we were in the area which is quite often.  We probably wouldn&#39;t have gone back but since the Manager had reached out to us we gave it another try.

I absolutely love they&#39;re desert my favorite carrot cake &amp; cheesecake I&#39;m totally gonna be buying a again, and the food always freshly cooked, reasonably priced the structure of the restaurant looks amazing decorated.

This review is just for the to go cheesecake. Well if you don&#39;t get the cheesecake here what are you even doing. Don&#39;t go for the food although will say the chicken Madeira is decent and the factory burgers are even better than decent ! Everything else v expensive and overpriced for what it is. Anyways, the to go cheesecake is busy !! There is gonna be a bit of a wait and it&#39;s hard to get the attention of the cashiers to ask about the flavors. The cheesecake itself is overpoweringly sweet but once again, this is not a healthy or homemade/hole in the wall cheesecake place. We got the snickers flavor and Craig&#39;s flavor. The snickers flavor is deceptive because i thought there would be snickers or peanut butter or even chocolate on the inside but it&#39;s literally just plain cheesecake w snickers sprinkled on top. <br><br>Also the price is expensive. 2 slices cost 18$!

Came here with my aunt on a Tuesday afternoon and I normally always enjoy my visit to The Cheesecake Factory. I mean who wouldn&#39;t the food is good and the cheesecakes are awesome. Unfortunately this one was just horrible!<br><br>I will say in their defense they were really busy but our waters were not filled up and they brought out a plate that was dirty when they brought our food out and said they would be right back with a clean plate. It took our waitress forever to come back. My aunt aunt was just eating over her napkin. By the time our waitress came back we were almost done with our Thai chicken wraps. My aunt also had one of those free cheesecake cards from purchasing gift cards during the holiday season. We tried to use it and were denied due to it being expired. The card expired on 3/31 it was 4/16 when we went. I mean come on!!! <br><br>For being as busy and big of a restaurant chain I am quite disappointed that they did not honor the free cheesecake especially given the slow service we received. I would understand had the card been expired for months and we only came in to claim the cheesecake then I could see where they shouldn&#39;t honor it. Highly disappointed in the lack of customer service at this location.

I eat and order here all the time but the customer service lately has been at an all time low. Today I went to pick up my order after they told me 15 minutes I ended up standing off to the side waiting for about an extra 30 minutes. When I made a mention about it... a man naans Bryan or Ryan who seemingly was some soRt of management rolled his eyes to say &#34;SO what... here&#39;s your order&#34;. No accountability whatsoever. Better training and leadership classes would do this location some good. I definitely won&#39;t be back. Drove all the way honE to find out all my food wasn&#39;t even in the bag

I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo pasta with chicken. This was the worse dish ever from the Cheesecake Factory. What was supposed to be a rich creamy Alfredo sauce was only a butter sauce. It was tasteless.

The food great as always, the manager LIED to me about the parking fee!  We wait for 1.5 to be seating,plus the time to eat,  I asked twice for the parking validation, he recommend to go the the movie and ask for that! I said I can&#39;t do that, I was here all the time,  YOU have to validated it!!! he said any way you don&#39;t have to pay anything, you just have to tell you was in the restaurant, we have an agreement with them, finally I had to pay, but I don&#39;t like liars

Went on a Tuesday, wait was not bad at all and service was great. <br><br>I had the Shrimp and Angel Hair pasta and would definitely have it again. It was delish. <br><br>My friend has the Salmon Salad and she enjoyed it as well.  <br><br>For those wondering about the parking validation it does work. It&#39;s good for 2 hours, BUT from the time you entered the structure. If you are there longer, standard parking rates apply.

I&#39;m just going to start off that my experience at the Cheesecake Factory located inside the grove was exceptional however, my overall impression change when I took my food home. <br><br>I own only black dinnerware so seeing a chunk of white dinnerware debris mixed within my angel hair pasta that was over cooked but still palpable was unacceptable and truly a frightening experience as I ingested the small shards assuming it was just very coarse salt. It bothers me that a well established restaurant such as this one failed to pay attention to detail. It was not until I scooped another fork full of food that I noticed a large flat white object protruding out from the pasta coiled around my fork. At fist I thought it was Parmesan cheese and honestly got a little excited until I realized.. I didn&#39;t add Parmesan cheese after I microwaved my meal. Low and behold it was a thick hard shard that came off the dinner plate I was served from at the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Initially inside the restaurant when eating the shrimp angel hair pasta there was no problems but I guess it&#39;s customary for staff to box our food which I have no problem with but, there were no shards in my food while eating and after my food was taken back into the kitchen there were now shards in my food. <br><br>I came to the restaurant to take my best friend from high school out to celebrate my promotion. The staff was friendly and I enjoyed the ambiance but this situation ended my experience from an exceptional experience to utter disappointment. So take the time to check our plates. Be more mindful on how staff handle items that customers eat off of.

Such a horrible experience at this location. The host told EVERYONE 10 minutes regardless of table size. My max wait of 45 turned into 1.5 hours. Then we waited upstairs for another 10 minutes. <br><br>Management seemed to not have any control of their seemingly stressed wait staff. <br><br>Our waiter was nice, but spread too thin we barely saw him and couldn&#39;t get his attention.
This is officially the shortest review I have ever written.<br><br>Big fat bland food for big fat bland people. With cockroaches in the bathrooms.<br><br>That is all.

The Cheesecake Factory is a chain and you will know it the minute you walk in.<br>I was with a friend who insisted on going, despite my protest. It was, what it always is, crowded, over-priced, loud, the food is average and the service fair.<br>You are in Los Angeles, find a unique place to go. DuPars in right near the Cheesecake Factory, go there, anywhere, but here. It is boring and you will be happy to be out of there and will not really understand how you spent so much on bland food.
Always such great service and atmosphere.  Great date spot to stay casual and not too dressed up.

Had an absolutely amazing experience, we were given a buzzer and told our table would be 10-15 minutes, the buzzer was great as it reduced congestion around the entrance, we got our table in under 10 minutes and had excellence service to match the food that tasted delicious. We had the burger and pasta and both were cooked to perfection and the cheesecakes themselves you couldn&#39;t fault. <br><br>If you&#39;re ever in the grove or around the area this should definitely be a stop for lunch as you get amazing food and service and a decent price

Cheesecake Factory is the home to amazing memories, and lots of family dinners growing up. I&#39;ve been to this chain in tons of cities across the country, and overseas. It has always been a great experience.<br><br>Therefore, this was the worst Cheesecake location I have ever been to. <br><br>From the huge crowds, to the small dining room, and HUGE lack of customer service, this location was just terrible on every front. After waiting longer than we were told, we were finally seated. We switched waiters twice, both being incredibly rude. I had to flag them down multiple times just to refill our water glasses. I&#39;ve never been been met with such horrible waitstaff during my time at other Cheesecake establishment&#39;s where I have had stellar service. <br><br>I thought the food would have been the redeeming factor. But even that was terrible...almost unsuitable whatever came out. I don&#39;t think it would have mattered what came out, the food was cold, tasteless and I think a 5 year could have made it. It was the first time I didn&#39;t ask for a black to go box, and I think I touched less than half of my pasta. <br><br>Overall, I would never come back here and I&#39;m ashamed this location even exists.

The service was little bit on the slower side even though the restaurant was not packed.<br>However, their food was really good and the portions were large enough to share, even those lunch menus were big enough to share between two people. I really loved their grilled shrimp salad and their pastas are pretty good too!! Everything was pretty decent except the speed of service:)
Had the carne asada medallions with rice and chipotle sauce.  Son had delish cheeseburger with slab bacon!  Service was excellent even with server in training waiting on us.

Five stars to a franchised place? Well hear me out. It is called the Cheesecake Factory. Every single time I come here, I sit at the bar. There&#39;s no line or wait for that. A tip for those that are coming on a date* <br><br>They have Don Julio Blanco tequila and Patron blanco and resposado tequila. Not bad for a run of the mill restaurant right ? Not to sound like an alcoholic but they also have other types of premium liquors. I&#39;m impressed. <br><br>They validate for parking in the structure, not the farmers market. A mistake I made lol. I go to Cheesecake Factory when a shot of tequila and cheesecake is a good way to end a Tuesday or Thursday night. <br><br>Food is not bad but not somewhere I would go to for food and feel super excited for . Like I said, cheese cake and tequila.

I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factory Restaurants but must say the grove location is my favorite! Greeted at the door, friendly faces, and great atmosphere. I am not sure if it was just my hunger but my food tasted especially GREAT tonight! I always leave room for my favorite part &#34;CHEESECAKE&#34; something special! <br><br>My wife loves Martinis and my kids loved the shopping afterwards. It was a win win all around. <br><br>Must visit more often. Christmas is our favorite time of the year to visit. Highly recommend.

For my money it doesn&#39;t get any better than the Cheesecake Factory. Their menu spans time and space and provides the whole family an opportunity to get a heaping helping of whatever they desire. Can&#39;t agree on where to eat? Make it a Cheesecake Factory night.

Why you gotta fight with me at Cheesecake?<br>You know I love to go there<br>Say I&#39;m actin&#39; lightskin, I can&#39;t take you nowhere<br>This a place for families that drive Camrys and go to Disney......<br><br>This is definitely a family place, the environment exudes that. The service was A1, the food was full of flavor and large in size, and the drinks were solid. I&#39;d like to go back and try other things on the textbook of a menu they have.

Received great service however, the one that stood out the most is Rigo. He made sure we were well taken care of by seating us and going above and beyond by coming in to check up on us. I definitely will be coming back to this location always.

I am very disappointed. I ordered a cesaer salad and the croutons were rock hard and not fresh. Also the flavor felt very artifical.<br>But the worst thing was when the waiter was talking to us he spat on me several times that was horrible! I will never be going to this restaurant again! Horrible service and unprofessional waiters!

After driving like 9 hours to LA, i def wanted a good meal even if it meant waiting an hr for it. Fuck it why not?? Been in traffic all day. Great food here, big ass portions, great service and nice outdoor seating. Would come back to this location!

This was the worst experience of my life I walked into this restaurant at 8:19 it&#39;s 9:58 now and I still don&#39;t have most of my order the service was bringing us food we didn&#39;t even order and I&#39;ve been trying to get a refill of my water for about 20-30 min and I haven&#39;t got one I do not recommend this place at all I rather go to McDonald&#39;s and then eat here ever again the manager on duty name is Daniel he is very disrespectful we are trying to explain our problems with the service/food and he has one of the biggest attitudes I&#39;ve ever seen in my life TRUST ME DON&#39;T EAT HERE.

Great service, the food was amazing!  I had the flat bread everything pizza, my wife had the orange chicken plate.  We got the peanut butter cheesecake, and the white chocolate raspberry cheese cake.  The place was packed and our service was still amazing.  The wait was 10 minutes, our waiter was always around.  We will definitely be returning.

It&#39;s really your typical Cheesecake Factory, but for the love of god, their service is incredibly slow here. Even their to-go takes so much longer than necessary. <br><br>I tend to eat here more than I should when I&#39;m shopping at the grove and honestly, they need some work on their customer service. I was just there last night picking up my to-go order (that I was quoted 15-20 min and it took almost 30), when a woman was addressing the manager for their server bringing the wrong wine and cheesecake to their table..... and all they ordered was wine and cheesecake. Haha!

Of course the food is AWESOME!  The service????? Not so much. We didn&#39;t see our servers much. Only three times.  Once to take our order, second to bring out food. And third to bring our ticket. <br><br>Our visit was a bit disappointing.  I bought one of my staff members that has never visited this establishment before. <br><br>Hopefully next time it won&#39;t be such a disappointment.

Let me start off by saying...this is the first 5 Star review I&#39;ve given. I dont care if Im coming here for breakfast, lunch or dinner this place never fails. From customer service to the (sometimes overwhelming menu) this place is consistent and they always deliver. The food is GOOOOD period. Cant forget the hot yummy baskets of bread while you wait for your food. I swear the wheat bread is made from Heaven. <br>Here&#39;s a list of all the things I&#39;ve tried and they all are a 10/10 (honestly, I have been here so many times I cant think of everything but..you get the point)<br>-Thai chicken lettuce wraps <br>-Fried Macaroni balls<br>-Toasted sesame cauliflower <br>- crispy fried cheese<br>-Roadside sliders<br>-Avocado egg rolls<br>-BBQ chicken pizza<br>-Miso Salmon<br>-Bruléed french toast<br>- blueberry pancakes<br>-Adams peanut butter ripple cheesecake #1<br>-Original cheesecake<br>- Godiva chocolate cheesecake<br>-Banana cream cheesecake #2

I dont know why i decided to give this place another chance, but i did, and as usual their service was lacking to say the least. They either need to hire more waiters or retrain their staff in the basics of running a restaurant and customer service. Also, they do false advertisement! I ordered my son a meal from the kids menu, which clearly states the meal comes with my choice of drink. I asked my son what he wanted and he wanted an apple juice. The server said it would be $1 more. $1 is nothing, but nowhere on the menu does it say it&#39;s an extra charge for juice as opposed to all the other options listed. Anyway i agreed to be charged the extra $1. When the bill came, not only did they take the liberty to charge me $1 on top of the price of the meal (see pics), they charged me another $1 on a separate line. Regardless of the amount, this is called STEALING from customers, Cheesecake Factory!!! You guys owe me $2!!

When we came in the Cheesecake Factory we were sat very quickly, we sat inside and had the best server ever. Yasmin was quick and very polite. Outstanding customer service, she brought bread automatically and we ordered drinks and appetizer. The food was good but the service made it outstanding. She checked on us and made sure our food was okay and brought bread and refilled drinks throughout the service. <br><br>The nachos was a big plate and enough for two people. The cheese was decent but the chicken and guacamole was very good! The salmon was cooked well and had good flavor. The calamari were delicious but came out too oily and the skin was coming off. Overall good service.

The food was good and that&#39;s about it. We waited 15 minutes after being seated and that was only because my friend had to grab someone to serve us. Our waiter Michael could not have cared less about serving us, he didn&#39;t come to check on us at all, and completely disappeared after taking our order. We spoke to the manager and all she did was give us a fake apology and offer us free cheesecake which neither of us wanted. There was no discount applied in exchange for that or anything. It&#39;s pretty clear they don&#39;t give a damn about their job or their customers. I&#39;ll pass.

Dont bother. I used to love their sired ahi salad and when I was bad the carbonara. The service is terrible the carbonara was soup with spaghetti  and it took 20 minutes for water and the wine I ordered. Just dont

I went at such a bad time lol<br>Last night was the tree lighting event and it was PACKED. Wait was ridiculously long, service could&#39;ve been better and foods overly priced. I guess it&#39;s considered an upscale restaurant..? <br>Well to start, this was probably the only restaurant that was open INSIDE the grove due to the event.. and if we wanted to eat elsewhere, we weren&#39;t allowed back in so it gave us no choice. We noticed that there was so many open seats but they couldn&#39;t take us in because of the timing of the event or something like that.. which made no sense.<br>When they took us the our table, they were missing a chair on a two seater so my date had to stand and wait till they brought him one.. again, unprepared.<br>I feel like they could&#39;ve definitely better planned knowing how crazy it was going to get. Oh man. <br>Food was ok. My date&#39;s pasta was super dry but and my pasta was very bland. I would&#39;ve said something but I had to send mine back already because they made it wrong and we didn&#39;t want to wait any longer.<br>But the sweet brown bread was soooo good. So warm and flavorful! <br>Food was a bit pricey for what it was. I didn&#39;t get to take pics because we were so hungry at that point, we just ate!<br>But we ordered the Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic &amp; bistro shrimp pasta. <br>Not sure we would get it again.

Very impressed - came here with 20+ individuals for my friend and I&#39;s graduation dinner, and they executed! <br><br>Everyone&#39;s dish was indescribably delicious. Maybe it&#39;s because we were starving and had lunch around 4? Nah. <br><br>If you&#39;re a seafood lover, you have to - have to - order the Jambalaya. It&#39;s full of flavors with a hint of Cajun. I modified it and got rice instead of pasta (my friend got pasta and liked mines better) and only asked for shrimp in it (chicken and shrimp also tastes good). Ooo, don&#39;t be a fool and forget the Calamari Bites. Sometimes you get more batter than calamari but not here! <br><br>Our servers were also phenomenal at bring us the complimentary bread - yassssssss, bless.<br><br>The only weird/annoying was that the bartender kindly asked us not to order drinks from the bar but at the table. A bar is a place designed for individuals to order drinks at - sorry. We were ordering drinks in intervals, so it didn&#39;t make sense to flag down the server every time we wanted to order one, two or four drinks. The funny thing was, it wasn&#39;t even busy at the bar.

I&#39;m only giving them 2 stars because I have had better meals there. But the last time I went. I had to wait for a bar table for 45 min. I ordered the calamari and the chicken carbonara. The food took forever. When I finally got my calamari, it was cold. When I finally got my pasta it was bland as could be. (Ragu and noodles would have been better). Not one person ever bothered to ask me how it was. If they did, I would have sent it back. I was very disappointed with the whole experience. So much so, I will not be back! Save your money and go somewhere else!

My co-workers and I went for happy hour around 5:30 and our waiter was Jesse. Although he seemed polite, I have to say he looked the least interested in recommending us (myself per say) much of appetizers or drinks. As I asked him what was available for bourbon selections he again seemed to have the least interested in helping me. Then as I concluded the bourbon I wanted to use on my old fashioned he had left as I was just turning over to place my order. Should&#39;ve asked if I wanted to place an order before taking off so abruptly. Least to say worse customer service I&#39;ve received thus far in a long time. I know customer service, as I myself have to provide it in my line of work and this definitely wasn&#39;t it. Drinks seemed to be watered down as well only had one round.<br>Perhaps better training and educating would do the trick for this spot, but I don&#39;t believe I&#39;d recommend this place to any of my friends/family.
The Cheesecake Factory is a token favorite of my mine. I enjoy a lot of menu options.  I recently had the shrimp patter and it was good.

Service was great. Food was so good I got all my favorites! Just hate the set up at this location and how they kept switching my wait time. On my birthday! If I didn&#39;t pay to uber 30 mins I would&#39;ve left.

This is the WORST cheese cake factory I ever been to really slow service rude waiters BUT WORST OF ALL I GOT FOOD POISING! From CHICKEN! I ordered the parmesan breaded chicken and took one bite and knew something was wrong not to be rude I ate some of it and immediately started to feel sick so I called a manager he said he would take it off the bill but I didn&#39;t care about the money it really didn&#39;t taste right so I gave it back and went home about a hour later I started to feel really sick after a other hour I started to VOMIT! It was uncontrollable I puked so much I popped the blood vessels in my eyes  I have more graphic pictures but don&#39;t even want to show them it was so bad it stood like that for a WEEK so I would never go back to this location  it was the worst experience in my life I never vomited as much in my life then that night it was terrible NO ONE SHOULD GO they should be happy I didn&#39;t sue

If I could give this place less than one star I would. I was visiting LA this weekend, I specifically went to this location because if was the closest one to me. I went there to purchase a whole pumpkin pie to bring over for Rosh Hashanah dinner and you would think that for $60 they would give you a pie that isn&#39;t fuc*ing frozen! The person that rang me up had a crappy attitude for some reason. I had to stand there and wait for a shitty frozen pie for 20 mins. I don&#39;t plan on ever going back to this place and I&#39;m going to reverse the charges on my card. <br><br>* update: I have contacted them directly as instructed and we&#39;ll see what happens. Personally I don&#39;t understand how/why corporate has not stepped in and fixed the issues with this location. Their reviews are terrible and this is a location I would think they&#39;d focus on .<br><br>Second update: 11/1/18<br>I was contacted and asked to contact them directly. I did and so far nothing has happened. They have enough bad reviews were hopefully people will think twice before choosing this dump.

Where do I even begin  -  I must say that overall, I love Cheesecake Factory for what it is. The food is good, and most of the time the service is great. However this time I was extremely disappointed to the point where I will not go back to this location simply based on the abysmal service JUST with trying to get an accommodation for seating. Myself and my best friend&#39;s Mother attempted to get reservations for my best friend&#39;s Birthday, and were immediately told over the phone that they do not accommodate reservations for over six people. Ok, as much as I don&#39;t understand this I went with it. Upon telling my best friend&#39;s mother this, she called in to speak to the manager to see if there was a way that we could get around this as we had a party of 11 people coming. She spoke with the manager, and we ended up putting in two reservations online back to back so we would all be able to sit together. Excellent! Now we are all set for the Birthday dinner! When we arrived there, we were greeted with nothing but difficulty from the front desk. We were told that there was only one reservation online that was showing up, and that the other one wasn&#39;t there even though it had been submitted and confirmed. They even had it documented in their system that the manager had been spoken with. Unfortunately the manager told the front desk he would &#34;be right there&#34; to discuss, but we never spoke to him. The best part of this situation is that the gentleman at the front desk said &#34;I don&#39;t care who&#39;s birthday it is&#34;, and that we would have to wait around two hours in order to get two tables next to each other. Once we told them that we were going to go elsewhere, shockingly enough they told us that they had two tables that had opened up next to each other. Upon looking - two booths back to back. Listen, I get it because I&#39;ve worked in the service industry and about 99% of the time I am understanding especially on busy nights, but to be greeted with that kind of hostility is really unnecessary especially on somebody&#39;s birthday night. I would expect more given that there were reservations on file, and documentation that someone who worked at the restaurant had been spoken with. Needless to say, we ended up having a wonderful birthday dinner at Maggiano&#39;s who were able to take us in immediately without a holier than thou snap-back. Super disappointed, Cheesecake Factory - I love your food, but I recommend adjusting the reservation debacle, and maybe some attitudes.

Came here while I was venturing out at The Grove for the first time, however there was a Dancing with the Stars event going on and it was super crowded. My girlfriend and I just snuck in and sat down at one of the tables near the bar and none of the servers noticed. We ordered a drink and some buffalo blasts as appetizers. We were in a rush to just get food, validate our parking, and leave to go somewhere later that evening. However because it was so packed, our planned 10 min dinner took about 30-40 min in total.<br><br>Key Tip: Try not to come here while it&#39;s packed, or if there&#39;s an event going on. Our service took forever unfortunately.

Don&#39;t get fooled....they say they validate parking at the Grove for 2 hours..that is a lie...3 weeks in a row we stopped by for Friday dinner....stayed for less than 2 hours and got charged $7 for parking....just deceptive..  just say you don&#39;t validate and be honest
The wait time was horrible!!! The food wasn&#39;t the greatest and don&#39;t get me started on the waiter. My girlfriend and I had the WORST experience ever!

The Grove Cheesecake Factory - amazing location <br>Wait time for 6 people on a Saturday  1pm- 30-45minutes <br>Service - our servers assigned near the patio were excellent and very attentive. We were here 6/29 1-3pm<br>The only reason why I&#39;m giving this place a 1 star is because there is a thief amongst those who clean the tables. Left my rayban sunglasses on the table and literally came back after 7 minutes to get it back. There was no lost and found according to the receptionist??? Manager supposedly asked around who cleaned our table and looked underneath the table??? &#34;Sorry we couldn&#39;t find it&#34; And I am not accusing ok! I am very sure the SG was left on the table. Just disappointed about the whole thing especially when we came back right away!Make sure you don&#39;t leave anything! I would have let go over a $140 sunglasses but the point is people should be cautious and aware and so is the owner of the establishment.

Last night I came here with my son and the hostess at the bottom of the stairs told me 15 minutes for us two. It was not it was more like 30 minutes. And whatever right but I could see people that came in after me already eating. <br><br>We finally get sad at a two top table (i have a toddler with me). Which is no big deal but next two us on both sides are 4 tops with two people that sat down within 30 seconds before or after me. So I was annoyed that I had to sit with him on my lap when it easily could&#39;ve been avoided if the hostess knew what they were doing. <br><br>We waited for 15 minutes (the table next to me with the same server) for her (our server, tall black girl with the high ponytail) to come over just to say hi ill be right with you. She finally comes over and we order our food and drinks. No its been like 30 minutes and we still have no drinks or bread. I look over and shes telling the hostess to bring us bread. The hostess was literally going crazy and didn&#39;t know what to do she was so spastic and crazy. She comes back and puts two baskets of bread on my tiny ass table for me and a two year old. The drinks finally come. My mojito was weak but really good in flavor. Baby got milk that was half full. I just laughed, whatever. The ladies next to me didn&#39;t get full sodas. We all chuckled like wtf is going on. <br><br>Our server was attending to a party of maybe 9 next to the ladies i was next to. All of  her attention was on them or she was no where to be found. <br><br>I got my cashew chicken that was sooo good! It was the best ive had from cheesecake in awhile. Baby got a pepperoni pizza that was good too. The server came over with a fake ass smile like howww isss everythinnng and I was just like fine. <br><br>I ate quickly because I had an appointment at Apple. <br><br>I wait like 10 minutes, can&#39;t find our server anywhere. She literally talked to me twice. Once to take the order and the fake howww isss everthinnng lol  so i asked another server for two boxes and my check.<br><br>The other server brings the check and i paid exactly my bill to the quarter. No tip (Ive only done that one other time in my whole life. I was a server for years in every kind of restaurant but our server was a joke and unacceptable.You don&#39;t get tipped just cause you&#39;re in the building) She didnt have to do much but take orders, bring drinks and attend to her customers. She had a runner and busser) I walked around for a few minutes, I was going to give the server who gave me my check $5 but couldnt find her. If a manager reads this, shawty gotta go. She is not cut to be a server lol

I&#39;ve always enjoyed my time at the Cheesecake Factory in the Grove. It&#39;s always been a pretty solid spot to eat. And it still is. But the idiot waiter named Juan really needs to be fired. I asked the dude for a refill and he refused. Literally said he&#39;s incapable of doing so. The woman next to him gave me one. Juan is a genuine idiot and a lazy employee. Don&#39;t be like Juan. <br><br>Outside of him, &#34;and also our non-existent waiter which was the reason I had to go get my own refill in the first place&#34;, I would&#39;ve given it a 4 star rating. <br><br>Get your shit together Cheesecake Factory. You&#39;ve got prime real estate at the grove. Don&#39;t let lazy ass waiters ruin it. <br><br>Still tipped tho cuz I&#39;m not a dick.
This was by far the worst customer service I&#39;ve ever experienced. My rude waitress Jeff was not only rude, but offended my whole family. Never going back there again!

Love the location at the Grove! Service was great and so was the food! <br><br>Appetizers - of course the complimentary bread is always delicious but was not hot this time. So a bit disappointing. We ordered the chicken samosas, they seriously are so delicious. I&#39;m Indian and I&#39;m quite impressed! <br><br>All 3 kids ordered kids meals - chicken fingers and fries and chicken quesadilla they said was good!<br><br>My sister and I had a bottle of Pinot Noir - was actually good and the prices per bottle were not bad at all. We both shared the tomato flatbread - really good! <br><br>Happy!

Food: Good<br>Service: TERRIBLE<br>Atmosphere: Dark, Loud<br>Chipotle chicken pasta: yummy, definitely try<br><br>2 stars because the food isn&#39;t bad or else I&#39;d give it 1 STAR ONLY.<br><br>Boyfriend and I came here for a dinner date. The wait to be seated for dinner around 7:45 pm was 45 minutes, so we decided to go to the bar and find self seating. Once seated, it took a good 10 minutes for a server to notice us and to clean the table from the previous people. We got our menu&#39;s and ordered fairly quickly but, we did not receive utensils, appetizer plates, or the complimentary bread that they typically hand out once you&#39;ve been greeted. We had to ask for them ourselves after aimlessly waiting for a good 7 minutes. We also ordered drinks but, those did not come out for over 25 minutes. I understood they were busy, but that does not give them an excuse when I&#39;ve been to much busier restaurants and have received better service.<br><br>The food came out shortly after which was great, but our server NEVER came up to ask if we needed anything else or how the food was. We ate for a good 30 minutes without any contact. We even had to wave our server down to look at a desert menu and order. Those occurred on two separate occasions too. We almost just gave up on ordering dessert but, my boyfriend never had a cheesecake from here so I wanted him to try one obviously cos they are good.<br><br>But, OMG, you do NOT even want me to get started on how terrible it was to get our check. It took forever to find our sever to ask for our check. Then, it took about 15 minutes to actually receive it and ANOTHER 10 minutes for the server notice us waving him down and process it. We could have dined and ditched!!<br><br>Your food is good Cheesecake Factory but, please, train your employees better!! I won&#39;t be coming back here unless the service improves by an extraordinary amount.

Just spent $160 or so on family dinner and the food was horrible. Food was very salty and chicken very dry. Can&#39;t believe I paid that. Drinks were really good though, the bartender did an amazing job making our drinks.

Okay so every time I visit the Cheesecake Factory at any of the locations I am left highly disappointed and the Grove location is no exception! The wait at this location is a very long wait, but they supply you with a pager that allows you to go a pretty far distance so you can do a little shopping while you wait. <br><br>The staff here is a little rude and some of them are impatient and seem like they just hate their jobs. We were seated on the balcony and it was a pretty hot day so it was uncomfortable and crowded. Our waitress seemed a little off and was not very attentive. And for some reason I always feel like these restaurants are a little dirty!<br><br>We ordered peach bellinis which were too sweet and tasted like they had zero alcohol. They also took forever to come out. The food was just very bland and not good. I decided to order the fish tacos and they were a little cold when they arrived to the table. The fish was not crispy and a little soggy. They just seemed flavorless. The only reason I gave this place another chance was because I was given a gift card. Do yourself a favor and try one of the other thousand restaurants in the area. This restaurant isn&#39;t worth the time or money.

I frequent this Cheesecake Factory a lot. It&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve been here, but today&#39;s visit was horrible. The food was rushed! I ordered Fish &amp; Chips, the fish was super mushy. It tasted like pancakes, the fries were undercooked. I sent that plate back to the kitchen. My friend ordered the spicy chipotle pasta, it literally had five itty bitty pieces of chicken in. Instead of complaining we just took the &#34;L&#34;. However, Cheesecake Factory is removed from my list of places to eat.

Tonight have A Bad day here. I&#39;ve guests from Asia come to visit on holiday, we pick dinner at here. But we got **Unpleasant Experience**<br><br>1st The customer service was horrible, they put us wating 55+5 min but when is our time,  they give the seat to a group come after us and we&#39;ve the same a group of 5 person too, **No professional at all** I ask them, What &#39;s happend ? Cann&#34;t tell. <br><br>2nd, We ordered food before the next 3 tables from us but **we got food the last table**<br><br>I  ask a mamager, we sit 30 min order food beofore them, Where&#39;re our food?<br>she said, I don&#39;t know...I just come to work ** No Professional Again** Even a manager. They should, told us, Let me check, what&#39;s happend?,  Is it ???<br><br>The food tatse good &amp;  great. But the service very very poor.

Simple and Sweet<br><br>Cheesecake factory is definitely a great place to go celebrate in big parties or when you have a lot of friends with different needs. Cheesecake factory can deliver as they have a massive menu that WILL cater to everyone. The food is alright but its the portions and the free bread that makes up for everything. You will definitely end up with leftovers because of how giant each dish is. I always get the Jambalaya pasta because that&#39;s my go to item. Of course they are known for their cheesecakes and their cheesecakes are super decadent but oh so delicious. I don&#39;t think you can go wrong with any of them as all the ones i&#39;ve tried are really good. <br><br>I think for this location service can be average as other yelpers have mentioned but its not bad. The decor is solid at every location and this one is no exception. Heck this one is 2 stories and you take a escalator up to the dining room! How awesome is that?! <br><br>Definitely a great place to celebrate in big parties and get together. Prices are also extremely fair so thumbs up!

Got food poisoning for a second time here. :(<br><br>I dropped by this Sunday with my boyfriend for lunch after looking for gifts for family members around the Grove. I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo with a Pineapple Mojito. The meal and service were okay, food was a little too greasy for me, but I really think what have gotten me sick was the ice water. <br><br>Last time I got food poisoning from this location was a couple years back after being the only one at my table to be drinking water. My cousin ordered the same plate as I but was drinking coke and never got sick. There&#39;s something seriously wrong with the water! I don&#39;t even know how they can screw this up, as it&#39;s only water!

It must have been over a decade since I&#39;ve eaten at a Cheesecake Factory. I wanted to visit a pop up shop at The Grove (first time at The Grove, shopping plazas and places where everyone wants to go all at once in general are not really my thing although I could be describing all of LA save for a few precious square feet) and my friend wanted to eat here. It was a 25 minute wait for a table of two and we considered and later regretted just not walking one block to the Farmer&#39;s Market at The Grove. <br><br>My first impression of this place is that it&#39;s &#34;like a theme park restaurant&#34; - and my friend pointed out how a line on the escalator to the second floor looked like people were in fact on a ride. Macaroni Grill is comparable food wise but just does such a much better job with food and ambience. After 25 minutes of waiting people ride the escalator to wait 10-15 more minutes. <br><br>The low ratings is primarily due to the drink menu coupled with the greasiness of the tables and floors. I felt like I was eating somewhere in Chinatown where at least it&#39;s remotely acceptable and part of the atmosphere. But the light brown tables really brought out the greasy look. Walking to the restroom was greasy. I was wearing mule flats with a reliable bottom tread and the floor was greasy enough to make the trip to the restroom a bit precarious in terms of slippage potential and felt my step slide at least twice. I hate greasy places. The &#34;blood orange margarita&#34; was a joke that went unfinished. Wrong taste, wrong glass. Avoid their cocktails at all costs and just go for draft beer or wine. <br><br>Their food was the only good thing - their infamous brown bread and butter. I had the jambalaya pasta and it was scientifically perfect. Their food undeniably has the taste of several food scientists sweating over recipes and testing them before putting it onto their ever changing menu. That&#39;s really the only interesting thing about this place. I compare it to McDonald&#39;s and use the same term: &#34;eatability.&#34; The food has high eatability - you can eat a lot of their huge portions before being sated and even when sated want to eat just a bit more. It isn&#39;t necessarily the best food by all standards but boy is it so...eatable. And I don&#39;t mean edible...eatable foods are foods that create their own standard rather than adhere to traditional standards and emphasize the most base human cravings and turn those up a notch. The balance of color, of ingredients, of texture, of ease of transporting food from plate to mouth and the art of shape/portioning - it is all down to a measured science and I gotta say that in itself is pretty respectable and fascinating. Eatability is all about being too good to be authentic. That said, I probably will never come back even if there is a time and place for eatable foods.

Can I tell you that my service here at the cheese cake was amazing. I never had great service like this in a while. Juan made my stay here, amazing. Thank you Juan for giving me exceptional service. You were nice , kind and thank you for the bread. Lol please go sit at Juan&#39;s section. You won&#39;t be disappointed. <br><br>Thank you cheesecake factory for having Juan. He needs a raise.

We where a party of 9, a small celebration for my Mother in law&#39;s birthday. My in laws only speak Spanish but my husband placed their order. The waiter mistakingly placed 2 orders instead of 1. We right away told her. She took the plate back. When it was time to pay and got the bill we sow the amount 185... But it was only the grand total didn&#39;t show  in details who order what. I inform her that I wanted to see the entire bill. She got bothered.. we also sow that there was a 18% tip added to the bill we asked her about it and just said it&#39;s only 15% what&#39;s the big deal  but we inform her that we where going to split the bill. Shouldn&#39;t be a problem right.. well this lady said very rudely &#34;I cannot deal with you guys I am going to get my manager.&#34;.. We where all confused the manager came and we asked him about the tip and also about splitting the bill they removed the tip but they didn&#39;t split the bill. The waiter then came back angry and said there&#39;s not tip in the new bill. You leave the tip in the table. She then brought us our cheesecake in a to go container when we had told her that 2 of them where to go but 2 we where going to eat at the restaurant.. very rudely no response she kept rolling her eyes and was so angry with us. She demanded a tip 3 times but I told her why would I give you a tip when your being so rude to us. She shames us with the manager on site as we where getting ready to leave my in laws started walking towards the door when OUR waiter came and pushed him. An elderly man walking with a cane !!! No lie !! even corporate called me and said they do see the waiter passing by my in laws n they do see there was a interaction..(camera capture this!)  but said she could of had pump into him by mistake.. I&#39;m sorry she&#39;s still on duty there&#39;s no tables there so she has no business being in front of the store.. she&#39;s not sitting anyone what a coincidence that she bumped into him!!!  What an unpleasant evening we had to celebrate my mother in law birthday!! Totally disaster!!! Save your money go else where .. corporate says the waiter been working for Cheesecake Factory for many years and very well experience I&#39;m here to say otherwise!! Obviously they don&#39;t see what&#39;s going under their NOSE! Not only did we feel discriminated but this is assult!!!!

If I could give 0 stars I would! I have never experienced such horrendous service at this Cheesecake Factory or any restaurant for that matter! I have to say I&#39;m disgusted! Came in, they said there was an hour wait which was perfectly fine. When our buzzer started going off we arrived back promptly and still had to wait another 25 minutes. After we were finally seated we waited for almost an hour before we even spoke to a server! Got no water or bread! The table next to us had arrived 10 minutes after and were served, had finished their food, and left before our order was even taken. We asked for a manager and she could not have been less apologetic. She was extremely unprofessional and she only even offered compensation AFTER we asked. And it was only 25% off! Do not come to this Cheesecake Factory if you are black! Extremely racist! (Side note: couple next us was white)

I ordered the chicken cesar salad which tasted great and the basil tomato flatbread which I wouldn&#39;t order again. It was burnt on the bottom so we had to scrap as much black bits as we could off. I think the complimentary bread tasted better. The good thing about this restaurant is that it has an extensive menu so you can try something different next time. The other good thing, is the brown bread. Best thing ever!<br><br>Service was okay. I did think it was odd that after walking through the front door and letting the hostess know how many people were in our party, she instructs us to go upstairs to wait. As a new patron to this restaurant, I thought our table was ready. The &#34;waiting area&#34; is pretty much standing in front of the cheesecake display and in the servers&#39; way as they try to get to their tables. It was a bit crowded. It would have made more sense to wait downstairs where we are not in people&#39;s way.  Service was okay means that they did what they were supposed to do - ask how your meal is (yes, I know our flatbread wasn&#39;t good but I didn&#39;t want the re-made one to come out with people&#39;s spit on it. It was fine to just eat as is), check on your drinks, and be super cool and bring more bread. It wasn&#39;t horrible and it wasn&#39;t exceptional. It was good.

The Marina Del Rey Cheesecake Factory location continuously disappoints me. I took a 3-month break on this specific location, which is my &#39;home restaurant&#39;, after receiving poor customer service and subpar food. I made several complaints to the managers, and they seemed jaded and disinterested. Today, I decided to try them out again, take out only- of course, and they did not surprise me...took 3-4 times for me to call for someone to answer the phone. When someone finally did, put me on a 10-minute hold, and then answered with &#34;what can I get you?&#34; Where is the customer service!? Food was gross...this location is just bad. Take your business/money elsewhere! Businesses, especially now, are suffering and in need of money- don&#39;t waste your hard earned money on this establishment!

WORST EXPERIENCE!!!<br>I ordered Pasta with sausage and it came out like this.<br>So i asked the server Paul &#34;Is this suppose to be like this?&#34; and he answered yes <br>I was like what???<br> I order this all the time<br>he was annoyed that we asked....<br>He seemed careless<br>Never coming back

Ordered the shrimp scampi and got slightly breaded tasteless shrimp and pasta in tasteless sauce. <br><br>I had to add lots of salt for some kind of flavor. <br>Correct me if im wrong but im use to shrimp scampi where you can taste the lemon and butter along with whatever other seasoning but this was just awful and i lied about everything and just ate it since i had not eaten anything for the day and waited a little while before receiving the food.<br><br>The breading was crunchy on the outside and gooey on the inside and found myself eating some of the skin that wasnt pulled of the top part and had to keep spitting it out until i just peeled off the breading and added more salt. <br><br>I ended up taking bites off of the other persons plate,so i can say that salmon with potatoes and broccoli was very tasty a tad bit too much salt in the mashed potatoes but very delicious meal including the sauce it came with on the side.

I love this restaurant chain. I usually always have a good experience at which ever location I go. <br><br>This cheesecake is a nice spot. You can sit and order or get your food to go and in good time. If it&#39;s during their rush, they&#39;ll give You a buzzer. But you can easily waste 15-30mins walking around the Grove or Barnes n Nobles next door!!! The seating is upstairs, and you can also done in their outside seating area and get a sweet view of the Fountain. <br><br>Staff: pleasant, can be scant so you might need to get their attention<br><br>Alcohol: pricey and not that strong but a large menu! <br><br>Food: good. I&#39;ve never had any issues with my food at this location. Favs: Chicken Corn Tortillas, and their pastas !! Yum!<br><br>Overall a good dining experience.

I like cheesecake factory&#39;s in general. The food is decent and decently priced. The service here was actually really good and the wait was about 40 minutes on a weeknight. They validate the parking but it&#39;ll still be about $6 to park in the garage. <br><br>The restaurant is on the second floor while the check in is on the first. The dishes are your standard but I felt the chicken to be a bit tough and some were slightly overbreaded. Not bad but also not as tender as some of the other locations I&#39;ve been to. Cheesecake was still bomb though.
Our family like this place very much!!  We always go to there during our prominade in the Groove:)) Very nice place, kindly staff. We like to have a dinner or tea with desserts in terrace.

Came here to mainly try the other desserts besides the cheesecake and my boyfriend and I order a Hot Fudge Sundae and we both expected it to be a warm brownie but it was cold which was pretty disappointing and we came on a Wednesday and it was super busy but maybe because it was raining that day and everyone wanted to stay inside and chill but the staff was okay as well

I come in wearing a hoodie, a baseball cap,sit at the bar and get treated like crap.  Bartenders more interested in the Golden State game and what&#39;s going on their phones than dealing with me as a guest.  When I finally get some attention order a premium drink and bottled water.  Think that should give them some clue that I&#39;m here to spend some money.  Nope:(. MOD come up to them and says there will be an inspection tomorrow so make sure all the coolers are clean.  Guess what happened after that.  Zero guest service! <br><br>I worked for CCF for a long time, back when we only had 18 restaurants, and it&#39;s truly sad to see how far the service standards have fallen.  Funny thing is that I spoke with the female manager on my way out.  I paid my tab, still tipped 20%, and she was combative.  I wasn&#39;t asking for anything, as I had already paid my bill and tipped.  She told me how long she had been with the company. I know Shelias words of &#34;I&#39;m so sorry&#34; but she didn&#39;t get it.  <br><br>Sent a complaint to CCF web sight times two times and no reply.  If CCF wants to actually reply to me it&#39;s <a href="mailto:iainwalling@gmail.com">iainwalling@gmail.com</a>.  Hey CCF get back to basics and stop treating your guests like cattle.  There will come a day when they stop coming.  You are going down the path of restaurants that thought they were too good to fail.  Guess what happens to restaurants who thought that.  Out of business!

My family and I were in the area and decided to stop by for dinner. Their Spicy Chipotle Pasta with asparagus is always a great choice for us! Yesterday we ordered a separate entree &#34; Crispy Louisiana Chicken &#34; with a mixture of pasta and noodles. Truly enjoyed it.

This place will never be bad for me. This is my number one go to place. Love the fact that it has variety so each person in your party can choose what they crave. If you&#39;re in mood of sea food and someone else burgers or Italian so this place will have it all.  I have been to almost every cheesecake there is even in Dubai, Kuwait. Love almost everything they have. The only down side is that you gotta wait for a table. This time  we ordered sandwiches and loved it. Love their brown bread as well. I think I will go for hours if I decide to name everything I love about that please.

One good thing for sure you can always guarantee dining at The Cheesecake Factory for the most part, you will always get good service and a good meal.  Everyone of course raves about their breads, and so we ordered more and more of it.  Why not, it was complimentary.  LOL :p  <br><br>While I&#39;d tell you what to order here, but I&#39;m sure at one point in your life or another, you&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory, but I believe most of everything on their menu are good. I prefer their seafood when I&#39;m here.  If you do decide to order desserts, may I suggest ordering their Cheesecake Banana?  It is really darn good!!  And after your meal, don&#39;t forget to walk it off around The Grove, burn a few calories after dinner, or maybe even stop by for a nice outdoor cafe at the EBar-Nordstrom.<br><br>Until then, Cheers! ~ :p

Not sure why this place would only have 3 stars. Besides the fact that it can get busy on weekends, since it is a huge tourist location. Decided to cut some time and sit in the bar area which wasn&#39;t too much different than regular tables. The server was very friendly and attentive. Had the herb crust chicken break which was very tasty. And can&#39;t forget about the brown bread that&#39;s complimentary with every meal. Make sure not to fill up, Cheesecake is a must!!

We were treated like cattle by staff, get them in  and out.  I asked for window table, said I would wait as long as needed, they disregarded that, stuck two of us in booth for 8 and we had to clear the extra settings for them.  Server clearly over seated, tried very hard though. I don&#39;t eat out often because of this, it should be a relaxing experience considering how much bill and tip always is. I tip even if not happy.  I&#39;m sitting here with handicapped person who doesn&#39;t hear and can&#39;t talk well and all I wanted was window seat .

Had another great meal and dinning experience at The Cheesecake Factory @ the Grove.  Mickey was our wonderful server.  I make sure to go to every time I visit Los Angeles.  They have everything one could desire - great food, professional service and a beautiful decor.

This is based off of a DoorDash delivery. 10th time ordering. <br><br>Ordered the combo: steak and shrimp scampi combo. I usually get this when dining in. Also a slice of cheesecake. <br><br>Entree - was room temperature and the food portion seemed smaller than when dining in. Expected a little bit more food for $23. Shrimp was a little over cooked. <br><br>Cheesecake - was still cold, was a good portion slice and was fully intact. Delivery was excellent. <br><br>Bread - no bred. When ordering online, it says that bread is automatically included. I did not receive bread. I have requested bread on past orders(eventhough it says it&#39;s included) and about 70% of the time, no bread. <br><br>Verdict - usually the food is warm when ordering(so could been a off night),the desserts are usually delivered correctly. Ask for bread, if not you most likely will not get it.
Same as other cheesecake factory around LA reasonably price, so so food nothing especial, customer service kinda bad, too much wait for reservation and order of food.

This review is for the Manager whose name was Steven and how he handled the disturbing situation.<br><br>We came here to get a lunch and as a starter ordered Fried Calamari. After couple bites we got from Calamari it appeared some noddles between the calamaries and also on the red sauce they served with.  We inform our waitress and she took the Calamari and about 5 minutes later manager Steven showed up and told us how it was a normal thing to rice noodles to contaminated with fried calamari. SERIOUSLY, I DID NOT WANT YOUR NOODLE IN MY CALAMARI PLATE and do not Bullsh.t about how its a common thing for them to contaminated. <br><br>Absolutely zero star management!!!!

Service is horrible at this location. You can sit there and wait and nobody comes to greet you or ask you if you need a menu or water. We sat and waited for about 45 minutes and still nobody came to help, so I had to flag someone down and finally someone came to take our order!! They&#39;reThey are very rude here I understand that they get super busy but it&#39;s not a way to treat the customer !! <br>I will never return! <br>Drinks were horrible and so was the food!  <br>Don&#39;t get me wrong I love Cheesecake Factory, just not this location

First time here and it will probably be the last time. We came here for dinner and it was a 2 hr wait time. The food was cold, and not the best. <br>Our waiter however was very nice and very helpful. On my way out I stopped at the front to buy a cheeses cake to go and the guy at the cashier had major attitude and he was very rude. I was just trying to buy a piece of cheeses cake I didnt need the extra attitude. My party was definitely  not happy with the service or the food I will not be coming back.

Is it just me or is The Cheesecake Factory wildly underrated?! Their menu is more expansive than almost any other restaurant I can think of, and the food is GOOD. Honestly I would just go for how great the appetizer bread is! <br><br>Real talk, the portions are very generous for a price that will not break your budget! Have you tried their Chinese Chicken Salad?! Only $15 and that thing is the size of 3 meals! <br><br>Another one of my favorite things this restaurant provides is the Skinnylicious menu! I adore the Asian Chicken Lettuce Wraps - light and delicious! Another one of my favorites that you have to try if you haven&#39;t yet-- (not on the Skinnylicious menu) Mac n cheese balls! So great for a shareable appetizer! <br><br>This location at the Grove - just like every other Cheesecake location I&#39;ve visited - has a beautiful ambiance full of classy decor and a helpful/friendly/professional staff. Whether you&#39;re going for a drink and cheesecake or a decadent meal - you&#39;ll enjoy your Cheesecake Factory experience!

The restaurant is on the 2nd floor. There&#39;s an escalator you can take if you go inside the building. The waiting time depends on the time of the day and on the day of the week. But if you are there for dinner, you will probably have to wait at least 30+ min. For appetizer, I would highly recommend ordering the warm crab and artichoke dip. It&#39;s delicious, but a bit oily. It comes with toast on the side.

I have to understand that fat meat is greasy... lol. I placed my order at 5:35 pm and my server approaches me at 5:53 pm stating my food is on its way. It is now 6:03pm and counting what makes matter worse everyone around me has several elaborate dishes and my food has yet to arrive. My server did offer me some soup and or salad while suggesting 6:05 and counting. The food arrived 35 minutes after ordering it....here is the kicker....they forget the fries....

The great thing about the Cheesecake Factory is that they somehow manage to replicate their brand, excellent customer service, and delicious food at every location across the US. This franchise at the Grove is no exception. <br><br>While my roommate and I just briefly stopped in to pick up a to-go order, the staff was very helpful and friendly and the ambiance was exquisite. You enter and there is a grand escalator to take you up to the dining area. To the right there is a large glass window which overlooks the movie theater-- the aesthetic is simply perfect. <br><br>While we didn&#39;t have the luxury of enjoying our meal in this environment, they managed to package the meals in a way that maintained expectations. This location makes the cheesecake factory really stand out and I would highly recommend going! Truly an experience.

What great food and great service!!! Jamel was our waiter and was very accommodating and courteous. We felt like we were very well tended to. The Jambalaya was made so perfectly and so was the Calamari! Hope we get him again when we come back!! Amazing experience and wonderful ambience!!

If you want terrible service and food that is mediocre then this is the right place. Cheesecake Factory is a brand and unfortunately not quality for more than a decade. <br><br>I went to the grove to eat at the steak house, but  they closed. Seems like every restaurant here only lasts a few years at tops. So I was forced to go there. Unfortunately I was let down yet again.<br><br>I ordered Hibachi Steak Med-rare and got med- well.  Also the mashed potatoes were cold. Lack of Presentation. Typical and upsetting. For paying over $20+ I personally think I would of enjoyed a double whopper from burger king more than I did here. Never Again will I make the same mistake.<br><br>Another thing is sanitation. Tables are dirty, 2nd floor balcony glass was dirty, which unfortunately my sweater would rub against while I was crunched seated in a tiny space.<br><br>:(  :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :( :(:( :( :( :(:(

Horrible Costumer service. I was waiting an hour then when my table was ready I was waiting again 30 mins wtf.  Employees are so ugly non professional. <br>you just gonna wast your time and money. I will never come back here.

One of the best place to eat after shopping at grove you can go to the Cheesecake Factory full bar amazing service and delicious food. Do not forget to ask about MIKE SMITH best service really good attitude towards the job.<br>Let me share my drink with you <br>Jeff made my drink so good

This place doesn&#39;t serve good food at all. We ordered Crab Cakes, Cajun Jambalaya, BBQ Chicken Pizza and Tiramisu cheesecake.<br><br>We liked the crab cakes and the cheesecake but the entrees were really pathetic. Pasta was overcooked and pizza was tasteless. <br><br>Really disappointing visit!

I love the food, quality, and ambiance at Cheesecake Factory. This location, food on point, drinks on point, customer service not on point. Customer service is part of the entire dining experience. I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s just me, but when you have terrible customer service the food tastes just as bad. A young woman on the first floor, did not greet us, smile, just asked for name and number in our party without even making eye contact. I asked her a couple questions which she ignored, and she just looked annoyed and pointed to go up to the next floor. Ummm hello, excuse me miss! Rude much?!  When we got upstairs the attendants were very sloppy and unorganized in getting people seated, the wait staff we had to constantly hunt down to refill our drinks, and when leaving to get my parking validated, same rude chick with purple burgundy tinted highlights just stared when I approached her, did not ask me what I needed help with, I just handed her my parking ticket, got it stamped, no smile, no have a great day, she just looked pissed. Maybe she was having a bad day, and if not, please get this woman basic customer service training, and the rest of the staff to be more efficient and organized. Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chains, but not coming to this location anymore.

Sat at a table in the bar at Thousand Oaks Cheesecake Factory today. We&#39;ve always had good service and we enjoy the food, but the waiter acted like he was being bothered when I asked him the kind of salad dressings.He wouldn&#39;t even tell me what the options were. So we left.  Went to Urban plates where everyone was very helpful and the server didn&#39;t mind listing the kinds of dressings
Great food too much as always but always on point! <br>Chicken and shrimp gumbo, calamari and Linda&#39;s fudge cake oh and a side of plantains! Delish! It was like 2 orders worth but perfectly made!

I give them 0 starts because right from the beginning it went bad, and it only turned worst by the end of the day. it was my sisters birthday and some friends came along, 2 kids, and from the youngest to the oldest we were tired of waiting more than 2 hrs to eat. My sister chose this place and we respected her choice. I have honestly been here before and haven&#39;t had the energy nor desire to spend time to write a review for them, I haven&#39;t been so happy nor have my waiting time been short. I always waited more than 1hr 30 min for a table than wait  more than 30 min more to order my food and than wait some more for them to bring me the food. I always leave upset and with my food to go because by than I have lost my appetite. But on my sister&#39;s birthday  ugh  <br><br>I will advice my family and friends  to choose another place to celebrate and have a delish warm and fresh meal instead of Cheesecake Factory; their food is not tasty, the service is bad, and the price you pay is not worth it
I love the food and service here especially the cashier named Lorena she was very helpful and nice

I ordered from Cheesecake Factory via Door Dash and was severely disappointed with a wrong delivery order. Who is to blame? I&#39;m not 100% sure, but since the salad was prepared incorrectly, and I was missing key items like the darn DRESSING and salad toppings, I&#39;m leaning towards Cheesecake Factory being in the wrong. I can&#39;t imagine Door Dash was in the kitchen making my food... so I hold the restaurant responsible for not including dressing for my Santa Fe salad, and also leaving out the crispy onions and ALSO for not including bread when I specifically requested it. <br><br>I called the restaurant for any reparations, and they told me that I needed to contact Door Dash for refunds. Fine, I&#39;ll accept my financial reparations from Door Dash, but I still hold the restaurant responsible because making the food properly is YOUR responsibility. <br><br>I&#39;m sure people who have ordered delivery can understand the amplified frustration when food doesn&#39;t arrive correctly. We wait almost an hour for the food, and when it finally comes... it&#39;s not what we ordered. Plus, there&#39;s rarely anything we can do to correct the mistake immediately. We just have to be extremely disappointed with our meal for the day. It is quite frustrating and definitely affects my future decisions to order from this restaurant ever again.
Excellent service and food on a beautiful afternoon. Definitely would recommend this particular location
Super good food and everything is so delicious! My favorites are the enchiladas and the shrimp with angel hair!!

There&#39;s a wait always here!, Specify Outdoor balcony!<br><br>If you plan to eat here and want to still look around at the bulk of the shops at the grove you need to do what the locals do. Once you park, go straight there, put your name in, and grab a buzzer. Specify you&#39;d like the outside balcony for the complete experience if you&#39;re willing to wait 2 hours for it, and then go shopping with the buzzer, It works for about 2,000 feet in any direction so hit barnes and noble, nordstroms, or apple and enjoy the street musicians and fountains. If you are unwilling to wait for the 2 hours and get first available its really only an honest 30-45 min wait usually so stay closeby and enjoy the grove. People watch and relax. go upstairs for a beer and watch the tvs, they have 2 there. <br>There&#39;s always the easy ticket too, just go upstairs and sit in the bar without reservation if you&#39;d like a quick and and out there as well. Sometimes we sneak up to the top where there is a cash register and just order cheesecake to go and walk it back to our house. <br>Great spot overall, you just need to plan it right in order to make it work for you vs waiting and losing your cool and ruining your day. <br>I talk about restaurants and how the should have a solid ratio of tables to reservations and all the other restaurants that i leave poor marks on need to take lessons from Cheesecake here, they are very accurate with time waits and really know what they&#39;re doing.<br>Great spot. we love it.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of those places you forgive for being a chain... The food is always excellent and so are the drinks and the service. I highly recommend the skinny angel hair pasta with shrimp and the Chinese chicken salad... Some of my personal favorites! <br><br>Something honorable to mention about this location in particular: I witnessed a waiter spill a drink on a customer at the next table. The customers were old and very upset about it, they weren&#39;t yelling or anything but they had disgusted and pissed looks on their faces and said nothing. A few minutes later, the manager approached their table and apologized and offered the meal free for the person the drink was spilt on. They made sure to make it up to the customer

So today I came in and tried the gumbo  A M A Z I N G! I enjoyed every bit of it. Great service, and the atmosphere was amazing! Looking forward to coming back. Also, it&#39;s inside of the grove which is an outstanding place to visit if your in town!

Phenomenal Michelin Star restaurant  from the service to the international flavors, Cheesecake Factory at the grove does it all. I&#39;ve never left with an unsatisfied, belly, heart, and spirituality. Thank you for making me believe in good food and better people. You will never disappoint me. CF 4ever

Service was terrible, we waited 2 hrs when we originally were told 1 hr, food was cold  but plates were hot?? Makes no sense right, and then we didnt get offer noo refill? Never have i ever complaint and am a huge cheesecake fan but this one is no good i felt rob out of 100 honestly.

This review is useless since people will still flock here because it&#39;s the grove. Was told it is a 45 minute wait. Came back 45 min later and I was told it would be another hour. Not sure how that is acceptable. The employees at the counter are not the brightest people and really need to be fired or replaced. There is no manager to complain to either. Had to cause a scene to finally get a table after waiting an hour and a half. My food was over cooked and slightly burnt. I&#39;ll never come here again.

One of the best things about Cheesecake Factory has to be their delicious free bread. I got a to-go order while waiting for a movie screening next door, and I was thrilled that they include free bread and butter with to-go orders! <br><br>My friend and I split the Bistro Shrimp Pasta (one of my favorite dishes here) and it did not disappoint. When we opened the box in the theater, almost everyone turned around to find the source of the delicious smell. The pasta was the perfect al dente, the shrimp were perfectly seared, and the sauce was delicious.<br><br>I&#39;ve never ordered to-go at Cheesecake Factory before, but this location prepared our food insanely fast. We only had 20 minutes before the movie started, and they got our food out to us in ~15 minutes.

5 STARS for customer service, ambiance, and food!!<br><br>The food is extra great here at this location as well as customer service!!  We come here when we are at the Grove and feel like eating pasta and salad.  Our recent visit was amazing.  Erick from the Dessert counter was friendly and great customer service!! Our server Jesse was polite and quick!!  That&#39;s what we hungry people appreciate hahahahah.  Thank you Jesse for introducing yourself to our party that came first and when others arrived he was polite and introduced himself again, yes, I remember these little details.  He checked on us frequently, even on a busy day, that is great service. The chefs here are on point, the dishes were cooked perfectly and tasted delicious!!  <br><br>Thank you everyone for keeping up the good work!!
Good service.  The food the decent and well prepared.  The wait was about 1 hour on a Friday evening for 5 people

Michael H is a super cool waiter! I really appreciate that he was super patient with my dad and got him every little thing he asked for with a awesome attitude! My family and I really enjoyed our meal. Thanks so much Michael for the great experience at this location! You rock !

So I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factory probably 50+ times in my life. I can&#39;t remember ever having a bad meal until this one.<br><br>Seated quickly and our server was really excellent. They seem to have some issues with their chefs /kitchen. <br><br>I ordered the Chicken parmesan pizza style. The pasta on top was hot and taste free and the chicken was cold. I reluctantly sent it back because I was so hungry. I probably send back 1 out of 100 dishes when I eat out. <br><br>I then ordered my favorite dish : Chicken Madeira. It was undercooked and tasted really fatty. I thought it was just me, but I asked someone else to taste it and they said it was definitely undercooked. Plus, the Madeira sauce wasn&#39;t the same as I&#39;ve had before. <br><br>So I sent this back and ordered Fried Shrimp. This was edible, but not that tasty. The shrimp were not as big as the waiter described and didn&#39;t come out that hot. <br><br>Also, disappointed that after 2-3 disappointing dishes they didn&#39;t at least waive the cost of the 3rd dish - due to the massive inconvenience. <br><br>Only redeeming thing is their cheesecake is phenomenal. <br><br>I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever be back for the food though.

Oh my gosh, I guess its a thing with this restaurant. My sister had told me the one in OKC was really slow and this one was dreadfully slow. Everything took forever! And it wasn&#39;t busy at all. Forever to get a waiter, forever to take my order, forever to get any attention at all! I wanted dessert but I had to give up on it cause he took forever just to bring me the menu. I actually got up to find him and tell him forget it I needed the check. And guess what? It took forever to get it and then pay it. The only reason I went there is cause I had a gift card and that would be the only reason I would ever go back again! Too much good food elsewhere to put up with this nonsense.

My friend wanted to pop in for a slice of red velvet cheesecake that she had eaten years earlier! The rest of our group was so hungry we decided to stay. The vibe is terrible if you&#39;re into any kind of cool, relaxed ambience however it&#39;s obviously a family chain restaurant and for that category it&#39;s totally fine.<br>There was a tonne of veg options on the menu, the waiters were helpful and we did eventually get the cheesecakes (although I had carrot cake and I must say, it was everyone&#39;s fav!)

I&#39;ve been going to Cheesecake Factory for about 2-3 years now and honestly it&#39;s always been a great experience. Thee food is cooked to perfection and the service is just as good. For the most part I&#39;ve gone to the Glendale location and Santa Monica location and its been spectacular. This time I decided to try the location at The grove I expected the service to be just as great . My experience was garbage we waited about 20 min downstairs which is fine we (me and girlfriend) know it gets busy . Once our buzzer goes off we&#39;re told to go upstairs they have a table ready . we go up the escalator and meet Sandy i think I&#39;m not great with names which is the person who is supposed to show us to our table she asked my name which has just been confirmed to have a table ready . She said &#34; we&#39;ll call you in a second your tables being cleaned &#34; bro that second turned into almost 10 minutes just standing there looking like fools . We decided to walk away and she didn&#39;t even notice . It&#39;s like they don&#39;t care about the customer . She was just chatting away with her co workers and were left waiting almost 30 min with not even a glass of water . Ultimately we decided to walk out and she didn&#39;t offer anything not even a simple goodnight . Awful service on her end . The restaurant for the most part has pretty good food . I&#39;m off to look for somewhere else to eat !!

We went here for lunch. I had the Smoked BBQ Burger with fries; my friend had the veggies burger with a salad. The burger was great, but if you&#39;re looking for something somewhat healthy go for something else. I felt like I gained 10 lbs after eating the BBQ burger. Probably didn&#39;t help that I had a side of ranch to dip my fries in. <br><br>The service was great. Our ice teas and water were filled without having to ask our waiter. We sat outside and it was a beautiful day. <br><br>I&#39;ve also been here several other times. The fried calamari is a must try, as well as the eggplant Parmesan. During dinner time it gets very busy. I&#39;ve waited as long as an hour before. The good thing is they will send you a text when the table is ready so you don&#39;t have to wait around. Go shop and come back when you get the text.<br><br>The grove has an hour of free parking, which means you&#39;ll end up paying if there&#39;s a slight wait or you plan on taking your time. I really enjoy this location. The outside seating is worth the wait when it&#39;s a nice day.

UPDATE (2/11/18) <br>Let me first say that I have never had a bad experience with CF&#39;s food or take out food until tonight. I will definitely still give their food some love but I had to update this review solely so their management will know and hopefully be mindful of it moving forward. <br><br>I have never had the shepherds pie at cheesecake and wanted to try it. I ordered thru door dash and it arrived looking fine...a lil oily and not a lot of gravy but I was fine with that. The vegetables were nicely cooked and although it all tasted a tiny bit bland it was still pretty good to me. As I continued to eat it I felt more and more like the taste was off...and almost as if It was leaving weird taste or coating in my mouth the more bites I took. I decided to stop eating it and put it aside. Didn&#39;t think too much of it all, but 15mins later my stomach began to get very upset and my lower back started cramping alil. I grabbed the plate...opened up one of the several big chunks of ground meat in the dish and saw right away that it was extremely raw (See Photo Included). I usually like my meat medium rare to medium but this isn&#39;t a steak...this is ground beef...and the majority of it was very raw inside.
