I was going to look past it it all...but now an additional 30mins later my stomach won&#39;t stop gurgling and I keep having to use the restroom. <br><br>Look I know we are all human and have off nights...but it&#39;s not ok to give someone food that could possibly make them ill...and I&#39;m sure with ground beef it&#39;s hard to tell...but I hope you will help me out and let the kitchen know it happened so they&#39;ll just be more careful next time and maybe cook this dish the extra couple minutes extra it needs to save customers like me the grief. I know you have great staff and I&#39;ve enjoyed my visits before which is why I&#39;m being extremely understanding about all this, even despite how sick i&#39;m feeling right now. <br><br>.********** .********** .********** .********** .*********<br>(ORIGINAL REVIEW) <br>One of our favorite happy hour spots! Not that their regular menu isn&#39;t fantastic but we stick to the happy hour because we love hanging out at the bar and the portions are so humungous on the regular menu...the happy hour appetizers are the perfect size for me and my boy to get three different options and share. Tonight warranted a top notch review however because our bartender Taylor was beyond amazing. She was super attentive, offered amazing suggestion and made us two of the best Skinny Long Islands we&#39;d ever had. We ordered the Buffalo Blast, Tex Mex Eggrolls and the Spring Rolls. All of which looked so good that it wasn&#39;t until we had demolished them that I realized I hadn&#39;t taken pictures of them in their pre-eaten Instagram modelesque state...when I&#39;m hungry and the food looks amazing my elite yelp status falls by the wayside. My stomach always wins! The buffalo blast is breaded but not hand wiping greasy and you get a beyond generous portion for the $5.95 price along with some celery sticks (as if to make us feel better for the fried goodness debauchery) along side ramekins of hearty blue cheese dressing and buffalo sauce to dip them in. The Tex mex rolls were the perfect combo of spicy shredded chicken, corn, cheese and Mexican filling accompanied by a creamy cilantro ranch like cream sauce and fresh tomato Pico to top it with, all wrapped in a crispy not greasy fried egg roll wrapping. The spring rolls are a happy hour staple with huge pieces of plump shrimp and rice noodles along side their peanut sauce which is to die for. Pair that with the above and beyond service of a bartender like Taylor and you have a recipe for the best happy hour experience you&#39;ll ever have. Four skinny long islands, complimentary bread, three appetizers, a vodka soda and a house tequila neat we were sitting with a $58 dollar tab that warranted nothing more than a beyond 20% tip and this glowing yelp review. TIP: if you have a smile on your face the grove theater will let you validate your parking so you can stay two hours and pay $2.50 for parking...all depending on your smile and demeanor of course. Thank you Cheesecake Factory and Taylor for making our date night amazing. We&#39;ll definitely be back whenever she&#39;s working despite the hap

I got the<br><br>1. Shrimp with angel hair pasta ($18.95): Large Shrimp Sautéed with Tomatoes, Lemon, Garlic, Herbs and Fresh Basil on Top of Angel Hair Pasta with a Touch of Marinara Sauce.<br><br>I&#39;d say it was a 2.5/5. <br><br>I also got fries on the side and they were 1/5.

I sat down with my mother for her birthday and started with the mini crab-cakes which were delicious. The mac &amp; cheese burger followed and definitely didn&#39;t disappoint! That we came in a half an hour before closing and still got wonderful service. I might become a regular lol

Came here with a group of friends for my birthday dinner on Sunday evening. I understand it takes a while especially for dinner but to wait 15 to get a buzzer and another 45 to be seated was too much. Our server (forgot his name) himself was nice, and his energy was very positive, but that couldn&#39;t even save the experience we had. It took a while to even get our appetizers, and my boyfriend had to ask 3 times for his forgotten drink. When the food came out I was ecstatic only to see that half of the plating seemed room temperature and the other half hot and fresh. They remade it, though it took a while that I had to just take it to go as I lost my appetite really. My friend explained this to a manager and really the only compensation we were gonna get was a slice of cheesecake on the house. Wait was long, half the food wasn&#39;t warm/hot, and we had to remind about our drinks from the bar. Oh and the table right next to us had about the same party number, they seemed to have gotten served much faster and before us even though we were seated first. At the end of the night I wasn&#39;t even craving the slice of cheesecake so I just asked for a managers name, only then did I at least get my entree comped. I know it gets busy and I know it falls on kitchen sometimes too, but the overall experience wasn&#39;t there this time...
I always find what I want even if menu is huge! Thee food is always great and sweets to die for.

I usually love cheescake factory and I have been ordering the same thing for a while now. I wanted to order the lemon herb chicken on Saturday when I came in. i usually substitute the mashed potatoes for marinera pasta without a problem. I&#39;ve done it at all cheescake factories including this one. The waiter we got was rude about it and said he could only ass regular plain pasta and would charge me 3.99$ for the sauce which would come separately..? 3.99$ for sauce? I told the waiter that i&#39;ve been getting it that way for the longest time and he said that only &#34;lenient&#34; servers do that without a charge.. So are you not lenient?? Really bad customer service from him and I did not like the way he talked to us. I was disappointed. <br><br>Besides that Cheescake factory is a good place for the many options they give you. Try the chocolate moose cheescake it&#39;s to die for!
They do not take reservations over the phone, only walk-ins. That means you must wait 45min+ to eat here.<br><br>Review coming soon (45 minutes)

My family &amp; I went to this location of the CF and the food was great! The building is really nice on the inside (also, pretty chilly. bring a jacket ). We went on a Friday, which seems to be a busy evening for them but the service was still pretty good. <br><br>Oh, and the cheesecake is too die for  I will definitely be visiting the CF again with others.

Excellent customer service. All the staff was courteous and professional. Food was delicious. Wait time was exactly what we were told. Although the kitchen ran out of my dish and didn&#39;t inform our waitress until we had been waiting roughly 25 minutes after ordering, the waitress and manager were very apologetic and made sure that we left as happy customers. <br>Only thing I&#39;m confused on is parking validation we went downstairs to get our parking validated and were told everything was fine but were still prompted to pay at the parking lot. Not sure what happened.

There was paper in the food. Manager comes over and doesn&#39;t believe me. She literally put her bare hand in my food to rip the paper in my face THEN TRIED TO JUSTIFY IT. Not to mention we were there for almost 2 hours because the server was MIA.

Waited 40 minutes to seat 2 people on a Saturday night. Waiter was great but did not come around to us often so had to keep calling him for more refills. It took us 20 minutes to get a check. Service was so slow even though we were there pretty late. <br><br>Food is decent. <br><br>They do validate. <br><br>Floors are greasy so be careful not to fall.

I came here a long time ago and got some cheesecake which was delicious, but it was at that time I realized they also had a restaurant.  I thought the next time I come to this place, I would have to check it out. <br><br>Since I got some gift cards, I finally decided to check out this restaurant.  I came on Memorial Day after 2p.  I  did a take-out order and got a Skinny Hamburger, Filet Mignon and 2 Strawberry Cheesecakes.  I asked that my hamburger be cooked well-done, and it was.  A small salad was included and was fresh.  I got the Filet Mignon cooked medium well-done, and it was.  However, there was a small area that had gristle.  The cheesecakes were, of course, delicious. <br><br>I waited a little over 30 minutes for my food.  The restaurant and bakery were both very busy.  I got my parking ticket validated.  I think it took a little over an hour.  The parking lot was pretty crowded, too.  I almost had to park on the top level. <br><br>I would definitely come back and/or check out the other locations.  They have a lot of food to choose from on the menu.  The workers here were pretty nice, too.

Omg!!!Listen Linda....if you know like I know don&#39;t waste your time! The food was horrible and the manger name JOHN didn&#39;t make it  any better. So,so disappointed but on a postive note the server name Katera was great! I will be calling higher management in the morning!!!

I had the exact experience as a previous poster who left a 1 star.<br>Was told 30-40 mins, an hour later we asked how much longer we were told 15 minutes. 20 more minutes later we were told 10 more minutes. We were at the top of the list for next for quite a while and watched them seat other people. Then once our buzzer went off we had to wait even longer for a server to seat us while the staff standing right in front of us pretended we didn&#39;t exist.<br>All the food we got was excellent. The chipotle pasta I got was semi cold on the top layer but mixing it made it up made it warm enough again.<br>If the service was better and they didn&#39;t blatantly lie about wait times the stars would be higher

Since this location is at the always busy Grove, it&#39;s always packed. <br><br>Hubby and I decided to come here and use a gift card we&#39;d received a few months back. We&#39;re huge fans but we both took the day off and it was during the holidays so it was a special occasion, or something of the sort. <br><br>We arrived around 1:45pm and the wait time for a table for two was 60 minutes. INSANE right?! What sucked is that their pager system wasn&#39;t working and they don&#39;t have a call/text feature so we pretty much just had to hang around and keep checking the list to see where we were. If it wasn&#39;t for that dang gift card we totally would&#39;ve left. <br><br>Once we we were called 75 minutes later, we were told to go upstairs and the hostess would seat us. Well apparently there was a miscommunication bc when we went upstairs we had to wait another 5-10 minutes bc there wasn&#39;t a table ready for us. <br><br>I ordered the two mojitos, buffalo blasts and garlic noodles with shrimp. Hubby ordered a strawberry milkshake, fried Mac n cheese and fettuccine Alfredo. The bill was $155 and it kind of shocked me. I was thinking maybe $100 but $155 for the quality and portions we received def was not worth it. <br><br>Our waitress was clearly over booked. Anytime you have to flag down a busboy cleaning another table to ask for a refill on your water that&#39;s a problem!<br><br>The only real Pros were the two mojitos. They were delicious and since I hit the skinny version they were under 150 cals! <br><br>Doubt we&#39;ll be visiting anytime soon. TBH I&#39;d only come back with a gift card.

After a busy Saturday we did not feel much like cooking so we decided to take a chance with dinning at the Cheese Cake Factory. We where waited on by D&#39;Qorrie he was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and made suggestions and persuaded us to try the white chicken chili and it was great.   This type of attention is rare and deserves many return trips.

I have not eaten at this particular Cheesecake Factory in 7 to 8 years. The customer service was horrible. I had an impolite and unpleasant experience. My first waiter acted as if he did not care and put my order in wrong. My waiter was going on break and another waiter took over. The second waiter did not have any manners and was nonchalant. I informed the manager and he was extremely kind along with responsive. I received a discount on my meal.<br><br>Due to the crowdedness from THE GROVE and frequent customers, the staff is too busy to pay attention to customer&#39;s needs. I will not come back again to this location and don&#39;t recommend it to others.

Almost a five star review but the music and noise can be a bit loud. <br>I don&#39;t expect theCheesecake Factory to blow me away with anything but it does consistently deliver quality food in a reasonable time. It&#39;s at the Grove which is tremendously convenient as I live nearby. The breads they bring to start you off are usually fresh and have a very good context. <br>I typically get a pasta, especially the bistro pasta with garlic and shrimp and my better half gets a steak, the hibachi steak. Never disappointed.

This dinner came after a day of standing in heat waiting to get into Dancing with the Stars. After a good show I would like to get some good food!<br><br>Our server was Allen and he was seriously the BEST!!!<br><br>He started off with giving us an unwarranted breakdown of items to choose from! LOL just his charisma took over the table and he was on a roll!! we ended up going with the wontons for the appetizer and they were really good!<br><br>For the entree I chose the factory burrito grande and wished I didn&#39;t. She went with the bistro shrimp pasta, which was really really good! The factory burrito was huge but a friend of mine made a great point... Don&#39;t order mexican food unless you are at a mexican restaurant LOL and I will leave it at that! The bistro shrimp pasta was just delicious and cooked to perfection! I have no complaints at all. <br><br>If you&#39;re looking for cocktails def get the lemon drop!

I&#39;m personally not into chain restaurants but my fiancée convinced me to give this Chessecake Factory at The Grove. I honesty enjoyed the Chicken Madeira and my fiancé always raves about the chicken Piccata. The food, service, and location were above average. We sat outside because it was a beautiful day out. The only negative was &#34;Pleasure P(formerly of Pretty Ricky fame)&#34; was attempting to hide as if he weren&#39;t a C list celebrity.

Hostess are horrible they all have attitude, I come Atlease 1-3 times a week and they&#39;re all rude and it seems like they do not care about their jobs. Rico the manager is great he is always attentive. I honestly always come for the food but if the hostess could fix there attitudes this cheesecake would probably be number one

Huge menu<br>They got everything for everyone <br><br>Avocado egg rolls are awesome <br>Avocado salad is a must as well <br><br>Sometimes skipping the meal and going straight to cheese cake and warm milk is a good idea as well

We had our dinner last night in Cheesecake Factory to the grove, order appetizer and one main dish shrimp scampi.. they usually serve big portions so me and my husband share.. the calamari was good , scampi is always be my favorite but for some reason it was so darn cold the noodles was very cold specially the shrimp.. <br>do we called the waitress and ask her why is my shrimp scampi is too cold? Her response was let me call my manager.. my husband didn&#39;t really care about our scampi bring cold because he loves cold food and I don&#39;t.. I want my food fresh to cook or at least hot if they serve it . <br>Manager came and she said that she is the managers on duty last night she ask me what is the problem.. I was so calm even though I&#39;m already upset because I am starving but I can&#39;t eat my food  bec I was too cold. Manager response was if I could&#39;ve known a little early she could do something about it but not anymore bec my husband eat half of his food that we share, but my share I couldn&#39;t even  eat the rest of my food on my plate .. end up I had a  stomach ache. Manager couldn&#39;t do anything about the scampi being too cold but instead she offer us a dessert instead of offering us to at least re-heat of replace our scampi.  It was the worse customer service ever, it ruin our special night end up having a stomach ache.
Food was good, terrible server and we got a yummy bug in our drink. Our server was extremely careless and barely served us.

I would never do this but the service was HORRIBLE . My friend and I came here for his birthday and from the moment we got there the hosts were very blunt and unhelpful. We got a table and our waitress (Mia) was the worst waitress I&#39;ve very had. She was very un energetic it felt like she was just trying to rush us out . We got a dirty dish for our edamame and through out the whole dining experience Mia did not smile once &amp; when I asked for the check she smiled and sounded relieved that we were leaving . She brought me the check and took the plates from the table and my friend wasn&#39;t done with his burger so he was left with 1/3 of his burger in his hand . We walked out after paying and not even a goodbye was said .

Best ever cheese cake I had in my whole life.<br><br>I have been told the cheese cake was made with several kinds of cheeses to make the miracles but when I taste it ...it&#39;s absolutely surprised me ! You will not miss it!<br><br>30mins in line around 3pm is fair to me , I got to see the sum-sung VR show while waiting, and I get a nice 2level seat with street view...fantastic experience.<br><br>The service is efficient and warming...<br>I have no doubt will come back again<br><br>Plus as a fan of Big Bang theory you should check it out lols

The restaurant receives a lot of attention from tourists, because it is located in The Grove. The Grove is &#34;Tourist Trap Central&#34;. I walked the streets and possibly heard English spoken every 20th person. The other 19 spoke a rainbow of languages. I LOVED IT!<br><br>I have been to this restaurant more times than I can count. However, this go round, I decided to order items I have never ordered before. And, I am VERY glad I did.<br><br>Do yourself a big favor and check out the Buffalo Blast and Kale Salas appetizers. My husband is a Buffalo Wing aficionado. I took some back home to San Diego, because there were way too many for me to eat. They are the best he has ever had. It eliminates the bones. There is lots of crunch and the flavor is seriously amazing.<br><br>I am giving it a lesser star, because the hosts clearly put their emphasis on the tourists and &#34;name brand&#34; folks. I literally had to say hello to them before they acknowledged my presence (after 2 minutes), which I found humorous. I was dressed extremely casual. I looked very unassuming - possible frugal. However, I am a &#34;More Than 20% Tipper&#34; for quality service.<br><br>Positive Note: Tarin was my server. She was extremely patient and focused on making me happy - from the moment she said hello. She did not concern herself with my appearance, which was due to me spending 5 days in Cedar Sinai Hospital, nursing my son, who is in need of his second heart transplant. So, because of her, the generous cocktail, and the fabulous food, I will definitely go back.

Foods average. If your going for happy hour they have removed &#34;bar seating from the bar&#34; so you can only sit at bar and on  high table and chair and order happy our menu. This location is fun but you will have long waits due to over extreme crowding.<br>Still a fun location

Portions and pasta is great <br>One pasta fed 2 adults and 1 two year old <br><br>This a great casual dining place and has a great extensive menu <br><br>For me the cheese cake was too sweet but others liked it
Horrible parking I will not be coming back.slow service on the order to go side been standing here for 30 minutes and counting.
Tried to place an order for pickup by calling they transferred me twice to the bakery and no one ever answered took my business elsewhere.

Went to The Grove over the weekend and wanted to eat at Cheesecake Factory.... my first mistake. <br>Got there about 8 pm, huge wait (40 minutes), they took my name &amp; told me to come back in 15 minutes for a pager. We came back and could not find my name (spelt it wrong)....so we were put at the END of the list. NOT COOL ! <br>As 30 people left, a few here and there....were taken up to ANOTHER waiting area. We finally got called 59 minutes after we got there. 9:00 sat down, promptly ordered and got our food in a timely manner. <br>Finished our food and went down to get our parking validated at the hostess stand and left The Grove.  As we went to leave... our parking ticket had been INVALIDATED.... we had to pay $24 for parking. We were not the only ones.... several that ate at Cheesecake had the same problem... SERIOUSLY not COOL !!!<br>Long wait, okay food and got our ticket invalidated !!!! Cheesecake Factory... you owe me $24 and a reason why I was put at the END of the line because your hostess could not spell nor find my misspelt name. NEVER will go there again !!!

This place is really prejudice, they sure know How to mistreat customers, they buzzed me when the table wasn&#39;t even ready, it doesn&#39;t make any sense, then they tried to argue about it with me, made me Feel so uncomfortable as a human being, these people and the manager does not know how to run a business, Crazy shit, Fuck These People, I Lost my Appetite

Worse snacks I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. I was completely unsatisfied with my meal and our server didn&#39;t accommodate our ticket in any manner. In the beginning he acknowledged that the kitchen staff wasn&#39;t executing good service and once he said that we should&#39;ve left. He also took forever to deliver the check and retrieve it for payment. We also never received our straws.

You obviously can&#39;t ever go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. They have so many options to choose from, that no matter how big your party is, there is definitely something for everyone. From my experience, I try a different dish during each visit and they&#39;ve never disappointed. Not to mention, their cheesecake is incredible (10/10 would recommend the Red Velvet). <br>One thing about this location is it is always packed so you&#39;ll usually always end up waiting at least 15 minutes for a seat, and on top of that service tends to be a little slow (but they try their best). If you have a lot of time on your hands, and you&#39;re looking for a place to hang out with friends, this is the place to be, but if you&#39;re in a rush, I would definitely go with somewhere a little quicker. <br>Side note, if you&#39;re a sucker for table bread, you&#39;ll LOVE theirs. I could honestly get full off of just the bread itself. <br><br>If you want a really good appetizer, go with the avocado egg rolls. Probably the best thing to ever happen to me.

The building itself is beautiful, gorgeous views and the environment is lovely overall, that&#39;s it though! The staff at the to go/ pick up counter are unprofessional staff members who need to be retrained and learn to speak to all individuals with respect alike. I would say go to the Beverly Hills location, it&#39;s smaller but staff is professional &amp; kind. If you do order to go or delivery be aware that they do not keep your food warm they leave it out and let it get cold..
Came for lunch before a movie, they have a special menu at the bar at lunchtime, kind of low-calorie.

Came here to this restaurant to have a good time. I did with my friend and the food was amazing. What I didn&#39;t like was the nasty attitude our first waitress gave us. Did not like her at all. When she had to leave and we had Allison as a waitress she was so much better. Now it was my birthday so me and my friend assumed we&#39;d get a complimentary slice of cheesecake. We were charged which is fine, but the attitude given by Daniel a manager<br> really pissed us off as he was unprofessional and rude about the ordeal. Won&#39;t be coming back here at all I&#39;ll stick to the Santa Monica location. I&#39;d give ZERO stars of I could, screw this location.

An example of high volume poor service. The wait is outrageous considering the quality of service and then the food. Largely tasteless with exceptional poor service means that if you were paying for a restaurant by the minute you would be over paying.<br>A chain that has lost its values and service. Go somewhere else if you enjoy good food and good service.

I dont usually write reviews but my experience here for the first time in a long while had me itching to say something. <br><br>I slowly became irritated with cheesecake employees.....they tell me that our table is ready for us to be seated in a few minutes. Instead they had us waiting for another 10 to 20 minutes, was not even given an apology for the wait nor an apology for the sudden mix up of tables which was given to others who were after us. <br><br>Then we were seated but no one comes to greet us or get our drinks or anything. Finally I got a waiter&#39;s attention and he just nonchalantly just says &#34;I was helping out other tables.&#34;<br><br>Again No apology.<br><br>Food was mediocore at best. Warm. But not the quality that was expected for the price. <br><br>The saving grace was the replacement waiter who covered for the our waiter while he was on dinner break. He was attentive, alot warmer to talk to compared to the fridged response from the former. <br><br>Over all, extremely disappointed. Thanks.

My boyfriend and I went to the grove last night looking for a good restaurant to eat at and we decided on Cheesecake Factory. It was about an hour wait (not bad for a Friday night), but for the food and service we received it was totally worth it!<br>Our waiter was Arya, he was great, super helpful, and overall a fun waiter which made our dining experience that much more enjoyable! We ordered drinks from the bar, I had the passion fruit mojito, which was amazing and my boyfriend ordered the El Diablo margarita which was pretty good (a little too strong for me though). We ordered the cheeseburger spring rolls, there were delicious! If you find yourself here, definitely order them! For our meals I had the shrimp scampi, and he had the lasagna verde. Both dishes were excellent and full of flavor! <br>For dessert we had their new Very Cherry Ghirardelli CheeseCake which was to die for! It was full of cherries and chocolate! Honestly, try this. Even if you&#39;re not a big cheesecake fan (which I&#39;m not) it&#39;ll make you one!<br>The food was great the ambiance was great and our server Arya was great! Thank you for making date night amazing!

I love the Cheesecake Factory. When I was in high school I use to go every week to the Cheesecake Factory. But when I was younger I only ordered the same burger. I was never open to trying new foods. As I got older I started trying new food and the Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. Their salmon dishes are amazing. The food is always fresh and the customer service is great. The one thing I don&#39;t like about the Cheesecake Factory is that it&#39;s so dimly lit. Sometimes you can&#39;t even read the menus. I recommend adding more light. I get it&#39;s for the ambiance but this has made me not come to the Cheesecake Factory as often. If you are looking for great patio views and customer service, visit this Cheesecake Factory. You won&#39;t be disappointed.

I went yesterday afternoon around 2p. Perfect timing because there was NO WAIT which is unheard of. My friend Kristin and I were seated within 2 minutes. Instantly our server JUSTINE welcomed us. And she is why I&#39;m writing today. Incredibly attentive and fast service. She gave us the full scoop on what was good to order (we had t been in a while) and was refilling our drinks without them ever getting empty. Strongly recommend the cauliflower appetizer. It&#39;s addictive so I would order double quantities because it&#39;s THAT good. Also, lettuce wraps are so damn tasty. Please read: you must use all three sauces together to get the full taste effect which is why they&#39;re yummy. Anyway Justine brought us extra sauce and kept us feeling like we&#39;re VIP customers. <br><br>Notably, I would avoid coming during peak times because of just that. Waiting time, busy servers, and loud are ALL discouraging - just plan your visit against the normal busy times. Duh! <br><br>If you&#39;re lucky to have Justine as your server, you&#39;ll be dining like queens and kings. Can&#39;t wait to come back.

This is one of the best places where a person could go either with family or with friends<br>Their service is excellent<br>The food is on time<br>I would recommend all of you to go and visit <br><br>Though some locations require reservations but waiting is worth it.  The food is excellent

Been here a few times and have never been disappointed! There&#39;s almost always a little bit of a wait but the food quality and friendly service are just as dependable as getting bread delivered to your table upon arrival. <br><br>Always a solid choice and I&#39;d recommend this location!

This was my first time coming to this location and I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;ll come again any time soon <br>The guy at the register for pick up was soooo rude I wish I got his name because those type of people does not need to work in customer service. I walked up to the pick up counter and said hello I placed an order for pick up he didn&#39;t say anything he just did some hand gesture as if he was rushing me or telling me to keep speaking but I don&#39;t know why he couldn&#39;t just speak and ask me what&#39;s the order or name on the order. I said to him he didn&#39;t need to do that or have an attitude he said &#34;you&#39;re the one with the attitude&#34; I was polite and said hello I placed an order YOU didn&#39;t even greet me when I walked up you didn&#39;t ask what my order was or nothing didn&#39;t even make eye contact <br>I just don&#39;t like going into places with poor customer service because you don&#39;t deserve my money .<br>That&#39;s how I feel

So, I have to write this review or else you will not know what to expect.  <br><br>So tonight I cannot seem to shake this migraine headache and decided to self-diagnose the reason for it and decided I had not eaten correctly today.  Used a dash app to order tonight. 11.20.2017<br><br>For starters, one has to understand that The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s &#34;specialty&#34; is CHEESECAKE and yes they master cheesecake EXTREMELY well.  However, I could never give their food outside of the cheesecake a five-star rating, regardless of the location.<br><br>Which brings me to my order tonight.<br><br>I settled for the Shephard&#39;s Pie.  I TOTALLY LOVE the Irish version of the Shephard&#39;s Pie but decided to try this one due to the veggie content.<br><br>Flavor - excellent (1 star)<br>Food Quality - excellent (1 star)<br>Ingredients - partially acceptable but questionable. (-1 star) <br>Cheesecake (Didn&#39;t order this time, but the Keylime Cheesecake is ALWAYS a star. (1 star)<br><br>No need to dwell on Flavor and Food Quality as each held it&#39;s own.  Now the ingredients, well let&#39;s just say I renamed it the Mushroom Pie instead of Shepherd&#39;s pie.<br><br>Who made the cook mad tonight and caused him to pour approximately 2 cups of mushrooms in a to go order size of the Shepherd&#39;s Pie.  Clearly, it was not made to order and given that, I can only imagine how many mushrooms were used for this pie.  Visual:  standard saucer sized portion with 1/4 cups of medium to large sized cooked mushrooms.  This is the amount I removed from the saucer-sized portion.  But where was the beef?  Yes, beef was in the pie, but more mushrooms than beef were alarming.  The beef is the base of a Shephard&#39;s Pie, not vegetables primarily the mushrooms.  <br><br>So, if you LOVE mushrooms. order the mushroom pie, aka Shephard&#39;s Pie on the menu,  the next time you order and you will be delighted.  <br><br>**Please omit typos as I still have a migraine.

It was my first time in The Cheesecake Factory, and its my first time in USA . I have been im lots of restaurants and food hier was the BEST. I wanted to give 4 stars bc of waiting time ( was around 45 min) but but i changed my mind bc i have got free bread and best cheesecake ever. Stuff was very friendly also. Before i leave  usa i will go there once more.
Horrible service! Guy at the front desk with a man bun doesn&#39;t know how to talk to people

I liked Tuna tataki salad.<br>It was fresh and tastes good, but my daughter&#39;s kids marinara sauce pasta wasn&#39;t good...<br>Pasta was so dry and hard. <br>My husband ordered beef kabobs with rice. Beef was ok but rice was so dried and hard. <br>We told a server about it and she brought him free brown rice. <br>A slice of Cheese cake was great, we loved it. <br>It was my daughter&#39;s birthday, they sing a happy birthday song for my daughter, very nice.

INCOMPETENCE LIVES HERE. I ordered a Raspberry cheesecake with cashier. Asked her if it was a plain  cheesecake with RASPBERRY... she sales me a lemon cheesecake with raspberries...Never mentioned it had lemons in it. Im allergic.... she gives me half of my receipt which does not have what kind of cheesecake i purchased anywhere on it. I had to ask for and she gave me attitude in front of the manager.. She had the nerve to tell me to read whats posted next time. Girl bye!!! Run me my refund...CUSTOMER service sucks here.

It took me almost a month to write this because I was truly saddened and upset by Daniel Kim, the manager. On August 8, 2018 my family and I came here to celebrate my sons 6th birthday.  It&#39;s his favorite restaurant and we come every year.  We were a party of 8.  The waiters came, sang happy birthday to our son after we&#39;d finished eating, we&#39;re taking pictures having a great time.  We had to have been there for only an hour MAX.  After eating we always let our son say what he looks forward to in his new year of life.  The manager Daniel Kim comes over and says &#34;are you guys celebrating something today?&#34; I responded kindly and said &#34;yes, its my son&#39;s birthday&#34;, he looks at my son and says &#34;Happy Birthday&#34; he then continues to say if we&#39;re done eating could we please leave because they have full house and people are waiting.  I said &#34;excuse me&#34;, he repeated himself again.  He continued walking by our table every 60 seconds to see if we had left.  After five minutes of feeling uncomfortable, I told everyone to get up and leave and asked for his name. With a sarcastic smirk he says &#34;Daniel Kim&#34;.  My son was extremely saddened by this, our tradition of birthday memories were ruined for my son.  He asked why we had to leave and I felt really bad about it  I was extreeeeemely sad and upset that we (a BLACK party of 8) who just spent almost $200 eating at your establishment were asked to leave.    <br><br>1) Not my problem if you have a full house.<br>2) How dare you even smile at my son and have the NERVE to say Happy Birthday and then ask him and his family to leave?<br>3) As manager, manage your restaurant, the capacity, and stop letting people through the door if you have a full house.   <br><br>I love the Cheesecake Factory but my entire family and I will NEVER eat here again since a person in a position of power treats paying customers like this.  My sons birthday dinner was ruined and that is the memory we will all have as a family on his 6th birthday. <br><br>-A former loyal customer

Cheesecake Factory takes me back to acute nostalgia of my middle school days. Always came here on the weekend after school and shared a plate with friends.<br><br>The same favored dishes are still now. Never had a dish I didn&#39;t like. Some more than others.<br><br>Appetizer <br>Buffalo blast<br>Thai lettuce wraps <br>Warm &amp; crab artichoke dip<br><br>Pasta <br>Jambalaya pasta <br>Louisiana chicken pasta <br>Spicy chicken chipotle pasta <br>Bistro shrimp pasta <br><br>Salad<br>Luau salad<br>Chinese chicken salad <br><br>Dessert<br>Original cheesecake with strawberry <br>Red velvet cheesecake <br>White chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake
I went The Cheesecake Factory both in Los Angeles (The Grove) and Seattle (near Washington Convention Center). Both are good, nice ambience, tasty food and big portion.

came here for brunch, we ordered our usual, fave breakfast brunch menu, but we were disappointed it was not good as before (brunch combo, belgian waffle, burrito). the waitress, I guess is new at work, she did not bother to check on us and we always have to have someone else look for her &amp; we had to wait longer again for our change from the payment. Hoping they will improve the food and the service, only then we will b coming back again, as this has been our fave brunch spot.

Worst Cheesecake Factory! Unorganized long waits mediocre food and bad service! Couldn&#39;t get any worse on a Saturday ! Just don&#39;t understand how management does not organize their staff better. Waited for over a hour to get seated for two, another 15 mins to order and 30 minutes to get the food. <br><br>Will not be returning !

Came yesterday for a late lunch! The service was a little slow but the food was great!! As you can tell by the pictures we ordered a lot of food!! One tip I would say is that the server served us our food and didn&#39;t once come back to check on us, we had to ask other servers and bus boys for Napkins and even spoons!

I enjoy this location plenty to do after you eat you can walk that food right off by store hopping. The restaurant is very nice lots of murals, you can eat in or outdoors and it&#39;s all on the second floor. <br><br>Straight to the point the food was delicious, customer service was pretty good, they messed up on someone&#39;s order so we got there free salad with grilled chicken ;-), my negatives are I hate how you wait they take your number when your table is suppose to be ready than you get upstairs and wait some more, this location stays busy so the booths are half ass cleaned, and they&#39;re wrong orders or delays in receiving your drinks or condiments. Which is why I gave them 3 stars.
Wow... packed on a friday night<br><br>Grrrrreaaaat service!<br><br>Small world but big restaurant On the second floor of the grove shopping Main Street five tram tourist experience

Cheesecake Factory..at the Grove..<br>I don&#39;t have many positive feedback about this place..<br><br>[SERVICE] <br>The service was terrible..the people who came after my family and I got their food first, then we got our food, which I thought was weird..<br>And it took awhile to get our food and the check..<br><br>[FOOD] <br>* Chicken Piccata: It was really dry, and there was barely any sauce on the penne pasta, but the chicken was good. <br>* Louisiana Chicken Pasta: Delicious. Recommend <br><br>[TIP] <br>In my opinion, the seating inside is much better than the seating outside. <br>* Also I&#39;ve heard the desserts and cheesecakes are good, but I&#39;ve never tried it.<br><br>[THOUGHTS] <br>I was pretty disappointed in this Cheesecake Factory..like really disappointed

Our table was dirty with crumbs when we sat down and the menus were also sticky and seemed dirty. The staff was very friendly but a bit slow with the service (at no fault to the waitress as she seemed great at her job). The Caesar salad was good and had just the right amount of dressing and the Carbonara was okay. The cheesecake is always a 5 stars.

I recently went for the first time this weekend after hearing so much hype about it and I do not have the words to express my extreme disappointment. The wait time to be seated wasn&#39;t so bad, but when we were taken to our table, the bus boy had just finished cleaning out table with what looked to be a dirty towel, and our cutlery was placed on the bare table...not wrapped in napkins or over a napkin, they were placed on the bare table. To me, that&#39;s disgusting. There&#39;s no way of knowing how many people have sat there or what&#39;s been placed on that table. When I picked up my fork, it was dirty. It seemed to have dried left overs. I got over it and we asked for disposables. <br><br>Then when we were served, my mom was not given what she ordered and the waiters response was &#34;oh really?&#34; And the rest our our food was cold, greasy, and bland. From all the hype I had heard, I expected a decent tasting plate, but i got cold, greasy, and bland. My family received variations of the same. <br><br>Safe to say I am never going back there again. If you want exceptional food and service, go to Maggianos or Andrés (across the street between Payless and Whole Foods, they have delicious pasta!).

I came here with some friends during a really busy time. We found seating at a table in the bar since this is the only area that allows for self seating. The service was excellent and the server was sure to bring anything else we needed and filled up all soda cups when he saw them empty without us asking. I ordered the skinnylicious pear and endive salad. I love it and happen to order this every time!<br>This location was great and I would absolutely come here again!

Best place for special occasion or if you want to splurge on yourself. The most beautiful location especially the outside. I love coming here and eating their pasta. The best appetizer is the bacon crispy brussel sprouts. And I love that they have options for drinks. However, this time around I hated what I ordered. The have the Impossible Burger and it was the most driest food I have ever eaten. The servers were amazing. I always get regulars and this time around Jessica was the one that helped me and she was amazing. The staff are very well trained to help with your any need that you have. I wish I had said something about my meal, but the Impossible Burger is a vegan option. I am a meat eater so the experience was not the best this time around. I will continue to try their other meal options because they are delicious, but I am mostly here because the scenery is amazing.

I had a disappointing dinner here and I hope someone from management finds this review.<br><br>My friend and I had dinner here last night (Tuesday) at 6pm. We got seated right away and our waitress was fast to offer water, bread and take our order. I ordered the almond crusted kale salad from the superfood section. At first I asked for dressing on the side then changed my mind and said just give me the salad as is. My friend ordered the same salad but instead of kale asked for mixed greens. Both of our salads arrive but look completely different aside from the greens. My salad was missing pretty much everything- dressing, avocado, quinoa and cranberries. I asked the waitress if this was how my salad was supposed to be because they looked very different. She told me she would take it back to the kitchen, 10 minutes late I get the corrected salad. <br><br>I understand mistakes happen but HOW they get handled says a lot about the restaurant and customer service. I am not going to ask for a discount but I do think a discount or complimentary dessert should have been offered. I just expected a bit more service. Oh well.

I had been coming here for so many times. This is the first time ever i got a very bad service. Me and my 2 boys (age 4) went there last night. We sat down and the server came and said he&#39;ll be there soon. I was waiting then he came to asked us for drinks order . I already knew what i want so i ordered everything right away. <br><br>Usually Whenever we wait for the main dish, we always got the bread first. The drinks came out very fast. Then we were waiting for 15 mins until the main dish came out. Still no bread. I asked for the bread to the other server ( i don&#39;t know where our server was ) ... half way through our main dish the bread finally came out. Boooo <br><br>After that the server MIA again ... until we almost finish our main dish . I even have to asked other server to call our server ... i asked him to just pack the dessert that i order for to go. <br><br>I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s because he thinks i was only with 2 little kids so i will not spent so much money there or because he&#39;s so busy . But i spent $38.45 in total so i think i had the right to get good service right ? <br><br>He&#39;s like totally ignoring us the half time we were there .... <br><br>Oh well ... maybe it&#39;s just not my night . <br><br>Foodwise ... i have no complaints. Always so good. My new fav menu is Chicken Riesling  ( do i write it right? ) . And of course the cheesecakes are always the bomb. Tiramisu cake always the best .

I was at The Grove yesterday with one of my friends so we decided to stop by the Cheesecake Factory for lunch because we had a gift card and let me just say it was pretty disappointing compared to the service we have had at other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s. <br>First off I only know what my waiters name was because of our receipt . So our waiter Nicolas wasn&#39;t that attentive. It took forever to get anything from him...he wasn&#39;t that friendly and never checked on us once we were eating our food. It took close to 15 minutes to get boxes for our food and another 5+ minutes to get the check . The food was good as always but I really wish we would have had another server , I swear I saw other tables with different waiters getting checked on so frequently and with ours it was close to impossible to even track him down for a refill. It was just a little disappointing to say the least .
Awesome customer service experience with Elisabeth and Sonia,  food is good everywhere but only select places have such good service and attentiveness to individual customers. 10/10 would come back

Decided to come here since my boyfriend and I were hungry when we got to The Grove and it was the first restaurant we saw. Entered, and there were quite a few people waiting in the lobby. Put down our name and was told to return in 40 minutes to get a buzzer. This was fine since we wanted to explore The Grove in all its Christmas-ey glory!<br><br>Returned after 40 minutes, received our buzzer, and was told it was going to be another 20 minutes or so. We decided to wait outside since it was crowded in the lobby. After about a minute, the remote started going off and I assumed they were just starting it up. We go inside anyways and are told to go upstairs!! Score :) We wait just a few more minutes upstairs and then get seated!<br><br>Our waiter, Jimmy, was great and took good care of us. He had excellent customer service skills and checked on us just enough times. <br><br>I ordered the garlic noodles with no meat. It was nice and simple.. just the way I like it. Don&#39;t forget to soak the noodles in the sauce every now and then for some more flavor. Had a few bites of the Hibachi steak, which was cooked just right. I also ordered the white sangria. It was light and refreshing.<br><br>Good food, good service!

Made a special trip to The Grove to see the decorations with the family visiting from the Bay Area during the holidays.  We were there after the stores closed, but Cheesecake Factory was still taking names for the waiting list at 9:30 at night.<br><br>By the time we were seated, it was almost 10:00 PM.  Everyone was fading, and just seeking a slice of dessert and a beverage in a reasonable time frame.<br><br>Instead, it was noisy, crowded, and though the servers were rocking and rolling, it was hard to get decent service.<br><br>Everything at this location appears larger than life - the interior design is on a grand scale, the  second floor feels like being 3 or 4 stories high in the air.  The portions are big and expensive, to boot.<br><br>By the time we were able to order and be served, it was late, late, late.  It just felt over the top on so many levels.  Was very happy to get out of there and back down to street level, which was blissfully quiet at the hour.

It had been a long time since I ate at a Cheesecake Factory... All I remember is the large and in charge portion sizes that even filled ME UP... So when it was suggested we hit up Cheesecake Factory for lunch, I agreed, with subtle excitement because I wanted to see what the latest was at the chain restaurant. <br><br>Well, bring your reading glasses because when you&#39;re seated, an ANTHOLOGY is given to you.... Full of delicious sounding fare and photos. Luckily for me, I was very much drawn to the &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu, thus I only had to read two pages of menu items... That being said, I still struggled to pick what I wanted... The chicken lettuce tacos or the large salad with salmon... I went with the latter because when do I ever crave chicken over salmon? <br><br>My dining companion got some chicken dish, the first menu item on page 11, without the mushroom sauce... But for starters, he got a slice of STRAWBERRY CHEESECAKE. Clearly he&#39;s living the YOLO LIFE. Ha!<br><br>Everything was up to par however, of course, some of the toppings I wanted included on my salad were taken off (Womp) and the piece of salmon wasn&#39;t as big as I was hoping... But oh well, maybe I should start training my stomach to eat smaller portions...?<br><br>Ahhhhh ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!!!!<br><br>When all was said and eaten, we left the Cheesecake Factory bellies full (and a doggy bag for HIM... Pussy) and I do recall myself saying, &#34;we can totally add The Cheesecake Factory&#34; to the list of places we go again... After all, I still have to try those chicken tacos!

Seated upstairs close to the door we were freezing cold Ask to change table, our waiter refused have to spend all diner with our coats .<br>Waited 10 min for a mojito, actually arrived after my food not good .<br>My burger arrived without fries, been told they made fresh ones, well I was done with my burger the fries finally arrived, it&#39;s frozen fries :( takes 5 min to cook them anyway really bad experience for my first time at the Cheesecake Factory

Food is phenomenal. But service was kinda slow and disappointing. It was Christmas Eve so we had to wait for an hour to get seats, which is acceptable. We got seated and placed order but order took way too long to reach our table. The drinks itself took good half an hour. Worst thing was after getting our appetizers, waitress never came to ask if needed anything else. When we ask to order our mains, we were told kitchen is closed. We should have notified at least. Luckily we got the cheesecakes we wanted. <br>But overall the food was delicious but service needs to keep up with it.

Best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever ate in my hole entire life. I ordered pastas, tacos and the were so good ! If you are going there but without trying their cheesecake you should worry about yourself ahaha

I am going to assume that if you are reading this review, it&#39;s because you are walking around the Grove and you are wondering where you can have a sit down lunch or dinner and get some drinks and you are not entirely sure about the other restaurants so you are thinking a chain is a safe bet.<br><br>And that is what it is. This is a safe bet. Same family restaurant with a huge menu and their trademark cheesecake. Except this location is loud... and it&#39;s dark... and did I mention it is loud, like a music videos? Lots of 20-somethings on dates before a movie, or hip families where the noise drowns out their kids.<br><br>I only come here to get loud and eat lots of bar food type appetizers.

So, I hadn&#39;t visited this place in years, I was reminded why. Now its not necessarily the food is bad or even the service. For me, the wait time, the level of service and food is just not up to par with what you pay for. I came here because my sister wanted to come here for her birthday, and the birthday girl gets what the birthday girl wants. <br><br>First, Wait time is ridiculous, we waited roughly an hour for a table of 4. Then when we were helped we still waited another 15 minutes for them to clean the table and walk us over. <br><br>The food here is good, not my personal choice because it is on the heavy side for sure. I guess the cheesecakes are to &#34;die&#34; for apparently but I don&#39;t have a sweet tooth myself. Everything came out fairly quick I will say which is good. <br><br>The staff were helpful and very nice for sure. We asked questions and they were able to answer them confidently. <br><br>I would recommend this place to anyone but only if they are not hungry yet and are willing to wait for a long time for a table. This particular location happens to get extra busy so come with plenty of time. The great thing is that there are shops you can go and spend some time while you wait. So that part is definitely a plus. <br><br>Parking is not cheap but they do validate, just don&#39;t forget to do it.  Personally I wont be back to this place unless someone absolutely must eat here.

I went to The Grove Cheesecake factory with my family the night before I headed back to Connecticut. I enjoyed the food and had a great time. A random waiter (not ours) gave my stepmom a complimentary slice of cheesecake! The staff is friendly!

Lost, scared, alone, and hungry. I kept my hunger a flame as I strolled through American Girl Stores isles, until, in the corner of my eye I caught sight of the beauty that would ultimately become my fate- nay- destiny. The fluorescent lights shimmered like a god down to me, and spoke in soft whispers: &#34;Avocado...egg...rolls&#34; Sweet glory came to me as the beaming, bold, brave woman host with the &#34;J&#34; necklace told me my wait time, quick as a bell, I was at my booth. My waiter greeted me with no judgement, no pain, no expectations of me. They knew, I was just there, to exist. Nothing more, nothing less. I couldn&#39;t stop scribbling letters in my marinara sauce, it all kept leading back to one thing, &#34;J&#34;. But what was the J for? What connection could I have had to the J? Why am I here? It was everything, and nothing, all at once. J: for John Hamm, american actor. J: for Julie Albright, american girl doll. J: for the host with the sweet smile whose aura popped through like a sunrise.... J. Her necklace. it became... everything. <br>food waz aight.

Stopped by The Cheesecake Factory while I was up in LA. Hadn&#39;t been to one since 1998 but since I got a CF gift card for Christmas, why not right? Anyways, our server Paul was very friendly. We ordered a BBQ Chicken pizza, avocado spring rolls and these chicken taquitos. My pizza was missing the red onion and instead of making me a new one correctly, I was brought a small plate with raw red onions. Anyways, I&#39;m not reviewing to say anything negative or post. It&#39;s just there.

Not to long ago I celebrated my bday with 11 people and to get a table for that many it took me about 1 hour and half. Which I expected that much, I love going to the Cheesecake is where my parents taken me all ways for my bday. Yet one of my friends got food poisoning that night and their was a hair in one of the plates. I was busy making sure my friends where okay I did not fine out until later. I sure which the food is better prepare meaning the cook in the chicken wear their hair nets and hats so no hair will fall on to the food. Also don&#39;t wait for the all the food is ready because can cause food temperature. We were help really well and service was good. Yet I wish my guess could have had a better time. I say this just be more carful nect

At the Grove location the food is usually good, BUT you will almost always find that your to go order is incorrect.  You need to open your order and account for each item, every time, or you will most likely find you&#39;ve been shorted or that they HAVE you the wrong order.  Managers will credit you, but you probably wanted the meal you ordered....

This place is a joke. I went in there with my wife and friends last night. We asked the waiter to make sure my wife&#39;s food didn&#39;t have dairy in it because my wife is allergic. He made a big point to say that it was all taken care of and that she would be fine. She got incredibly sick from her meal there. She has had severe stomach issues since. It wouldn&#39;t be such a big deal, but this is like the 4th time this has happened at this location and they screwed up my wife&#39;s order everytime. I honestly think the kitchen doesn&#39;t treat allergies with any respect. I&#39;m so mad. I&#39;ll never eat here again and if you have allergies I strongly urge you to not go here.

Came to &#34;The grove&#34; with the fam on a rainy day yeah grove on a rainy day insane right already saw a accident and a whole lot of people that shouldn&#39;t be driving but still made it here. <br><br>I ordered the bang shrimp and Cuban egg roll appetizers. The family said it was greasy, the egg rolls but it was ok and the shrimp was good but not a speck of spicy heat but it was good. We also ordered Madera chicken, everything pizza lunch, and Louisiana chicken pasta.<br><br>The pizza was good. Crispy crust good toppings but it&#39;s pizza, even bad pizza is good pizza. The chicken Madera was slightly dry and needed some seasonings but the potatoes and sauce were delicious. Lots of mushrooms. The Louisiana pasta was a bit disappointing. The sauce was thin so it didn&#39;t really coat the pasta and the veggies were more like a garnish then part of the dish. It was like crispy chicken and bow tie pasta noodles with veggie garnish. Sad.<br><br>But, what you really come here for, cheesecake, we ordered strawberry and Apple cheesecake. Both were excellent. Totally worth ordering. We actually enjoyed the strawberry a bit more than the applewhich is surprising for us. The apple had less cheesecake and more filler. The strawberry more cheesecake with just a bit of strawberry on top. <br><br>We had a really good waiter, Amanda, who was so awesome and took really good care of us. Kudos to her!

I&#39;m not a huge fan of chain restaurants to begin with but we had a friend who wanted to go for his birthday. Worst experience in a long while. Server brought bread, but no plates, when we finished our cocktails we put them on the edge of the table to be picked up, they were never picked up and were left there up to us paying the bill, we were never offered refills on the cocktails, and the best part...the big kicker; the server heard us mention it was someone&#39;s birthday, we did not ask for a dessert or anything, but the staff brought over a dessert, a sundae, AND charged us for it. The birthday boy did not order it or eat it and it appeared on the check. The entire table works in hospitality. We will not be back. <br><br>The only saving grace of the entire meal was when the server went on break (some tall curly haired guy) and we were served by the &#34;breaker&#34;. He was great. Unfortunately our server returned after break and continued to ruin the night.

I love Cheesecake Factory however today was unbelievably overcrowded and no one was managing lines or making it easy to even enter the restaurant. <br><br>The line for one person was 35-40 mins. <br><br>The hostesses at front were trying to help too many people so no one person had their attention which made service even slower. They suggested I go upstairs and try for bar seating but because of the unmanaged crowds people were crowding everyone in the bar area and fighting for seats. When a seat finally opened up I had to compromise with a couple by agreeing to split a table we had both spotted at the same time but we weren&#39;t allowed to sit there because although in the bar area, it isn&#39;t considered the bar. <br><br>I left. I don&#39;t need a seat that bad, with that much stress, and management doing nothing to help.<br><br>It is a shame because I was really looking forward to lunch.
Celebrated my birthday here!<br><br>Love the dishes.<br><br>I&#39;m a huge fan if the Chinese Chicken Salad.<br><br>We had tiramisu cheesecake! <br>Love it!<br>Not so sweet but great texture!

Probably the worst service I&#39;ve ever received at a cheesecake factory. Also there are only two working bathroom stalls here. Two sets of people on either side of us ordered after I did and received their food and checks before  I got my food. Super slow service.
My favorite food is cheesecake.<br>I&#39;m crazy about cheesecake of Cheesecake Factory!!!Other food is also great.<br>I go there once a month. This is my pleasure.

I would have given it 5 stars if my pasta wasn&#39;t partly dry and sticking together underneath the top portion. It tastes very good but as you continue to eat it the remaining noodles are dry. The stuffed mushrooms taste great. I have no complaints there. I will order there again. Overall they do have great food.

Ulises was awesome !!!! I&#39;ve had good &amp; bad experiences with This store .. but this day was nothing but good ! Had the Bistro Rock Shrimp .. wife had the Ahi Tuna dinner .. both perfect ! And the excellent service by Ulises was the topper ! Thank you

I came here with some friends the other night before seeing a movie. We were pressed for time, and we let our server (Rachel) know. She kindly took into account our time crunch and made sure our orders arrived in a timely manner. Rachel is one of the best waitresses I&#39;ve ever had to this day! Thank you!

Great place to grab something to eat. We got there around 3:30 so there was LITERALLY no line and no wait to get seated. That was a huge plus+.  Beautiful place, great atmosphere, beautiful roof decor, lights were dim so perfect place for a date or to hang out with friends. As opposed to other places it was actually not too loud or noisy. There wasn&#39;t even the occasional plates being dropped so good job Cheesecake Factory. Staff was on point brought us warm bread basket (both white and oat) with butter and took our drink order. Server said food would be out in 15 minutes and guess what....it legit came within that time.  So happy cause we were both hungry. Server was so nice and always gave a warm smile.  Had a great experience! Before we left server reminded us to validate which i thought was a kind gesture. We&#39;ll definitely be back to this location.

I think this is by far the worst service Iv ever had in my life. <br>Last night me and my boyfriend went around 1030 and placed an order both of us starving. I heard a few other people complaint about the food taking over 30 min mind me the place was empty. <br>The bartender took our order and we waited approximately 35-40 min. <br>Finally one of the dishes comes out and mine did not arrive. <br>The bartender forgot to put my order in, so the manager walks over and says, &#34;oh he forgot to put your order in Nd the kitchen is closed now, have a great night.&#34; <br>I sat there with no food, to top that off no accommodation at all while my boyfriend stared at his burger. <br>They even asked us to leave saying there closing. <br>I will NEVER go back to this location.

The pineapple upside down cheesecake is extraordinary. However, I am so disappointed with the entrée. We order the hibachi steak and fettuccini alfredo. The hibachi steak is tasteless and the fettuccini tastes too heavy.

It has become an annual tradition of a Stanford friend and mine to eat here every time we are at The Grove for the holidays. It seems silly to eat at a chain restaurant when there literally thousands of other places we could be eating at in L.A., but I love the view of the balcony as well as the service here - so much better than any other Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to.<br><br>My favorite things to order:<br>- cheesecake (obviously)<br>- Hibachi steak (sooooo good!!!!!!!!)<br>- omelette (when I make my own)<br>- cocktails (happy hour!)<br><br>I have no complaints when I come here, except for the ridiculous waits at times. Other than that, if you are here on a crowded day, just reserve your table ahead of time and shop around the area so your buzzer works. (I believe the buzzer works as far away as two blocks, when I was in San Francisco).

Walked in around 10:30pm today asked for a table for 4 waited for few min and me and my brother in law noticed the biggest damn cockroach passing few feet away from us . My brother in law told a employee look you guys got a big cockroach on the floor instead of the employee removing the cockroach she just goes near it and throws a dish towel  over it lol . So we are hungry and say let&#39;s just sit and eat , but as soon as we sat down all 4 of us got soooooo disgusted we just got up and left .

I came here with my mom last night. We ordered the chicken and avocado club, the green salad, sweet potato fries, and grilled artichoke. My mom ordered a beer and a Diet Coke. I was surprised at the experience I had with Cheesecake Factory last night. I am a visitor from Arizona and have never had this experience before. The food was cold and I couldn&#39;t flag down the waitress because she was not around and unattentive. The sandwich was sloppily made and the overall taste of the food was bland. She didn&#39;t refill our drinks, or ask how the food was. At the end of our meal we were talking and she rushed us to leave so she could have the table. She was very rude and unprofessional. Will not be coming back!
Had a great time at the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove. We were seated right away a d our waitor was friendly and the service was great.

This is worst place at the grove.<br><br>Food<br>Very average, then again, who really expects the food to be great at Cheesecake Factory?!??<br><br>Service<br>Dirt Poor. Surprisingly, it must be this specific location.

This Cheesecake Factory compared to others has the best balcony outside seating possible. I got seated outside and it was a perfect view to everything on the grove strip. The food was great and our server was pleasant and accommodating. My mojito was amazing too.

Food is good!  Customer service has been good but lately it hasn&#39;t been so good.  I&#39;ve been to their happy hour many many times and in fact I&#39;ve tried to reserve a few tables at the happy hour section and I&#39;ve always been told that I couldn&#39;t.  Well a few weeks ago I went to have a drink and a bite, it was happy hour and I walked to an empty table and the waiter comes running to tell me that these 3 tables were reserved.  I was surprised because I thought that you couldn&#39;t reserve tables at the happy hour section. He said that I had to look for another table.  Well after waiting for 20 minutes I finally sit down.  To my surprise the &#34;people&#34; who had the tables reserved never showed up.   But 3 different parties were allowed to take these so called &#34;reserved&#34; tables.  Hmmmmmm Maybe cuz I&#39;m Hispanic!!!

Awesome ambiance as expected of a Cheesecake Factory. Our volunteers of service and support team from church get together once a month. I&#39;m on the fellowship committee to select and vote on an event. For this particular month of June we selected a sit down dinner and the venue was here! This location does not take reservations but did put together tables to seat our party once half showed up. They were very accommodating and made the fellowship dinner a success! We really enjoyed the service and the food was downright dynamite! Definitely will keep them in mind for future events. I had the Louisiana chicken bowtie pasta with sauce. Chicken was crispy and light. The pasta and sauce was delicious with a little kick of spiciness without overwhelming the dish. I initially thought it didn&#39;t have enough sauce to begin with but quickly realized that is was all at the bottom if the plate under everything  and only needed to be mixed into. I also had the Strawberry Lemonade in a sugar rimmed glass. Tangy and tastefully quenching

Not the best experience having gone with a small group of friends. The waiter seemed really annoyed that we weren&#39;t ready. Three out of the four of us were first timers which I can see why it could be a problem. That said, we finally ordered and everything came in soon after. <br><br>At the end the waiter began to loosen up and made us feel a little more at home. With that, we went ahead and tried some of his suggested cheesecakes. I wasn&#39;t disappointed with my choice. I went with the seasonal pumpkin and pecan cheesecake. It was really good. If you like pumpkin pie and pecan pie that&#39;s for you.

The food is not terrible but it&#39;s not great. It is not worth the amount that is listed on their regular menu. <br><br>For this reason, if you want a quick decent snack and tasty drinks, I would suggest going for their happy hour (4pm-6pm). If you do not want to snack, just go for their cocktails! If you are on a diet, you can also get any of the cocktails in a skinny (less calories); just let the server know .

So I visit once a week the cheesecakefactory since my wife loves the drinks I really hate coming back to here. . . Anyways she&#39;s white and I&#39;m Hispanic so each time we go; even different locations we always  have to wait for our food at least 45 min to a hr even for the bread... everybody who comes  after us gets first served with food and drinks while we are waiting... most of the time we see 5 or 6 tables who  came after us to get their food first!! even though our order  came first also simple like a mac n chesse or a houssalad we spend by each visit over 120$ and everybody treats us like we are some gypsys who don&#39;t tip or who knows.. <br>Anyways when my wife visits the cheesecake factory  with her white friends she always gets served fast and without  any issues!!  <br>2 weeks ago we went  to marina del ray,  a black family with us was waiting  for over 45 to get a order going we watched  the family  waiting and waiting until 3 black servers came across to take their order which was pretty weird since no black servers we serving in the patio my point is that the cheesecake factory is super racist  if u are a person with colour u won&#39;t get served  or treated with respect.. unless u wait until everybody has their food besides u

I came here the other day for an early dinner with my friend. They have the futurist seating arrangement, compared to other cheesecakes&#39; with their&#39;s offering a balcony/terrace option. We sat outside on the terrace since it was such a nice day! Food is good, but nothing great. Service was okay, but I can tell it was busy, so no complaints. <br>If you happen to stop by here, request eating on the balcony so you can people watch! :)

The Cheesecake Factory at The Grove is a very romantic and beautiful restaurant to eat at. I typically only go here if I have a date, as the ambiance and shopping places around it (and the fountain that is outside with the water shows) make this place quite enjoyable. <br><br>The food is just the same as any other Cheesecake Factory. Delicious, and the food comes out in a very reasonable amount of time. <br><br>We started off with one of my favorite appetizers. The Thai lettuce wraps. This thing is DELICIOUS. Always has amazing flavor. If you&#39;ve never had it before please try it you&#39;ll love it. The sauces are savory the meat is perfectly cooked and wow. Just wow. Get it. <br><br>I got the garlic noodles with chicken. I normally get the Pasta Di Vinci (my favorite one) or the Spicy Chipotle Chicken. The garlic noodles were not as flavorful as those other two dishes. Nowhere near them. In fact the noodles tasted watered down which was disappointing. <br><br>My friend got the ribeye steak. THAT was delicious. A beautiful medium cook and it came with fries. <br><br>Gentleman if you&#39;re planning on bringing a date here, you won&#39;t be disappointed.

* Food. <br>Delicious. We ordered a lot of dishes , it was cooked perfect. Cheesecakes were fantastic. <br>* Staff. <br>Our waiter didn&#39;t come to us , because he was busy, and another guy accepted our order and he was nice . We didn&#39;t like our waiter, he came to the end of our meal and didn&#39;t smile , he was so serious. <br>Food at the restaurant was prepared fast . And I liked that  they drought: 1) drinks 2) bread whit butter 3) main orders 4) dessert . It&#39;s right . <br>* Atmosphere.<br>Nice. Furniture was so comfortable, but there was no enough light , I understood it&#39;s design , but when I have meal I wanna see face of my partners . I liked that they had a lot of tables and it were all  closed and another customers didn&#39;t  disturb us . <br>* Restroom . <br>It wasn&#39;t so clean , but I didn&#39;t wait in line . It had all what I needed . <br>     * Conclusion : I wanna visit this Cheesecake Factory again. So delicious. I want on line just 10 minutes. Fantastic and Perfect food.

Been here a few times over the years. Always have received prompt, attentive service. Tonight was no different. We started off with Nashville nuggets, just ok. As we were waiting for our main course. They sat a couple at the table next to us. (Tables are super close to eachother ) my complaint ? They had a dog with them. The lady claimed it was a service dog. I understand, service dogs serve a purpose. My complaint is the space was so cramped, that the dog kept stepping on our feet. She was feeding the dog, dog food. So that smell was in the air. And it&#39;s just not something I want to smell or deal with while eating a delicious plate of Alfredo with shrimp. It put a curb in our appetite. The couple didn&#39;t mind as they drank away. My birthday and I got no dessert.

Wait is always long at cheesecake this is the biggest reason for the three stars, food options are never-ending, service was great which is unusual it can be a hit or miss depending on how good a shift the server is having LOL.... I had the three cheese pasta with chicken, hubby had the jambalaya, baby had the spaghetti ( which is pretty big for a kid so this is good they can have leftovers the next day) everything tastes good pretty basic  so no complaints.  We had no problems at all this time around, really enjoyed our dinner and will be back,  I mean it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory they&#39;re Nationwide it&#39;s a chain of them can&#39;t really go wrong here

Waiter stopped  once to check on us And waited 20 minute for silverware and I had to get up and go get them  Not sure what was going on or busy on Friday but I think the quality shouldn&#39;t go down this was the worse his name is terrele I believe but I was really disappointed  with the service

Never again... I just got home and had a strange feeling this while I was eating... I felt something was off with my food...<br>Now my stomach is upset and I feel that I&#39;m about to throw up.. This is not about the service but it&#39;s about the food..

I have been to quite a few Cheesecake Factory locations, but this was the best. Clean, friendly, and delicious. The food was fresh and tasty. The orange chicken was delicious, the perfect balance of sweet and savory. My hubby tried the cashew chicken and it did not disappoint. The firecracker shrimp had a light and slightly crispy batter with tasty sauce, very good. The lemon meringue cheesecake is our new favorite from their dessert menu. I even enjoyed a free birthday sundae. The one thing we did not like was the filling inside the chicken potstickers.
The worst service in town! Over booked and under staffed. Give another establishment your business.

Starting with Honey Wheat Brown Bread and Cucember lemonade. You prepared yourself with them before Bang Bang Chicken and shrimp;) also my favorites are famous meatloaf and cajun chicken. The only negative thing is waiting before get in;(<br>Thanks

Visited on a Sunday evening around 7:30 pm. There was an hour wait, and we finally got seated a little past 8:30 pm on the balcony (great views of the shops below). Our server was very friendly and attentive to our needs. Bread could have been a bit fresher (not very warm and a bit on the chewy side). We got stuffed mushrooms for appetizer, which was pretty good. For my entree, I got the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. The flavor was pretty good, not too overwhelmingly spicy. I would have liked more chicken though, and the pieces of chicken that were in the dish were fairly small. My friend got the Louisiana chicken pasta, and they gave a lot of chicken. Overall pretty good meal with fairly large portions (I always have a doggy-bag after eating at Cheesecake) and a nice place to eat if you&#39;re visiting the Grove.

Like most Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to, the food has always been good. However, I would suggest to never go on a busy night. <br><br>A 2 hour wait is not great, but you have the rest of the mall to explore in that time.<br><br>We were seated on the balcony with the theater lobby in view. It was a nice atmosphere but then I sat down and my feet were greeted with a wet syrupy floor. I look down and find that the entire floor has been neglected, cluttered with spills and stray food. Not something I want in any restaurant or my own home. A dirty restaurant is something I can&#39;t stand.<br><br>The service is decent. The servers were very nice and food was served in about 10-20m of ordering. However, you can tell its a busy night when you notice that the pasta you ordered was slightly undercooked. It was also a little bit colder in temperature than you would want to eat it at. Then you would see under a light, the large smear that was meant to clean the edges of the plate. It should have been clean, but it was a clearly visible tomato smear. <br><br>As the table beside us finished eating and the clean up crew came around, I really hoped they would clean the floor. Unfortunately they didn&#39;t and it bothered me quite a bit. I wouldn&#39;t want to tell someone else to do their job when I&#39;m a customer, so no words left my mouth. <br><br>TL;DR<br>The cheesecake and food was good at least.<br>Never go on a busy day, or you will face the quality of food and cleanliness of the restaurant lacking. <br><br>Better off going to Americana Cheesecake Factory.
Pretty good. My family&#39;s new years eve tradition is to eat here! Their salmon is great! The Cheesecake factory has something for everyone and I really suggest you try it.

I grew up on The Cheesecake Factory but when I became an adult and began to explore I moved on to different things. That being said I have loved this place most of my life. The food is consistent. Nothing spectacular nothing too tragic but today I was here for brunch and my breakfast potatoes were crunchy hard and so greasy I squeezed one and it dropped on the plate. The sad part is that I could tell by looking at it that this was going to happen. That is a simple quality control issue that could have been addressed in the kitchen before it came to the table. I exchanged it for a side salad instead. The disappointing part is that no member of management came to speak with me about it and the potatoes were left sitting on the table for the duration of our meal. It&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve been here, it will probably be years before I come back. The wait staff was very nice and understanding and they worked tables together to assist each other which is always a plus.

Probably one of the worst Cheesecake factory&#39; s in la. The service is shit 50 percent of the times, they don&#39;t even ask you if you want to be indoors or out. I ordered a steak with &#34;vegetableS&#34; medium RARE and got a well done piece of meat with cold mashed potatoes and soggy disgusting green beans.
