The worst experience ever.  Oh and they didn&#39;t give me a steak knife until I had to call for the a1 sauce

June 23,2017 @ 8:00 pm<br><br>Just got lucky we were seated in less than 20 mins and mind you it was a Saturday night at the grove. Allison C. was our server (I hope) it says on the receipt. She was very attentive and always ask if we were okay. That&#39;s more like it good customer service!!! Thank you!!!! Food was awesome!!!!

I went there for late lunch after the movies and it was 30min wait. The dining area is on 2nd floor so took the escalator up. It&#39;s smaller in size compared other locations. We sat in the patio and it was crowded on a Saturday afternoon. Our waiter was nice and good on refills by asking. I ordered my usual chicken Romano lunch special and it was delicious and smaller than regular dish. The free bread was delicious and fresh not crusty hard. Remember to validate the parking card.

One of my favorite places to go. When I tried Cheesecake Factory for a first time I was surprised with quality of the food! Food is so great, specially pastas are my favorite. Another favorite thing is when they bring you a fresh baked bread! Service is always on top! I would recommend this place for everyone!!

This establishment is usually mediocre, yet when there is an actual rock in the food they serve, it downgrades the entire experience to simply subpar. Choose another location like the Italian place across the street, much better quality.

The wait staff was very friendly but they are terribly overworked! Also there was a small parasitic bug on my fruit, and I was really disappointed by the dishes. If you are looking for quality dining with no bugs in your fruit, I strongly recommend that you avoid this Cheesecake Factory.

Given the location at the Grove, this Cheesecake Factory gets really full, so expect a long wait or go during off hours like right when they open or for a late dinner.<br>Service was fine, not really stellar, they are busy and just trying to get through the line of people waiting to eat next.<br>The menu is insane, way too much really, but usually everything that comes out is pretty good.<br>One of the better chains when it comes to quality, prices are a bit higher, but portions are large and you can easily have left overs for later making the price justified.<br>They also have a pretty good happy hour which is my favorite time to come here.<br>Perfect for pleasing a large group of people with different tastes.

This place is the best! Amazing food and i love the vibe i get from here feels kinda like im walking in vegas, very professional and clean and special shoutout to the waiter kase (hope i spelled that right) was amazing and very friendly you will be lucky to have him as your waiter , keeps you entertained before your meal arrives , all in all great place to eat !

I hate to give bad reviews but our waiter was so douchefied it was unbelievable.  So full of himself and for no apparent reason.  Good looking????   NO    Great Personality ????   NO     Great Server       Yes, and NO.    The Orange Chicken was awful.  I mean, nothing good there.  The apps we ordered were amazing as was the bread.  The cheesecake is to die for.  <br><br>Our waiter was such an ass, why doesn&#39;t he go sell cars or something?  The whole experience was not worth the wait, nor the $75 bill and he was so undeserving of the amazing tip he received that he will probably not realize how bad he was.  Dude, get a personality or at least get some looks, cause ya got neither.<br><br>I&#39;ll never come back, not even for dessert.  I&#39;ll eat some M&amp;Ms which are only $1.00 a bag and then go to another place where I don&#39;t have to spend $75 for food which has a main meal which is inedible.<br><br>Mr. Personality forgot to give us forks with our to go cheesecakes, so we stopped at Mickey D&#39;s and got some there.  Maybe that is where we should have eaten!!!

The food had no flavor and the servers are slow! Theres no reason why a cheesecake, should be frozen at a Cheesecake Factory but mine was and it was thawed out in a microwave. The server told me this because my cake came out so late

My favorite chain in America!<br>Yes, they are always packed, yes the workers are always full of things to do and sometimes they can be confused or missing something! So don&#39;t go there if you in a rush.<br>But for me there is no problem, the food is delicious!!! Superb!! And everyone treats me very well. Also the prices are very good! 5 stars to them.

What&#39;s happened to the quality of cheesecake factory??  I used to love their food.  You always knew you could get a good meal at cheesecake.  I went a few months ago and was extremely disappointed in the quality of food.  The bread came out cold.  Everything we ordered lacked flavor. The service was subpar.  Cheesecake Factory has definitely gone downhill.

We went at peak hour for dinner time and only waited 30 min which is good for that time of evening . The service was great . The waiter didn&#39;t keep us waiting too long and he also didn&#39;t rush us. He kept up with refills and bread. <br><br>The food was a good price and the proportions were huge! The food was great!!!!We didn&#39;t have room for dessert, but had plenty of leftovers that were just as good the next day!!
amazing customer service.. the food was great and full of flavor.. i tried out the celebration cheescake it was amazing!! i went in around 1pm on a saturday and there was no wait!!

Food here is horrible I would never come back I do not recommend you come here and waist your money not only that I had got a philly cheese steak and bread was not fresh like they said and it was cold and nasty

Not only did we wait 3 hours to be seated, then they started bringing out the food and my co-workers plate was not brought out until 15 minutes after everyone and she had ordered the same thing as most of the people in the group. I ordered spaghetti and meatballs wanted to keep it easy and my pasta was undercooked it was disgusting, then the chicken jambalaya they didn&#39;t put enough chicken worst service ever and food was not that great.

I have been here multiple times. Dine in and take out. Do not even bother calling and ordering to go food here. I was on a &#34;brief hold&#34; for literally 16 minutes and then after ordering we picked up our food and it is always wrong. No vegetables with my chicken and biscuits? No broccoli on the side of fish plate. Just an all around messy restaurant. Way to busy and the staff is not properly trained to handle big crowds. Don&#39;t bother going here total waste of $ and time

Why I&#39;m giving a one star review. I left my Id in my car and had picture of it on my phone and they didn&#39;t accept it. I hardly drink because I have a child and only time I wanted a drink they card me here and didn&#39;t serve me. <br>I loved the cheese cake factory for business meeting but this my last time coming here. My Id was very clear with my age on there. I also have valid id from another county and they didn&#39;t take it. Very piss off

It&#39;s too busy and it&#39;s super bad service when we arrive here we need wait 20 min and more to get the water and bread. And if we didn&#39;t tell the waiter to grab the bread to us. We will just don&#39;t have it. And we sit in a corner and we can hardly find the right waiter. And the other waiter will just say someone will be right there when we have some questions need to talk to someone.

Everything was fine until the bill came, used my American Express Card and the chip would not read. The waiter refused to take my card and stated that he would &#34;get in trouble&#34; if he swiped the card as opposed to using the chip. I am on vacation and I have not had any other retailers/restaurants refuse to take my card due to a chip error, especially a company with a national presence. Can not imagine a chip read error message is a valid reason for refusing a card. Very disappointed!!!

The management here is terrible and needs better training. You shouldn&#39;t lie to customer to cover up bad service.  After almost 2Hours waiting I get my food cold. Thanks for ruining my Birthday Dinner!

Okay so I&#39;m a picky eater but my meal being wrong tonight wasn&#39;t because of my order. My server was excellent and apologized for no reason and the manager was mortified and apologized too. Even gave us free cheesecake. Offered me another meal correct. Their customer service is top notch. They do go above and beyond to make people happy.

Such a nice Cheesecake Factory location! It is well kept, the employees are nice and the decor is beautiful! I hadn&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in years before coming here to celebrate a birthday last night.. the food was better than what I expected and the prices were decent too. I won&#39;t be surprised if I end up getting takeout somewhere in the near future

Probably my worst experience EVER! My son and I sat at a table and when we were seated it was dirty. Then we waited an extra 20 minutes before being seen by a server. He never checked on us. The busser came over and just started sweeping and cleaning under us and our table while we were eating. We asked for extra bread, which never came, we were never checked on, and then just handed the bill. It was terrible. I have yet to have a good experience at any cheesecake.

Some customer service from the Manager Daniel there were no seats available at the happy hour area and unfortunately I couldn&#39;t move from where I was because my 2 year old son was sleeping and they couldn&#39;t accommodate me. It&#39;s simple I wanted a happy hour menu food and they couldn&#39;t bring it from point A to point B. I like how Daniel didn&#39;t offer a solution he was just point plank that he couldn&#39;t do it. Never again am I&#39;m coming to this place.

This place is for the uncivilized (savages) not sure if it&#39;s the unprofessional girls hosts at the door or its the savages who push and cuts people off in the queue. We literally left, wasn&#39;t in the mood to lecture anybody about etiquette and professionalism or being a human in general.  Anyway this branch needs a new manager.

If I could give zero stars I would. Our server Nicole gave the poorest service ever. First she forgets to put in our order so after waiting 40 minutes she informs us that she forgot to put the order in and she will bring it out as soon as possible. <br><br>Secondly, the food came out and it was terrible. The omelette was over cooked and my salad had no taste. The lunch salad at Wendy&#39;s had more flavor than the one served. <br><br>After the food came our sever Nicolle S. neglected to come by to see if we were happy with our food. At that point we had been there for over an hour and I wasn&#39;t willing to spend more time there to send the food back and order a different dish. As a result of getting bad service and terrible food I paid my bill and left zero tip (I&#39;ve only done this one other time in my entire life). That&#39;s how bad the service and quality was. <br><br>I truly feel that Nicole had plenty of opportunity to make up for her mistake. However, her actions showed that she really didn&#39;t want to be there and do a a good job. Attitude is everything and hers played definitely a key role in making this experience a negative one.

YOU NEED TO GIVE RACHEL A RAISE. She works at this establishment and is the best waiter I&#39;ve ever met. She gave me and my friends hugs and was the best person ever. Please give her a raise she is super sweet. -a satisfied 13 yr old

Although this restaurant is a chain I felt like this one was on point when it came to customer service. They have an escalator and elevator to get to the main dining area and the hostess knew that my grandparents needed to use the elevator. She was so nice and showed us right to it. Then the person who was leading us to our table realized that the seating that was given to us would be uncomfortable for our elderly family members to get situated in and changed our table before inconveniencing us with the initial one. <br>The food was on point as always. We got the Chicken Madeira, Thai Lettuce Wrap, Corn Tamales, and Avocado Eggrolls. The Chicken Madeira was tender, juicy, and flavorful without being salty. The lettuce wrap was super fresh and refreshing. The corn tamales were a bit over sauced and drenched in sour cream but they were still good. Avocado eggrolls were like guacamole with wrapping on them. (it could be a good or bad thing lol) <br>All in all we had a great time and got to stroll just enough before it got too tiring for my gpa and gma. The parking garage is quite close to the restaurant so this is definitely a plus!
All I wanted was one slice of cheesecake,Waited an hour in line to NOT get a slice of cheesecake, thought I went invisible

In general my dining experiences here are always pretty good. It is hard to get an item if it&#39;s been forgotten I&#39;ve found, but still enjoy dining here. I&#39;m writing this review because of the customer service I received tonight. I ordered a whole cheesecake online to be picked up under the name Logan before close, some stuff came up beyond my control and I had to call and ask if it could be picked up tomorrow. Was told it was fine and I was about to thank the woman on the phone and apologize again I got a quick &#34;yeah, uh-huh, okay. Bye-bye&#34; before I even finished the word &#34;thank.&#34; I work in service industry too and even when busy I never cut someone off like that. It&#39;s just rude and makes me unsure I even want to bother with this location and just order from a different one.

Of course it was packed we waited to be seated for 1.5hrs!!! Ok no big deal. We waited 45 min then came in to get the pager. I ordered medallion steak. The portion was small compared to other food sizes of cheesecake factory. The steak was really dry. <br>The sangria drink was good not too sweet. <br>Of course the cheesecake- macadamia nut white chocolate cheesecake out of this world- very delicious.<br>Overall experience was good but i was really disappointed with size of steak and dryness

First time at this location . I went on half of cheesecake day which was crazy to say the least.  There was a line to get in before it even opened but I was at the Grove so I said I&#39;m going to eat here anyways. Once the doors open it was a pleasant surprise. Service was good the cheesecake was good everything was perfect will definitely be back when I go to American girl.

I have been here multiple times. Dine in and take out. Do not even bother calling and ordering to go food here. I was on a &#34;brief hold&#34; for literally 16 minutes and then after ordering we picked up our food and it is always wrong. No BISCUTS with my chicken and biscuits? No broccoli on the side of fish plate. Just an all around messy restaurant. So disappointing. Way too busy and the staff is not properly trained to handle big crowds. Don&#39;t bother going here total waste of $
Waiting time was 40min - 60min. There was around 40 people in a little room with a couch for<br>5 people to sit. We had to wait all this time standing.
Love the brown bread ooooo I want some right now oooooo brown bread but sometimes they don&#39;t have it and I get pissed

Really the best dessert. When I was told about this place, I did not think that it would be so delicious. In an institution always there is no place. If you want to sit, make a reservation in advance. Try a caramel cheesecake. Good price and quality, the staff is very friendly, everyone is smiling. For this is a big plus.
trash asian host with glasses. turn away loyal customers. never coming back to this location. no wonder only 3 stars. fire that fake smile asian

Here I am picking up a to go order and the employees have stuck me in an order line. The girl sneered at me as she did it. I&#39;ve already waited way too long just to grab a bag that&#39;s already paid for. Terrible customer service.

The portions are huge, and the service is fantastic. So why the three start you ask? Well for starters, the place is filthy. From the uncleaned tables to the dirty silverware, I am disappointed in how this place operates. As for the food, it&#39;s mediocre at best. I&#39;ll be back because it&#39;s convenient for me, however. Improvements should be made.

When in LA visiting my mom with the kids, this is ALWAYS what everyone wants. I would prefer ANYTHING else at the Grove but the kids always come first :P<br><br>Anytime of the day, there will be a wait so I always put in my name and go shopping for ONE hour. They have done away with the pagers now and will text when the table is ready but you must return 5 minutes of the text !!!<br><br>My daughter always get a few appetizers for herself: chicken strips, fried cheese, Southern fried chicken sliders, Buffalo Blasts, and a side of mac and cheese. My youngest son likes the house made corn dog lollipops and french fries and  the older son likes a cheeseburger and french fries or a side of mashed potatoes and both have to have a apple juice. My mom loves her coffee and Shrimp Scampi or Steak and Shrimp Diane. Its hard for the kids to wait so the squaw and french breads are very helpful to keep them occupied before their food is ready. I stay away from EVERYTHING and order either a filet and vegetables or the pork chop with spinach, dump the mash potatoes and along with a Passion Ice tea, it&#39;s a decent meal for me :P<br><br>My daughter always have to finish off eating here with her favorite dessert, Oreo Cheesecake. My mom doesn&#39;t like my sons and they sense it so while we were having dinner, my two sons tag teamed her while the older one kicked her from under the table and the younger one took a little spoon and threw whip cream directly in her eye. When I realized what was happening, I was like OMG!!! <br><br>The restaurant is very loud and busy so it&#39;s a great place for young children to eat :P

The place is pretty big, and give you a buzzer that allows you to wander the grove pleasant streets while waiting it&#39;s usually big lines. <br>It&#39;s up to its name and you won&#39;t find most delicious cheesecakes elsewhere, surprising considering its a big chain name. Food is also very good, I have tried fish, stake, burgers and was never let down. <br>Being that big and always crowded waiters can suffer to provide efficient service, although they&#39;re usually very nice and you can see they&#39;re trying. <br>Needed to go to the restroom in one of my visits and immediately regretted, scarily nasty.
Sonia was the greatest! Super friendly! She definitely knows how to make someone feel welcomed !

Very Rude Customers Ruined my experience.<br><br>People cut in front of me twice in the line at the bar. Management wouldn&#39;t do anything about it. Never going back. Respect your customers if you want them to return.
Great place the steak diane was good my girlfriend got a rib eye steak medium rare it was delicious totally coming back will be coming back too great time for first timer thank you

Such a fun place for a gathering but extremely noisy and highly energetic. I was taking a mellow afternoon on my own away from hubby and kids so it was a bit overwhelming with the loud gatherings but I sat back took a breathe, found my gratitude and enjoyed the moment.

---Atmosphere, Service, Parking----<br>Located at The Grove you can expect this to be a busy place. With the same look and feel of other locations elsewhere, it&#39;s a great setting with a couple differences. They do have a patio with what I suspect to be a nice view. When you enter there&#39;s a host stand with several hosts, and they&#39;ll take your name down and present you with a pager (if you have to wait). The cool thing is that the pager allows you to walk to a certain distance, so ask about how far it reaches the surrounding area. Once entering you&#39;ll head up a set of stairs or escalators and then you need to talk to another set of hosts who then ultimately seat you. Nearby is a display with desserts and dressings for sale. <br><br>Service was pretty great by newcomer(at the time) Asia when I visited last and besides one bump in the road with hosts prior to sitting down, everything else went well. <br><br>The Grove has parking and it&#39;s in a large parking structure. Make to sure to ask about validation as they validate an hour here (first at The Grove is free). <br><br>--Food, Drinks &amp; Prices---<br>I&#39;m sure you know what they provide here and at the many other locations; the menu is vast with all sorts of things. Many appetizers, small plates, pasta dishes, pizzas, burgers and sandwiches, soups and salads, tacos, chicken and steak dishes, seafood, and all other sorts of entrees, ranging and hitting many flavors of different cuisines. Portions are large and same with the calories in everything (don&#39;t look!).<br><br>Love the fresh bread and butter they serve first.<br><br>I&#39;ve pretty much loved everything I&#39;ve had at the Factory over the years, can&#39;t go wrong with anything really.<br><br>Here&#39;s a few things I&#39;ve tried:<br>-Avocado Eggrolls - Avocado lovers unite! Tons of it obviously with a couple other ingredients mixed in served with a tamarind dipping sauce.<br>-Tex-Mex Eggrolls - Crispy rolls filled w/spicy chicken, corn, black beans, peppers, onions and melted cheese. Served with avocado cream and a pica de gallo.<br>-Buffalo Bites - Lots of breading on this thing but for those who love buffalo sauce these are filled with chicken, cheese and wing sauce.<br>-Crab Cakes - Three of them I believe and pretty tasty.<br>-Meatballs with ricotta and garlic bread - Great meatballs and sauce, served with great bread for dipping<br>-Chicken Scampi Pasta - All the great flavors of a scampi, delicious.<br>-Steak Diane - Medallions of certified angus beef steak covered with black peppercorns and a rich mushroom wine sauce. Served with mashed potatoes and grilled onions. Great!<br>-Pumpkin Cheesecake - If you like pumpkin pie you&#39;ll adore this just the same.<br><br>All sorts of drinks and a full bar is available. Something to note is that The Factory has it&#39;s own line of wine, I believe beer as well (I may be wrong on that).<br><br>Prices are in the $5-20ish range.

horrible service in the &#34;Bar area&#34; which is the area assigned for &#34;First Come First Serve&#34;!!! <br><br>It has been vary accessible compared to waiting an average of 45 minutes to an hour!!! <br><br>And be careful you don&#39;t get into a bar fight because these hungry people don&#39;t MESSing around! LMAO!!! <br><br>The last couple times I went i waited for about 10 mins and a didn&#39;t want to hover over the guy that was leaving, so I thought I&#39;ll just wait until he leaves, I mean NO ONE wants crazy people running up to your every move that looks like your about to finish! This Lady runs up to th chair and says what... &#34;SORRY ITS FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE!!&#34; Im like wow! <br><br>So beside that craziness...<br><br>Well let&#39;s start with the food, if you sit at the bar and not the high table area behind it, your food and service will be great.. <br><br>But if you sit in the bar area that has separate tables well service is crap!! And food comes out LATE,Half way cold and the avocado eggrolls I usually get where dark brown when suppose to be well YEAH GREEN!! <br><br>the food is hit or miss.. The service is iffy.. But the management does the best they can:)<br><br>HORTIBLE

Through all the years I&#39;ve been going to the cheese cake factory in the grove this has to been the worst experience in my life. Not only did we wait forever to get seated but when we got our food it was cold and it had no taste! My daughters pasta tasted like they heated it up in the microwave a few times. My steak Diane had no taste it usually has a sweet taste to it but this time it was plan. Even the bread was cold and hard. The only reason why I didn&#39;t complain about it was because my husband didn&#39;t want me to make a big deal off of it. $153.00 down the drain!!!!!

So I&#39;ve never ever ever ever ! Ever had a problem here and today it was such a disappointment the hostesses don&#39;t know how the he&#39;ll to do their jobs . I came to eat of course for a party of two . We came left our names and got a reservation for us two , the host told us it was a 45 minute wait we got our buzzer and went out side and waited till it buzzed, exactly 45 minutes later our buzzer goes off we come turn in our buzzer and they sent us upstairs to get seated so we went up stairs checked on with them and they told us 15 minutes so I&#39;m like okay fine 15 more minutes yeah almost 30 minutes later and I go and check with the host and tell them what happen because we&#39;ve been here for almost an hr and some minutes she said oh wait 20 more minutes I&#39;m like really every who&#39;s came up for seated right away why do I have to wait almost 2 hours to get seated after I was told it was a 45 minute wait she said well you have to wait 20 more minutes because you aren&#39;t checked in mind you I checked in soon as I came up stairs .<br>This place is such a fucken mess don&#39;t even bother coming here to eat unless you want to wait 3 hours so you can get seated .<br>Cheese cake factory .<br>Get your HOSTESSES TO DO THEIR JOBS RIGHT IN STEAD OF FLIRTING.<br>If I could give them a negative ass star rating I would !

First time in Cheesecake Factory. Great experience and all. Ordered &#34;ultimate &#34; a velvet cheesecake, gosh it was amazing and a little too sweet for my taste plus that thing was huge.<br><br>Staff is great, though it would be confusing for first timers with the greeting/seating arrangement . <br><br>Location is great, its the grove after all . Bathroom isn&#39;t capable of handling their costumer capacity .<br><br>Overall good

Biiigggggg let down! <br><br>I normally love the factory but this time they dropped the ball! <br><br>I got the steak Diane and chicken madiera! <br><br>Cold as ice! Not sure how it was cold but me and my friends food was cold! <br><br>The waiter offered to &#34;re-toss&#34; the food on the stove and offered free cheesecakes but we don&#39;t eat cheesecake so we expected something off the check instead! <br><br>She brought the food back out and it looked nothing like it did before, no sauce and poor presentation! <br><br>It was warmer this time around <br>Check came, no comp!

I&#39;ve always loved the Cheesecake Factory and it&#39;s has always been my default place for birthdays, anniversaries etc. <br>Came here on Christmas Eve and it was a mess. Longest wait ever in the cold, yes we had reservations. It seemed very unorganized with random names being called out. Many people were crowded by the door, had to trample through to get to the host. Next time I think they should keep the doors and hall clear. <br>Our food took a while to get to the table but I thank them for keeping the bread baskets coming. Unfortunately, having no self control doesn&#39;t help you here. I filled off the bread basket too soon and couldn&#39;t enjoy my meal, lol don&#39;t be like me. <br>The food arrived kind of cold, but it took so long for it to arrive and we were so hungry that we just ate. One member of our party asked the server about his dish but she didn&#39;t seen to take an interest and didn&#39;t offer to replace the cold dish. I understand it was hectic but standards are standards. Other than that thanks for being open on Christmas Eve!

I have to give this place 3.5 cause of their slow service.<br>Came here for lunch at 2pm. The wait was 45 min so we just sat at the bar. We waited 5 mins to have the table cleaned and set-up. Another 5 mins for the waiter to show up. By the time, he asked for our drink order, we were ready to order our meal.<br>We asked for the brown bread which we loved! And we got the salmon firecracker, Jamaican shrimp and jambalaya. Foods great but they served our appetizer with the meal so all the taste we&#39;re mixed together. We come to Cheesecake Factory all the time and by far this franchise at the Groove has the worst service.
Horrendous customer service. The staff here is very unfriendly. Utensils are always filthy. I love CF, so driving out of my way to avoid this one is worth it.

Always loved this restaurant and I really hope will continue love them. Because I always get the service and food that I want. Service is always great and I just like Being in this restaurant. Have been here already more than a few times. And always after I leave I&#39;m thinking about when I should go back again to eat my pastas.  I really love eating Pasta at this place. <br>Thank you for a such a great service and good.

I&#39;ve been there a while ago during my stay in Los Angeles. I was pretty young at that time and I was very amazed by the Cheesecake Factory<br><br>1/ It might sound silly for Americans, but as we don&#39;t have this system (yet?) in France, I think buzzer they give you so you know when seats are available is very efficient<br>2/ Our server was so nice and made us feel very comfortable<br>3/ I got the maha mahi fish with asparagus, it was fresh and delicious ! <br>4/ It was so clean that I almost fall<br>5/ The strawberry chessecake was HEAVEN<br><br>If I ever travel to the US again, I&#39;ll go back !<br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Ffoodiealex.blogspot.fr%2F&amp;s=21f23546c9f952f6753acd0bf3774c256ddde9e4cf97b89bcfeb17eead12b670" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">foodiealex.blogspot.fr</a>

I treated my dad  for dinner here or Father&#39;s Day. I think everything here is delicous. So delicious its tough to narrow down what you want to order. lol I thought this location was fun. Its right in the middle of the grove. On the day we went there was a live band playing and they were pretty good. My only complaint is the waitress was nice but just not a good waitress overall. First she tried to clear the table while we were still eating. And then she gave the wrong check. She didn&#39;t even realize she gave the wrong check until I pointed it out to her. She didn&#39;t receive a good tip from me for that. <br>Other than the lousy waitress this is a fun place with delicious food.

While the food is good and the cheese cake is out of this world. The service is sub par. Never have I been discriminated so much by ordering a glass of ice water. If you don&#39;t order a drink, I have to ask the waiter two time before he brought me that ice water and he gave me this attitude that I should&#39;ve have ordered a drink. Also l then got my parking ticket validated, ended up paying the full price for the ticket. So much for the validation. What is wrong with drinking water? I was the designated driver!

Service was good and quick! I ordered the fried shrimp and fries. Everything was good! De&#39;qorrie, our waiter was the best! He checked many times to see if everything was good and even gave some suggestions. Definitely coming back.

The service was too slow here. We came around 3 pm and we had a hard time just getting our orders in. Of course food is always good here however to get a guacamole dip took 30 minutes. Overall 3 stars because of time. And prices are about $15-25 per person.

Its been so long since I have stepped foot into Cheesecake Factory. We came here for a birthday celebration. I am a huge fan of eating burgers. When I order the mushroom burger, I assumed it would just be regular size which it was. Half way eating into it I was still hungry, by 3/4 of the way I was already filled up. I managed to finish the burger and had a couple of fries. The burger may look average but theres alot of meat. The food was good, service was okay. Our server was a bit too busy with texting, I stood there for a good couple of minutes waiting on her.

The quality of this restaurant has declined over the years. I ordered the green chilaquiles with carnitas and eggs and was very disappointed. The sauce was bland and the garnish was poor as the corn tortillas were very dry. It felt more like nachos than chilaquiles. The carnitas also tasted old as if it were left overs from Saturday. Wonder if the KM did his line check? I expected more for what my husband payed for and I honestly could have made my own chilaquiles at home, but my husband decided to surprise me and spoil me with a Sunday brunch at home. I would definitely not recommend this dish and instead recommend to go to a real Mexican restaurant if you really crave this dish.
That&#39;s awesome!  Amazing cheesecakes! Very nice staff!  Not too long time waits on the line. Very recommended for everyone who love sweets!

Just had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory at the grove in Los Angeles California! This place is magical and the our sever Deshawn Wilson Was awesome. The food is always good here wish we had one in Sweden but we don&#39;t see you next year !!

I came here alone during the lunch rush recently, having just lost my job and needing to get out of the house and treat myself just a little. To keep things cheap, I ordered just an appetizer and a slice of cheesecake. Of course, you know the free bread and cheesecake are delicious. That&#39;s not why you&#39;re here, deciding which location to choose. <br><br>Let me tell you -- the staff here were wonderful. Normally I get some strange responses while dining alone in LA, but these guys didn&#39;t care at all. I sat out on the patio, took in the sun and fresh air, and read a book while I ate, and they took care to bring me what I ordered (and refill my water) without disturbing me. I kind of wish they had, however, because my waiter comped the whole meal without saying a word and then finished up his shift and left before I noticed the bill. I don&#39;t know his name, so I can&#39;t thank him properly, but if you&#39;re lucky enough to get the same rotation I had when I went, you definitely won&#39;t regret choosing to go to the Grove (which I know is a crazy thing to say).<br><br>Thanks for the love, guys! It really brightened my day!

We came here in a Saturday at 11:30am for lunch and we&#39;re seated right away. After that we say and waited for over 5 minutes with a hungry toddler, no drinks, no bread, no crayons - nothing. The restaurant wasn&#39;t even that busy as there were plenty of empty tables around us. Once we ordered the food took forever. We didn&#39;t get the food until over 30 minutes later. Our server barely checked in on us and the bread that was served wasn&#39;t warm. My Thai lettuce wrap appetizer as an entree was delicious. My husband&#39;s Kobe burger looked good. The kid&#39;s butter pasta was so dry. I&#39;ve had better.

I really like Cheesecake Factory...food is great...service is usually pretty good...desserts are wonderful...but...my dissatisfaction is that they have a &#39;suggested&#39; gratuity at the bottom of their check that has our local 9% sales tax added into the sub total! Why?? They are being dishonest in that the gratuity should be based on the sub total amount of the food/drinks, NOT the total amount of the bill, with the tax included.  So...if you choose to tip 20%, using the figures on their check, you are essentially giving a 22% tip.<br><br>I totally support the servers, but Cheesecake Factory Corporate needs to be honest with their patrons and change their policy regarding their deceptive checks.

Got seated right away and greeted by the hostess, I love the bread with butter there, I got the Shepard&#39;s pie but it didn&#39;t taste so good to me, I&#39;ve had better in Vegas, it seem too fatty and the ground beef tasted a bit off to me. My boyfriend got the Mac n Cheese burger and he said it was okay as well and he has had better, he thinks it was the bun that wasn&#39;t the same as what they would usually use. I&#39;ll probably try another location. But I would come back to try their nachos. And omg the plates are so heavy lol I had to box my own food which I don&#39;t mind but usually when I go to cheesecake they would offer to box my food. But man those plates or dishes are heavy

Okay I always come here for the red velvet cheesecake because that thing is crack to me. I also usually get their tanaki ahi tuna salad. This specific chain restaurant wasn&#39;t my favorite. Not only was the cheesecake a hot mess (not cool at all so the cake didn&#39;t hold its shape and the batter lacked the usual ever so slight bright flavor) but they went a little overboard and drenched my salad in the super sweet dressing so it felt like I was just drinking my salad. My friend had asked for more bread and the waitress said they were out of the wheat bread which was fine but she never came back with the sourdough. Most likely won&#39;t come back to this specific location.

Had a great time here last night for our Anniversary! The service was great even though they were busy they treated us great food came out on time was really wonderful! Had the salmon was very good cooked perfect !! Our waitress bought our dessert with happy Anniversary on the plate so sweet !! Got the low carb cheese cake since I&#39;m on a diet and loved it !! Was just perfect and prices were very fair !! Thank you CCF for a wonderful experience our waitress  was very nice was training a guy they were great as busy as they were they were perfect !!!! Thanks for s nice night !

I love the cheesecake factory food and I hate that they are called the cheesecake factory because I thing that the meals are better than the desert. I highly recommend the avocado rolls for the sauce! And also their salmon dish is amazing. I also recommend people to share their cheesecake as it is pretty heavy and very rich!<br>What I enjoyed the most was the balcony with view on the grove. The service was a little bit slow like the one in skokie IL but the waiter was nice!

CATERING &amp; OFFICE SNACKS!!<br>Easy way to out do the other moms at school or home events or at work is order some of everyone&#39;s favs from here off the catering menu!! Ask for kosher and halal though so we can encourage it. <br>They are always so nice when I go here whether alone or with my now eleven year old son over all his life even when he was a tiny tot and were even then kind to a woman with a small baby and toddler all thru those hard to deal with kid in restaurant ages he was and though he was well behaved they never rolled their eyes or acted like they did not want families there like some places do so they are very family friendly also but please remember to clean up after small kids at places including restaurants as parents and to tip a little extra when affordable to those waiting on a small child who made a mess not able to fully be cleaned up by those parents. As that should not be a stand out thing and no one should have to have that problem but grateful I was able to eat miso salmon here so often before a big slice of cheese cake over the years. And what a nice kids menu, he always enjoys it!! I do hope they add kosher and halal and diabetes friendly options listed as such on the menu.

Shout out to Brandon for being super attentive &amp; friendly!!<br><br>Mariam &amp; Amy were also incredible &amp; considerate!!<br><br>Thank you for making our experience at The Cheesecake Factory a great one!!

I had previously ordered from here for my exec staff at my company and written a review of two/three stars because they had forgotten to put the meat on two of my salads. As a person who&#39;s worked in the food industry for a few years, I get that things happen - this could&#39;ve been a simple mistake, so though I wasn&#39;t happy about having to go back and get the order fixed (after tipping as well) I was okay with letting it slide.<br><br>That being said, I decided to order from them again today, though I was uncertain about it. <br>Two more salads came out without meat on them, and because the person who filled my bags assured me they were made correctly, I didn&#39;t notice until I had walked back over with our food. <br><br>I could understand checking food to make sure it has no cheese on it, etc. as part of a specification, and I&#39;m also not the type to leave bad reviews, but this is really unacceptable and reflects badly on me as an employee when my execs notice something&#39;s wrong. We usually order from CF pretty frequently, but I honestly think that&#39;s going to stop now. I&#39;ve been to CF as a dine-in and had a good experience, but there&#39;s just some major miscommunication between the kitchen staff and the order team.

Tonight we had dinner at the grove at this restaurant--What a big difference from the one near my house in Woodland Hills quick service the food was delivered in a quick manner not like the one near me which rates a 3 only--The waiter a tall 6-7 afro-american hansom waiter took our order was so helpful and sweet great personality too--If I want great food and great service this is the place to eat---

I come here every other month and this time the service has been awful.  We came in right after opening and had to wait 10 min just for server to come over.  Then another 20 min fir bread and drinks.  Then our order was overcooked.  Then our desserts took another 20 min.  For the money spent here...the service should be great every time.
Went to the cheese cake factory for Valentine&#39;s Day with my girlfriend and our best friends and ended up with food poisoning. Don&#39;t recommend
Not using Postmates with this restaurant. Food is low quality at best. Ava did were old and dish sat out for a long period of time causing avocado to turn black. Very disappointed in this restaurant.

This is more of a review regarding the layout they have here, which is just completely nonsensical. Why the heck do they have two check in stations that seem to operate separately?! When you walk in the door downstairs, you check in at the host stand. They tell you when you can go upstairs, presumably because your table is ready and someone will seat you upstairs. Well, tough luck. We went upstairs as instructed, no one helped us or greeted us upstairs so we walked around til we found a waiter and asked if we could just grab a table, since there were plenty at this hour. He told us to go back to the host stand, where the hostess was more interested in gossiping with her friend than she was in providing customer service. She made sure she finished her conversation before she attended to my party and the other parties waiting, with lots of attitude, mind you. Outrageous.<br><br>I just don&#39;t understand what the point of checking in downstairs is if you have to check in again upstairs. Like logically, for crowd control purposes, you should check in downstairs, and then have the party go upstairs when someone upstairs is ready to seat you. Seamless process right? THe way they have it set up, upstairs is a total fire hazard. You have people waiting to be seated, and probably confused why no one is helping them. You have people oogling at the cheesecake displays. And you have people trying to exit the restaurant too. Three way traffic in a tiny hundred square foot radius.

Wow once go through the whole crowd, and get seated. Superb service!<br><br>Located at The Grove. 1 hour free parking + 1 hour free validated parking. The seating is upstairs with RSVP and host downstairs. Interesting?<br><br>Food is the same. Nothing too great but very general for everyone to at least be able to eat something.

Omg I love this place. You can&#39;t miss. Literally the best food I&#39;ve ever had. The huge menu gives you world of flavors. Every time I there I step out satisfied and full. All the dishes are strongly recommended. The place is romantic and placed on top of the grove. You will be experiencing outstanding feeling seating at the balcony. <br>What I liked the most is the service. Apple, our server, was 100% helpful. He took care of us so elegantly and nice. To be honest the management are doing great job running this place. We ordered one dish by mistake and they changed it in a second, no question, with smile.<br>I&#39;ll come back for sure.<br>Wish all the places would be like this place.

Worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. I&#39;ve always loved eating at this chain restaurant ever since in junior high. My go-to dish is the Pasta Da Vinci, and after 10+ years, I always still crave it every time I walk past a Cheesecake Factory. There is a location near my office, so I decided to grab the pasta dish as take out. HUGE mistake ordering from here as this place is in the Grove.. which basically equals super packed and full of tourists. When I got back to my apartment, I noticed my food was barely lukewarm and watery. The dish barely had a taste (and the little taste it did have.. was pretty funky) and did not taste ANYTHING like the other times I&#39;ve gotten the Pasta Da Vinci. There was also pieces of pasta that did not belong. The dish comes with penne, but there were random pieces of farfalle and other types of pasta. I also found a couple pieces of sausage that obviously should not be there.... since this dish does not come with sausages... makes me wonder how they cook the food...<br><br>Thanks to this location, I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever want to go to another Cheesecake Factory again. So thanks for ruining that for me.

I went probably a month ago with my boyfriend . Love the food there . I get there and the waiter is not welcoming at all and when we received our drinks he didn&#39;t even give us straws . We had to ask the bus boy because he has just gave the drinks and left. Our food came I ordered a pasta and my boyfriend a burger. When he ordered his food he has told him can you please bring ranch with that and he never brought it . Again had to ask the bus boy . He didn&#39;t ask us at all how we were or how was the food but just stared from a far. Delicious food but needs to work on the customer service

You know, I&#39;ve actually never had the cheesecake. But the food is outstanding. You can order from the starters menu and get more options for the sane price as a entree. I really love the honey mustard chicken strips.<br><br>The wait staff is also really nice. I mostly love that they&#39;re open late, so you can feast like a beast after your movie lets out.

So the story goes like this, a day before I called this location to make a reservation and I was told no reservation, first come first serve, I was ok with that but the fact that the lady who answered the phone told me they have lobster but when I came the day after with my visitors from Australia who wanted lobster we found out NO LOBSTER, management please teach your staff what to say and know their shit!!!!!

I got the chinese chicken salad because of all the raving reviews about it, but its so.... meh. For $15 i was expecting something a bit more than your standard bagged salad mix and some tortilla strips and chicken. Mendocino and tender greens both have wayy better salads for the same price range. Just very disappointed :(

So... it was actually my roommate&#39;s birthday when we went. HIS FOOD HAD HAIR IN IT and the manger, James, told the whole table that he was going to &#34;take care&#34; of his food and that he was buying a round of cheesecake to our table.<br><br>In our understanding (me, roommate, mom, pops), James was going to get my roommate&#39;s meal deducted from the bill and that everyone was going to get complimentary cheesecakes. That didn&#39;t happen. <br>What happened instead was 1. his food was still on the bill (after James said he would &#34;take care of it&#34;) and 2. Only he (my roommate) was getting the complimentary cheesecake and not the rest of the table.<br><br>Although it made sense my roommate was going to get the complimentary cheesecake, what we were not pleased about was how James CLEARLY said he was going to buy the whole table cheesecake and that he was going to &#34;take care&#34; of the bill. <br>It was CLEARLY said (&#34;the whole table will get cheesecakes&#34;) said AND implied (&#34;I&#39;ll take care of it for you&#34;) that his meal would be deducted AND we were getting complimentary cheesecakes.<br><br>I felt really bad for my roommate. He was expecting to have a great time, we all did.

This 1 star (wish it could be 0) is for waiter Demeitrie E.  Came in with my mom to have a nice dinner but he ruined it.  Sucks that they hire people with such ugly personalities.  The food this time was not good.  I didn&#39;t even eat it.  of course, he didn&#39;t care to even ask.  Not a gentleman at all.  Disrespectful and seemed to discriminate because of my race.  Just made the whole experience awful.  Demeitrie! start being polite and treat your customers with respect.

Boom! Yes!!! Jack was our great waiter! He is a writer and if his writing is better than his serving then he&#39;s going to be a success. The food was fabulous! I highly recommend the Original cheesecake. It&#39;s so creamy and delicious. The food was all so yummy!

I tried to order in advance because I know  they can get busy. <br><br>I guess I&#39;m an idiot, because that clearly doesn&#39;t work. I was on hold for 18 minutes. I LITERALLY had time to drive there, sit at the turn arrow to turn into the grove, park on level 4,walk to the elevator, WAIT for the elevator, walk to the restaurant, smile at the host in the front, slowly go up the escalator, wait for 2 people in front of me to be helped..and was STILL on hold..I literally showed the woman at the counter that I was on hold..and then she looked down at the phone and say &#34;oh&#34;..........what in the actual f*uck???
Food is okay. Wait times are terrible. Not only is the wait long but it&#39;s also highly inaccurate. Don&#39;t recommend it. Better places in the area

Treat yourself to good food and drink there. Drinks here are readily available, so you can enjoy a glass of wine or try something new. This restaurant is kid-friendly, so little ones are welcome to tag along. Be sure to check out outdoor seating when the climate is right.  Here  is a great location to host a group dinner or lunch.<br>Very polite waiters, fantastic costumer services, awesome environment! <br>Totally, I really recommend this place to everyone!

It&#39;s not about the food. But the people who work here. They steal your belongings if you left it by accident. Again, they STEAL. So to the people who plan to go here?  You better watch out of your things. The management sucks, Super low security. It&#39;s makes this restaurant a stupid restaurant. If you call them about your things you left? They would only say &#34;there is no match of description you said or your probably left it somewhere&#34;.  Wtf, i know i accidentally left it on our table as we were on a rush and have a lot of take out food in our hands. This is the worst restaurant i&#39;ve ever been to. Unlike pf changs, they have the best service. I regreted i went to this place. Specifically this cheese cake factory in the Grove. We should have went to buca. Nearby. I won&#39;t recommend this place!

Once, we told the waiter it was our friend&#39;s birthday hoping they would give us some free cheesecake. Instead of giving us free cheesecake, he simply said &#34;oh, happy birthday&#34; and walked away.<br>Used to be a place where my friends and I celebrate our birthdays in middle school and have our parents drop us off before taking group pictures outside. Now, this a place for families that drive Camry&#39;s and go to Disney. They don&#39;t need to know all of our business. The huge menu gives you world of flavors.  Drake loves coming here, we fought here once.
Server alex sucks she has poor choice of words telling me &#34;I don&#39;t care&#34; all I told her it&#39;s my birthday.

I dined here this afternoon, arriving around 1:30. Right when I walked in the door, there was no one around but a woman behind a stand. I assumed she was the hostess so I went up to her but she was occupied looking at something behind her stand, so I politely waited for her to finish. After about a minute she finally looks up at me. She did not offer a greeting or ask if she could help me so at this point I thought that maybe she was not part of the restaurant but only worked in the building. I asked her if there was somewhere I could park my stroller and then moved upstairs via the escalator.<br><br>At the top of an escalator I notice another stand identical to the one downstairs but this one had some people crowded around so I waited in line to put down my name for a table. When I got to the host, I told him &#34;table for two please!&#34; He stared at me blankly and asked if I had already given my name downstairs. I told him I did not then he frowned and said the wait would have to be about 5-10 minutes. I told him this was fine and moved to the side.<br><br>My 2 year old daughter and I hung around looking at cheesecakes and about 15 min later they called our number. We returned to the host stand and returned the buzzer. The host told us that they were just cleaning off the table and would seat us shortly. I stepped to the side of the stand to wait to be seated. About another 10 minutes pass and I see several other parties called and also asked to stand to the side. I was pretty close to the stand that the host could have just turned around and told me there was some issue but he didnt. I waited another 5 minutes and went up to ask him if there was a problem. He told me that there was some confusion and that they were getting reorganized. The other two parties that were called and asked to wait were ignored. He could have told them both the same but he did not. Another few minutes pass and another hostess arrives to take us to our seats. As we are walking, she looks at my daughter and myself and asks if I would like a kids menu instead. I notice at this point that the male host who took our name down had handed her two standard menus. Since my daughter is only 2 I found this very strange. She went back and got the correct menu and we were finally seated.<br><br>I ordered the kids spaghetti with meatballs for my kid and the grilled chicken avocado club for myself. The spaghetti was a large portion, more than she could ever eat, but tasted good. My sandwhich was a monster and impossible to eat without making a mess, but was also very tasty.<br><br>Our server was a little difficult to find because the one who took our order and the one who checked up on us were not the same. I can only assume that the first one went on break and failed to inform us that the server would be changing. Once I figured out who our server was supposed to be it was a more pleasant experience going forward.
Great service tonight.  Enjoyed the ambiance and great customer service.  Thanks Team Cheesecake!
I go to the Cheesecake Factory at The Grove in Los Angeles. The environment is loud, but the food is delicious. I always order my favorite Pasta Jambalaya.

This is my first time ever trying Cheesecake Factory. The host didn&#39;t even acknowledge me nor said hello. I went up to the desk and ask for a table he just handed me a buzzer and told me to wait. No instructions as to what to do after it&#39;s buzzed nor to even go upstairs. Again, just horrible assistance when it came to be seated, we were rushed to our table and weren&#39;t even asked if we liked it.

I normally have good experiences at The Cheesecake Factory, but sadly our visit to TCF last Friday left a lot to be desired. We arrived right at 6pm with a party of 4 and were told the wait would be 15 mins. After 25 mins had passed we started getting a little antsy. Waited until the 30 min mark and went up to the hostess to find out how much longer we&#39;d have to wait. When I handed them my number, the hostess looked on her computer, made an obvious &#34;oops&#34; face and said we should go upstairs to be seated. It was completely obvious that they had forgotten to text us although our table had been ready for a while. When I pressed them asking why we hadn&#39;t received a text, they rudely said &#34;we tried texting you but no one came up&#34;.  Such a blatant lie as there were zero texts received. And how shady is it to try and blame the customer? I would have pushed it further, but we were with out of town guests and I didn&#39;t want to make them uncomfortable.<br><br>Their unwillingness to admit the mistake and own up to it left me more than a little irritated. The meal itself was ok. Our main waitress was very nice and came by frequently to check on us. One of the random servers who delivered part of our meal was rude and barked &#34;who had the pasta&#34; when she had to repeat herself (uh, our guests didn&#39;t speak English, lady. Sheesh).<br><br>Overall, our party enjoyed the food/wine/cheesecake. The low 2 star rating is solely for the irresponsible and rude service we received. I will avoid coming to this particular TCF location in the future.
Food was ok. Server was nice Hispanic man. But the utensils were dirty, really disgusting. Told a worker got a new one though.

Med-Rare, Smokehouse BBQ Burger w/Ceasar Salad.<br><br>Burger: Thin crispy onion rings. Applewood Smoked Bacon, 100% real Cheese, Smoked, tender beef.<br>I remember their &#34;Ranch House Burger&#34;. This one is just as tasty. I haven&#39;t found a better burger &#34;anywhere&#34;, in 7 years!<br><br>Caesar: Nice creamy dressing w/just enough tang &amp; garlic, fresh grated Parmesan &amp; super fresh Romaine. <br>When a dude, switches out &#34;French Fries&#34;? You know the Caesar, is boss.<br> $21.00 and WORTH IT!

*update, was here Friday night, and this time my husband and I sat at the bar for the first time. To my surprise it was a lot cozier than the tables or booths, I very much enjoyed the service from Patrick the bartender/server. He was very attentive and he was mixing drinks while getting us everything we needed. He was multitasking to the max and got so much done. I know other servers are twice as busy having multiple tables ordering and needing service, but this is the first visit everything comes out very fast and good if I may add. Now I know sitting at the bar can be beneficial.

This is definitely my go-to restaurant.<br>Every time I&#39;m back home visiting family or meeting up with friends for a quick lunch, we always go to the Cheesecake Factory.<br>Just the amount of options they have - there&#39;s always something good for everyone to choose from.<br>My personal favorites are: the firecracker salmon roll for appetizers, the Pasta Da Vinci or Steak Diane for the main meal, and the 30th anniversary cheesecake for dessert.<br>We came here this week and we had the Luau Salad which was so fresh and delicious, Pasta with Meat Sauce (we change the pasta to angel hair), and the Strawberry cheesecake.<br>I&#39;m sure everyone&#39;s been here by now, so hopefully these suggestions help!

Terrible, everytime i&#39;ve called here, it&#39;s taken longer than 1/2 hr. to get the status/update on my order, currently happening as I sit here writing this, think i&#39;ll take my business elsewhere.

This Cheesecake Factory compared to others has the best balcony outside seating possible. I got seated outside and it was a perfect view to everything on the grove strip. <br>Service was great and so was the food! <br>love mushroom soup every Wedansday

I don&#39;t like big chain restaurants so I&#39;m biased already against Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ll let you know that now.  Parking is not difficult since The Grove has sizable parking structure and Cheesecake Factory validates for 2 hours.  Not bad.  <br><br>I was pretty happy to see their &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu has gotten bigger.  If you haven&#39;t noticed, almost everything on their regular menu is over 1K calories, including salads.  The dish I ordered, Lemon garlic shrimp with angel hair pasta was under 570 calories.  Not little, but it made me feel less guilty.  <br><br>Our server was very friendly and efficient.
Doesn&#39;t take reservations, fix your website and help your people with better information.

On all visits to this location, we have had incredibly kind and extroverted staff that are superbly attentive and ready to make your meal a good experience. The food of course is excellent and wide spread. Recommending this place highly for any dinner occasion if you have a little extra to spend on it, and maybe have no idea what you want to eat until you read it on a menu. This clears that right up in the best way.

We had interactions with five people. Only Demetrie was nice and efficient. Everyone else acted as if we were bothering them. This includes the host that gave me a one word answer, the lady at the bakery who could not figure out what to do, the person who seated us, and the lady who rang our bill up. In fact she gave us so much attitude. I have no idea why only Demetrie was kind and considerate. We will not be returning even though Demetrie was outstanding and the food was good. I don&#39;t know what made the last lady give us so much attitude. Whatever the reason, it ruined our experience because it was the last exchange we had.

The server Demitri was amazing! He was so friendly and on point with the service! I&#39;ve been coming to the Cheesecake Factory since I was a little girl but he made me write my first review! Promote him to something higher than a server! He deserves it!

J our server was phenomenal!! Our choice for breakfast meats didn&#39;t exist One would think in a restaurant of this caliber and location, that something other than ham or pork sausage would be available. Nope. Nothing. Come on Cheesecake Factory!! Get with the program. You do it on other items. Help us eat breakfast better. Thanks!!

Came here in the middle of a touristy tour of LA as we visited the grove. We could&#39;ve chosen anywhere to go because of the huge farmers market but I had a serious craving for cheesecake so this is where we went..<br><br>Place was absolutely packed but we managed to get seats for three at the bar. I chose the oreo cheesecake and a coffee. <br><br>I love Cheesecake Factory. I wish they&#39;d come to Dublin!!

Food was delicious, music and atmosphere was nice, not to bad prices, but Brianna is the reason I will be coming back! Best manners and quickest service! I didn&#39;t have to ask for a single thing! She&#39;s the best the food is awsome, this restaurant is doing good!

I love this place. It&#39;s really hard to get seated as they are always crowded so we normally sit at the bar to eat but that&#39;s fine with me. <br><br>The menu is Cheesecake Factory standard I guess so there is a lot to choose from and we&#39;ve always had great bartenders. <br><br>The crowd is mixed so you might have loud kids around and as it is so crowded you will have at least three people run up to you and ask you if the seat next to you was free when one person has to see the restrooms but it&#39;s the grove so you wouldn&#39;t be here if you weren&#39;t willing to put up with masses of partially annoying people.

Sitting here waiting to be seated.  We have 6 people waiting to be seated on a party of 9 according to the person at the door we have to have 6.6 people here to be seated. Unbelievable. According to him it corporate policy. I feel customer service should be priority.

I&#39;m from out east, I wanted to treat myself and a friend to &#39;guaranteed&#39; great food, and this used to be one of my top 5 fave chain restaurants of all time, so I will be as nice as I can w/this review:<br><br>Got seats fast, within 25 mins-- sat in outside area that barely had other people<br><br>And now that I&#39;ve stated the ONLY pros, I wish to get started with the cons:<br>But, let&#39;s make it interesting and use a point system!<br><br>-the virgin sweet cocktails were COMPLETELY FLAVORLESS, it tasted like I was drinking a FLAVORLESS rosy pink colored ice slush (-1pt)<br>-replaced it with a straberry lemonade, settling for a tasty alternative....but was again disappointed, with a pink colored watery lemonade....(-1pt)<br>-would have ordered another option, but it seemed that my server was too busy being just too busy to answer our tables needs (-2pt)<br>-finally received my salad after about 20 mins of munching on bread, and to my surprise it arrived extremely soggy without any added dressing (-3)<br>-ordered the herbed salmon with a small request of garlic mash and the server assured me that they can do it<br>However, what I had received was 3 heaping spoons of minced garlic carefully spread atop only a ladle&#39;s worth of mash potatoes....(-10pts)<br><br>Do these chefs @ this location even know how to cook??? I know of no one who can stomach 1 spoon of raw minced garlic and still taste their meal enough to enjoy it....I&#39;m included, since I was unable to stop tasting garlic after downing my previous drink, and trying to nibble on anything else.....<br><br>But hey, this is the nice version.<br><br>And considering the above math, I will never eat @ cheesecake factory in the grove again!
Amazing place. 10/10 would recommend going to this specific Cheesecake Factory. Our waitress was kind.

This is for the Grove location only.<br><br>The good: Pizza and salad were excellent. It was open late. The view from the patio was pretty nice. The price was ok.<br><br>The bad: The staff. The host tries to be cheerful but makes odd jokes about peoples names. The server was cranky and nit picky taking orders. The food runner ignores several calls pretending not to hear them. The bread basket has gotten a lot smaller.<br><br>I think the staff at the new Santa Monica location is a lot nicer.
Went here for dinner.  Ashley W our waitress was fantastic best service I have had in a long time.  Thank you Ashley!

If you&#39;re expecting excellent service and good food in the restaurant, you will get it! <br><br>If you&#39;re expecting that same level of customer service when placing an order to go, you will NOT get it.<br><br>I was placed on hold for over 5 minutes; I hung up and attempted to call FOUR more times- no answer. I understand inside restaurant traffic can build up- but having a to-go customer on hold for that long, and then not having anyone answer the phone FOUR times is just inexcusable. You will lose business that way.
Joined some friends for Happy Hour. It was great. The burger is one of the best deals for HH. Grab some drinks and some apps and enjoy. We will return.

Out of all of these fine establishments this must be the absolute worst one I have been to. Keep in mind that I frequent Cheesecake Factories ever so often. Service was horrendous. Wait time on bread was over 15 minutes and had to constantly ask nicely for it. It took over 45 to receive my food from the restaurant. I sat here on watched a nice couple walk in get seated, order food and eat. I then watched another couple sit down after the table was cleaned and eat. Even after me asking nicely &#34;Where is my food?&#34;, I received a smile and the waiter kept walking. My compatriots&#39; food in the end was cold as if it had been sitting there forever. Emphasis on forever. She then told me I&#39;ll be back with your food. That was another 15 minutes. Keep in mind it wasn&#39;t busy at all as there was only 3 booths filled. I don&#39;t know how people come here it baffles me. Never again. I wish I could subtract money from my order like the funny pictures kids post on social media. Next time when I want a sandwich, I&#39;ll find a nice homeless person and pay them $5 to make it for me. It would probably take less time for them to get a job and find an apartment to rent then make my sandwich than it did for these people to make mine. What a waste of a fine Thursday night with my compatriots.

I went around 4 and had to wait about 10-15 min... Which was great! Our waiter Daniel was absolutely amazing! He was on point and when he went home for the night out new waiter Howard, I believe, was awesome too!! Even the gentlemen who brought our dinner plates out was extremely nice! <br><br>My dinner, the skinnylicious Asian salad, needed more flavor to it. It was very bland and I felt like I was eating air! Lol the wild blueberry white chocolate cheesecake was delicious!!! <br><br>For as big as this restaurant is... Only having 3 stalls for the women&#39;s restroom is ridiculous!!! It&#39;s beyond tiny! I mean small!!!

The Wait Is Long Which Is Expected But The Service Is Not Great, They Take Forever To Bring Drinks &amp; The Food Take 30-45 Min Which Is Ok But Is ALWAYS Wrong..... The Management Is Decent Because They&#39;re So Apologetic! I Just Wish They Cared About Fixing Our Food More Than Apologizing &amp; Explaining Why Things Were So Bad. (We Still Tipped 15%)

The service was amazing and the food was really good!  Most of all I enjoyed my table on the top level looking over the shopping center with beautiful night lights.  Made a quick trip to L.A. and as usual I always enjoy myself at The Grove.

The service here is absolutely dreadful!! Don&#39;t get me wrong the food here is outstanding and very tasty; however, my friend and I waited 1 hour to be seated after being told that it would only be a 25 min wait. Meanwhile they kept sending other people to their tables, people that arrived after us with the same amount of people in their party. The server that we had visited our table 4 times during the entire dinner. The first time to ask us for drinks, then for food, then to bring the food to us, and lastly for the check. Not once did he even fill our glasses with water. When we flagged him down for more water he only filled my friends cup and left mine empty on the table. HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!

UPDATED REVIEW<br>I had not 1 but multiple hairs on my chicken Madeira.  See photo.  Worst dining experience of my life!  The manager did not communicate.  She took off with the plate and just left us here.  What a strange date night.  So gross!  The hair felt thick like body hair.  It was in my teeth!<br><br>Great selection of food.  I ordered pumpkin cheesecake and really liked it but would go back to my fav vanilla bean cheesecake next time.  The grove is beautiful for Christmas.
Great place to eat my family comes here almost ritually and now my girlfriend and I come on random dates. The Grove is another fantastic atmosphere for families and couples.

Every meal on the menu is amazing. The staff is fast and very caring. The food is great there has never been a time they will disappoint you with your order, but if they do they will bring you something new or the same one without doubt!

Have you ever gotten such good service you write the review as you&#39;re walking to your car? That&#39;s me right about now. QUOREE you are literally the best server I have ever had in my life. His service is impeccable. His positive attitude and energy made our night. He was professional yet fun. I will be requesting to sit in his section every time I come here (which is very often). Thank you Quoree! Oh yeah, the food was amazing as usual.

THE GARLIC SHRIMP NOODLES IS DELICIOUS!!!<br>The Take Out portion is very generous.<br><br>Spaghettini, Fresh Asparagus, Shiitake Mushrooms, Oven-Roasted Tomatoes and Parmesan in a Delicious Garlic Sauce. Available with Chicken or Shrimp.

If this review was based on service I would be giving negative stars. I have no clue where they find these waiters but it&#39;s a joke! The waiter had no clue about the drinks or beer when asked said &#34;no idea&#34;. Pretty sure you need to be knowledgeable and trained in your job to best help your customers. Also, when I asked for extra sauce the waiter pointed in my food saying &#34;which sauce?&#34; Basically touching my food and in my personal space. Bit awkward, but that aside I wasn&#39;t too disappointed. The food was actually tolerable for a chain. I expected bland and low quality but I was impressed with my meal and my friends. Had miso glazed salmon with brown rice and veggies. Felt it was a good option and the flavor of the miso was lovely. I ate every bite! Would come back but hope I get a better waiter!

This is my first experience here. Now to start we waited twenty mins while looking around other stores, no big problem. We were seated by a host who had two sky buns and didn&#39;t even say a word, no hi or anything, then a women served us water, we assumed she was our waiter, 35 mins passed and we had not even ordered our food, while other people where getting their orders, or water we were being ignored, my friends asked the waiter that served us water who told the manager, and the manager came to take out order now to make things worse another man came mad becuase he probably got in trouble idk, but I would not recommend this restaurant, as a business major customer satisfaction should be priority, and the Manager taking more order, doesn&#39;t not make things better, anyways I am still waiting for my order lol might just leave because my movie is about to start!!SKIPPP

I actually had a pretty okay experience up until the very end. The servers were on point, but the chicken was a tad underseasoned so it wasn&#39;t bad but wasn&#39;t great either.<br><br>What really did tick me off though is the validation process... or should I say the lack of.<br>Thing is they do offer validation, but the person who was doing it apparently had absolutely no give a damn&#39;s that he couldn&#39;t be bothered to do it properly. What really infuriates me about this entire situation is that this is an effortless and beyond simple task. It&#39;s literally a single swipe motion that takes less than 2 seconds to complete.<br>The more I think about it the more it pisses me off. For someone to have this level of indifference just means they have been doing this type of activity for a while and that management has either yet to catch on or don&#39;t care. Either way, it embarrassing and just shows how much this place cares about its customers once they&#39;ve taken their money.<br>The amount I had to pay for parking isn&#39;t the issue, it was a marginal amount, but what really ticked me off was because this was all caused by someone who literally just have zero damns about doing his job that they couldn&#39;t even be bothered to spare 2 seconds of their time to swipe a parking ticket properly.

I can&#39;t go wrong with this place.  <br><br>Admittedly, their service slows down when the place gets packed, but it&#39;s nothing too problematic.  Their pasta dishes are usually on the dry side...  why they don&#39;t make enough sauce for each dish is beyond my comprehension.  Their portions are pretty big, so I always end up taking leftovers home for a second, even third meal.<br><br>Be forewarned though: the entire place gets REALLY loud!  I usually like sitting out on the patio where everyone else&#39;s conversations don&#39;t bounce off the walls to my table.<br><br>Some decent dishes:<br>- Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes<br>- Spinach and Artichoke Dip: definitely NOT as good as the one at CPK, but still good<br>- Chicken Bellagio: Can be a bit dry, but the arugula makes this dish so yum~  Make sure you ask for extra arugula so that you get the mix of different texture throughout the entire meal<br>- Chicken Madeira: My go-to dish.  You can&#39;t go wrong with this one.  So yummy and moist...  and the asparagus is always steamed just right.<br>- Club Sandwich<br>- Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club<br>- Blackened Chicken Sandwich<br><br>If you have room for dessert afterwards, a slice of cheesecake to share is a must!!!  These are some of my favorite:<br>- Fresh Strawberry<br>- Ultimate Red Velvet<br>- Fresh Banana Cream<br>- Vanilla Bean<br>- Kahlua Cocoa Coffee<br>- Wild Blueberry White Chocolate<br>- Peppermint Bark

Cheesecake is consistent and you can&#39;t go wrong when you are hungry and you can&#39;t figure out what you want to eat.<br><br>With a vast selection of menu items from pasta to meat to salads, they fill every void.<br><br>What I really like about Cheesecake is the &#34;Skinylicious&#34; menu.  It&#39;s lean and clean food and very reasonable pricing.<br><br>A job well done Cheesecake Factory!

This is by far the worst experience i have ever had at any cheese cake resturant due to the rude manager named daniel of which he failed to mention his last name. Its was 10:35pm on a Wednesday August 1sth 2018. Me and a colleague walk into the grove cheese cake factory, and request to be seated in the patio. We put our name downstairs and they told us to proceed upstairs where we will be seated. Once we came up, they told us there is no seat outside. As such, i proceeded outside to check it for myself. There were 5 open tables against the wall. I went back inside and that is when manager ** daniel ** was speaking to my colleague. The first sentence that came out of his mouth was &#34; sir, do you have a problem?&#34; I was in disbelieve by his poor choice of sentence and his demeanor. So i proceeded to ask him if he is really the manger as i could not believe that cheesecake would higher employees with such a poor customer service skills of of which they do not know how to communicate and treat a customer. Furthermore, i was very much bothered by his posture and his aggressive and hostile demeanor. I proceeded to explain to him that i am a  manager at big retail store and if i ever chose my words so poorly and my demanor was so hostile and aggressive, i probably would be without job the next week. He further gave s sarcastic smile and he had nothing to say. Finally, i requested the corporate phone number to file a formal complain in regards to this issue. Once again, he was not apologetic and his posture was as if he owned the business snd our business did not matter. Cheese cake must discipline if not fire  this poor manager name daniel as his poor choice of words and his hostile and aggressive demanor could make a lot of customers uncomfortable. This is not an army but a friendly dining environment of which customers should feel welcomed. Very unhappy with cheese cake to have given an opportunity to manage a lovely and big resturant environment like this to some poor skilled, hostile, and aggressive individual.

IMO this place is so overrated and expensive.  I came here a couple of times but the only thing that actually made me happy was the avocado egg rolls.  Last night, I craved this place for some reason so we went.  <br><br>Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta- gross.  I personally don&#39;t like &#34;asian styled&#34; pasta so the asiany flavor with the spice didn&#39;t hit it for me.  The sauce is just too sweet and non-appetizing for me.  I should&#39;ve gotten the Da Vinci.  <br><br>Fried Shrimp Platter- you can get this at Santa Monica or whatever beach for a cheaper price.  This was like $20 for a couple of shrimps with fries.  <br><br>Salmon Plate w/ mashed potato- This was alright, nothing special about it.<br><br>Alfredo- Too creamy, thick, and overwhelming.  <br><br>Stuffed Mushrooms-  They give like 4 mushrooms for $6 lol.... LOL AHAH <br>HAHA<br><br>HAHA HAAHAHAHAH when the bill came out my card and I probably cried a few tears.  RIP.

Great location and service! Everytime we are at The Grove we eat here, top floor seating! You can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. We always seem to get the same dish... Miso Salmon and start with Crab Wontons and fresh tropical Iced Tea. Thank you to our beautiful and attentive server, Rebecca R! <br><br>Tip: Take advantage coming during lunch hours for the Lunch Specials (dinner sizes at lunch prices!).<br><br>Happy Eating!
