Now I was going to give this place the benefit of the doubt, but seeing other reviews changed my mind. I love The Cheesecake Factory, this was my first time to this location and I was disappointed. With the two check in stations seems to cause a lot of organization issues. We received a buzzer and was told it would be a 30 minute wait. After 20 minutes it went off and there seemed to be 5 other groups waiting to be seated. We waited another 10 minutes to be brought to a table, with no napkins or silverware. The food was decent, and the waiter was friendly, as usual. The bathroom looked like it hadn&#39;t been cleaned all day. I probably wouldn&#39;t return to this location.<br><br>Glad to see you guys replied. I do love the Cheesecake Factory, this was my only visit that wasn&#39;t great! I hope you guys can improve this location.

We just had the worst service ever by what the manager called one of his best servers. She literally  took order and never came back until our drinks were empty, food was gone, and actually said are you still waiting on your food?  We had asked for more bread about 15 minutes prior and no one delivered.  I&#39;m extremely embarrassed that I brought my out of state guest to visit this place and extremely dissatisfied with the service.  The other unfortunate part of this is all the manager had to say was he apologized and to please find a manager next time we visit. REALLY!?!?! Why to remind them about their terrible service?!?! I would like to give it no stars if I had the option!!!

Love the food. Servers are always really nice, accommodating and knowledgeable.<br>But why do I need to put myself on the list and come back 30 minutes later to get a buzzer, then wait 45 more minutes and then go up and wait 10 more minutes to be seated.  And why is it so dark inside? and why is the table for 2 are so tiny that you can&#39;t have more than 2 plates on them at the same time plus you feel part of the conversation of the tables on your sides because it is so crowded. <br>But the most annoying thing is that if you want to have a dinner and movie night you can&#39;t trust this spot to work with your movie time.  They don&#39;t take reservation and they are always full. <br><br>And yet, still one of my favorite places in Los Angeles.

This isn&#39;t my first time coming to cheesecake, I stop by all the time. And I know that this is a prime location because it&#39;s at the Grove. And I also realize that when you come with a large party, you&#39;ll have quite a wait. We were a party of 8 and arrived right after lunch time, so I knew we would have to wait. We were told the wait was going to be around 30 mins, we received the buzzer at 1:34 pm. The 30 mins passed, then 40, then 50 and at that point we decided to get a status update. Again, I realize that we were a large party during rush hour, but it doesn&#39;t hurt to get an update, right? So, one of the guys in the front (the very pleasant one) told a member in my party we were next to get buzzed. I don&#39;t think they realized I was also part of that same group bc I was standing next to the two greeters, while the rest of my party was on the other side. So I was literally over hearing what they were telling other parties about the wait, the order on the list, etc. Another large party came in to check on their status (and yes they arrived after us) and the same pleasant greeter told them they were third on the list. Then before I knew it, they were telling this party to go upstairs because their table was ready. At that point I told them, wait a sec, I just heard you tell them they were third while my party was supposedly next. The other greeter, answered me very rudely and said &#34;Well, they&#39;re a group of 7 and you&#39;re 8&#34; in which I replied, I understand but why did you tell us we were next&#34; but I walked away to tell the rest of my party what happened. At this point it had been over an hour, we eventually spoke to the manager who was of no help. While we were still waiting for a table upstairs, the same rude greeter came upstairs passed by us, and made a rude gesture towards a member of our party. At which point, we couldn&#39;t believe what happened and we were infuriated. Again, manager did nothing but told us they were trying to get a table for us, and they&#39;d be giving us comp appetizers! <br><br>Well, we got our buzzer at 1:34 pm and we didn&#39;t get seated until 2:57 pm. And no, we did not decide on appetizers. I&#39;m giving two stars because our waiter, Paul, was nice and very pleasant.<br><br>I just could not believe the service we received that day. I&#39;ve been coming to this location for years, I&#39;m pretty sure much longer than the rude greeter. And was just in shock that he had that attitude and had the audacity to make such a gesture. <br><br>Again, I understand we were a big group and we were in for a wait. But don&#39;t tell us one thing, when you mean another. Even still, by the time we were seated it was well over 30 mins. Well, it&#39;s now 3:40pm and just received our food.
So disappointed,,, I ordered Bang Bang chicken &amp; shrimp,,, but I got something different or somebody&#39;s leftovers? If you ordered togo, plz check before you leave to make sure... :/

I love the Cheesecake Factory. I have been to America a number of times now and I always make sure that the Cheesecake Factory is on my list of places to go. <br><br>We went to the Cheesecake Factory in a large family group. It was the last night of our holidays and probably the worst night of our holidays. We waited around an hour (which we expected) to be seated. When our server, April, arrived we were lucky to get a smile out of her. We placed our drink orders and I ordered an alcoholic drink - you know being 30 and all. I got asked for ID, which is fine. I provided the server with my Australian drivers licence. She glanced at my licence asked if I had my passport on me, which I told her no. (As a traveller I never carry my passport on my person in case I lose it or something happens). She then told me she can&#39;t serve me any alcohol (I don&#39;t even think she looked at the ID properly). We tried to explain that our group had been served at the bar before being seated with the same ID&#39;s but she still wouldn&#39;t serve us. That was that. <br><br>We had also tried to order drinks at the bar after she had declined us service (as we had ordered there prior to being seated) but the server had told the bar staff to refuse us service. <br><br>The server came back shortly after and said she feels like she didn&#39;t explain herself properly before. She then gave a spiel about how it&#39;s company policy and she could lose her job (understandable) and that how every so often the staff of Cheesecake Factory come in and do training on international ID&#39;s/licenses (which I call bulls**t as she wouldn&#39;t serve us on a valid Australian Drivers Licence). Also, we have been to other Cheesecake Factory restaurants and we were served on the exact same ID&#39;s. <br><br>Now I understand that there is company policy and procedures and there are laws that need to be followed (being in law enforcement myself) but I feel that the way this was handled was very poor. Our group was extremely dissatisfied with the service provided at this particular store. Furthermore, some of the meals were poor quality. <br><br>Our group was not happy with the experience at the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove. The server (April) provided poor service from the moment she said hello to the end of our dinner.

Came for lunch today and wanted to sit on the balcony since its a nice day. We were told ther were no tables available so we were seated inside. As i was walking to the restroom i noticed a few empty tables. So i asked the hostess and she said ohh we don&#39;t have waiters for thoes tables. When i told my party i was asked what does that mean?  Lets just say we walked out never again.  To bad this app don&#39;t have negative stars
I didn&#39;t like this place. Gave me americano burger when I ordered macaroni burger. Bronze trash.

First time going to this one. Wait time was over an hour and waiting area was tight so we had to wait outside in the summer heat, luckily it was towards the evening. When upstairs and waited some more. Lots of chatter between co-workers. They looked understaffed maybe and overwhelmed. Food was tasty. Noise level was loud. The place was crowded. I would go back there. It&#39;s great for small and large crowds.

I&#39;m not fan of Cheesecake Factory.....but I have to say this was the first time I actually enjoyed eating here.  <br><br>I had the lunch Garlic Noodles with Shrimp, it was little too salty..but over all it was tasty.  I really enjoyed it.  The girls and I shared the buffalo wings and the shrimp dynamite.  They both were super delicious!  I had the Peach Mimosa, perfectly done.  <br><br>I would definitely come back here. =D

As I said on the phone -- while [that] one experience wasn&#39;t great... the whole thing that made it stand out is how freaking fantastic you guys typically are. <br><br>If ever there were a company to model by others who sought success, it&#39;s the operations, consistency and ethos of The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Thank you for taking the time to read my review -- and though the single experience truly was 2-stars... the comprehensive, lifetime review I have of your business is nothing short of 5.

Yay! I&#39;m a fan...Yes, I really am.<br><br>I was pleasantly surprised with my first try at The Cheesecake Factory. It turned out to be a perfect Sunday night dinner with friends. Even though service is on the slow side, the very cordial server and the delicious mouth watering menu made it worth while.<br><br>As the name implies, The Cheesecake Factory specializes on &#34;cheesecake&#34;, however with the wonderful selections on their menu, the Salad, Pasta&#39;s &amp; Farfalle are just too  hard to resist! <br><br>The Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic I ordered was terrific! Blanketed with a rich and creamy Parmesan cream sauce, this dish just screams &#34;eat me!&#34;<br><br>I also tried the Chinese Chicken Salad that my sister ordered...what an amazing way to start a meal! Sliced grilled chicken breast, rice noodles, mandarin orange and other delightful goodies consist this refreshing starter!<br><br>Our table have become a smorgasbord of generous servings of aromatic and mouth watering pasta dishes! With marinara or white sauce, they all looked amazing and tasted fantastic!<br><br>I have to say, The Cheesecake Factory impressed me, Often I just zoomed and scrolled past TCF when looking for dinner place suggestions, with the fantastic service and generous delicious food serving that we got, I highly recommend giving The Cheesecake Factory a try - it would probably change the way you look at a Cheesecake House.<br><br>Chin chin!

Horrible service every time I have eaten here. Never expect to receive bread if you call in your order for pick up! They offer it, you ask for it, they assure you it&#39;s in the bag, however it NEVER is! Always check to make sure they have your order correct when picking up your food. They always seem stingy when it comes to their bread and to go orders.
If you want to eat and still be hungry go to the cheesecake factory, had dinner two times an didn&#39;t have enough food, and prices are high for the small amount they serve you

First time I&#39;ve been to this location, and it was an amazing experience. First of all, there was a ridiculously long wait (more than a 2 hour wait) for a table, so I decided to just ask them if me and my friend can order takeout instead. Even thought they were jam packed, they were kind enough to let us in and order upstairs. When we got there, the display of cheesecakes was unimaginable. It was like walking into a bakery filled with your favorite cakes (mine being cheesecake). We were going to order, but we decided to try to ask if there were any bar seatings open. To our surprise, they told us that it was open seating and we were free to grab any open seat. We were shocked when we walked over and found two open seats!!! It was too great, bypassing maybe about 30 parties and getting to sit down at the bar and order. The ambiance is absolutely terrific. Though slightly dark, it highlights the collection of liquor at the bar, along with the Christmas lighting outside on the main street (if you come during the holiday season).<br><br>If you want to save room for dessert, I would recommend just ordering appetizers, which in my opinion, are better than their main courses. I got the loaded baked tater tots and buffalo chicken wings. The chicken wings were average, wasn&#39;t bad, but didn&#39;t stand out. However, their loaded baked tater tots were out of this world. Perfectly fried tater tots with cheese, bacon, and green onions, with sour cream to dip on the side. Oh man it couldn&#39;t have been anymore perfect. Once you bite past the perfectly fried outer layer, the inside just melts in your mouth and you taste a creamy combination of cheese, potato, bacon, and green onions. And this appetizer is only $6 for about 10 of them. Definitely worth getting it. <br><br>As for the desert, I tried the tuxedo cheesecake, recommended to me by my friend. And boy it did not disappoint. If you love chocolate, or anything sweet, get ready to taste chocolate on top of cheesecake on top of chocolate on top of more chocolate. Comprised of their fudge cake, chocolate cheesecake, mousse, and more chocolate, this cheesecake makes you feel like your mouth is swimming in chocolate (along with the two giant creamy, delicious mounds of whipped cream they top it with). <br><br>This experience here couldn&#39;t have been any better. To those with a party of 2 or 3, try the bar if the restaurant is too crowded. If not, it&#39;s still definitely worth the experience, especially if you can get a seat outside on their beautiful balcony overlooking the Grove&#39;s heavily decorated and beautiful main street.

i have been there many times.  Food and service usually is very good, but tonight after waiting more than thirty minutes for our food the manager came and apologized for the delay and told us that the kitchen burned my chicken picatta and that they are making it again.  When the food finally arrived I realized the chicken was undercooked.  I showed the manager and decided not to wait for another replacement!  I was offerred free dessert and we ordered two desserts we were charged for one of them!

One of my all time favorites, they have worlds most extensive menu and something for everyone. I was never so impressed when a friend of mine who had dietary needs expressed his concern for certain diet needs and one of the chefs literally came out, talked to my friend one on one and created a meal just for him! Their team goes above and beyond with a positive attitude and for the most part all employees make very good eye contact and listen. Ten Thumbs up!

This is a great spot for happy hour. The bar seating is first come, first serve. I ordered a Mint Mojito and Long Island Iced Tea ($6 each), which were both very refreshing and delicious. To share amongst me and my two friends, we ordered the Lobster and Artichoke Dip ($6). This was really good and you can taste the chunks and flavors of the lobster. I looked over at another table&#39;s plate of nachos, which looks huge too! It is definitely comparable to Yardhouse&#39;s nachos, so that&#39;s definitely something I&#39;ll order next time.

I was disappointed 2 times at this location. The waiters are not very nice and are rude. Besides,the food arrives always lukewarm and I hate this.The waiters don&#39;t even checked me if everything was good or not,he did like it was a fast food place. This location is to avoid.

I wish I could give this place zero stars. DO NOT GO HERE! HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! This was a place I was hoping to show my cousins for the first time who are visiting from Kansas. We were told Saturdays are the busy days not Fridays. Sadly we waited an hour and a half for the food let alone when receiving the food it was cold. We ordered two kids meals and realized after a couple of bites that the pasta wasn&#39;t fully cooked, cold and was bland. Sadly my cousin and sister were no longer hungry and was grossed out, they just wanted to leave. We called multiple servers to help us since our own server checked on us once during the entire meal. We ended up waiting another 30 minutes just for a manager to show up after we got two people to get a manager. We were able to finally get the manager after my boyfriend got up from the table and went and found her himself. God bless him he had the patience to explain to her calmly what happened as they were walking to the table and she approached us being very rude and claimed that it was our faults, that we were children. This was highly disrespectful, as a restaurant they should have customer service as their top priority.  I have been to several locations for Cheesecake Factory and even when it has been busy I have been treated with respect and correctly. I thought to give the one at the Grove a try, but oh I was wrong you would think that it is LA we would get the best service. I&#39;m very disappointed.

The Cheesecake Factory, Lincolnshire, Illinois<br><br>Ordered the burrito which years ago was very good. Yesterday it was filled with rice, a few morsels of chicken, skimpy on the cheese and a few peppers. Overpriced for a plate of rice in essence.

The wait wasn&#39;t long probably because we went on a Wednesday night around 7pm. We didn&#39;t wait longer than 15 minutes. I ordered the chicken enchiladas, they weren&#39;t great, they could&#39;ve been better. My boyfriend wasn&#39;t too thrilled about the shrimp scampi, the strawberry lemonade was wayyyyy to sweet. But the ambiance is welcoming.

For my first time at any Cheesecake Factory and on valentines day ,what was expected to be a long wait turned out to be fast quick and easy. I absolutely loved it . The ambiance the setting perfect for a valentine dinner if you ask me. Great customer service everything was great except I must have ordered the wrong dish which wasn&#39;t so appetizing to my particular taste. However I did see other options on the menu that I might have enjoyed a little more and will definitely be returning to try something different. Plenty things to do afterwards, several stores . Very touristy everything about the Grove is lovely. Parking is validated for an hour or so I believe. Great place to visit. Highly recommend it.

My favorite chain restaurant and one of my favorite restaurants.  I always sit at a high top or at the bar to avoid having to wait in a long line.  The menu is huge so there is something for everyone, and honestly everything is delicious.  You&#39;ll never leave here hungry and usually have leftovers on top of that.  The bread is enough to fill you up alone as it is so good.  Some of my favorite dishes include the Pasta with Meat Sauce and Chicken Bellagio.

My favorite restaurant. You guys were a relief from the terrible service I received at the Santa Monica location. The server was awesome, and the food was too, besides Our avocado toast being overly toasted. If  any issues, it had to be the cold air conditioning inside, it was too too cold. I must have been under the vent or something, because even the food got cold quickly
They are not very welcoming. The worst is that everything you touch is greasy ! The menu and the silverware were greasy and I brought my kids to wash their hands immediately. I&#39;ll never go back.
Tend to order takeout. I ordered over the phone and pickup. Took my dog in and no drama. It&#39;s appreciated!!!

I&#39;m disappointed to find out they sale fake glued steak because most of their food is good but I can&#39;t respect a well known restaurant to dip that low when they are tricking customers to pay for premium prices for scraps of meat. If you are not aware of this then I would do some research on it. This is bs The Cheesecake Faketory.

Very slow service. Below average food. Will never go back. <br>The waiter took a long time to show up then went away for a long time before coming back to take our order and left without telling us who our waiter is. I realize that I probably won&#39;t have to deal with the same person again but considering  the food quality, price and the wait I will never go back.

went to the Cheesecake Factory. Lovely spot. Great bread, nice big glasses of water and solid cheesecake. Validating my parking (or SO THE WAITER SAID HE DID) and it was still $8!!!! What a damper on a lovely evening????? But great bread and cheesecake per usual. Could have used more water refills but maybe our waiter was concerned re the drought.

So me and my best friend come down to have a favorite meal at one of my favorite places. We wait 35 min.. No problem however couple big guys get sat at this tiny table felt like for kids and the two young girls behind us got sat at a full booth. So needless to say I asked for a booth because we are about to order lots of things that can&#39;t fit on one little kid table. So they move us to this small secluded booth that has a table that same size and over the theater entrance.. Not a happy guy.. Kinda ruined my afternoon. Nevertheless we are eating at LaPizza

(My son&#39;s review) A foodie&#39;s must. From oreo cookie shakes to chicken alfredo, this place is great. The staff is friendly, too. For example, they give you a free birthday goodie (i.e. a cheesecake!)

Beautiful Décor, Lengthy Menu, Great Food &amp; Amazing Dessert. But what truly set it off as a 5-star PERFECT Review for our &#39;party of 9&#39; table of ravenous girls..... was our fantastic server &#34;Big Mike.&#34; He did all that he could do to make it a memorable night for us girls! From finding us a table for 9 (without the hour wait), to keeping us off his back by quickly responding with our drink order, to making sure there was bread &amp; butter (and plenty of it), Mike did it all. Thank you Mike from your newest admirers! (I hope the management knows what a winner they have in you!!) <br>PS - the Chicken Madeira is &#39;da Bomb!! Be sure to order it!!

Man I man, now I see what the bad reviews are about. I love Cheesecake Factory, but this grove location has the worst service AND clearly can&#39;t manage heavy crowds. I&#39;m going to give them a pass and say, the bad service has a lot to do with the fact that This place gets extremely crowded. (Hire more staff!!!!) I arrived with my 3 amigas celebrating a late birthday excited to eat some of my favorite bread and that&#39;s where it went downhill . Long story short, food came out luke warm, at different times and orders were wrong, after talking to the manager we got complimentary cheesecake, but guess what... YES that order was wrong too! The waitress apparently didn&#39;t hear what I said and sent over the wrong one smh... she was trying hard to hold back an attitude and at that point, I said it&#39;s fine and we just left. Great birthday dinner! Thanks Cheesecake Factory! Smh (moral of the story, don&#39;t celebrate anything nice here if it&#39;s too busy, you&#39;re service will be trash).

This is one of the worst cheesecake factories I&#39;ve ever been to point The food is average for a cheesecake factory. The service is what really bugs me. I&#39;ve been here all four times. Hated my service every single time. I keep giving it a second chance, Because it&#39;s very convenient I live very close to this location but I will no longer be giving it chances because every single time I have never gotten my food and under 40 minutes of waiting and I only get burgers or pasta which most restaurants can&#39;t do it way faster than this the longest I&#39;ve waited was an hour and 30 that is crazy for a burger so I talk to the manager and it took 15 minutes for the manager to come when he came out he was nice I will not lie about that but my server had no personality and everything I told him seemed like it was a huge chore for him and he gave me an attitude would not recommend this location
Went in for an evening meal around 6pm, no reservation, got seated quickly... But then waited 25 mins for no one to acknowledge us, not even to take a drink order! Not a great first experience!

My very first experience here started off rough with the hour long wait, but once we sat down it was wonderful. The service was amazing and had a couple people serving us. The food was absolutely amazing and big portions.

Love the Cheesecake Factory. Always something for everyone, even my 88 yr old dad who only likes Chinese food!  My current fav dish is the eggplant Parmesan. The Chinese chicken salad always good.  Great service, great food. This location, all the staff are nice and welcoming. Thank you CF

TERRIBLE service!!!!! Walked up, was told to wait until they cleaned the table. As we were waiting, two girls walked up and were seated inside. I watched them look outside and decide on their own to walk out to the table we were waiting for. I told the manager CYNDI and she basically said &#34;oh well, we are not gonna ask them to move. &#34; I had to wait for another 20 minutes with two kids!!! Shame on her. I bet you if it was reversed, based on the color of our skin, she would have asked us to move.
I love this restaurant! Excellent Service, Great Food, Nice and Clean Restaurant. My Favorite food Chicken Zucro Pasta with green sauce. Ihighly recommend it.

I been to many factory in the past an by far the worst one the only good thing was the cold beer . The food was garbage I ordered lasagna it was more like cardboard with melted cheese an chicken that was dryer than the desert smh this location needs to step it up especially being at the grove never again going there

The Cheesecake Factory is right down the road from me so I find myself frequently coming here for occasions I deem to be &#34;special&#34; or if I feel like eating a whole heap of calories, mmm delicious calories!<br>The restaurant is extremely impressive, two storeys high with gorgeous cathedral ceilings in the marbled lobby and the option of stairs, elevator or escalator to get from the waiting/hostess area to the restaurant level. <br><br>The Grove is a busy place, especially on a weekend so if you are looking to come here for lunch you&#39;ll need to be prepared to wait for a table, anywhere from fifteen minutes to an hour depending on the time of day you turn up- they do not take reservations. I&#39;ve never had a problem with the wait time although on one occasion I visited they managed to lose our reservation during the minute it took for myself and friend to ascend the stairs, it wasn&#39;t a busy evening though so it wasn&#39;t a problem.<br><br>The service can vary, depending on time of day although the wait staff are generally very friendly and helpful. Because this place is so busy their attentiveness can be hit and miss which can be irritating if you&#39;re extremely hungry. If you aren&#39;t sure what to order you can always rely on your server to give you a great recommendation! <br><br>Speaking of food... HOLY MENU! It is crazy how many items are on offer. Everything is delicious but I highly recommend the following:<br><br>Ahi Tuna Carpaccio (very healthy for all you gym nuts like myself)<br><br>Asian Lettuce Cups (Though the lettuce is kind of hard to wrap the contents in because of the leaf shape of the type they use)<br><br>Hangar Steak (Medium Rare for best outcome)<br><br>I also love their Glam Burgers and Sweet Potato Fries. You definitely need to hook yourself up with a Cheesecake before you leave, the Oreo Dream and Godiva are to die for but also very, very rich.<br><br>The best place to sit is either out on the balcony or (if you like the dark) inside in one of the booths.

They automatically give you drinking straws with every drink, even water. Considering some countries are banning plastic straws, this is incredibly insensitive to the environment. Please Cheesecake Factory, wait for customers to ask for s straw, don&#39;t automatically put in every drink! Otherwise food is good and service is great.

We went around 8:30pm on a Wed night. I read one of the reviews with a reply from the management that advised us to come after 9pm to avoid crowding. We were promptly sat in 20mins after the front told us there was a 25min wait. We had this carpaccio(?) appetizer that was really good. My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon and I had the Louisiana pasta. I had the pasta before at Santa Clara and really liked it but it wasn&#39;t as good here. It was kind of lacking but I still enjoyed it very much! My bf&#39;s mignon was supposed to be medium but it was a bit dry and well done unfortunately. Still, the meat was good quality and the mashed potatoes was really good! The servers were nice and attentive. I love this location! We were seated outside and had a nice view of the Apple store lols. It was nice.

Came here for lunch with a party of 8 on Saturday around 1:45. Decided to eat here since everywhere else was packed. The wait for a table was 1.5 hours (!!!) but we luckily found two bar tables and pushed them together.<br><br>We ordered from the Skinnylicious menu (low cal) and as always, it did not disappoint even for a vegetarian! We had a chicken pasta dish but subbed the chicken for mushrooms. The dish was so flavorful that I didn&#39;t even add hot sauce!! We also had the Asian lettuce wraps, which I love, and the margarita flatbread. <br><br>Service was great! Christian was our waiter! He&#39;s good at what he does.

Cheesecake Factory is a pretty safe choice for food. I almost always get their carbonara pasta, it&#39;s my guilty pleasure =). It&#39;s the fattiest, greasiest bowl of pasta ever but it&#39;s SO good. I like this location more than others because they take down your phone number and will text you when your table is ready, so you can wander the rest of the Grove instead of just standing around waiting. Also, they have a wonderful view on the balcony, great for people watching and if there is any kind of event going on. We also got the avocado, zucchini, and portobello mushroom fries as an appetizer the last time we went, and it&#39;s an awesome starter! I love portobello fries, and the batter they use here is great! I&#39;ve never had avocado fries until then and I think it may top portobello fries for me! So creamy on the inside and crunchy on the outside! Love!<br><br>The staff here are really nice and the service is pretty quick. Great food choice when you have a large party and when you want to maximize your shopping time at the Grove!

Let&#39;s start with why I gave it one star (other than the fact that you can&#39;t give negative stars) this Cheesecake Factory is in a cool location and like all other ones it has great food. We visited here today for my daughter&#39;s 15th birthday our waiter was awful not just bad like we almost walked out and said forget it awful! Everything we asked him for like a refill or the bill he rolled his eyes huffed and said &#34;yeah&#34; I am appalled that the management staff would allow someone to represent their company in that way. Our food did take longer than usual which wouldn&#39;t have been a problem if the service wasn&#39;t so bad! I did ask the front desk person for parking validation they brought me back a un-validated ticket so we had to pay for parking anyway. With all the other food options at the grove I would avoid this one as much as possible!

Food is great except the wait time. It is rediculouse to wait 1 to 2 hours! And when you finally walk in you see some empty tables!!! And eating inside is horrible because it&#39;s too loud. Other than that I like this restaurant.

This is probably the worst cheesecake location ever ! We ordered a pizza to go since the line was so long -- and I have never seen a pizza so dried up and small in my life !! It was really a waste of money and I will never visit this location again !! <br>P.s. I am only talking about this location cause I had great experiences on other cheesecake factories !!
I love this place.   Normally I order the salmon and it is terrific.   The staff is super friendly and the food is great.  Best place to eat at the Grove !

Walked over to the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove for the happy hour from 4-6pm... They have a special menu with drinks and full sized appetizers for $5.50. It&#39;s only in the bar area so it can get crowded, we were able to get two tall boy tables in the bar area and we had 9 people in our group. Our waiter (sorry can&#39;t remember his name) was wonderful! Very accommodating and helpful. We probably ordered 1-2 of everything on the happy hour menu, I had a few Long Island iced teas, which were not in the least bit strong, but that&#39;s expected for $5.50. We had unlimited bread and butter and the place can get a little loud, but overall, I would go back because it was a fun get together for us. My daughter was also able to meet Zendaya and she was really sweet and took time to take pictures with a couple of the little girls who saw her.

This is crazy!! I always go to the cheesecake factory in Ontario ca. But this place in the Grove in LA was something else. It took forever to get my water my mac n cheese appetizer was cold. Waited forever for my food and my plate had lipstick. The manager was ok and took care of us... but needless to say I was frustrated and left.
We always go here with my family on the weekends. Menu is very much traditional and huge. You can split one between two and still will be left overs. I usually take a pasta carbonara.

I have been coming to Cheesecake Factory since I was a little kid. I definitely liked the restaurant and I still do. However I feel like the quality of the cheesecake factories have gone down. There are still certain entrees I remember just as I was a kid. However, a few I can definitely taste the lack of quality. For the period of wait I had to wait on a week day, which was over 45 mins, is definitely not worth it.

Good old Cheesecake Factory-- a huge menu, with calories listed so you can feel motivated to go to that spin class the next day. The menu now has seasonal and vegetarian/gluten free options clearly market. The calorie count, while a buzzkill can make decision making a bit easier. They make a great dirty martini and their drink menus are actually very reasonably priced versus going to a local bar. They have an extensive list of sharing plates-- the flat-breads are awesome, chicken samosas have a good flavor. You have to order a slice of cheesecake to share at the end of your meal. The Godiva chocolate and fruit flavors are my favorite! Minus one star because the hostesses always seem to get some joy about saying how long the wait will be... maybe they have been beaten down by too many irritable customers. Even at 9pm there will be an hour wait. Snag a seat at the bar if you can, they are first come first serve.

Completely unhappy from beginning to end! I&#39;ve been to so many Cheesecake Factory restaurants.. Santa Monica, Sherman Oaks, Beverly Hills, Glendale .. etc. And honestly I&#39;ve never had bad service like this one. <br><br>First when we entered we were not greeted nicely, the 2 people up front were not friendly at all and not presentable either. We were &#34;greeted&#34; by a girl named Michelle, tattoos all over her, I mean nothing against that if you have a nice friendly attitude to balance it out but when you&#39;re mean looking and you&#39;re actually mean .. that art work does not help you at all. She asked how many people, i immediately felt a little rushed and just intimidated by her tone so I quickly responded with 2 she answered back with &#34;its going to be 15 min&#34; .. then I quickly said I&#39;m sorry I meant to say 2 adults and a baby, she rolled her eyes and said &#34;THATS 3 people it&#39;s going to be 20 minutes&#34; I said ok that&#39;s fine, is it faster if we seat out door, she responds with &#34;thats an additional 15&#34; all with an attitude and a rude tone. Whatever .. we decided to stay and wait Bc it wasn&#39;t busy and wait wasn&#39;t long, any other day I would&#39;ve probably not tolerated that kind of attitude specially as a good customer who goes to cheesecake on a weekly basis literally. So we get called to get seated, we get an outside table????? But did she not say it was going to be an additional 15? Okay well, we get seated around 5pm, ordered our drinks and food, didn&#39;t get our appetizer til almost 45 min later, our main entree we did not get until an hour later ??? Looking around and ppl who were seated after us received their food before us ? To top it off My food wasn&#39;t great at all, I get the same thing every time, the chicken pieces were super small, the sauce was watery with no flavor and my food was warm almost cold. Then right after the waitress serves our food, not even taking the first bite, she brings out the check???? Really guys? Idk but I&#39;m so disappointed. Not happy. Not satisfied. And it&#39;s too bad Bc i was starving, hadn&#39;t had lunch and I was really looking forward to a great meal at my fav place. Don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be coming back to this location anytime soon.

Came in with 8 people, was promised an hour and when I called back in half hour to add one more person, they handled it like the pros they are! We were seated in less than the time the told us. They noticed the number of children with us and our server took good care of them by taking their order first and making sure they were situated. <br><br>The food is always a 5-star because you can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake! The service was great. With three large parties located immediately next to our tables, the servers didn&#39;t miss a beat. it&#39;s the kind of service that corporate offices would dream of. I was very impressed.<br><br>Cost was very good for the quality and service. For 9 people to have lunch and drinks, it came out to $175 including the added gratuity for the large group. I was very satisfied. I only wish that they would open up in Santa Clarita so we don&#39;t have to drive all the way down!
Regret getting the jambalaya - all because I was too lazy lol. Chain restaurant, what did I expect? ‍

I have been to this Cheesecake Factory around 4 times and out of those times, I have received terrible customer service on 3 occasions. Twice I spoke to a Manager about it but this last time, I decided that I was done. I have worked at Cheesecake Factory when I was in graduate school and know for a fact the training they used to give their employees. Not sure if they do or if this location just had really bad management. I expected that their service would improve after the first two times, but alas, they are still lacking big time. I have experienced everything from servers having attitude, to not bringing out the appetizers and mains separately, to bringing out the wrong orders and I am done. The only reason I give them 2 stars is because the chefs actually do a good job with the food itself.
Food is okay depending on what you order. Food would be better if they would include all ingredients listed from the menu. However  Great happy hour!!!
Food was great need  should taken more pictures but look at the milk shake wow try it

It&#39;s a good place, it&#39;s nice how they have outside seating as well do you can enjoy the day and not be in a dim lit room. The food is good, I get the chipotle pasta (what I always get regardless of which location I&#39;m at). It&#39;s just as I remembered back home. The service here is good, but it did take a long time for the waitress/waiter to get to us. However, when they did, they are great as ever.

Cheesecake Factory at the Grove is the worst on Friday night. Worst hostess today (ie Friday nite at 7.33pm). Got turned away because I was 1 minute pass the wait time. So much for letting my 5 year old to drop by the bathroom on the way. Waited 50minutes just to be turned away. Thanks hostess for making the wait worthwhile.....

I&#39;ve been there a few times and I&#39;ve always had a good experience. My fam and I never wait long for a table even when they are crazy busy on the weekend. I always have a really good waiter that&#39;s attentive. The food we ordered was pretty good. I got the chicken maderia. For $18 I kinda expected it to look different. I don&#39;t know the look of it wasn&#39;t pleasing. The taste was ok. The mash and asparagus were delicious but something about the mozzarella cooked onto the chicken, wasn&#39;t that great. I also didn&#39;t like the oil that was on my plate. My food was in a little bit of an oil pond. Bedsides that, my experience is always great and so is the food. The cheesecakes are always sugary and delicious

ON 12/27/19 I talked to one of the managers named DANIEL. He did not care about my experience and pretty much told me that it was nothing he was able to do. He was very rude, unprofessional, sarcastic, overall horrible. After he was feeling annoyed by me he offered to send me a gift card. Today 1/09/19, I called to the store and Daniel was the only manager on duty, I told him I had not received the gift card and he did not care. This is jut getting worse and worse.

So disappointed. Cheesecake Factory is not the same as before. I used to love Cheesecake Factory but now I don&#39;t. I went to cheesecake with my bf and his mom. All three of us got pasta. My bf and I ordered the jambalaya and for one of them we asked for EXTRA sauce on the side. I repeated this to our server and he even confirmed it. HOWEVER, when it came out they did not put any sauce on it!!! AND no sauce on the side either...ummm...so you expect me to eat a tasteless jambalaya? I would understand if they at least gave me sauce on the side so I know where the miscommunication was but they put no sauce on the jambalaya AND no sauce on the side, just plain noodles. The jambalaya sauce took a very long time to come out, maybe around 20 minutes. By the time the sauce came out my bf and his mom were done eating. To top that off, my noodles had become cold! Ohmygosh...I&#39;m a pretty understanding and patient person but this is unacceptable! As I was eating my cold jambalaya, my bf and his mom were watching me eating because they were already done...awkward. Even after this HUGE mistake, they did not offer any discounts. I&#39;m not one to ask for discounts but the gesture tells you that they really are apologetic. All we got is a &#39;sorry&#39; and nothing else. I used to work at a restaurant too and if something like this happened, I would go to the manager and explain what happened and see if I can do anything to make it up. Super disappointed! Especially since Cheesecake Factory is a huge chain restaurant. <br>I have more bad experiences at cheesecake but this review is already super long. The only reason I kept giving Cheesecake Factory another chance is because I used to like Cheesecake Factory, but not anymore. Just take my word for it. You&#39;re better off going to another restaurant.
Taylor is lovely. <br><br>Me and my friend lucked out by heading to the bar area when given a quote for an hour wait. <br><br>All her recommendations were perfect.

My server was very nice and obviously this is a pretty location...but my dishes were dirty.<br><br>The initial plate I was given for bread had crumbs and residue on it. I didn&#39;t have to use the plate so it wasn&#39;t an issue. However, my cheesecake was also service on a dirty plate. I touched the sides and it had hard food residue on it. Seems as if the dishwashing machine is not doing its job. I found this extremely unappetizing  and did not finish my cheesecake (it wasn&#39;t that good anyway) =(

First of all. Utensils should be the first thing out on the table...I shouldn&#39;t have to wait 20 minutes for a damn fork...second the food was disgusting...third the service was horrible...I would not come back here at all so over priced for crappy food....and the wait was ridiculous...an hour and 30 mins just so I&#39;d order some nasty pineapple Chicken Shit that I had to send back cause it was just too gross for me to eat...my sister and I regretted coming here instead of wood ranch smh worst decision ever

Wow! I couldn&#39;t believe my eyes! I came in to the restaurant, sat down and heard a dog barking. I looked over and there was a dog in the restaurant climbing on the seats. The lady next to me was talking to the manager about it. The manager said that the dog was a service animal. I&#39;m sorry, when a dog is a service animal they are well trained. This dog was constantly bothering the people next to it and barking. I think of The Cheesecake Factory as a nice restaurant, not a place with dogs all over the place.

I keep ordering the Thai coconut lime chicken and rice and a key lime cheesecake to go. The beets with goat cheese is also my all-time favorite salad. I love the little pears and the chopped nuts with the arugula and the tender red and golden beets.
Always love coming to Cheesecake Factory. The pasta de Vinci was amazing, but as I was finishing my dish I bit into some charcoal bits. Was a sucky ending to a great meal
Great service from Anthony at the dessert bar today. He was very attentive to my needs. An asset to your organization.

I guess this is depending on the location of the restaurant. I was happy with the Irvine location, but the LA  location is terrible.<br>1. Food was average, yet expensive. Many of the stalls at the Farmers market are better; we go here because of the AC and quiet time.<br>2. Wait time is relatively short, a plus on a weekend. We were seated in the back section,looking down the lobby of the theater. The whole place was overtaken by a family .The kids were running around or playing loud video games. It was as if they owned the place.<br>3. Food was served quickly, but tasted more like cardboard.<br>4. When leaving, we asked for our parking ticket to be validated, we were told to do it downstairs. First, someone told us that the machine is broken, but then another staff told us there is no validation on weekend. When asked why I have different answers, the reply was curt, communication issue. Is this a valid excuse for a service company? Keep the waiters and waitresses, they are working hard.

This is far my favorite chessecake factory customer service is awsome fast service great greaters  especially from the sweet hostes Sonia she was the nicest very plesent to speak to  I felt as if she nows me for ever like she is a good friend of mine her costermer service is top of the line I just hope next time I go for lunch again I have her greeting me again

We got a few of their snack and appetiser menu options and boy was it worth it! <br><br>Cheesecakes are a must!! We tried the strawberry original and banana mousse. Nothing to fault at all!<br><br>Waiter was friendly, very busy but still made time for all his tables.

Enjoying a leisure stroll with my fiancé and we decided to stop here for lunch. The customer service was great. All the servers were pleasant and welcoming. They had a Skinnylicious menu which made me happy, watching my weight and all. I ordered the crab bites and the firecracker salmon rolls, delicious! I had the miso salmon with brown rice, it was good also. We didn&#39;t wait long for our food or drinks and the server kept refilling my iced green tea. I would definitely come again. My server was very nice.

I normally love Cheesecake Factory. What I don&#39;t love is waiting literally an hour for our food. We came at 4:15 and got seated within 15 minutes. Cool! We sat with our menus for 20 minutes. Not cool. It took forever to get water. It took forever to get our orders taken. My salad was room temperature. How does this happen???<br><br>So inexcusable.

Not outstanding. The bread was too hard. The place was too noisy. Pasta had a rubbery mouth feel. &#34;Louisiana&#34; Chicken Pasta tasted ordinary. The Oreo &#34;cheesecake&#34; was too sweet and did not taste like a cheesecake. Waiters weren&#39;t very attentive. I will not be coming back and will not be recommending this place.

Extremely bad service!  It was my mom&#39;s memorial and 5 sisters decided to have lunch at one of our&#39;s and her favorite restaurant yesterday at the Grove around 3 PM.  <br>We ordered a big mixed salad to share, but they brought the salad with no plates and no serving utensils.  We had to use our bread plates to eat our salad and our own forks to serve.<br>Then we ordered 3 herb crusted Salmon and 2 steak Diane&#39;s with no onions; one well done and one medium well. <br>First they brought the 3 herb crusted salmon, one of which was not fully cooked (I found out later after we left - if not I would have returned it), which my sister did not eat.   Then there was about 7 minutes gap and they brought the well done steak, and it had the ONIONS ... another 5 minutes goes by, and finally my medium well steak shows up, totally well done!  Eeks ... <br>The meat was not the prime meat that I had the pleasure of experincing in their other locations.  It was fatty, chewy and poorly cut (more like a stew meat than steak meat) and very poor presentation (stew of something) - NOT their usual appetizing and mouth watering display of food.   When I called to express my dissatisfaction, the answer was I am so sorry ... really?  <br>The bigger they become the less quality they offer and they treat the patrons that they don&#39;t know the art of dining and the fact that a family eats together, not one person at a time.<br>Almost similar thing happened last year at the Americana location during dinner hours around X-Mas and I let it go then, but it seems this is becoming a norm for them. <br>So sorry to see such poor management!

Our server came after we waited for 15min, which means we didn&#39;t event get the water for like 15min. We also waited another 20min for food. Our server never came back after serving out food, and we had to waive at someone for a check. Also, there was a chunk of burnt bacon in my pasta and a piece of bowtie pasta in my friend&#39;s spaghetti, which seems very unprofessional. I understand that they are always busy, but in fact that the table in front of us were consistently checked by their server, I think  the quality of service is depends on a server.

I&#39;ve everything about this place. Location, waiters, surrounding area, comfy, nice, clean. Never wait too long even in the evenings. Love food, especially Thai glazed salmon and all pastas there. Of course cheesecakes is really gooood. Just try it. Price is reasonable.

I LOVE Cheesecake Factory, But I HATE this location!!!! The wait is forever (so thank God we can go shopping, but who wants to go shopping when they are hungry :-( <br> The location is small and the Utensils are filthy!<br><br>Favorite dishes of mine are the Bistro Shrimp Pasta- YUM!<br>Thai Chicken Pasta! (This can be a hit and missed depending on the chef. I like  mine kind of dry with flavor. Sometimes, it comes a bit too much sauce and washed down. It tastes soggy.)<br>Chinese Chicken Salad is one of the best I&#39;ve tried so far! :-)

My husband and i requested a table for 10 got a wait time of 3-4 hrs.....sister and her husband request a table for 10 not even 10 minutes after us since our family was meeting there....they gave her a wait time of 40 minutes....my conclusion is they didnt want to seat an overweight couple over a &#34;normal size&#34; couple...will not be going back here

The hostess working in the from was rude. The server seemed to have the kind of attitude that he didn&#39;t want to work there. The food was meh. The carbonara was wayy too heavy, the spicy jambalaya pasta wasn&#39;t spicy, the hibachi steak wast really hibachi, it was just regular grilled steak that was sliced ( not sliced and cooked) but it tasted pretty good. The sides that came with the steak wasn&#39;t good. The cheese cake was delicious. Next time I&#39;ll skip the food and get me 3 cheese cakes for dinner!

I absolutely love the Cheesecake Factory and I always get the Louisiana pasta with broccoli instead of chicken. This was my first time in years visiting this location and when I ordered they brought out the food with both broccoli and chicken, and I told them I would like it remade after they stated it was and easy fix, as in simply removing the chicken. Our server James was really great about it but I was upset that my husband had a great looking meal that was getting cold while waiting for mine. When they finally brought it out it had almost no sauce and was very dry and bland. Adding sauce after didn&#39;t bring the taste I am used to with this dish. I felt like I wasted my money. James was really great and tried to make up for it, but I was very disappointed. I think I&#39;ll stick with the Marina del Rey location.
Food was great but the service was lousy. First time eating at this location and it definitely will be the last.

Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t something that can really go wrong. I know what to expect and my expectations were fulfilled. We came for lunch around 11:30 and were able to be seated promptly. Our server Eric was phenomenal and attentive to our table. We tried the Thai lettuce wraps and highly recommend them as an appetizer.<br><br>My only issue with this location, or in general The Grove as a whole, is that people are so adamant about bringing their pets into restaurant and retail stores. Why does your dog need to be present in these locations? Some lady had her dog who kept barking at customers and servers walking by. Not so great when you keep hearing a high pitched dog bark every couple minutes. Beyond that I was satisfied with both the meal and service. I did notice though that by 1 the place was much more packed so come early to beat the crowd.
Hispanic entrance Host had the nastiest attitude ever maybe cheesecake should up her salary since everything is so pricey .

Had great food  at the bar.. But do to the fact that the front desk host ingnored me when i asked if i had to check in down stairs or up stairs I rate it only 2 stars . And when I asked for her name she ignored me so I had to ask my server for the hosts name (Sonia) great food bad host Sonia needs a better attitude

We would just like to say that there is an employee by the name of Sonia that works at this cheesecake factory and she is absolutely divine! She reminds you of what customer service was meant to be. She makes the experience so delightful that you would almost rate the food second! She makes customers feel at home!
This restaurant has a huge wait time. The space is small so it takes a long time to get seated. The food comes out in a timely manner and is pretty good.

Honestly im not one to write reviews , and I&#39;m generally really chill about my service , but this was definitely not a good experience. It made me never want to come back to this location.  <br>First the waiting was kinda long but I didn&#39;t mind the lady at the front desk was kinda rude when I had asked where the Nike store was. She had a little bit of an attitude as if I knew where it was <br>They sat us next to where the they enter everybody&#39;s orders and they all talk to each other we heard about the drama and there personal life&#39;s (problems) <br> . It took them about 20 minutes to get our drinks ,  and they didn&#39;t bring all our drinks at once , it took an additional 5 minutes for my lemonade to come out , then they placed our order, by that time we have watched a few people come in and out by the time we even got our food ..<br>We both ordered a pasta dishes with no special request or anything like that .. we waited an additional 30-45 minutes just for our food. The food seemed like it was rushed and there was really no flavor .. so finally we asked for the bill which took about 15 minutes to get. We know it wasn&#39;t all the waiters fault because we watched some other waiters keep giving him request to help them out so we tried be as chill as possible and understanding . But it just wasn&#39;t the best experience and definitely made me not wanna come back.

We love the Cheesecake Factory and the food!  But...the wait and service is rapidly going to hell.  Waited 30 mins for a salad and pasta to go.. People before us got their food before us.  Manager apologized and promised to give us cheesecake, but never came.  We told him about horrible waits and he said he worked at the Santa Monica Location and &#34;he knows&#34;.   Fix the probs please

i&#39;ve had really positive experiences everytime i go to this cheesecake factory. especially today; i had ordered an oreo cheesecake about 4 days ago, and called to let them know i&#39;d pick up early. but they had no file of my order. so alex quickly arranged everything for me. as i had ordered a 7&#34;, he politely let me know they didnt have anymore but gave me a 10&#34; for the same price! such good customer service because honestly, i wouldn&#39;t have gotten the 10&#34; for full price. <br>every other time i come here, the waiters are always super nice. this location really does have the best service!!

Best part of a corporate business is the consistency of quality of food, environment and service. We can always count on a nice time when we go to a CF! My one and  only complaint is the volume of the music that is always blasting that makes it hard to have any conversation iver dinner.

This is probably one of my favorite places to go to for dinner, one because of how beautiful the grove is, and two because the Cheesecake Factory is probably one of my to go to places. However this time around my experience was not as I expected it and now after seeing the stars this place has on yelp I&#39;m more than sure I won&#39;t be returning here as well as Can see why, According to our receipt our server was Marianna V. whom only attended us when she took our order. She never came back with our drinks our food was brought to us by another really nice young lady who I later had to get up and ask her for our drinks she said she would speak to our server and have our drinks deleivered to us promptly which she did, not once were we checked up on after our food was delivered by anyone it for a refill to see if everything was ok to see if perhaps we needed our bill. Once we finished our food I had to ask for our check ask for a bag for the items we had left over it was such an unpleasant experience  over all I work in customer service and let me tell you that when you come dine at the Cheesecake Factory you expect to get amazing service a plate there is not 10.99 your plate there minimum is 16.99 and up. I expect to write a review for a ihop or Denny&#39;s for something like this not for Cheesecake Factory i definitely think and feel their staff should be retrained or addressed....

This place Is located at the grove.   Ordering to go is a hassle to pick it up.   The environment is always hectic !!! There is a guarantee wait for in house dining.  The food is just ok.  The service at this location is always pleasant.   The seating is very close together.  Not good for a romantic date or hanging with friends.  It&#39;s just to congested. It&#39;s full of people at all times.

I had terrible cold plate from there and the rice looked terrible; it was so old, but since my waitress was nice, I let it go. The ppl at the front didn&#39;t validate my parking pass properly and I paid 7 dollar for an hour. I called the manager with the name of Steve. He was absolutely rude about it and not sincere when talking to me. He lacks customer service skills. I asked him how&#39;s his day, he replied &#34;good what can I do for you&#34; with aggression tone. I automatically knew it the convo won&#39;t go well. All what I wanted was to bring the issue to his attention. He never offered any solutions and never said sorry for any inconvenience that was caused to us. I am very disappointed. I always eat there but I will never go to this location.

We had an amazing server (Rachel) who was great the entire night and the amazing food like always. The wait was 1.5 hours which isn&#39;t surprising from this specific Cheesecake Factory since it&#39;s in the middle of The Grove. We ordered the Thai wraps, the Farfalle and the Bistro Shrimp pasta (forgive me if I spelled these wrong). All the food was delicious and I was so full by the end of the night. I also ate around 4 loaves of their wheat bread which is to die for!! Highly recommend going here and shopping while waiting for the time to pass.

This location is ALWAYS busy. I even came here for dinner at 8PM on a Tuesday night one time and it was still busy; we had to take a buzzer and wait 30 minutes before we could get a table. I recently came here for lunch with a colleague and made a reservation to avoid the 30 minute wait but we still had to wait 10 minutes upstairs to be seated. I debated about giving my review 4 stars, but the consistently long wait times here annoy me so much that I couldn&#39;t do it.<br><br>I&#39;ve had pretty good, attentive servers here though. No complains about the service.<br><br>Expect at least a 20 minute wait for food... The last time I was here, we had to wait way longer than that for our food though which was annoying. I love the food and drinks here; it&#39;s generally on par. The only time I didn&#39;t enjoy the food was the time I ordered a Classic Burger; it tasted so bland that I could only eat a quarter of it. My favorite menu items are the nachos and their milkshakes!

I am so disappointed at this Cheesecake Factory. It is literally the worst one I have never been to. Today supposed to be a great day for me because I and my friend are celebrating our admission result. I recommended that we should go to Cheesecake Factory, cause it is my favorite restaurant when I was in Texas. She wants to go to the Cafeteria for the Mediterranean food. I pulled her really hard to this diner. When I entered the waiting hall. I talked to the emotional dead waiter. I said : Hi, how are u, I would like a table for two, with my very big smile on my face. The response was simply just: you will need to wait 30min with a blank face, and that is it. I was like, Okay~~fine, maybe this gentleman don&#39;t like to smile , nor response to greeting from customers, that is his personal choice ,totally respect.  After 20somehow times of waiting, I and my friend were summoned to the upstair. Then we went up, we got our booth with fork that still has some oil stains setting on our table. I thought, Ok this might because how busy this restaurant is, You know ppl do get mistakes, and I shouldn&#39;t be a b1tch just ignore that one and don&#39;t use it, which is no need to be panic at all. After that our waiter just brought us some iced water without asking what would we like to drink. I was like okay, Maybe 90% of customers order iced water all the time, they just assumed we will order that too. Next, he brought us with literally two bread hard edges( the head or the end of a bread, I don&#39;t know how to say that) in a small white plate with 50% occupied by a giant ass butter. Then, I looked around to see that does anyone else&#39;s entry bread has the same weird setting as ours. I was shocked by what I saw. Everyone (table for two just like us, not biased at all) was having a sophisticated iron basket with 4 pieces of bread sliced for them and a small plate of butter setting on the side. I was shocked and I feel really uncanny. Then I ask my friend how she thought about this, she told me to calm down, maybe they are running out of that basket or bread because they were so busy. After we ordered our meal, there was another new table of two coming next to us. I was really curious about what will their bread looks like. Not surprised at all, they were having the iron basket with those fancy setting. The only difference between all of us and all the rest was I and my friend are Asians, and all the other are Caucasians. I asked my friend is this racist? She told me I was just been over sensitive. After our meal was finished, I immediately asked to check out, because I was already really unpleasant. The table waiter was emotional dead the whole time ,like I slaughtered his whole family. He asked all the table around us in his section for &#34;Hey, how was everything?&#34; but us. I have no idea what did I do that offended him or this whole restaurant. I am the person who was making the smile face all the time, I am the one who was greeting all the staffs, and I am the one who will pay for the meal, why they treated me like this? Besides Racism, I cannot have another reason to fit the whole logic. The most interesting thing is that they dared to tell me that I can pay for my tip after they bring back my credit card for the payment. I was totally pissed, but my friend keep told me that ,it is fine just chill, I am totally overreacting. She paid for the tip with 18% ,cause I don&#39;t want to at all.  And then we just left. I don&#39;t know how this restaurant is training their staffs, may be let them learn from the 2 broke girls? Max and Caroline are their role model ? It is so ironic, I pay them , I smile to them, and I have to tolerate their cold ass. I really want to comment with Zero Star, but the system seems wouldn&#39;t let me.
Waited 30 minutes to be seated.<br>Had a great dinner.<br>Server was friendly and attentive.<br>Food was mediocre.

This is by far the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at cheesecake it was an hour wait as to be expected here but after the hour i would expect a little more customer service appetizers took 45 minutes and came out wrong took another half hour to fix food came out and again my husbands was wrong and our waiter like wowwww didn&#39;t clear plates or ask for refills or anything i do not know how they expect people to come back here just actually that&#39;s not true bcuz the table next to ya us a diff waiter and they were taken care of exceptionally well and the manager promised us free dessert and my husband didn&#39;t even let me look at bill before we left he paid and left he wanted out so fast...

I came here to cheesecake Nov 25 2017 for early dinner with my boyfriend. Jordan was amazing she was our waitress. She is incredible always checking up on us! Always keeping us updated! She really gave 110% of her time and effort! It&#39;s really rare now a days to find someone and genuinely nice and hard working as she is. Thank you for your great service!

Dining at Cheesecake Factory makes eating out an enjoyable experience; nice environment, kind staff, and delicious food for fair prices! This restaurant is located right next to the movie theater, and has both indoor and outdoor seating. All aspects of this establishment are clean, from the dining areas to the restrooms. All of the servers we&#39;ve been with were very patient, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. <br><br>The menu has many different kinds of dishes, from American to Asian to Italian. Servers bring out baskets of warm bread and butter while you go through the very large menu, and after eating, you can choose from a plethora of desserts. Oh, and if you&#39;re looking for a place to grab lunch, they also have lunch specials! They range in price from around $10-15, and they&#39;re just as delicious and large portioned.<br><br>Overall, whether you&#39;re having a casual dinner date or celebrating a special occasion, Cheesecake Factory is the perfect place for you!

Our server was a doll, she was great!  The food was not...we ordered two orders of brussell sprouts, one came out barely cooked and the other one came out burnt to a crisp!  Fries were cold.  It&#39;s a shame because usually I love their food.  I think they might be too big, too many tables, for their own good and not able to handle the volume.

Who knew it would take almost an hour for guac and an additional hour for a chopped salad. By the time my salad came I asked for a to go plate. I was full of bread and Strawberry Lemonade. I really don&#39;t know how they&#39;re treating Employees there, but judging from the skeleton crew Id have to say not well. I ,wonder if Mr Caruso would be interested in knowing about this. My family has worked for the family since the 80s when they owned dollar rent a car. Every business the Caruso&#39;s have ever owned or had something to do with has ran as smooth as butter. I spent $80 today and I have the card statement to prove it.Do better or be replaced. Clearly the management sucks. Id prefer Ruth&#39;s Chris to be there anyway. Been going to them 10 years and not one bad experience yet. I wish I could take my $80 back. I can think of better places to go.

Great customer service. Always on point. One of my regular restaurants. Reasons why: Staff is friendly, on point and goes above and beyond. They also allow late night call in pick up orders which helps if you&#39;re on a time restraint ;) Will be back soon.! Thanks to the gentlemen at the pick up counter.! God bless you guys are the best. !
this place service its ok， but I don&#39;t understand why the 1 New York steak came to two different smell and tasty, 1 was good the other 1 smell really stinking.

The food is always good. Not exceptionally awesome but just good food! Haven&#39;t eaten something I don&#39;t like. Some things are really awesome others are okay.<br> I love sitting outside because the inside gets so loud!

I now see why they only have a three star . Today was my first time at this place . Ive always bears negative things about this place . But one can only know by experiencing it . First the host ignored me when I was talking to her.  The server started off really nice. After he took our order . He came to check on the table once . The other times I had to ask for him . I asked a host for him.  I asked a busser for him he never came back . Another server brought me my check, and the busser dropped off my check.  I asked to talk to a manager . No one came . Get it together !!!! I will NOT. Be coming to this place again . Seriously! Who is training these people.

Mediocre, mediocre, mediocre. That&#39;s what you can expect from just about everything. Don&#39;t bring a large party here. Not good for groups at all. I would not eat here again. Management doesn&#39;t handle issues by means of trying to keep a clientele. So if you want to be treated like a corporate consumer, this is probably your cup of tea.

Ahhhh.....  I love you Cheesecake Factory.  After a gastly experience at Swingers Cafe around the corner, it was nice to be in a beautiful and clean establishment.  The first thing we did was wash our hands to get the muk off from the sticky menus at Swingers.  <br><br>We were seated right away and took the elevator to the top floor.  We were leed to a quant little table outside on the patio with a view of the store fronts.  Very nice.  And the weather was perfect.  <br><br>We ordered the tuna tartare and fried calamari and shared the grilled chicken salad.  All was wonderful and tasty as it should be.  Cheesecake factory has such a vast menu, that there is always something to tantalize your taste buds.

We have been eating at Cheesecake Factory for years. Today while having a late lunch we were given the opportunity to be served by a BEAUTIFUL individual. Throughout the entire meal our service was IMPECCABLE...We were AMAZED at how SPUNKY &amp; PROFESSIONAL she was. She was definitely ON HER BEST GAME. OH AND HER NAME WAS...RACHEL. Thanks
Horrible service!!! They kept giving away our table. 2 hours later we were finally seated. Never coming back again and corporate will hear about this!

Came here since we wanted to get away from our usual area of Orange County. We arrived and it was a little crazy waiting to get the hostess attention since everyone around the her were pushy waiting to be added to the waiting list. Eventually she got to us and got my cell number.<br><br>I got the text that it was our turn to be seated. We only had to wait about 15 minutes. Not bad on a Saturday for lunch. I was actually surprised of this location. The seating is upstairs. What was even better. We sat outside on the balcony. It was awesome! As for the service. It was slow. There were a good number of times we found ourselves just waiting around, but I did not mind too much since we weren&#39;t in a rush.<br><br>As for the food. I ordered the artichoke and crab dip for appetizer. It tasted better than my entree, but the bread was a little hard to bite down on. As for my main entree which was chicken and biscuits, it was really good. It came with mashed potatoes and veggies. Lastly, we finished after with vanilla bean cheesecake. Awesome! I look forward to coming back for more.

Not all Cheesecake Factory restaurants are the same.  Thanks to the fake snow, fake tree, and &#34;real&#34; Santa on Christmas Eve ... the Grove was packed ... as were the restaurants.  The Cheesecake Factory was the perhaps the busiest.<br><br>* The Good:<br><br>Miso Salmon is among the better entree choices because the Salmon is marinated in fresh Miso and then served with thick Miso Sauce, Snow Peas, and White Rice.  This is remarkably consistent and tasty at all the locations where I&#39;ve tried it.<br>Honorable Mention: A slice of Chocolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake to go.  Packed in a slice-shaped container (including spot for Whipped Cream), I&#39;m a sucker for the layered Fudge Cake, Chocolate Cheesecake, Vanilla Mascarpone Mousse and Chocolate.   <br><br>* The Bad:<br><br>Eager to branch out for something new, I opted for the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta.  This could be among the oddest favor combinations I&#39;ve tasted.  First the pasta was way too al dente.  Then the Honey Glazed Chicken didn&#39;t match at all with the Chipotle Parmesan Cream Sauce. Mixed with Asparagus, Peppers, Peas, and Onion this dish is worth skipping.  Luckily the menu is huge.<br>Honorable mention:  The place was busy and the place was committed to serving as many tables as possible.  To achieve this tables for two were placed practically side-by-side.  We were happy to get a table, but hated having to listen to the lonely guy/mom pair on our right and the awkward couple on our left.<br><br>* The Ugly<br><br>The Wait.  Is any place worth a 75 minute wait?  We had to wait 25 minutes just to get the &#34;pager&#34; so we could know when our 75 min wait was over.  We tried hovering over some tables in the bar area for a while (as were lots of other couples), but finally resigned ourselves to accept our wait fate downstairs amongst the hordes.  No matter how good a place is, enduring such a long wait deflates the experience.<br>Honorable mention:  The disorganized crush of people trying to get to the hostess counter was a mad free-for all.  I feel sorry for the staff having to try and make the best of it each night.  Wouldn&#39;t reservations help?<br><br>When wanting safe and above average food/desserts at the Grove, the Cheesecake Factory is a comfortable choice.
Great service and like Sonia at the front. Love the service at this location. And Sonia the hostess is very sweet. Thank you

Was looking for a replacement after Grand Lux was closed. Being that their sister restaurants I&#39;ve been coming to Cheesecake for their Sunday Brunch. The quality of the food is similar but the options vary just a little. I would say that the menu is a one size fits all. You can really find something for anyone there. Some of my favorites so far are the Lemon Ricotta pancakes and the Fried shrimp. The miso salmon is also very good. Take your pick. The odds of you being dissatisfied are slim to none. Unless your just really that picky . If your looking for a sub for Grand Lux like I was try Cheesecake. RIP Grand Lux.

My experience was honestly nothing special. The server wasn&#39;t attentive, was slow and pushy. But the food was wonderful. I ordered the meatball spaghetti, which was DELICIOUS! And I got a cream chocolate cake. It was good too, was very creamy and juicy, loved it. decor is cool and fancy. Overall, the food was delicious, but with such a big hall and busy servers, not a place I would come back for.

Me and my boyfriend came here February 10th. A little late on my review. We showed up around 9, the wait was about 15 -20 minutes. I have no complaints about the food itself. However will not be coming back. Our server, did not check on us. Our glasses were empty. There were 3 tables around us, and all surrounding tables got their food and appetizers before we did, and we had arrived before the others. Our server was not rude, however was very inattentive. I expected more, from such a nice location. I was wrong. Most likely will not return to this location.

The food is &#34;okay&#34; but the service was not good at all.. My server didn&#39;t say any suggestions..and when I<br>Asked if the pizza was thin or thick his answer was &#34;I think so&#34;.. What an answer is that??? By the way.. The hostess didn&#39;t smile and she wasn&#39;t sweet at all.. I worked as a hostess for three years and your job is SMILE!!!! I&#39;m not coming back!

I usually come eat here a lot for lunch with friends but let me tell you that this Friday was the worse. I was not going to comment about it but I do believe that we should all get acknowledged when we get upstairs not only was I ignored but the older lady that was upstairs is rude not only did she not look at me she seemed upset at everyone I will not be going there for lunch if I keep getting that kind of treatments......

I love this place!. The pineapple upside down cheesecake is to die for!. It is the main reason why  come here. However, the rest of the menu is very extensive and tasty. They have a separate menu at 600 caloroes or less!(if you meed that). The lettuce wrapped chicken tavos are great!   Best place to share if you want to have desert and a full meal. Try the chicken madera and steak Diane. Try it!. You can just add a small caesar salad (its big!), share that plate with someone and you will have plenty of space to share fesert. Totally worth it!.<br><br> Location thou is always super busy. It is hard to decide to eat here because the wait is always at least 20 min. But today, on labor day, it wasnt. We came here and we were told to wait about 30 min. I was very hungry but decided to wait. We only waited 10 min!.

Cheesecake Cheesecake Cheesecake, enough said<br><br>Being located at the Grove its nice. its close with lots of things to do but it sucks at the Grove because its always always super crowded. That aside the staff always has a smile and give you a buzzer so when your table is ready you can come. its has a good distance so that you can at least can shop some.<br><br>Its hard to explain what to get here, if you never been then you need to come.<br><br>The menu is a size of a large book. lots of things and they do brunch too with a different menu. Great drink menu lots of fruity drinks <br><br>Free bread and butter two kinds :)<br><br>I love the skinny menu and come here for lunch all the time.<br>I get the grilled chicken with pasta <br><br>I always get the food the way i requested. <br><br>Now for dessert.<br><br>The cheesecake is good. Lots of different flavors and they always have a seasonal flavor. <br><br>My fav is the red velvet cheesecake and the second is key lime.<br><br>I plan to come back and they do take out too.

Over all a decent place, always crowded even on a mid-week day.
