Staff is friendly, food well with the exception of two times were the food was cold and the cheesecake slice I received was so thin , it look like a reject. Cocktail drinks are tasty priced accordingly. Sometimes the place gets really loud. But I&#39;m still a fan of the cheesecakes.
Our server Bobbie was really nice however we got up to us the restroom and all of our food was gone... i understand you have people waiting for tables but please don&#39;t rush your customers out..

Ok so I am a huge Cheesecake Factory fan, and have been to multiple across the country probably over a hundred times. So I am not slamming them as I am a realist. But this visit was the most subpar ever for their standards. If you read my reviews I like them and review them as such. <br><br>On 12/30/16 I went and there was a 15 minute wait but the ladies at the front desk were very nice and accurate about wait time. Once our buzzer went off we went upstairs and we&#39;re seated. Now here is where the fun began. We entered CKF at 12:57p, were seated at 1:12pm, but was not asked about drinks or anything until 1:35p. They were busy, and our waitress had multiple tables and I could tell she was doing her best, but we did not leave until 3:04p because everything took forever.  We just wanted to pay because our Gumbo was just plain nasty (this time, normally it is to die for), but that still took 30 minutes. The people serving us tried their best but they were clearly short staffed, and we always thank the great state of California for giving 18-22 year old millennials the option to go to work or simply call in and be paid (pretty sure if they had it when I was growing up I would us every hour I had lol). I will be back but the visit today was well below my standard for such a established restaurant that normally wows me with everything.

I give this Cheesecake Factory location 4 stars. Of course a Cheesecake Factory is just that so there is nothing really special, however, the service and the food were both fantastic this evening. The one thing I don&#39;t like is the seating situation. If you don&#39;t get a booth, you&#39;re pretty close to the people next to you. So if you don&#39;t like others in your personal bubble and don&#39;t mind waiting a few extra minutes, request a booth   When the host/hostess welcomes you into the restaurant! I forgot my server&#39;s name(I&#39;m sure it is on my receipt) but he was phenomenal. Just a genuinely nice guy. Not too cheesy and not a rude server who is over it. He was perfect. <br><br>I hope this review helps! The Grove is beautiful any time of day anyway. You might as well go to Cheesecake Factory while you&#39;re there!<br><br>:)

Taste is ok! They have to do smth with a line and waiting time, I understand that they have a lot of customers, but whats the all point to wait outside and wait again when you sat. Been there with wife and waited 30 min to get a call, and they made us to wait another 30 min until they figure out who is our server is!

This rating is based upon the wait time. We were told that there would be a 40 minute wait when 40 minutes hit we had to go back downstairs to ask was our buzzer broken. Come to find out they are running about 20 minutes behind because &#34;guests are sitting where they shouldn&#39;t be.&#34; The issue is that you should give a higher wait time than a lower one. My husband has to eat in order to take his medication and now we have to wait another 20 minutes or more. We&#39;ve just been standing because there is no seating in the wait area or the bar... this is bad service at its best.... maybe this will change once we are seated
Worse place to go esp on the weekends, poor receptionist service!  Totally waste of time!

One of my go to places for Californian American food other than BJs. Easy, consistent food quality, nice decor and different depending on what venu you go to. I recommend trying their chocolate cake shot. Once in a while they have new dishes to try. Cocktails great too!

Long wait!  Also the staff at the front desk much rather have girl talk then assist the customers checking in.  The food is typical Cheesecake Factory and the service is mediocre.  Overall it is a typical food chain that services overprice cafeteria food.

I always come to this branch<br>I&#39;ve been to the one in the grove and it always disappoints me unlike this branch.<br>They dont have RSVP but You gotta make  come to the front desk 45 earlier to RSVP in person so u can get in faster. it&#39;s sometimes Bz.<br><br>They start you off with complimentary bread and butter  Brown Sweet wheat bread and sourdough bread cut diagonally. <br><br>They tell you they&#39;re name. I remember one was Sean a nice cute guy with glasses and I think the nice asian girl name Clarissa. The servers are always nice and considerate. I&#39;ve been here 5 times or more and its nice eat indoors if you don&#39;t like the wind. Gets windy and cold outdoors so I stay indoors.<br><br>I always! Always get the firecracker salmon. It&#39;s literally fireworks in your mouth. $12 but worth the experience. It&#39;s like a egg roll salmons and the sauce it very unique it&#39;s not spicy but it has a kick to it that&#39;s delectable to your pallet. It comes with cabbages so mix it and turn it into a salad. Excellent sauce. <br><br>I always get the Fettuccine Sundried tomatoes pasta. They make their fettuccine pasta thick and the sauce is so hearty creamy. Very satisfying. The plate can feed 2 people If u wanted. All they&#39;re plates are huge! <br><br>I always get a nice drink like the Strawberry Fruit Smoothie it has a ripe strawberry on top very soothing to your throat. I like it<br><br>But I always get the strawberry lemonade cuz I love lemonade. I prefer you to try their drinks. <br><br>Over all experience I love their food and atmosphere and customer service.<br>Perfect service every time I come here

Went here Saturday afternoon about 2:30 PM.  Sat in the bar, ordered a club sandwich fries and a salad, the salad didn&#39;t come so we just had them take it off and ate the club sandwich and fries. The service was good but the club sandwich was average at best,  no mayo, and it tasted like it had been siting awhile, I don&#39;t know that I&#39;d come here again and spend $14 for a club sandwich that has hardly any bacon and tasted just OK.
Besides this location always being busy service for me has always been great, and the food comes out good and hot except that it was hard to get warm bread today.

First time coming here with my wife. Overall good food . Started off with some wine. Next we had the egg roll sampler, then I had the Cajun pasta . Place was pretty busy so it was a pretty good wait time but the service was friendly and food was pretty good
Had my usually Thursday soup. Delish as always. Turkey Burger was juicy and loved the o ions on top. Great service.  Live The Grove

So far good customer service. The food is good. The  Miso Salmon is the best! Fresh warm bred served. Huge menu choices.i would recommend for a date or a big family. On the weekend you can expect to wait an hour to be seated.
Perfect place for lunch! Food is very good service too. There&#39;s a long variety of meals and that&#39;s what I most like I highly recommend this place.

The epitome of poor service. <br>Party of 8 sat in a booth.<br>One of the folks at the party was never served dinner.<br>Refills on fountain drink =0<br>A religious food requirement was ignored and instead of apologising the chef tried to justify. <br>The waiter was clueless, and most likely to blame for the missing entre.<br>The manager, when called, was not attentive or considerate. Made a big deal about crediting the meals that were not served.<br>The bread was tasty and one specialty meal was brought correctly.<br>Overall an embarrassing affair for this restaurant. :(

Pretty good location since it is at the Grove.  We got there around 7:30 PM on a Friday night and man, the line was long.  We had to wait for about an hour just to get seated.  It&#39;s cool.  I guess.  Start time for the movie we wanted to watch was at 10PM anyway.   We spent the next hour sitting by the fountain area, people watching and listening to the awesome Jazz singer they had performing that night.  <br><br>Herb Crusted Filet of Salmon (3 stars) -  I wanted to love it because I love fish in general but it came out so-so.  Nothing to rave about.<br><br>Service (3 stars) - they were busy.  Our servers introduced themselves, delivered the food, came back for the tab.<br><br>Ambiance (3 stars) - Very dimly lit.  They were probably going for the romantic vibe.  But with too many people dining it had a bar-like feel to it.  Which they also have towards the north side of the restaurant.<br><br>One thing I like was how you have to walk up to the 2nd floor to get to their main dining area.  Reminded me a bit of Jin Fong Dim Sum place in NY.

Jesse the hostess was extremely rude. We came to the restaurant at 255pm she told us for 10 ppl. It would be an hour and 40 mins wait. And said to come back in 30 mins to get the pager. When we came back she stated its still more than hour wait. We stayed we would cancel our reservation. When we came <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fback.in&amp;s=c4971fee1861963ef47ea744a257429a4e5f3c4887fa177e1c8f72cf40316eba" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">back.in</a> 3 mins later. Jesse said that the table that was ours was given to another family. When she had just states there was still an hour wait. I asked to speak to the manager. And now it&#39;s a 15 to 20 min wait. I am a 8 year army veteran and I can not believe how we are being treated. I will never dine her again

I walked in here to get a reservation for three and was told to wait 15 minutes to get the reservation and the ringer for when our table is ready. I then came back in 15 minutes only to be asked to wait another 10 minutes. This is unreal! The management here has no grasp of what is really going on. They need to work on customer service. This is not a restaurant, this is a laughing stock!

Usually on top of their stuff, but this Friday I was rather disappointed. Ordered a Carbonara that came out as a pasta soup. Watery, zero taste.<br>Normally I don&#39;t send my food back, but it was so bad that I had no choice. Second time it came out it was less watery(but still soupy) and still tasteless. (FYI; Had the same dish in Beverly Hills earlier this week, and it was delicious).<br>Sent it back again but this time I didn&#39;t wanna take a chance on the same dish, so I got an alternative dish which came out decent.<br>Service wise it sucked. The manager did replace the dish, but it was in a very mechanical way. No apologies, just didn&#39;t seem to give a damn. I mean; It&#39;s not that I think he should be on his knees,  but at least gave the courtesy to pretend like you care- Specially since you&#39;re the manager.<br>The bartender was lagging like crazy when it came to pouring wine, and we had empty glasses for a loooong time. Finally ended up moving to the place next door, where we were taken care of.<br>This review is based on the last visit. With exception of earlier this week, I&#39;ve in general been very satisfied with both the food and the service at this location. But the last visits does bring down my rating unfortunately.

cobb salad taste fresh.<br>fried cheese is ok.<br>ribeye steak is well cooked but the meat itself just soso.<br>both the steak of filet and shrimp scampi and steak diane is overcooked， we order medium but served medium-welldone &amp; totally completely welldone.<br>cheese cake is not very cheesy...the original is okay，the stawberry is kind of sweet...

I been here a lot of times and I got to say today&#39;s food was very delicious. Either the quality was upgraded or they hired a new more experienced chef. Regardless of the reason. I am very pleased with today&#39;s entree.
Food took a little too long for cold hard rice  but other than that stake and crab cakes were amazing  cheesecake   was delicious

Absolutely amazing cheese cake. I love their chocolate tower truffle cake. Just share it with sombody. The only place i feel i am eating real cake. It usually takes long time to get seated but worths to wait. Go weekdays around 3 pm.

The service is amazing and the interior design is fancy. The menu is as big as a chapter book and most of the food is fresh. The food is delicious and there is a lot of diversity between the cheesecake flavors. Overall this place is amazing and the waiters have an amazing attitude.

THE CHEESECAKE <br>                                  FACTORY<br>_______________________________________________<br><br>     I LOVED this place, the custom r service was  and the food was also  I had a great time we sat outside, and you can see the WHOLE grove (well almost) and our waiter was very nice. I loved the cheesecake the most!  ps. this was written and photographed by my 9yo daughter.

Went in on a Wednesday night, not too busy. It was about a half an hour wait, no problem. For starters, the hostess seemed lost on where to seat us. Our waiter was nice at first...then his service was horrible...he disappeared after bringing our food. Therefore, getting no refills on our drinks. Not just that but we were there foreverrrrr with no sign of him. We had to track him down for the bill, and it even took him over 10 minutes just to bring the cards back. The two stars is for the cheesecake, the food and service get 0. Won&#39;t be back.
It&#39;s my favourite place of a  huge choice of desserts.  Classical  and mango cheesecakes are the best.

Probably one of the most overrated places I know. This place is so hyped and does not live up to it tbh. It takes hella long just to get seated upstairs(1-2 hrs usually) not to mention the 40 min wait to get your food and all for some fancy mediocre tasting food. If anything the pastas are pretty good and the burgers ate decent but for the wait/price/hype I kinda expect better.. Nonetheless it&#39;s a great place for special occasions due to the whole fancy atmosphere etc. <br>I would come here 1-2 times a year.

So yeah, I&#39;m not a big fan of cheese.<br><br>BUT. The cheesecakes here are so delish.<br>So my focus for this review is gonna be solely on this cheesecake I tried the other day.<br>I had the white truffle raspberry cheesecake and it was so smooth and creamy!! Typically, I don&#39;t like rich creamy and super sweet things, but I killed this slice easily. Everyone was surprised. It was a really nice balance between fruity and rich, I think, which was why I liked it. I asked for no whipped cream because I felt like that would&#39;ve been an overkill. The crust was perfect, not too soft or hard but the perfect texture. <br><br>Basically: Try the desserts. They&#39;re fire.
It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory-full selection of every type of food and amazing desserts that are all expensive yet worth the experience.

When we arrived there was a 30 minute wait. The hostess was pleasant and smiling.<br><br>When we we were seated it was prompt and the seater was polite. Our server was very polite and quite pleasant. Refills came often and quick. My guests ordered the cob salad and the orange chicken both were plentiful and enjoyable. I ordered the Tex Mex egg roll. This is not the first time that I orders them but first time in a while. I was very disappointed, they changed the recipe. They were greasy, over cooked, and burned. When mentioned to the server nothing happened. I did not eat them.<br><br>Overall I enjoyed my visit, I guess I&#39;ll stick to what I know.

Food is great. Quite pricey. THE CAKES AND DESSERTS are just...absolute heaven in your mouth. We bought a chocolate and oreo cheesecake from them and it was just yummiest cake i&#39;ve ever tasted. It was sweet but not too much. You can taste the rich chocolate and the cheescake together. The oreo part of the cake isn&#39;t crushed. They&#39;re still whole (picture provided). <br><br>Oh and their receptionists are nice as well. I don&#39;t know about you but for me, the receptionist part of a restaurant is very important. The service is busy but they are attentive and not rude.

The Cheesecake Factory is our favorite place.  But today in this location we were a little disappointed,  the customer service wasn&#39;t that good it&#39;s like they didn&#39;t really care about us. The 1st employee went to break 2nd one continued ( WHICH WAS OK WITH US). When we asked to take the food with us he brought the bags to our table and started to put the food inside the bag with his hands and the rest left so we continue and left helping others,  It&#39;s like we were helping ourselfs. Anyways the food is super.

If you&#39;re looking for a good happy hour look no further...wait maybe I want to take that back so it isn&#39;t so crowded. <br><br>Their happy hour appetIzers are good! You get the same portion size but for half the price. Same with their drinks. Where else can you get a good. Long Island for $5? (I&#39;ll give you a second) happy hour at the bar gets packed, so plan to get there early for a seat.<br><br>Couple of TV&#39;s. the bar staff are cool as hell. Love Laylani! <br><br>Good spot to drop into before a movie, after shopping &amp; when youre breathing!

ok, what happened to this place!  old bread to start with, dirty glasses - <br>I had the turkey burger that was definitely not the same as the other <br>cheesecake factories, and the fries were cold and stale!  blah

Came for lunch and made my day so much more annoying.<br>We come upstairs checked in, party of two. We were waiting to get seated. While we were waiting, another party of two comes up like ten mins after we been waiting for our table. They get seated right away.<br>Finally they seat us and take us to a booth where people were already sitting!<br>Obv they didn&#39;t like their table so moved to that booth so I get stuck with some shitty small corner table.<br>Seriously I wonder why do I come here. Not like their food or service is ever great.

I&#39;ve gone here twice within two weeks <br><br>First visit, was ok. The front lady didn&#39;t want to accommodate my party of 6. Told is it would tale 3 hours to get a table. I don&#39;t understand why they can&#39;t have two tables together or nearby. It&#39;s not rocket science!<br><br>Second visit, our server, Marisol was the best! So sweet, helpful and attentive! I was impressed with her service. Because of her, I&#39;m ready to come back and just ask for her. <br><br>Food is outrageously enormous.  I ordered a lunch size Chinese chicken salad and I really believed they had given me the regular portion. <br><br>So you do get what you pay for. Food is generously enormously large. But so good!

Worst Cheesecake Factory experience I every had!Group of 6 of us visited this location earlier in the week; multiple waitresses and waiters; the first waitress tossed the silverware on the table, we then got a new waiter, drinks were never refilled, meals were incorrect,cold and/or over cooked,  BUT my meal was actually prepared correctly (Louisiana Spicy Chicken Pasta so 1 of 6 meals correct is why the get the 1 star).<br><br>We sat for over 40 minutes before served, it became so bad that the manager had to come over and comp half the bill and provide free deserts- She was very nice- if only her staff could&#39;ve followed her lead on this particular night-so, addition star added.<br> <br>This location will need to revamp its staff or train them on providing great customer experiences as there are lower cost and equal or greater food quality options in the area.<br><br>If this type of service continues with others, I wouldn&#39;t be surprised if more bad reviews follow-But this did provide memories as it will be the measuring stick for bad dining experiences.

Uneducated or careless staff??? I came in to try the impossible burger they added to their menu.  The server informed me that it IS vegan.  I asked because I AM vegan.  She said they changed the sauce when they added this burger to be vegan.  She told me everything on it IS vegan.  I came again and sat at the bar and the bartenders told me the same thing.  It is vegan.  GREAT!.... not.  I came a third time and ordered the burger and my server told me the sauce and bun were NOT vegan.  I said oh.... when I came before the server told me they changed the sauce when they added this burger.  He said ok well let me double check with the kitchen to be sure.  He came back and told me the sauce and bun are NOT vegan.  Which means their staff is either uneducated or careless.  I was glad he actually took the time to be sure.  But this means I know consumed dairy which is NOT in alignment with my dietary choices.  I felt VERY angry at the time and VERY disappointed.  For me, my diet is a choice and I should be able to eat out and know that I can trust what the servers tell me.  What if I had an allergy?????  It is quite horrible when you think about it.

Visited this place with a special friend the African American waiter was beyond rude. She wanted to order a mai tai. There are no  drink prices listed on the menu. She asked the waiter he informed us &#34;he didn&#39;t know off the top of his head&#34;!    In shock we had no response and decide not to order a drink. The waiter then hesitantly stated he would go find out.  He retuned and told us the mai tai was $12.80 ish.   We ordered the drink and food.    When the waiter returned to check if things were ok ... he was not only rude but insulting,   He asked &#34; can you pay for anothe drink&#34;?.    I was so insulted until I  refused to respond to his rudeness.  I asked for To-go containers paid the bill and left immediately.    I have visited this and many other locations and never been insulted and treated so disrespectfully,   I will never return to this location again. I suggest if you happen to get an African American watier you don&#39;t ask  about anything on the menu!!

Hello, it&#39;s Mort again. My wife and I are on vacation here with our kid and I figured I would stop by to check in on the structural integrity of this Cheesecake Factory. You may recall I reviewed the one in Cherry Hill, NJ that I helped construct. Anyways, after our initial wait, we went upstairs and waited again. Then we were seated and, you guessed it, we waited. Luckily I&#39;m never in a rush, only searching after that next adrenaline rush. That&#39;s another story though. The service was hospitable and the food quite scrumptious. My wife got the veggie burger and I myself ate Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta. Our kid got the herb crusty fish. Maybe it was herb custard fish? It was good. My wife wasn&#39;t happy about all the farts afterwards though. We drove home with all the windows down. Thank you for good food. And to the two people dining next to us that wouldn&#39;t stop staring at me, thanks. Not often ol&#39; &#34;construction extraordinaire&#34; Mort gets the public all starstruck anymore :)
Service was slow. The server was obviously overwhelmed so we were not attended to adequately. He forgot several things. Our drinks, bread , and place settings. Food wasn&#39;t hot.

This CF is at the Grove which means parking is ridiculous and the line to eat here is even more ridiculous! We had to wait 30 minutes for a buzzer then 45 minutes for it to buzz. It was absolute chaos at the entrance with people trying be put on the list, to turn in buzzers, to get buzzers, OMG it was crazy and there were just two people working. I felt so bad for them. However, after the chaos, we were finally seated and our waiter was amazing and very attentive. My cajun pasta was very good and the cheesecake was even better of course. I would suggest to not come here on the weekend but if you must, just get ready to wait and walk through mazes made of bodies -_-

My parents were visiting from Florida and I brought them here for a late lunch on Father&#39;s day.  It took us over an hour to get our table, but once we sat down we had a great lunch.  The food took a fairly lengthy time to get to us, but without us saying a word the server came and told us he let his manager know about the wait and we could order Cheesecake on them.  The food was DELICIOUS with big portions as usual.  Once we were finished, the server presented us with the desert menu and we ordered two slices which never appeared on our bill.  The manager and server were truly doing their best on such a busy day.  I will absolutely go back!

Sorry for not writing this review sooner. It has been two weeks since my visit to this location for the first time. I didn&#39;t like the hostesses downstairs. I patiently waited in line to put my name down on the list. People behind me in line stepped to the left and right of me, to be taken by the next hostess and have their name put down. At least 3 groups cut in front of me. Until I finally interrupted all the stimulation that seemed to be distracting the hostesses (the natural atmosphere of Cheesecake Factory) and said &#34;HEY! Aren&#39;t I next in line?&#34; She said, &#34;...yes.&#34; And could not understand my firm statement. I said, if you see someone next in line, call them over. Don&#39;t just take the next person who walks up. Obvious a line had formed. Be fair to those waiting. I can be pushy too and cut the line, but don&#39;t think you hostesses would want people crowded around the counter in a disorganized fashion.  One hostess (young black girl with braids) was one I had contact with. She was unaware of what was happening. She apologized and put my name down, and apologized one other time later. I appreciate this, but please, take more notice of those who are patiently waiting to receive a pager. Just because I came in alone, does not mean I am not important, because that&#39;s how I felt...<br><br>On a side note, I found a place at the bar, and my server was Kennedy. Gosh is she awesome. She was attentive and sincere in the way she engaged with you in conversation. She patiently answered ALLLL my menu questions and was knowledgeable about everything. I would go back to Cheesecake just because of her. Servers should emulate the style that Kennedy puts out there. She is kind, caters to your needs and is helpful. She offered to box my food for me, which many Cheesecake servers don&#39;t do. She checked on me enough. I didn&#39;t have to grab her attention much, if at all.  Thank you Kennedy, for making my solo dinner just days before my bday, a memorable one. Honestly. <br>I hope you get some recognition at work for your exemplary work ethic.  Keep doing you!<br><br>Lastly, I can&#39;t forget Cindy. I hope I spelt her name right (or maybe it&#39;s Cindi)?  You were an absolute gem. U offered me a pleasant memory with your friendly and genuine chat. Thank you for your confirmation on my cheesecake selection.  You were very generous with your final gesture. My birthday celebration for the week, began that night and both you and Kennedy made it a memorable one. Much appreciated!!!

Always busy since it&#39;s in the always busy Grove. However, I think the service is always solid. I love the Jambalaya pasta and the guacamole from the Cheesecake Factory. There&#39;s almost always a wait, especially for dinner (sometimes more than an hour). Service can be slow but considering the volume they get, it&#39;s not bad in my opinion. Recommend!

Don&#39;t get me wrong-- I&#39;m a Cheesecake Factory fan. They have a menu BOOK so whether you want pasta, fish, steak, chicken, sandwich, salad-- they have it. I wouldn&#39;t say their dishes are excellent but it&#39;s a good choice when quantity &amp; medium quality is the name of the game. My personal favorite is the avocado egg roll cuz it&#39;s served with a side of crack sauce. Entree wise I like the chicken pasta plate (I think it&#39;s the Louisiana chicken with mushrooms &amp; bell peppers). Cheesecake wise the raspberry truffle cheesecake is amazing. <br><br>That being said, why does this location suck so much? It seems so fancy when you walk in because you enter to see the hostess section &amp; then you have to take a long escalator (or the stairs) to the dining area. But the service is SUCH A FAIL. The servers travel in packs of 2 cuz they&#39;re so busy chatting with each other. They forget to bring your much needed cocktails &amp; bread until you remind them 15 minutes after ordering. They tell you they told the kitchen not to add certain ingredients (ahem: cilantro) but your dish will have cilantro. They try to charge you for things you did not order. They take SOO long to process your bill that you start to wonder if you need to ask about it. <br><br>Food was whatever but service was so bad this place gets 1 star. Not a fan-- would not revisit. Don&#39;t be lazy &amp; just walk to the farmers market to eat!!

Unfortunately my experience today was so disappointing! It was busy for lunch but that is not a good excuse for a bad pasta dish  but that&#39;s what got! Over cooked rubbery shrimp and chicken with no flavor AT ALL!  The Cajun Pasta is my favorite but it&#39;s the second time I&#39;ve gotten rushed bland food! So very dissatisfied....

My family and I arrived at the Cheesecake Factory located in the Grove yesterday (7/13/2014) for our  compensated meal due to an incident that had occurred several weeks prior where our card was charged twice. Thankfully, the Cheesecake Factory HQ was kind enough to apologize for the situation in which we were grateful. <br><br>So, when we arrived at the restaurant we already knew that we were going to get some hate from this. Anyway we tried to brush of the glaring, shooting-daggers-at-you looks from the hostesses and just went about our business. Our waitress was friendly at first but I feel like someone told her our meal was comped, and then she was not-so-friendly and was only to be found when it was bill time. <br><br>I had a menu in my hand to order a cheesecake later. So, my sister ordered first and then I was in the process of telling her my order when she just grabbed the menu from my hand and walked away. Yeah, we were appalled but we still tipped her well. <br><br>I want to point out that, maybe once a month, my family chooses this establishment to dine in and we ALWAYS order a lot. However, we decided to decrease the amount of dishes we usually order since we felt bad. I loved eating at the Cheesecake Factory before but now, I&#39;m not so sure. I&#39;m sure working in the food industry is difficult but you know what, everyone&#39;s job/life is difficult in some way and that&#39;s not an excuse to DISRESPECT customers.

Used to love eating at The Cheesecake Factory at The Grove. We always enjoyed the balcony, good service and good food. I suspect they are victims of their success, and of the Grove&#39;s success. They were busy before, but they&#39;re crazy busy now, and the service has not kept up. I&#39;ve noticed the decline over the past year. but last Saturday night was really bad. Waiting over 30 mins. for our cocktails, an unsmiling unsympathetic waiter. Even the food quality was less - maybe 20%,  or so? It&#39;s too bad. Hope they can figure it out.

The vibe here makes me feel luxurious. The waiters &amp; waitresses are really friendly. When I come for dinner I usually wait around 10 minutes to even an hour, but I think it&#39;s worth it.<br><br>Their bread &amp; butter for appetizer is free and it&#39;s really good. Maybe it&#39;s good because it&#39;s free HAHA.<br><br>Their coke is really good and refreshing. Yes... some cokes just taste awful but their coke never disappointed me.<br><br>Their food: <br>Pasta Carbonara: BOMB! I always get this when I come here. I love bacon &amp; cheesy noodles... so it&#39;s carbonara. I usually get another plate (of the other person&#39;s choice) and we share the two plates. It&#39;s less overwhelming like that because you don&#39;t get all of one plate. Carbonara can get a little bit cheesy in the end...<br><br>One star off is for the wait, but it&#39;s reasonable.

the food is good got the Louisiana chicken pasta and my girl got the white chicken chili and both were good we also got buffalo blast. No complains <br><br>The waiting period is very slow they told us 1:10 mins before we can be sittted for a party of 4. Then we had to wait like 20mins for food to come. Our server didn&#39;t have any customer service matter fact she seemed like she didn&#39;t wanna be their. Took 10 mins just to bring our drinks ! No service !!

3 Words: Biggest Disappointment Ever. My friends and I went to cheesecake factory thinking we could get some of the &#34;world&#39;s best cheesecake&#34; as a part of a suprise birthday celebration for one friend in our group who visited from another country. As we finally found a seat to settle for a party of six, we asked the waiter for a 6 inch whole cheesecake and found out that it would take over an hour after request. (Which is a huge delay!) He then gave us time to decide if we would want to make that purchase and decided we would wait, however once he came back, he told us that we may or may not be guaranteed the cheesecake after the 1 hour wait. Because of that, we decided to leave due to the extreme disappointment that this restaurant brought us. First of all, the Cheesecake factory should always have a whole cheesecake ready to go, having every single one frozen is completely ridiculous and only shows how unprepared the restaurant is to take on the demands of its customers. It&#39;s called the cheesecake factory for a reason is it not? So how about you stop freezing the cheesecakes during open hours where some customers might want to eat it then and there. Even Marie Callanders has their pies ready to eat upon request for God sakes. Even Vons has whole cheesecakes ready to eat!! The fact that Cheesecake Factory of all places would have all their world famous whole cheesecakes frozen 24/7 is insane! Ready to eat whole cheesecakes should be available upon request!! It&#39;s not even debatable for a restaurant looking to satisfy all customers. And for this, they will forever lose a customer. Also, the fact that our cheesecake was &#34;not guaranteed&#34; according to the waiter was also completely absurd. The customer should always be placed as a priority and tonight, our group did not recieve the treatment of customer priority. <br> <br>If I could rate 0/5 stars I would. Cheesecake factory really let us down, and it was embarrassing for us not to have had a whole cheesecake ready for a suprise birthday celebration. Again, completely ridiculous experience and definitely would not come back.

My Bestie, Marife and I decided to eat here. Wait was an hour which was normal at this location. Before an hour our table was ready.  Bestie ordered chicken tenders and I ordered Sheila salad. Food came. I gave Bestie some of my salad and Bestie gave me some of her chicken. After a few minutes I see a worm crawling on my plate....suddenly lost my appetite.  Called the server, he apologized,  took my plate then the manager came and apologized asked if I wanted something else, I said no. Managers excuse is because their vegetables are organically grown. Really? Does it mean they don&#39;t wash the vegetables before they serve it? Come on, lame excuse.

Lunch time at the bar is usually the shortest wait time for me here.  Usually only come during lunch and try to be in and out before the hour just so I don&#39;t have to pay for parking.  Best deal it get something from the lunch menu.  It&#39;s a smaller version of the regular dish and a lot cheaper.  Not much can be said that isn&#39;t already written.  Cheesecake is good but sometimes the special one are a tad to sweet for me.  Fan of the wheat bread so we just ask for it instead of the sourdough.  If you aren&#39;t in a rush there is always shopping to do once your meal is over. Just to burn those newly gained calories.
This location has to be my favorite. Great staff and nice vibe. I just wish they gave samples of the cheesecake lol.

I really do love the Cheesecake factory.  The service and food are both outstanding.<br><br>The menu is hilariously large, but manages to be creative.  The salads here are surprisingly good and their sandwiches are fresh and flavorful.<br><br>Ironically, the one thing that isn&#39;t very good here is the cheesecake....go figure.  Other deserts are great, however.  The strawberry shortcake is isn&#39;t short on anything.<br><br>Will it change the way you look at food?  No.  But if you&#39;re looking for a semi-casual dining experience managed impeccably, then look no further.
Great service. The food portions are huge. Def order the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake off the hook. Wished they took reservations but we&#39;ll be returning !

It was my first time going to The Grove yesterday with my cousin and a friend. We decided to eat at The Cheesecake Factory for lunch.<br><br>I ordered the buttermilk pancakes with blueberries and the strawberry fruit smoothie. I thought that the pancakes had too much blueberries in them which made it a bit too sweet. The smoothie was good though.<br><br>We ordered the ultimate red velvet cake cheesecake to share at the end of our meals. We all thought that it was too sweet so we didn&#39;t like it that much.<br><br>The waiter we had was nice, friendly, and professional.

This was second visit here. The guest I was with had a gift card so we decided to go here. Once again, this location was a disappointment. First we had to sit outside, we were not told my the hostess that we would have to sit outside/balcony. So we were cold sitting there no sofa were available inside for at least an hour. My food was not lukewarm and my order was incorrect. The waitress only visited our table to bring us our food...will not visit this location again.

The grove is beautiful place. The Cheesecake Factory fits right in. The food here is not bad. They have an extensive menu, I usually get a glam burger and I&#39;m really satisfied. This visit I decided to try their Cajun chicken littles. They were not great. Basically chicken tenders (small) with dipping sauce. I felt like I was a kid again except I paid 15-17 dollars for chicken strips. Not a fan of it but the desserts here are amazing. I personally love cheesecake so their classic New York cheesecake with strawberry  is always good. Don&#39;t forget to get your ticket validated on the way out. Could save you some money

Cheesecake Factory has always been one of my favorite restaurants. We decided to have dinner there Saturday night and I realize it is busy and we were told a 45 minute wait. It turned out to be a hour and 1/2 wait only to go upstairs and wait ten more minutes. If we would have know the wait was that long we would have went somewhere else. We had a great server who went on break during our time there. That was ok but there were 4 of us and while on his break our food came out one dish at a time. The last meal came out 11 minutes later the other 3. We talked to the manager and she tried to make it right but still upset because we spent so much time out of day and it became a stressful experience instead of an enjoyable night out for dinner.
Great service and a friendly atmosphere. The wait time for a Saturday was only 45min. Food was satisfying

Sadly I have to rate this with one star but I needed 0 stars for this review.<br>We arrived at this location at 5:40 pm. At our table, 30 minutes after we got our appetizers,( sweet potato fries and a salad)then I ordered my favorite &#34;SHIMP SCAMPI&#34; I get the same dish almost every time I go there.  (I know my plate very well) <br>If you eat this normally, you would know that this dish is made with lots of garlic cloves, lemon,  wine sauce. Parsley etc. <br>Once I look at the plate it looked odd and I knew something was not right.<br>The sauce tasted ONLY like heavy cream and butter, NOT EVEN 1 GARLIC on it. No parsley. <br>So I asked the girl who helped us what was her thought about that plate?. And she kind of knew what I was talking about... <br>she asked me if I wanted something else or re-make the plate, I told her: <br>I just want the shrimp scampi made &#34;the right way&#34;, The way they normally make it. <br>15 minutes later she brings me a plate... I did see 2 roasted garlic cloves ( when they usually put about 7-8 cloves) the angel hair was 1/4 of the original portion and and didn&#39;t taste like freshly made. <br>(My advise to you, never return a dish). Now I know why they always say that. I ate by myself because my food wasn&#39;t right the first time and took longer to bring the second try.<br>Overall very bad experience, it is the second time something happened at this location. <br>Good luck!

I am a mother and father of my son and this was possible the worst Mother&#39;s Day dinner I could have had. I love the food here but after being here for over two hours I left with no food because they couldn&#39;t get it right and the person taking the order couldn&#39;t understand English . I finally said forget it ,but while waiting for food they sure kept us plenty with drinks and had the nerve to charge us $90 in the end ,after they couldn&#39;t get out food right because they kept getting us to order drinks. Guess what my Mother&#39;s Day dinner still never happened ,and I still haven&#39;t eaten..... Possibly the worst experience EVER !!!

Not the best service at this location, others nearby are definitely better. We came in for a weekday lunch and had issues with basically the entire experience. We had issues getting a table (we checked in to the host, they said our table was being almost ready and just being cleaned, then as we waited for our table, they seated 4 other groups of the same size that came in after us, so we had to remind them we were waiting), issues with our meals (entree salads were 95% lettuce - seriously lacking in toppings and dressing that make an entree salad worth the price they charge), communication with our waitress (asked for extra dressing for 2 different salads, brought one container of dressing and didn&#39;t say which one it was for, then when I asked for a to-go container later on she asked for which salad so she knew they needed different dressings). <br>2 stars for ambiance and the fresh bread, the rest of the meal was seriously dissapointing, especially compared to the other locations not too far away.

The wait on Saturday night is literally insane. There is a 30 minute wait JUST TO GET a PAGER. Then you have to wait for them to call your pager. Your alternative is to fight like cavemen at the bar upstairs. Warning: People are vicious and it&#39;s kill or be killed like the African Sahara. I let a woman and baby, rightfully, grab a high table, but then there is NO ORDER. People just grab and jump in front and grab even though you&#39;ve been waiting clearly before them. They really need to institute a list or line at least.

Just had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove it was amazing! Our server was Demetrie, really sweet guy and took care of us very well. <br>After a long day at work all I wanted was a good drink and a really great dinner with my boyfriend &amp; that&#39;s what we got and more.<br>Thank you Demetrie for taking care of us, you&#39;re such a sweetheart.

This is a good place to go to for casual dinning and if you have special occasion to celebrate.<br>We had chicken &amp; shrimp jambalaya &amp; their special big  chicken burrito both were good.<br><br>Also, I had 2 sangria&#39;s, I would not get them again, the fruit wasn&#39;t fresh and it tasted like it was just thrown together...BLAH!  Sangria is suppose to be made over night so all the juices of the fruit &amp; wine have time to marinate together this 100%%% was not!<br>Now the fantastic cheesecake TOASTED MARSHMALLOW SMORES TO DIE FOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<br> WOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW<br>FANTASTICCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC

Decided to take the kids to the Grove and hang out and have lunch. Well, went to get seated at the restaurant and got in right away as it was about noon. The only problem is it took over 18 minutes to even get acknowledged. Eleven minutes in I went to the hostess and said we have been here for over eleven minutes and completely ignored. She said she would send someone right over, yep, 7 minutes later. This was still after she said she would get us our drinks and never did. Ruined the whole lunch. Not going to this location again. I would have left but kids told me to relax. Two stars are for the salads we had. Many locations in the Grove, they won&#39;t miss me but we&#39;re not coming back.

1 star for the 30 minute wait turning into a 50 minute debacle. For being seated when the table wasn&#39;t cleaned. For having the worst server ever - never refilled our waters, drinks, nothing. He didn&#39;t check on us once. Until we asked to speak to manager. <br><br>He had other  staff members come by instead. The manager was just as useless. I hate leaving less than 20% -- but for being a restaurant at the Grove, learn what it means to provide CUSTOMER SERVICE <br><br>The food was good. But the shitty service makes me never want to come by again. Get it together CF.

The Cheesecake Factory at the Grove is pretty easy to find. Parking can be validated after you eat at the front desk downstairs. An escalator and stairs are the only access to get up to the second floor where the restaurant is located. Very intimate, dark inside but I enjoyed it. Our waitress was very nice and helpful. We ordered two items from their lunch menu which were the pizza and salad combo, and the pasta. They were considered &#34;smaller/lunch&#34; portions but I honestly felt they were pretty big already. The pizza was great! Salad was good, we ordered the Cesar salad with cheese and dressing on the side. I also ordered a fettuccine Alfredo in which you can add chicken to, but I passed and tried it by itself. It was sooo filling but it was good, thick, creamy! For dessert I had their &#34;original&#34; cheesecake which was also great!! Can&#39;t wait to come back for more but I&#39;ll have to try something else rather than the pastas.

Love Cheesecake Factory!!! However watching the staff play around with the manager and hostess when people are waiting to be seated is unacceptable! <br>There was at least 20 empty tables on a Tuesday at 2:00 and I waited over ten min without being seated while watching the manager talk to the staff about his pen and laughing about stuff that was not work related. I walked out annoyed and ate lunch at La Piazza, where I was seated immediately. Get it together Cheesecake Factory!!!
Had the gumbo and it was really good.  Lunch with my coworkers and everyone said their food was good.

Perfect vegan salad and great waiter Tyler. What I enjoyed the most is how good the food was and the waiter being so involved with the selection of food and making sure what I ordered was vegan with no dairy products.

(1) the line was a 40 minute wait before our buzzer went off, when the buzzer went off and we went upstairs and (2) waited an additional 15 mins before being seated (3) the food took 40 minutes to come and then  (4) tab took me reminding the waiter  twice and another waitress... honestly you&#39;d do better a McDonald&#39;s .

Haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in years and probably won&#39;t be back for another few. <br><br>Friday around noon, restaurant not very busy. Sat at the bar, service was fine. Ordered a burger MEDIUM WELL and fries. Fries were over cooked, burger was under cooked. As soon as I cut into it it created a greasy bloody puddle and made the bun soggy. I had to cut the 2 halves in half so I could eat around the edges that weren&#39;t red. I would&#39;ve been fine with a slight pink center but this was medium at best. Basically I got half of a burger, a few fries and a soda for $23. If the burger was cooked as well as the fries and the fries were cooked as much as the burger it would&#39;ve been perfect. <br><br>Stick with the cheesecake. I should have.
Always good to come to any Cheesecake Factory. Great service, yummy food but  average drinks.

I think this place is pretty average. My friend and I went last night and waited 15 minutes to be seated, this is not bad at all considering it was a Thursday night. I ordered the Asian chicken salad. Big portion but not a lot of flavor. My friend got chicken tacos. He said they were delicious. The server was ok. Overall an average experience. Unfortunately, I probably wouldn&#39;t go back.

I had one of the worst experiences at cheesecake. The host was horrible to me and decided to ignore me completely. It was around 8pm and I asked two times how long is my wait time and she ignored me with no eye contact or anything and just spoke to the person next to me who was already getting helped by someone else and she went back to ignoring me. I had to yell out to her in order for her to help me. I felt as though she was Doing racist act towards me and ignoring me because of my color. This was so wrong and I have never felt so disrespected anywhere else . HORRIBLE HOST SERVICE from this specific person.

I was shopping with K, all of a sudden, we saw this famous Cheesecake Factory. Without any hesitation, we walked in and had a wonderful lunch experience. I ordered the recommended chicken pasta with tropical smoothie and those were great! This place is nothing like that &#34;cheesecake factory&#34; in TBBT, but this is a nice restaurant .

3 stars for food but the service was so appalling I can only give one star. I would strongly recommend avoiding this place if you want to have a dining experience that won&#39;t leave you wishing you&#39;d just stayed in. Rude waiter and even ruder food runner. <br>I&#39;m sure not everyone has this kind of experience but I&#39;ll certainly not be coming back and I would warn everyone against it too.

They flat out lied about the Impossible Burger. I asked for it medium rare. They said they couldn&#39;t do that because Impossible burgers are veggie burgers and therefor arent supposed to be cooked half way. The &#34;chef&#34; and the management said the same. Either they were just making this up or the Cheesecake factory corporate headquarters told them to lie. But the whole idea, the party trick, the magic of the Impossible burger is that it cooks like a real burger. It&#39;s advertised as being best when pink and red in the middle. If you cook it all the way through it&#39;s just a lifeless Puck like any other. Again, if they had refused on the grounds of policy that&#39;s one thing. That&#39;s bad but it&#39;s not lying. They tried to talk to me like I was someone who had never had a Impossible burger and told me that you can&#39;t cook Impossible burgers that way, that that the only way they can be prepared, which is a real rip off not just to the customers but even more so to the Impossible Burgers company. How many people who&#39;ve never had an impossible burger tried one based on all the hype, then got this dry overcooked Grey lump and it just confirmed to them that they still don&#39;t like veggie burgers? Cheesecake factory has never been a good restaurant. But being sub mediocre is their right. But lying about a product? Slandering another brand with falsehoods? Isn&#39;t that against the law?
Came in for drinks and an appetizer during happy hour. Jadi was super personable, cool, and an overall pleasure to be around. Thanks for the great service
Excellent food and great service!  Love this location and the wait wasn&#39;t bad for a party of 4 on a Sat @ 1pm.

I can never remember which dishes I&#39;ve tried here...but the ones I can definitely remember and love are their cobb salad with balsamic dressing, thai lettuce wrap, crabcakes, avocado eggrolls, da vinci pasta, jambalaya pasta, lousiana pasta, and shrimp and chicken gumbo.<br><br>Also, who can resist their complimentary bread, right?!<br><br>anyways... cheesecake factory is always a good place to go for Italians and nice atmosphere

service is not award winning at all. food not the best version of cheesecake factory. i could have just been the string of employees we encountered. i had the biscuits and gravy meal. biscuits were burned. never happened in 15 years of going to different ones. if gordon ramsey came here he might pop his lid, just sayin...

I would have gave it 5 stars but the reason was that their Strawberry Martini was $11.98 that is pretty outrageous. <br><br>I ordered Chicken Madeira and my husband ordered a Factory Burrito. Let me tell you that burrito was massive (Monster burrito) and he loved it. he just didn&#39;t finish it.<br><br>**Make sure to ask how much is the booze. lol

Quite the &#34;eh&#34; experience. Wouldn&#39;t be my first pick, wouldn&#39;t be my last. Everything was very mediocre. Happy hour pricing is vey reasonable of you sit at the bar. We had about 4 appetizers, 1 entree and an additional side dish. Bill was 60 dollars which is not bad for 2.<br><br>Our waitress was super sweet and did the best she could with being attentive. Everything took a while but it wasn&#39;t anything super ridiculous. If you&#39;re just getting out of work and wanna drop in for a small bite and some cheap drinks, recommend it. <br><br>But side note like come on with making servers and bartenders dress like the help. It&#39;s 2016 and you can have a fine dining experience without having your server running around in a sweaty Oxford shirt 3 sizes too big for them. It makes me uncomfortable because I know they are uncomfortable!

Extra star for a nice server; got there right when they opened up and things were just not ready to go; confusion as to what area was open and who was serving that area; we finally got an attentive server to assist; basic egg breakfast was ok- greasy potatoes, super hard bagel; avocado egg rolls also were also really greasy and dipping sauce that went with them was odd- like sweet and curry like. Coffee refills were plentiful but never actually hot. This place is much better for lunch and especially dinner, as their entrees and service then seem to be much more in point.

We were very excited to come and eat at the grove. However, we waited for more than 2 hours and 30 minutes. We came in at 5:30 and put ourselves on the list. Only to be told to come back in 30 mins for the buzzer. It is now 8:22 pm and we still haven&#39;t gotten seated.!!!!!!!
This is for sure the worst Cheesecake Factory location. They overlooked my shrimp and we waited over an hour for the table. Below average experience all around.

Wish I could possibly give this place no stars. I&#39;m usually always at this location with friends! last night I had the worst customer service experience ever! Our Waiter Lamar needed to be reminded constantly about our order. The worst part however came later on when I realized I lost my wallet, not only were they giving me the complete run around but they made sure every person I spoke to about my wallet gave me a completely different story. At all cost please do not sit at Lamars table, I&#39;m sure he found it, left him cleaning our table, and never turned anything in! <br><br>Also try avoiding the Manager Angela, said she looked at the camera, left me a message and no such thing happened! it&#39;s really hard supporting a company who doesn&#39;t care about their customers, wouldn&#39;t check the cameras for a loyal client and her friends, and had no sympathy  at all, in fact teased me about my wallet and being so careless!<br><br>god bless

If you are not in a rush then get yourself a seat at the bar ( if you are lucky enough) and have some calamaries. Plates are big as well as the drinks so split the food and bills. Then .. you will be able to watch your favorite movie. <br><br>Families and big groups are welcome with the craziness that could also bring. Recommended.

We had a terrible experience.<br>We came there on a Tuesday night for my daughters 9th birthday. <br>The waiter held a tray full of drinks, including coffee, virgin daquiries, lemonade, and water, over my daughters head.  When she moved in her chair, he spilled the contents of the tray all over my child and into my purse and coat and me.  We were soaked.  My daughter was crying and sticky.  The waiter did not get a manager (the restaurant was so busy that it was hard to get any help). Instead he refused to even assist me with drying my coat and purse, and told me that there was nothing he could do about it.  He brought towels and wiped up the floor.  My daughter was a wet wreck.  She was sticky and her spirits were soured.  Despite the fact that my purse was swimming with water with the contents ruined, I attempted to bring up the mood so as to help my daughter forget the unpleasantness.  At the end of the meal... no one was around to help.  I tried to wave down assistance for 20 minutes... the evening was getting late.  I got up to leave with my family when finally a check was brought to me.  They not only charged me for everything, there were even additional drinks added to the list that were not ordered. I was in a hurry to leave, and I didn&#39;t want to get my daughter upset by arguing, so I quickly paid the check and even added the standard gratuity.<br>When I called the next day regarding what happened so that my dry cleaning would be covered, they kept me on hold for 15 minutes before some manager named Cindy said &#34;that&#39;s not what my waiter told me&#34;  and that &#34;no one heard a child cry&#34; and that &#34;you could have called a manager&#34;<br>Avoid this place.<br>The staff are only superficially nice, but deep down they hate their customers<br>Who would pour a tray of drinks on people and then not pick up their dry cleaning bills.<br>They don&#39;t have enough service -- make you wait before you get in and also make you wait as you sit for service.<br>Avoid this place like the plague.

This location is probably my favorite. Dined in the bar area waiter came right over took our orders but was unsure about the orders management came out just to double check our orders and food was prepared great give 5 stars for today&#39;s experience this location never disappoints.

Bordering on 3.5 - 4 stars. I feel like I can&#39;t exclaim &#34;I&#39;m a fan!&#34; because the food wasn&#39;t knock my socks off to die for. It was yummy - but I wouldn&#39;t scale any cliffs to get at it.<br><br>I came with my boyfriend and we had the lunch special (turkey sandwich, green salad, and soup of the day) ($11ish), the Shrimp dinner (6 pieces of large shrimp, fries, and cole slaw) ($16ish), a strawberry lemonade ($4.50), and a Guinness ($5.50). We also chowed down on some of that delicious complementary bread they have.<br><br>Even though the lunch special is supposed to be &#39;smaller&#39; (a half sandwich) it does come with a full bowl of soup and a nice portion of salad. This alone was tooooooo muchhhhhh foooooood. Honestly, the sandwich and the soup would have been plenty. The soup of the day was a lentil based soup and it was super yummy! The green salad had a nice vinaigrette dressing, however the sandwich was just turkey and a slice of tomato and was easily forgettable. <br><br>The shrimp was nice and juicy. The sauce that came with it added a nice kick that was cooled with the tartar sauce. This meal was huge and I think that the boyfriend and I could have been very content just sharing that. <br><br>Service was okay. He was friendly and there when needed. Nothing to really write home about. <br><br>I should have tried the cheesecake but I always order too much damn food here to ever get around to desert. Next time I&#39;m just going to order the soup and a big fat slab o&#39; cake!

I don&#39;t normally complain about one of my favorite places to eat but the other day was the last straw. I ordered wings but they came out burnt and had barely any buffalo sauce on them. Their food is not so great anymore as it used to be. Give it two stars cause of the desert but wouldn&#39;t recommend eating at this restaurant anymore.

My friend took me to Lunch yesterday at the Grove location...Our Mistake ...on a Saturday.  I had Never been to Any Cheesecake Factory....and I&#39;m not sure I will again. Given that it was a Saturday...we had to wait to be paged...but to have to Wait an additional 24 minutes ...for a Turkey sandwich....WTH ? The sourdough bread ( type of roll) was a ROCK..I had to &#34;eat the Turkey OUT of the bread&#34;...Server said she Could Exchange the bread....but after waiting 24 minutes for my Lunch....NOT

An obvious choice for families and they know how to accommodate but I did learn a few tricks. Instead of taking advantage of their high chairs which I thought were a bit too low for the table, I used my own booster seats. But discovered the same problem - the table was eye level so the boys&#39; had to reach up a bit to grab the food.<br><br>For more, check out my site - link in profile!
Our server was ok. The wait was long. He set down all the tickets and didn&#39;t hand them to any of us.

I chose this place to celebrate my birthday. I knew I was going to have a large party (11 people total). I called them days in advance AND the day off at 10am to let them know that a large party was coming for dinner that day. They didn&#39;t take reservations and they said to call back closer to the time to get a more accurate wait time. I called an hour and half before 6:30 pm (on my way to the grove) and I told them my party size and they said they couldn&#39;t give me an estimated wait time unless I was there in person. Still holding on to hope because I had never been here but love the grove for it&#39;s magical ambiance. I arrive to put my name down and they tell me it&#39;s a 3 HOUR WAIT! I was expecting at the most an hour and half (like everyone  else was being told). I KNEW this would happen which is why I called SO MANY times in advance to warn them a large party was coming but they didn&#39;t do anything to accommodate and make us wait even longer than everyone else... it absolutely spoiled my birthday filling me with both outrage and sadness because my entire party had travelled to get here only to be expected to wait to eat until 9:30pm. It would have been nice to know on any of the previous phone calls that the wait time could be up to 3 HOURS instead of telling me to be there in person AND then turn away my entire party once they arrived. How does that even make sense?!?

My daughters love the bread and pasta at Cheesecake Factory so we go at least once a month. Well, last two visits were not great but we accepted it since things can go wrong.  However when it is your third time! I had to say something. Gratefully the manager was very nice to apologize. Didn&#39;t have to take the food off the bill but he was very apologetic. However the server.... no.  I don&#39;t think I can go back for a while. The food took 40 min to come out and order was wrong. Food was burnt.  Not an initial apology from the server. Gave some tips and three stars for the manager. Seriously my daughters (under age 10) even noticed she was not good both time as a server. Seriously Cheesecake Factory?

What a Great experience!!! This isn&#39;t my first time visiting at cheesecake factory. But it is my first time visiting this location! A year ago I was diagnosed with celiac disease and it&#39;s hard to go out. Cheesecake factory makes it very easy and enjoyable!! Surprisingly, they have a large variety of completely gluten-free appetizers, salad, entrées, and even pastas! <br>Tristan gave us the best service and went over and above to answer all our questions!!!! The bus boy (Baltazar) even overheard us wishing we had asked for water to go, and went out of his way to get it, even though they were closed!<br>***I didn&#39;t even mention the gorgeous view from the balcony that overlooks the gorgeous Christmas lights at the grove!!! <br>Hands-down to this place! Highly highly recommend it!!

This place can have pretty fast service during off-peak hours. During off-peak hours i get seated really quickly.<br><br>However, weekend nights (Friday-Sunday), they get really busy and waits can take up to an hour for a party of 2.  Also, during those times, waiter service gets really slow as they have to deal with many other tables.  One time, our party of 8 had to wait over an hour to get our food served, which was really ridiculous.  My dad ended up talking to the manger, and he apologized, which I really appreciated.<br><br>My go-to dishes are-- <br>Appetizers: Spinach and Cheese dip, Avocado Egg Rolls, Sweet Tamale Corn Cakes, Buffalo Blasts (ask for honey mustard dipping sauce), Stuffed Mushrooms<br><br>Entrees: Spicy Chipotle chicken pasta, Louisiana Chicken Pasta, Chicken Marsala, Crusted Chicken Romano, Thai Chicken Pasta, Miso Salmon<br><br>Desserts: Tiramisu<br><br>You can ask for extra sauce for the pasta entrees, which is really great.  <br><br>I find that this cheesecake factory makes their dishes more flavorful than the Cheesecake Factory in Palo Alto (which is weird, considering it&#39;s a chain restaurant and you would expect them to have the same recipe at each chain).<br><br>There is happy hour from 4-6pm on weeknights, ONLY if you are seated at the bar.  Happy hour features $5 appetizers and select drinks, which is a bargain!

Horrible experience! The two white girls that give the wait time kept skipping me and my girlfriends and letting other people go ahead of us and we waited TWO HOURS! Not including for the waiter to take our order. He did not even apologize for taking long! I would much rather go to The Americana. Never ever coming here again bad communication BAD SERVICE!

This cheesecake is a great location with a cute balcony seating. Love it for brunch, lunch and dinner. The drinks are great with lots of great choices. There is pages and pages of menu for any taste with large portion of salad and pastas. ... And finally the dessert... If u manage to save room, it is a definite must try. Of course I won&#39;t forget their yummy fresh baked warm breads. Hint: get balsamic vinaigrette dressing as bread dip.
This place has incredibly slow service.  The waiters do their utmost, but they&#39;re fighting a losing battle when they&#39;re so understaffed.  Unfortunately the food quality is also inconsistent.

We have the chicken pot stickers for the first time. They were amazing. They came in white ginger sauce with sesame seeds and shaved green onions on top. We split the chicken because I did because it is such a large dish.

I remember last year in September 20 my family and a few of my cousins we all went to eat in Cheesecake Factory. When we went inside the restaurant I was like oh my god!!! It was a big restaurant and super fancy at that with a lot of customers <br><br>The service was really good. The workers were friendly people and not rude at all to every customers. In the restaurant the customers were also really friendly and everyone was enjoying their food.  There was many good food in the restaurant. All the selection of food that they had looked delicious. The price looked expensive but in the plate they gave you a lot of food and the plate wasn&#39;t a small one it was a big plate. I remember that i ordered a chicken shrimp soup and it was the best soup I ever had in my life. I just wish that i would have gotten more shrimp than chicken. My brother ordered some nachos and it came with A LOT of cheese and meat. It was a huge plate in my opinion. After we finished eating we all ordered cheesecakes. I order a new York style cheesecake. It was super delicious. My cousin ordered a double cheese burger or some type of burger but damn it was really big and with the mouth of cheese it had i think it look like a juicy burger.<br><br>I would recommend this to all my friends especially one of my close friend Maricruz because I am pretty positive that she will love it, she loves cheesecake and i would say hey i found the best cheesecake ever and you should try it in Cheesecake Factory it is worth it!!

This has to be the worst experience i have had... The hostess was extremely rude and wouldn&#39;t put my name on the list yet continued to take other parties! I felt so disrespected.. As if i wasn&#39;t good enough to be placed ??? So i asked her why she completely ignored me and continued to take other parties ... She looked at me and told me i had to wait? Well i been in line and yet u continue to take parties from the sideline ??   I just left and took my business to the restaurant across ... And there was no wait and the food was delicious!! U guys have to try Morels steakhouse  .:: best experience ever!

Had the worst experience at this Cheesecake Factory.  First, we were overwhelmed by the strong smell of patchouli oil that one of the staff was wearing.  It was so bad, my friend told the manager about it.  The manager was apologetic and said she would say something to the employee.  <br><br>We ordered our food - our waiter was great. Very nice and personable.  He walked away to put in our order. Suddenly, a woman and her young child are rushing towards our table - the woman has a napkin over the girls mouth, and the girl is vomiting into the napkin and on the floor.  A waitress points the woman in the direction of the bathroom and proceeds to cover the vomit on the floor with a few napkins.  Other wait staff did the same thing with the vomit path leading to the bathroom.  <br><br>My friend and I watched as the wait staff walked over and slipped on these napkins, for almost 10 minutes. Finally, my friend tells one of them that they should probably clean it up properly before someone slips and falls.  Someone brought out a swiffer type dry mop and cleaned it up without soap and water. Not very sanitary for a place that serves food. <br><br>We received our food - teriyaki chicken and a turkey burger.  The chicken was ok, but the rice was under cooked and hard.  The turkey burger was bland and dry.  We didn&#39;t want to send any food back because at this point, we just wanted to get out of there. <br><br>Safe to say, I will not be going back to this location.

Ok just have the red velvet cheesecake because it is amazing and totally worth how ever fat it might make you. Turtle cheesecake is an amazing runner up if you&#39;ve already had the red velvet. Peach Bellini is also delish. Pizza is always amazing. Turkey burger is never good. Service is always pretty good despite how busy they are. I love to go here with my book and just read and have some dessert. I also love that it&#39;s at The Grove so I can go look around or shop afterwards or before. <br>Really really yummy. They would be totally lost without the cheesecake though.

Took my son and foster kids out for lunch here today.<br>The service was good. Thank you Sophia.<br> One adult and 4 kids having a day out at the Grove.<br>We started with the spinach and artichoke dip. It was good but a little on the cold side. The kids ordered the kids Mac n cheese, kids pizza and kids chicken quesadilla. Really can&#39;t go wrong with kids food, ya know. <br>I had tried the grilled salmon last time and it was dry and too cooked. Asked for not too well this time and it was raw inside. Asked for the Tataki salad to go. Will rule on it once I get to eat it.<br>Ok a little ticked at the Tataki salad. Nothing anywhere says it has ginger. I hate it when people eliminate stuff like that from the menu. If you are going to add a garnish, especially if something so pungent, put it on the G- D menu!! I could&#39;ve opted out of it! I H8 ginger! Can&#39;t stand the sight, smell or taste of it.<br>The portion size of ahi tuna looked great and then BAM!!! Ginger overwhelmed it!<br>Seriously considering reducing the 3 stars I gave!
We always go here with my family on the weekends, menu is very traditional and huge. You can split one between two and still will be left overs. My kids usually take pasta carbonara.

Ordered a whole cheesecake for my birthday party. Picked it up at 12pm &amp; served it at 8pm, still frozen. They gave me a frozen cheesecake. I asked, when I picked it up, if there were any special instructions but they said no. <br><br>It wasn&#39;t like an ice cream cake. A frozen cheesecake is like a rock. Very disappointing as my guests could not eat it (though they made an attempt to lick it like a Popsicle.)  Also disappointing as silly me actually thought they made their cheesecakes fresh there. <br><br>Wrote a letter to the manager who sent me a generic letter. My name or date wasn&#39;t on the letter. There was no explanation. Just a generic letter they print out and mail. No sincerity. And a gift certificate, which was nice.<br><br>Never doing that again. Whole cheesecakes are expensive! Not only that, I had to take time off of work to pick it up. Would have been cheaper and easier to just get a Trader Joes cheesecake and cover it with strawberries. I was so disappointed.
Two stars because I love their food and obviously the cheese cake. BUT, service from hostess is the worst! Even Jack in the box have better service than this place.

My high school best friend, Diane and I, always make a point to stop at the grove for a feature film and some of those deliciousness donuts at the Fairfax. Well this time she was feeling a bit wild and decided we try happy hour at the cheesecake. For just six dollars the very sweet waitress gave me my abbbbsolute favorite, a delish Appletini. Let me say the hustle and bustle at happy hour is quite energetic but if you get there early enough you can find yourself a high top table. Now for the cuisine. The must must must tries are the buffalo tenders. By heavens, if you could but a taste to the word divine it would be these tenders. You must also try the crab and spinach dip, guilty pleasure but hey, when with old gal pals sometimes you have to just throw waistlines to the wind. The best part is right after you can waltz right into the gorgeous movie theatre for the new Melissa McCarthy flick! Ten out of ten stars Cheesecake!!
Worst place ever . They took 2 hour to get a table . Manager was a asshole. The food was bad . Don&#39;t  go there . Duck them being real
Food was very tasty and filling. Could only manage our mains so no room for pudding which was a shame. Service was OK but not spectacular however the restaurant was busy

This place is amazing ! I only tried the cheesecakes and they were really good. The portions are huge so you can totally share and in that sense it is not pricy at all ! The classic one with the strawberry is awesome !

Great food and drinks and service overall but the waiting time was too much, 45 minutes waiting for a text and once you get up stairs to get your table it&#39;s another 15-20 minutes! Ain&#39;t nobody got time for that!

I used to have good respect for Cheesecake Factory, but recently their quality and service has been declining. I have a major allergy issue, and we visited back in March. I ordered and specifically told the server 3 times to make the proper changes. I always get the same thing at other locations and they can accommodate. This server tried to have me to try something else instead, then went and checked with the back and came back to confirm they can do it. The food server (different person) even repeated the food order and the customization to me. After eating it, I started feeling ill. I asked the server again about the custom food and he said that&#39;s what you ordered. After a couple of more bites, I realized they were wrong and it was not customized. So the manager finally came over and confirmed it wasn&#39;t. He offered to pay for the meal of $40 which had no meaning for me and what I went thru that night. Thankfully it wasn&#39;t a hospital visit but still a painful night with no sleep. The manager even asked me for my name and number so he can check on me the next day. Guess what, no call. Probably thought I was a dine and dasher. I have been going to cheesecake since I was in my teens. Now it&#39;s just not something I will refer people to or go myself. I heard they are expanding, and we all know what can get lost during expansion; quality and service. This was a long time ago and I had a accidentally  placed it on the wrong location because of gps update. Sorry for the confusion.

Food was good, however we were planning to order dessert. (Cheesecake anyone?) our server never asked if we wanted dessert, just brought the check which sent a clear message- Get Out! We mentioned this to the host on the way out who said we could&#39;ve told our server we wanted dessert. Gee, never thought of that! The point was we didn&#39;t feel our business was welcomed. I make frequent trips to the Los Angeles area and this is one place I won&#39;t visit again.

Every single time i come here i am so satisfied. Being a server myself, this place goes above n beyond. Everyones super polite, the food is always hot and comes out exactly as ordered. I love my steak here!!

Cheesecake Factory is Cheesecake Factory --- you know what I mean if you&#39;ve eaten at one or another location once or twice.  I almost never try to go to the Grove&#39;s location because it is always packed! People are always waiting and spilling out of the doors. Unless I&#39;m grabbing a slice of cheesecake to go or slipping in to use the ladies&#39; room, you won&#39;t find me there during dinner.<br><br>My group decided they wanted to dine here at 6pm on a super busy evening. I was delighted to learn they can take your cell phone number and text you when your table is ready! I was excited about this and overcame my grumpiness about possibly having to endure waiting because we were able to walk around the stores while we waited for our table. They gave us an estimate of 30 minutes (and I thought... with all these people waiting here? Yeah right!)... and it was actually about 40 minutes when I got the text. Acceptable!<br><br>We sat on the outdoor patio which was nice except for when The Grove started pumping the fake snow (aka soap bubbles) and it started drifting onto our food.<br><br>Foodwise, having previously worked across the street from a Cheesecake Factory, I have the usuals I always order. This particular night, I had the BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad. That thing is like something you can bring to a party to serve 10 people. I&#39;m used to the lunch portion so the dinner portion was just a mountain of deliciousness. I only finished 1/3 of it before being stuffed.<br><br>Other usual favorites: Grilled Shrimp and Bacon Club (without bacon now since I don&#39;t eat pork anymore); Cajun Jambalaya with Brown Rice (instead of pasta); Chicken Masala; Mahi Mahi and Shrimp Veracruz; Vietnamese Summer Rolls; Avocado Egg Rolls...<br><br>Favorite cheesecake: I&#39;m a cheesecake purist so I love the original! On a wild day, I might order the chocolate tuxedo cream cheesecake. And their chocolate truffle cake is AMAZING if you&#39;re in the mood for choco-heaven.

I love the Cheesecake Factory. You usually can never go wrong eating here.  I love The Grove location but this visit wasn&#39;t so good. Quality of the food wasn&#39;t great. My daughter ordered a bacon cheeseburger and the bacon was so burnt and greasy. I can&#39;t believe they actually put it on her burger. It looked like burnt beef jerky.  It was literally black and greasy. I brought it to the attention of one of the waitresses and she had some NEW bacon cooked and brought out to us.

GUESS WHAT?  THEY DON&#39;T SELL CAKE @ THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY!<br><br>Why would anyone review The Cheesecake Factory? I mean, do people review McDonalds?
