Ok... ok, maybe it&#39;s not as mainstream as I think it is but let&#39;s take a quick look at the bell curve before I make my point:<br><br>A) Outliers to the left are blurbing one liners because they have been paid/incentivized to opinion-ate in bulk.  <br><br>B) Masses in the center are either truly pleasantly surprised or remorsefully aggravated.<br><br>C) Outliers to the right are convinced their opinion matters and suffer from diarrhea-of-the-mouth, and therefore check-in to Yelp even when they visit aunt Sally&#39;s restroom.  Don&#39;t be offended.  I&#39;m secretly trying to catch up to you.   <br><br>Currently I&#39;m a B. <br><br>With that said I am remorsefully aggravated.  My family and I decided to celebrate my stepfather&#39;s birthday at The Cheesecake Factory.  We are busy people.  Picking up a cake for any reason on a Thursday in the midst of our demanding lives isn&#39;t something we do.  So The Cheesecake Factory seemed like a no-brainer, right?<br><br>One would imagine.  <br><br>I thought my waitress would be impressed when I flashed my baller smile and said, &#34;We&#39;d like to order an entire cake.  It&#39;s his birthday :).&#34; <br><br>Turns out, &#34;Whole cakes are frozen but I&#39;ll check with my manager.&#34;  Proceeded by, &#34;Yeah, we don&#39;t do that.&#34; <br><br>Hmmmmmm.  <br><br>So basically what I was subliminally told was: <br><br>1.) I can&#39;t offer you what you want, but I&#39;m going to double-check and make sure what I&#39;ve been trained to say is really true because it doesn&#39;t even make sense to me. <br><br>2.) Yes, we may have an entire display case of all sorts of cakes ready to go but we&#39;d rather let them mesmerize the window gawking dieters than profit off of you.  Only Jesus knows why. <br><br>How does this story end?  Drinks thrown at the manger&#39;s face?  A vengeful dine and dash? No.  We gracefully ordered 6 variations of cheesecakes and asked the waitress to at least attempt a nice presentation.  Hopefully they&#39;d figure out how to form a pie from six slices.<br><br>Needless to say--they didn&#39;t.  Also needless to say, I&#39;m smart enough to realize that kind of money can buy better service with or without an entire cake.

Had to be the worst experience we have ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. The music was way too loud, so much so that the server messed up orders. We passed on ordering appetizers because she said that the orders would be up quickly,  but that was not so so we awkwardly sat there ,because once again the music was so loud we couldn&#39;t even have any conversation. When our food did arrive ,my daughters pasta came without mushrooms because our server thought she said she didnt want any , also my daughters drink order was wrong but it took soo long to get it she just took what they gave. My waffles were burnt ,but again it took soo long I wasnt about to wait another 30 minutes. Needless to say I expected more , sad when Pleasanton, Irvine ,and Riverside are by far out perform..Unfortunately we were treating a friend from Japan and disappointed that this will be his one and only experience with a CF...

Do not recommend to go here. As I walked in the hostesses were not paying attention to any guests entering I approached the counter and they were too busy talking to each other. <br>The wait was suppose to be about an hour hostess asks for a phone number and never repeats it to see if she got it correct.  After an hour and a half of waiting I decided to leave two and a half hours later still no text letting me know my table is ready I will definitely not be attending this place again.

First time the other week at this location and it was awesome! I went with my grandma during the week on a cold rainy day. When we entered we went up the escalators after being greeted by the hostess and it was beautiful going up. The interior reminded me of the Ceasars Palace in Vegas.. really pretty inside. We had terrific service can&#39;t remember our waiters name but he was talkative and great! Food was amazing and I thought the Marina location was my favorite yet this may be the winner. I love their avocado spring rolls, the bellagio, chicken romano, bang bang chicken, and the red velvet Cheesecake. Soooo good!!! I&#39;ll be coming back.

I was so disappointed!!! I thought for sure this place would be awesome since it&#39;s at &#34;The Grove&#34; but was I sadly mistaken. I have never been to a more disorganized restaurant in my life!  It started with the rude hostess and overly crowded waiting area downstairs, then as they herded us upstairs to the second overly crowded waiting area. The waiters/waitress all looked liked they wanted to be anywhere but there doing their job! Our food came out and mine was wrong. My daughter ordered the pizza  oh let me rephrase that...A cracker with sauce and a sprinkle of cheese on top. I will never go there, nor will I ever recommend it to anyone!!! Sorry Cheesecake factory. and yes...I did let the manager know!

Wonderful courteous service by Travis G. He anticipated our every need from water to napkins and generous recommendations. He was patient with our party as we celebrated my mother&#39;s birthday. Travis was attentive and proactive with our entire dining experience. Thank you Travis G. We appreciate outstanding service which is rare these days.

Food is ok. The music is sooooo depressing. Makes you want to reach for the razorblades~ it&#39;s funerial! Service is super slow~ actually inconsistent. Two people left because no one came to their table for half an hour. I guess you have to individually ask for water because they brought my sister one and none for me.<br>Waiter is a nice guy but didn&#39;t even notice he served me a dirty mug with a hair in it ~<br>Someone please change this morose music!

My daughter was celebrating her 12th birthday on Tuesday, August 9, 2016 with shopping and chose Cheesecake Factory at The Grove for lunch.  We were sat immediately and noticed all the flatware had dried food. We asked waitress for new place settings.  She returned and again flatware was filthy.  On the 3rd attempt, all looked good until she started placing the knives down, my daughter noticed they had food.  Exasperated the waitress replied she would just be bringing us plastic because we were picky!  I replied that while dining at a National Chain, sit down restaurant that we were not being picky and most definitely expected clean flatware.  Due to her rude handling of the situation, we elected not to dine here.  <br><br>I also spoke to the manager and expressed my disappointment at the handling of this situation.
Really bad. Silverware not washed... I wouldn&#39;t recommend to go to this location. Will never come back anyways.....

Want to indulge in delicious food? Want to have delicious cocktails? Want to have decadent desserts? This is the place for you. Yes, it&#39;s a chain, but still a good place to eat after a movie or just for brunch. I&#39;ve tried almost all of their cocktails and can&#39;t really decide on a favorite. When the server comes to the table, ask him to not bring the sour dough bread and you&#39;ll get the most delicious and warm bread you&#39;ll ever eat. Sprinkle it with a bit of salt and pepper after buttering it and you&#39;ll see why.

Dinner with the wifey after watching San Andreas .I forgot the young lady&#39;s name that helped us , but she was very kind and helpful &amp; place is very clean.they also validate the parking ticket .

BE ADVISED: I ordered steak Diana and I received stew pieces on my plate. I called up<br>The manager told him I&#39;ve had this dish at multiple cheesecake factories and it is nothing like this, he takes it back and gets me a new one and it is the same exact dish they just warmed it up. It&#39;s called &#34;steak Daine&#34; meaning a while<br>Steak cut in without altering the look of the actual steak not stew pieces. The meat was so brittle and chewy it was disgusting. <br>Also, my friend ordered salmon with shrimp scampi and they gave her the salmon and three pieces of grilled shrimp that was clearly not even in the scampi sauce like other cheesecake factories. They seem to do their own thing in the location. <br>Let&#39;s not forget the rude hosts at the door, they all need to be fired and hire new polite employees. <br>I would never come to this location ever again.

Great food. A little pricey. But great!<br><br>Don&#39;t go on friday/weekends nights - suuuuper crowded. Even if you booked a place in advance (or waited over hour like I did) a lot of people inside makes this place kinda cheap dinery place feeling.

Expect to wait 45 minutes and for your order to be messed up. It&#39;s happened to us on multiple occasions... They&#39;d take forever to bring out the order and then the order would be messed up. I once ordered fish tacos, and one of the tacos didn&#39;t have any fish in it LOL. This Cheesecake Factory is a joke, you&#39;re better off going to the Americana one. Save yourself the time and frustration.

I like this place .. But sometimes the hostess is very unkind with this attitude like she&#39;s  working at Spago&#39;s and believe me I&#39;ve been to Spago&#39;s and the service there is Impeccable But back to cheesecake .factoryAside from that . The food is pretty consistent and I love the atmosphere
I&#39;ve always loved the Cheesecake Factory. Just had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove it was amazing!

It&#39;s been awhile since I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory and it seemed like the only familiar place to eat at in The Grove. The wait time was ridiculous for 2 so we went upstairs to see if we could get bar seating. As we&#39;re waiting for something to open up, a manager looking lady asked us if we were waiting for a bar table and was super nice about it. She then literally asked this couple to leave who apparently had been sitting there for hours. Our waitress kinda made that whole encounter happen but I was super impressed and grateful that a chain like this would do such a nice thing. <br><br>I ordered the Cheesecake Factory chardonnay by Mondavi, avacado eggrolls, and the skinnylicious flatbread. The wine was great and nicely priced. The eggrolls are always amazing and I felt like the portions were bigger than what I remembered (a plus fo sho). Surprisingly, I got stuffed from all the food. I couldn&#39;t even finish the flatbread which was pretty small. <br><br>Our waitress was super chill and accommodating. Very honest type and not trying to push the menu too much like some of the other Cheesecake&#39;s. I like that this restaurant has a nice outdoor eating area that overlooks The Grove. I&#39;m sad I&#39;ve never been able to eat out there because the wait at this location is always so long. I appreciate that a familiar place like this is at The Grove.

Somehow I found myself waiting entirely too long for a BBQ chicken pizza. The first one was burnt. OK. Then it seemed to have taken an additional 30 minute to bring the second one out. I realize that is not the servers fault. The avocado rolls were fine. And everyone in my party got their food. I just didn&#39;t get my pizza until everyone was damn near done. The server was ok. The saving grace is that it is my grandfather&#39;s birthday.  Perhaps management can make sure the kitchen staff stops falling asleep at the switch.

Not sure why I would give this corporate behemoth a chance, but I did and they proved to be disgusting. Crappy uninspired food churned out like a factory would. Never again. At least the cheesecake was decent.

Received excellent service even though they were busy. My family and I felt well taken care of. The food as usual hits the spot and cannot rave enough of the Avocado Eggrolls lol. I go to Cheesecake just for those rolls lol.

Came here late after a movie next door and wanted to find somewhere for dessert. +1 for staying open til 12:30 on Friday nights!<br><br>I hateeeee that Cheesecakes typically don&#39;t let you put in reservations, but b/c it was late (10? 11?), we had a really short wait. Not sure why they needed to give us a buzzer to wait 3 minutes, but it was whatevs.<br><br>The hostess and hosts were pretty lackluster... not sure if it&#39;s because it was late at night and they were exhausted, or that&#39;s how they usually are, but I was unimpressed by their (lack of) friendliness.<br><br>But, our actual waitress was friendlier and gave us her $.02 in what to order. We did the Tiramisu Cheesecake and the ... Chocolate Tuxedo? Something like that. They were both good! She mentioned her &#34;top 10&#34; so we asked her to tell us what was in it... and I felt like she started making it up after the first few, but she tried :)

Food was fine. My husband left his sunglasses in the booth. When we returned a few minutes later to retrieve them the server tried to deny taking the glasses. Then another server told the other server that he broke down the table so he should have them. The hostess gave us attitude for asking about the sunglasses. Then the server finally said oh yeah I have them. So rude and unprofessional and overall strange. This location is a mess.

Just came back from The Cheesecake Factory after having celebrated two birthdays in our party of 6. <br><br>The following incidents occurred on a Friday night and I&#39;d understand if the waiters were just having a bad day to begin with. However, it does not constitute their rude behavior and unwarranted comments. The other Yelp reviewers were right when they said that the service was bad. I&#39;ve withheld the waiters&#39; names to protect their rights.<br><br>Waiter 1 - Everything was going okay in the beginning and he even took our group photos (not well, unfortunately). Then he wrote down our orders: 1 Da Vinci Pasta, 1 Chicken Scampi, 3 Chicken Madeira, and 1 Bang Bang Chicken. He repeated the order and we thought we were good. Twenty to 30 minutes later, our order arrives, but instead of 3 Madeiras, 2 other waiters bring in 3 Chicken Scampis. We tell them that we only ordered 1 Chicken Scampi. <br><br>The waiters go back and probably caused a commotion because Waiter 1 comes over shortly and says aloud, &#34;Next time, be careful with what you order&#34;, trying to take the blame away from himself and putting it on us. Remember, the guy repeated the order before he left, but he tells us that we got it wrong?  He quickly leaves before we could say anything--we were shocked. <br><br>The manager must have gotten word and came over to apologize about the mistake on our order. We told her what rude Waiter 1 said and we confirmed it was only him, and not the other waitress who also attended to us (but more on her later). The manager offered two soups on the house. This lady, unlike her waiters, has good PR and customer service. She alone deserves a star.<br><br>Waiter 2 - She was the waiter who tended to us for the remainder of the evening. We thought everything was going smoothly, but we were mistaken. One of us in our party had spoken with this waitress early on to let them know that we had 2 birthday celebrants. When it was time for dessert, our friend asked Waiter 2 if she remembered what they spoke about and if they had some kind of birthday treat (which they&#39;ve done in the past, along with singing &#39;Happy Birthday&#39;; they even did it that same night for a different table). Waiter 2 says with an attitude that came out of no where: &#34;We don&#39;t offer free cheesecakes; if we did, everyone would be coming here&#34;. <br><br>First of all, our friend didn&#39;t ask for a free cheesecake. She was trying to help you recall your earlier conversation. Secondly, you are in the customer service industry--what is up with the attitude and why? It seems that Waiter 2, for reasons known only to her, mistook what our friend said. Waiter 2 continues to ask if whether we&#39;d like to order dessert, gives us some time, and leaves to pack up our leftovers. When she came back, we declined in ordering desserts and instead asked for the bill.<br><br>Did we leave a tip? No way. Would anyone in their right mind leave a tip after being insulted? Twice? No, and no thanks. <br><br>We won&#39;t be coming back to this Cheesecake Factory located at The Grove. There&#39;s a long wait (they don&#39;t take reservations), they have rude and untrained waiters, and bad lighting. The only good thing was the manager. Someone give her a raise! With that said, we don&#39;t want any of the waiters to be fired from their jobs; we simply want to let it be known that their attitude and behavior was insulting and uncalled for. <br><br>After this bad experience, we brought our party to Marmalade Cafe at the Farmer&#39;s Market side for dessert. We were met with kindness and great, quality service. Cheesecake Factory, head over to the Marmalade Cafe and you guys might learn a thing or two.

a server came up to us and said to us &#34;you guys can&#39;t sit here i can&#39;t handle anymore tables&#34; after waiting an hour for a table so we had to wait with the hostess for a different tables. THE WAIT HERE TAKES FOREVER. when i asked the male host how long more do we have to wait for a new table he says &#34;i dont care if you guys eat here or not it doesnt effect me&#34;.... after finally being seated, our mood was already ruined by the other two employees. however, Jadi S turned our night around!! she is awesome. i noticed she had a lot of tables to take care of but she never gave us the feeling of being rushed. she is probably one of the best server in my experiences at cheesecake factory!! she was on top of her refill game and got all our orders out in a good timing from appetizer to dessert. she left us really happy after the negative beginning.

I would have given it 5 stars but this time around our server only checked up on us once. It was only to pour water, not to check up on us. Our server didn&#39;t even bother to bring us our food and didn&#39;t offer another plate even though he knew we were sharing. The food was mediocre this time around but satisfying.

Extremely rude people! We were a party of 12 people and had called a couple of days in advance to reserve a table for dinner. They did not take any reservations and were not helpful at all with any suggestions. <br><br>We were asked to reach and hour and a half before we wanted to reach, so as to get a table. We reached an hour earlier than scheduled and were asked to wait for an hour more. Lady at the front desk was rude! We went upstairs to use the restroom and we see 3 tables totally empty! We asked to be seated there or at least be shown our prospective table, but we were out rightly refused. We simple wanted to smack that lady across the face as she was treating us like some unwanted POS. <br><br>We left immediately and walked across the Street to another restaurant. The loss is purely of this place and we will strongly dissuade our friends and family members from visiting this place, where the staff is snobby and arrogant, and treats large groups (the onez who fuel the revenue growth) with disdain! Shame on the management. Get a group of decent people at your restaurant. This is a service industry, where such an attitude will send you spiraling face down in NO time.

Not what I expected, and the servings are so huge. I didn&#39;t even finish my food and I always have a big appetite but this time I was so full. My boy friend and I weren&#39;t pleased either. And the bread they serve as an appetizer is so dull. Despite the wait being an hour I really didn&#39;t enjoy the food.
Best service ever.  The waitress was very friendly, welcoming, accommodating &amp; attentive! Food was great that went along with the nice view from the top balcony seating outside!

This was my first time at this location but I have been to others. The customer service is okay here and so is the food. Nothing to rave about but I have had worse too. Come here if it is convenient or don&#39;t have other options.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, but not this one. Maybe it was just my shitty server (James M.), I was seated quickly, but it took forever for Dumbass James to even acknowledge i was there.  When James finally came over, i knew i had better order my food too, cause god only knows when he would return. He tried to impress me by not writing anything down. Not surprisingly when my order came out it was wrong. Took forever for my meal to be corrected. The manager came out (without me asking) to apologize and comped a drink (should have comped my dinner too). James of course tried to pass the blame to the cooks and insisted on calling me &#34;dude&#34; and &#34;man&#34;. I get more respect at McDonalds. Better service, too. I big let down! I would recommend trying one of the other many nice restaurants in the area. (This was on a slow Tuesday night)

This is the worst place to bring your family not because the food but the waiting time is ridiculous waiting one hours to be sat.  On top of the the customer service is not what I was expecting no one check on us during my visit. If any one is planning to come to this location be aware to spent more than an hour with your family just to get a table.
Very good, a little pricey, large servings. The cheesecake is great. A good spot for an happy hour before a movie next door.

When my bestie and I need a little pick me up we will go to cheesecake factory and just get two pieces of cheesecake togo. She usually gets the Duce de leche and I get the Coffee coco one! &amp; they are delicious!!! But if we have time we usually go for lunch for the lunch specials and the portions are HUGE!!
Love love this place , been here a couple of times , my mom really wanted to come so guess what we came !!! And indeed ! Best food ever !!! Definitely coming back!! And try more food!!!

I always receive great service at this location. Be prepared for a long wait, however, especially on the weekends. I really wish this location had a bigger waiting room. That&#39;s my only gripe with it, the hosts are clearly over it when everyone tries to huddle into this big gigantic swarm of people trying to check in and get a beeper. Everyone ignores the hosts directions to get into a single file line, and there&#39;s always so many people here that a single file line is virtually useless. They need a bigger waiting room for the people who choose to wait at the restaurant. I like the fact that they give you a beeper, because you can browse at the stores nearby while you wait. The servers here are always super courteous, kind, and apologetic. You can tell everyone is trying their best despite the setbacks and complaints about the hour-long waits. This location is definitely in my top 3 Cheesecake locations. I&#39;ll be back for sure.

Haven&#39;t been to this location in ages, forgot how great the service was! Jadi was very attentive and made sure we were in the loop, she checked on us multiple times before we were even ready to order. My brother had dropped $40 out of his pocket onto the floor one of the hostess (cheyenne) was honest enough to pick it up and ask if it was my brothers money. Kudos to her and the company for employing such honest staff. Keep up the good work guys.

I&#39;m not a huge fan of chain restaurants, but the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove is an exception. The food was solid -- nothing too fancy, just like any other Cheesecake Factory -- and the service was adequate. Yet I&#39;m giving this Cheesecake Factory 4 stars mainly because of its location. <br><br>Other than the Cheesecake Factory at Redondo Beach, which I have to say is a gorgeous location, the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove is just as spectacular. This restaurant is perfect for any youngsters out there who&#39;s looking to take a girl out to a nice place and not have to use up their entire life savings. <br><br>Overall this Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t going to blow you away with their food, but if you&#39;re looking for a nice night out with your loved ones or friends then The Cheesecake Factory at the Grove should definitely be a strong option. To good eatings!
This is a nice place, but the lines are crazy long and it is on the pricier side for the food they serve.

Gosh their steak is always well done when I request for medium. Consecutively two times I got my steak well done (tough) instead of medium. however we got it change in a short timing. And because at the same time unfortunately I have eggshell in my meatball (I ordered spaghetti and meatball). The waiter (Alex) got it change as well and they offered us free desserts :)

We ordered many types of food and all of them tasted amazing!! Our waiter was excellent because he would see that a cup is almost empty and wouldn&#39;t think twice about getting them a refill!! We will for sure come back here again!!
Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. Service was great and the food was delicious! What more can I say.........
Terrible service and VERY slow to bring food. I have not ever experienced this kind of service at a Cheesecake Factory restaurant before.
Excellent food.  Great quality well prepared.  But is painfully slow on services and food presentation. <br><br>Could score higher

Wait time was estimated 35 minutes.....Turns into 55 minutes.  I ask how much longer and I&#39;m told fifteen more minutes. Ten minutes after that, I am told 12 more minutes....Get Real!<br><br>&#34;Manager&#34;  HOLLY has to be the most UN-impersonable cyborg I have ever seen in my 48 years on this earth. She literally broke every law of customer service in regards to table side manner. If there was ever a woman in need of Paxil . . . . . . . . <br><br>3.25 for soft drinks??  9.00 a glass for house wine, Under nourish-able portions (for the price) - 4.00 flat rate upcharge on ANY deviation from your order and High wait time is making this place unbearable. REALLY gonna start going elsewhere after this past experience . . . .

OMG I could never say enough good things about this Cheesecake Factory.  The wait is always 45 minutes or more,  however truly worth the wait and we always meet nice people here and the waiters are all friendly, kind and professional. <br>Treat Yo Self!<br>BTW ORDER THE MANGO CHEESECAKE AND TAKE ONE TO GO, Lol

I came here with my best friend for her birthday. Coming in everything was great. The place was spectacular and all. We were impressed. We got our waitress and that&#39;s when everything went downhill. The first waitress was horrible, she did not address me only unless I spoke. She had an attitude and did not disclose that a Cheesecake slice would not be complimentary but she made it believable to be. She hardly checked up on us and we were served more by other waiters. She eventually came back and another waitress with her, Allison, who would be taking her place. Allison was kind, she gave us better service. Well the tab came and I was surprised to find out that the slice of cheesecake wasn&#39;t free so the manager named Daniel came and basically told us we should know that cheesecakes aren&#39;t free. It was my first time celebrating a birthday and I felt like it should be disclosed. He was so unprofessional and rude. Allison, a waitress, was so much more professional than him. I will not be coming back to this location ever again.

I was there a lot of times and in several locations. Cheesecake factory is a good restaurant with pretty big portions for a person. The only thing is that you have to wait a lot to be seated during the weekend.
Wow. Restaurant and bar amazing. Service was outstanding. Food is fair I have to say but ambiance more than makes up for it. 1.5 hr wait was only 45 min.

The experience was so unsatisfying, I didn&#39;t even stay due to poor customer service and racism.<br><br>I came here on Father&#39;s Day expecting seating to be difficult, which it was, but understandable. I was told it would be about a 45 minute wait and accepted what I was told and left with the device that would buzz when a table should be ready<br><br>I went outside to meet up with my family and let them know how long the wait would be, at which point, plans were to change as waiting wasn&#39;t a feasible option.<br><br>And so, I went back to return the device I was handed, but was cut off by a lady. I didn&#39;t mind at the time because I had assumed she would have to wait anyway and I was just trying to return the buzzer. As I stood there, this lady was asking for seating for the same size party as mine and instead of giving her a buzzer to wait, they were immediately able to seat her!<br><br>I was outraged and furious. Instead going to down the list to buzz someone who&#39;s been waiting of the same party size, the chose her instead, a white lady who just walked in. It&#39;s very offensive and very RACIST that they&#39;d be given such exclusive service, especially since the waiting system is electronically systematic, leaving very little problem to find someone else who&#39;s been waiting to fill in the gap.<br><br>The food here isn&#39;t bad, and for the most part, service is good, but the fact that something like that happened where most of what happens is already automated is unbelievable and could only happen with poor people skills and a lack of basic computing.
I don&#39;t like the food here. Weird taste (both on meal and on dessert).<br>One star back for the tasty bread.
I love this place! The avocado egg rolls are to die for!

The first thing you should know is that they DO NOT TAKE RESERVATIONS. This is a well-known restaurant located in a busy shopping mall in the heart of Los Angeles! What the hell do you think is going to happen if you show up at 7 PM on a Saturday night?! You&#39;re going to effing wait. So don&#39;t be a dick to the host or bitch to your friends about it--you CHOSE to come here, you CHOSE a busy restaurant, and you CHOSE to come on a noted DATE NIGHT. So stop being such a moron. If you don&#39;t want to wait for good food and ambiance, hit up a drive-through. *end rant*<br><br>I have never once had bad service here. That already says a lot about this place. I&#39;ve come for lunch, dinner, late night, in between meals, whatever time of day--never gotten a shitty server. In fact, I&#39;ve always left a good tip here. I feel like, for once, my age is not an issue at this place and the server doesn&#39;t treat me like a sub-par customer because I&#39;m not holding a black Amex. <br><br>Food I&#39;ve had here that&#39;s rocked my socks:<br>Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pastai<br>CAJUN JAMBALAYA PASTA!! (my personal favorite)<br>HIBACHI STEAK (server recommended it and it&#39;s amazing!)<br>MISO SALMON <br>Cajun Chicken Littles (my boyfriend gets this EVERY time)<br>Avocado Eggrolls<br>Thai Lettuce Wraps<br>Cheesecake (avoid the low carb one and you&#39;ll find a plethora of tasties)<br><br>Food that&#39;s been good, but not stellar:<br>Chicken Madeira (surprising since it&#39;s their &#34;most popular dish&#34;)<br>Bang-Bang Chicken and Shrimp<br>Chicken Bellagio<br><br>I can&#39;t really speak to their breakfast menu since I&#39;ve never had it here, and judging by their menu, probably never will. I&#39;ve had drinks here before and to be honest, it&#39;s just not worth it. There&#39;s plenty of other places to get drinks and kick back at that have a better drinking vibe. Also, never had any fish dishes here, but I&#39;m curious about them. Maybe next time?<br><br>Go for the food. And sit on the patio!

Put our name in for a table.  Was told 15 minute wait.  We repeated, &#34;15?&#34;  After confirming we sat to wait.  30 minutes later we went to check and is told by the host that the wait is FIFTY minutes and we still have 20 minuted to wait. <br><br>Okay.  BUH BYE!<br><br>Been to this location several times since I can walk here.   Service can be slow.  I&#39;ve tolerated it.  <br><br>But not anymore.  It&#39;s the straw that broke the camels back.
Stopped in for quick drinks. It was nice that a few seats at the bar were open and we didn&#39;t have to wait but my Bloody Mary drink was not the best.

Just so-so. Excellent food (as always) but mediocre service. We spilled some water and it took someone five minutes to come over. When I try to hand the lady I reported it to the bowl of pasta that was filled with water she just stared at it for a full 10 seconds. And she looked at me and said OK but never took it. I looked at her and said well can you take this so we can wipe the table? Sheesh.

I know this is a chain restaurant but it is my favorite chain restaurants every time I order anything I know I will always like it plus the price point is very good and worth every dollar<br>I always the fool and sometimes even a to go box the service is excellent and the Decour is kind a like a new Egyptian style

Food - maybe something is wrong with me, but I like Cheesecake Factory a lot. Maybe it&#39;s because all the food is always exactly what I expect it to be...or maybe because it reminds me of my childhood. Not sure. Anyway, my faves include the salmon firecracker rolls with the yummy cabbage slaw, avocado egg rolls, Chinese chicken salad, and of course their strawberry lemonade. <br><br>Service - always busy, but attentive. <br><br>Final thoughts - it might not be worth the wait on weekends...but you can always try to grab a seat at the bar!

It&#39;s probably best to come here earlier than noon. We arrived at 11:45 am for lunch and were sat right away in the patio as requested. There were also plenty of seats inside as well. (As we were leaving, the place was so packed, there was a line outside the door waiting to put your name in). I think it&#39;s interesting that they have the check in downstairs and seating all upstairs. Escalators take you up and stairs lead the way down. <br><br>Service was good and attentive, he was very patient despite the fact that we were three ladies all together that just wanted to talk, he was always able to politely interrupt our talking to ask us questions and to ask if we wanted to order or if we wanted any refills. <br><br>Foodwise, I ordered the chicken parmesan sandwich. It wasn&#39;t bad, but wasn&#39;t my favorite thing. Could have had some more marinara sauce on the side with it, that part was delicious. They have a skinnylicious menu also for the weight conscious out there. My aunt got a salad that she loved, although it appeared to be side salad sized at a full price. <br><br>Chocolate cheese cake was amazing as always. My mom got the regular cheesecake and that was also up to their standard. I love the cheesecake here. <br><br>Would definitely dine here again and would try something different. The best part about this place is the location, right in the heart of The Grove.

God bless you guys through Christ Jesus!<br>I had the ribeye medium, it was cooked to perfection.  It was the best rib eye, so tender and juicy.  Made Flemings look silly in taste.<br>Mashed potatoes were creamy, And the carrots in pecans or whatever get some!!!!!!!<br>Raspberry chocolate truffle cheesecake to go,<br>And all of my stomachs were happy.<br>I usually go to Beverly Hills one, best kept secret until now.

Awesome food. Great happy hour prices too. Service is fast, friendly and always with a smile. Even if you&#39;re just there for a drink and an appetizer, the great staff treats you like they&#39;re appreciative that you&#39;re visiting. They don&#39;t brush you aside because you just ordered $15 worth of food and then you&#39;re done. Whenever you&#39;re at the Grove, most definitely visit. Theirs always room for cheesecake.

Been here a couple of times.  As others have suggested somewhat typical inviting delicious Cheesecake  Factory, but this one is different because it is at The Grove.  You never know who you might see!  We always ask for the outdoor patio.

I hate to even give these bitches 1star.  They deserve a fucking 0. How dare these rude disrespectful mother fcks had the audacity to have the poorest customer service on my parents wedding anniversary date this past Sunday. They were trying to have a nice dinner and asked for the check and this rude ass bitch caught herself talking to my mother in such a rude ass manner. &#39;Wait a second&#39; no. How about a &#39;just a moment please&#39; or I&#39;ll be right with you? Wtf is wrong with that. People pay with their hard earned money to come out and eat. It just had to be a black waitress acting out. Idk her name but I wish I did. Fuck u bitch!

Yes, yes, yes this place is super good. The customer service from the get go was fantastic. So nice and helpful. No reservation needed. I didn&#39;t wait long to be seated. Very good food and drinks. Try the outside seating for sure. A bit chilly, but nice. Probably best during the summer time when weather warms up for the outside seating. Overall A + +

I usually like coming here, but I guess it wasn&#39;t a good day. I came and they told me 30 minutes. The buzzer never rang. I could&#39;ve took it home with me forever. When I went back I was next and I didn&#39;t like the seating. I felt a bit uncomfortable, and there&#39;s a mirror so it&#39;s awkward looking at myself and people beside me watching me eat. I really liked the waiter, he was a good guy. Come early if you wanna eat here. I once came here and they told me I had to wait a long time. I decided to watch Ant Man at the Pacific Theaters and the buzzer didn&#39;t even ring after that. Definitely make a reservation before coming here. Basically what I&#39;m saying is that you could die and reincarnate and the buzzer still wouldn&#39;t  ring

My water was delivered to me with dried food bits on the inside of the glass and a soapy film on the surface of the water. It was absolutely DISGUSTING and unacceptable. After politely informing the manager I was offered a meager insincere apology. Won&#39;t be coming back.
Great place! Always a fan of Cheesecake Factory. And the one at the Grove is no different. Shout out to there Bloody Mary&#39;s
Visited this location twice while in LA. I loved the fried mac and cheese balls and the Bistro Shrimp pasta! Both items were served fresh and hot and were absolutely delicious.
There was hair in our food, it was quite gross as a blonde staring at this dark hair on my plate made me sick to my stomach...

Food was meh. Bf and I decided to get something different than what we usually get, so he got the grilled rib eye steak (medium rare) and I got the tuscan chicken.<br>he enjoyed his steak, but I was a little disappointed :/ <br>The dish had asparagus, capers, tomatoes and this sauce all over, but the chicken itself was very bland...... It wasn&#39;t awful, I was just expecting more flavor.<br><br>However, the complimentary bread was spot on, as always.<br>Erick, our waiter was so nice! He was very attentive, wasn&#39;t overbearing, and came at the right times. Service was A++<br><br>Wait time of 40 minutes, but got called in 30! it does take a while to get the food though.

My friend was in town from New York and we chose to eat here because she works for the company. Service is always on point and the seating area above the movie theatre was very peaceful and a huge difference from the larger part of the restaurant. I fed my baby Mac and cheese off the kids menu. She is only one and loved it. My friend and I shared the vegan Cobb salad and a pasta. I enjoyed the Vegan Cobb. It had fruit on it but I thought that was slightly strange but the quinoa addition was very nice. We ordered Santa Fe Egg Rolls also, if you have these make sure you use the dipping sauce and eat some rice noodles which are really a garnish but we enjoyed. Refills came when they were supposed to and they gave us enough time to dine due to the baby slowing us down. They even brought fresh bread when we requested with olive oil and balsamic. Fantastic!

Lunch was nice and calm, even though the place was crowded. Had the honey chicken, and orange chicken which were ok. The whole experience was just ok, not impressed. Might go back if it&#39;s convenient.

I was here with my husband and daughter for lunch sometime last week. We waited about 15 minutes for a table, not bad. The server took about 10 minutes to get to us and was a little unfriendly, fine by me at this point since we were starving and wanted something to eat. He got us our drinks and we asked him for some bread as we ordered our meals. This is the reason for the 2 star. I am not joking, but I set my timer on my phone to check and see how long it took for him to get us the bread. 20 minutes go by and no bread!!! We flagged down another server that was walking by and mentioned to her that we requested bread from our server but he never got it. She was nice enough and brought us the bread herself. At this point its been 7 more minutes when she finally got us the bread. We did see our server walk up and down to the table across from us and next to us with bread and drink refills. Finally, another 15 minutes after we got the bread we get our meals. We requested refills on the drinks and more bread (its 3 of us and we&#39;re starving) . As we started eating our Santa Fe chicken salads we both noticed there was NO chicken in any of the 2 salads. I order the lunch size and my husband ordered the full size, the menu clearly says &#34;marinated chicken&#34; so I was expecting some kind of marinated chicken. We have ordered this salad at other locations and have notices they add very little chicken, not to say none. By the time the server came back to check on us again, we were almost done with our meals, but when he did we mentioned to him the chicken issue and he did in fact apologize (that is why I did 2 stars even though the chicken is not his fault but he did apologize) he  offer to bring us some chicken on the side or change our meals. We opted for chicken on the side for the salads. Will probably keep coming to Cheesecake since we do like their food but they need to work a little more on customer service and quality control.

We love this place so much.  There&#39;s always a line but worth the wait (go check out the book store next door while you wait).  We ate here a couple of times and we always had amazing service.  Quick and friendly.  The food is AMAZING.  Some of the best plates worth the try: Cajun Chicken &#34;Littles&#39;, Chicken Madeira (OMG to die for), Chicken Piccata, Chicken Marsala and Mushrooms.  Ok so maybe most of the stuff I order is with chicken but trust me, it&#39;s all good.  Their pastas are very delish also.  If you&#39;re stuffed after your meal (and i think you will), order some desert to go.  We love the carrot cake and the original cheesecake.

We have been here about 6 or 7 times and I wouldn&#39;t slate the place, the place is lovely, well decorated, the staff are lovely, attentive and so forth. You expect a wait, and a longer wait for outdoors. Just accept that as it goes with the popularity of the place. We still like it here and will continue to return but there are some niggles and it&#39;s not always 100%....for one, they have an awful noise problem inside, one that I&#39;m not even sure they are aware of. We sat inside on Sunday night and it was awful, we were almost shouting our conversation to each other, the racket caused by staff clattering knives and forks was deafening as was overall staff noise. It reminded me of a school canteen. The music was much lower on the decibel list than the staff and kitchen noises flooding out and even drowned out customer chatter. Not a pleasant noise. Especially not a nice noise To try and sip a nice Malbec in! There is a time issue too as we have twice still been eating starters when hot mains come out? Who wants to sit watching $30 of main courses go cold?....Also, I don&#39;t know why they feel that it&#39;s a nice idea to leave a gap of 4cm between tables for 2, it was ridiculous, we were a 2 but almost a forced table of 4, which was uncomfortable, but this shouldn&#39;t have to be pointed out, lastly the whole bill nonsense coming far earlier than you want it is just rude, annoying, interrupts conversations, puts pressure on the customers to leave and if they have a $40 near full bottle of red sat in front of them it&#39;s not nice. I feel sometimes that the real acid test is that the manager goes in the restaurant and sits like a customer and sees and hears and feels what they do, it&#39;s a test which I&#39;m sure would always see changes. We received the bill without asking for it with a lot of wine left in our bottle and she brought the bill and said ,no rush sir, but there is, always is, as we continued to talk she came back and picked up the empty wallet, interrupting us again,we apologised saying we hadn&#39;t done it yet..... We stopped our conversation yet again at a point we hadn&#39;t planned, he ruffled through the wallet.... Just a rude interruption, there is clearly a rush, they hover around, watching for cards going in wallets, you feel uncomfortable, rushed and after paying we put some cash tip under a glass after getting our card back and we were interrupted again with a snatch of the cash and her saying &#39;I&#39;ll get that out of your way sir, .........it wasn&#39;t in our way? I can understand it when they need tables, both times there were many spare tables so it&#39;s just their practice I suppose. Saying all that, All the food seems to come out well, we especially love the Thai chicken wrap starter using lettuce leaves and triple Chinese style sauces. Most of the startrpers we have tried and we love, the small Greek salad is especially tasty. We really hated a dish of strawberry shortcake last week where a soggy super large biscuit was placed floating in red sugar syrup, served with equally marinated in sugar syrup strawberries with ok ice cream and a huge amount of cream to give it the ridiculous effect of a tower......not nice in so many ways,sickly, ridiculously too large and soggy and sugary.

Cheesecake Factory has amazing food and menu, no matter the locations I&#39;ve be too. We do go to the Grove location often because it is close but we are always weary of how busy it is. Unless it&#39;s off peak hours don&#39;t ever expect a short wait. Lately we always just head straight to the bar area to try our luck. So far we&#39;ve had decent luck and find a high table within 15 mins or so. <br><br>The last time I have to admit our server, was nice but he did an awful time of managing his time but most of the time our service is usually pretty good. So int his case I gave it four stars due to consistency and great food. They recently just added a chicken Katsura plate to their menu and it is fantastic, I&#39;ve ordered twice in a row. If you don&#39;t like spicy food, just have them take out the siracha sauce. Can&#39;t ever go wrong with avocado egg rolls, my favorite. I also love the chicken Romano.

Worst service of my life. When we first arrived, we waited easily forty five minutes for our buzzer to go off (we were told it would be less than twenty minutes). When we stood to be seated, we were told the table wasn&#39;t ready yet and they&#39;d call us by name. When we FINALLY got seated after being there over an hour, we didn&#39;t see a waiter for almost thirty minutes. By the time he got there, we already knew what we wanted and asked for water please and then ordered the rest of our meal and dessert. The waiter was once again nowhere to be seen for yet another twenty minutes (so, to recap, we had been in the building almost two hours, seated for nearly an hour, and hadn&#39;t even seen a glass of water). He finally arrives with water and what we had ordered for dessert, without bringing out bread or our appetizers or our entree. We asked for the check early. We didn&#39;t touch dessert as we wanted our other food first, we finished both our waters with no refill for over forty minutes, and after yet another twenty minutes he brings out a basket of bread and a check. (My partner and I had started timing these rare visits as a betting game, it had gotten so bad.) It would be a while longer on our appetizer, he said. Could we wait another thirty minutes? At this point I could&#39;ve laughed. We canceled the remainder of our order, paid for our cheesecake and left. <br><br>So, we had been seated nearly two hours before we got our bread basket. Nearly an hour before we got a glass of water and forty minutes for a refill. We had been in the building nearly three hours before being told we&#39;d have to wait longer for even our appetizer. As we didn&#39;t want to be eating mediocre pasta when the sun came up, we had to leave early. I&#39;ve worked in food service before. I&#39;ve worked busy nights and have dealt with being understaffed, fussy customers, the lot. They were not understaffed, it wasn&#39;t particularly busy, and from what we could observe many tables in our section were barely ever checked on, many had finished drinks and long finished their bread or food and were simply waiting for someone to swing by. <br><br>We will absolutely not be returning to this location.

Started off with a dirty table and awful service. Servers weren&#39;t attentive and not accommodating except for one. I was supposed to give it 1 star but it gotten better at the middle of our meal. So, here&#39;s 3 stars.

This was only about my third or fourth time eating at the Cheesecake Factory, despite having lived ten minutes away for my whole life. As a large national chain restaurant, I feel it&#39;s quite overhyped, but it does have its advantages. I tried to organize the pros and cons from my limited Cheesecake experiences:<br><br>PROS<br>1. professional and friendly service. excellent, especially for a large corporation chain. they cater to your preferences as best they can; I once asked for a different type of pasta in my dish and they were very open to substitutions/requests. <br><br>2. the free unlimited bread. I personally like the white french bread with olive oil and butter (the waiter will give you the olive oil if you ask), but many of my friends prefer the slightly sweeter brown bread. <br><br>3. the wide variety of food for a relatively decent price. steaks, pastas, salads, soups, desserts -- there are almost too many options. <br><br>CONS<br>1. can be a long wait. avoid mealtimes and you&#39;ll be able to get in within half an hour or so. <br><br>2. very dark inside. my eyes always hurt from straining to see my food and the faces of the people I&#39;m speaking with. may make for an intimate setting with a date, but not really apt for large parties or families.<br><br>3. the extensive menu does include some faulty dishes; it&#39;s a hit or miss type of thing. here are the ones i&#39;ve tried and still remember:<br><br>Steak Diane - good beef with a good mushroom sauce, tastes superb cooked medium rare. <br><br>Shrimp Scampi - large shrimp with a slight crunch in a citrus, garlic sauce <br><br>Chicken lettuce wraps - nothing special, just some chicken and vegetables wrapped in lettuce with a sauce commonly found in Mexican places. my mom really likes them; they&#39;re meant to be appetizers, but can serve as a light meal. the lettuce adds a nice refreshing crunch when you&#39;re not ordering salad.<br><br>Spicy chicken chipotle pasta - not spicy at all, actually sort of sweet. the sauce gets cold pretty quickly, and you&#39;re left with a clumpy mess of a dish. <br><br>Jambalaya pasta - the spices&#39; balance is pretty good, but gets cold and nasty quickly as well. I don&#39;t recommend the pasta dishes here. <br><br>Original cheesecake - very good; after all, they get their name from this signature dish. <br><br>Tiramisu cheesecake - DIDN&#39;T HAVE A GRAHAM CRUST!! i felt cheated. the tiramisu cake part was merely eh, and the cheesecake part wasn&#39;t as superb as the original cheesecake. the chocolate mousse/whipped cream on top made the dessert extremely decadent and sweet. I would stick to the basic cheesecake. <br><br>Sundae - got a free sundae on my birthday; there was only a spoonful of extremely sweet vanilla ice cream buried under a LOT of whipped cream and sitting on top of black chocolate fudge. it was free, but didn&#39;t feel like a big deal. <br>                                            <br>Sides - tried the fries, salad, and mashed potatoes; all are decent.<br><br>just some of my thoughts on a much reviewed restaurant.

The service here is amazing! Stasia is our server and I can&#39;t express enough how sweet and kind she is. It is slammed and she manages to come and check on us whenever she can. Good job cheesecake grove for having a great waitstaff! My food is also delicious. Sitting at the outdoor patio with this perfect summer day tops this wonderful meal and experience off!!

Bad experience with a take out. I live pretty close but what was supposed to be a Cobb salad became a chopped salad. The order taker admitted the wrong doing but what a waste of time. You think they just switch the salad and take care of the difference but I still had to pay $3. By the time I ate my other order it was terrible cold. I guess Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t stand by quality service or food.

Really enjoyed our visit to Cheesecake Factory. Our server Michael was so funny!!! Michael took our order but we as getting off shift so he introduced us to our new server Rachel C. Service, food and dessert were great!! Was busy and still had great service.

Delicious!! This place is amazing! They have a huge menu filled with anything from salads to steak to deserts! No matter how many times I come here I am always satisfied and always come back for more. My absolute favorite is the chicken Tastada salad. I will definitely come back for more!
Amazing pasta. I ordered chicken ramano with alfredo sauce and omg how delicious and juicy the pasta was. Hands down the best pasta i have tried yet.
Ryan U. turned a poor experience into a great situation he was helpful and professional as well as a wonderful disposition.Thx Ryan U.!

Anthony and Luis at the To-go counter are awesome!!! Always friendly and exhibit impeccable customer service. I come to this location often, and usually pick up food to go. If my food is late, or im waiting a bit longer than usual, Anthony will even offer a courtesy beverage for my delay. This cheesecake factory is the reason i stopped going to the one in Beverly Hills. People fail to realize how far friendly service goes. Even if the food is not always impressive, the service always is.

This place always delivers on everything. Good and drinks. I have yet to go wrong on an order. The menu is so big and overwhelming I couldn&#39;t decide so I asked out waiter what he likes and he suggested a pasta dish with chicken, peas, tomatoes and cream source. It was loaded with calories but absolutely delish!  I love this place.

Pretty nice customer service! It was packed around 6:30pm on a sunday. There was a long line for sitting inside and zero line for sitting outside. Our server JESSIE was super sweet and nice and the food and drinks were very good.

My friends and I are dinner here a few nights ago after the outdoor movie. The waitress was great but the older white lady with short hair kept rushing us out. She interrupted us mid convo saying &#34;we&#39;re closed you have to go!&#34; We still had food and half a bottle of champagne left. It&#39;s not our fault the food came out later and we had to eat it shortly after they closed. I can&#39;t believe how rude she was. I never want to go back.

I havent been to Cheesecake factory since they first opened in Pasadena yeeeeeeears ago.<br><br>But my coworkers had a dept lunch here a few months back, and i had to come.<br><br>I ordered the meatloaf, with mac n cheese. Soooo the Meatloaf was very bland, and after salting, it was a bit better. The mac n cheese was very cheesy, but it wasnt tasty either. <br><br>Ummm... next time im sticking to cheesecake.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! HAIR IN FOOD! My mother and I went here to eat. Hostess asked us our name so she could write it down since it was a ten minute wait. I began to spell out my name and mid sentence she cut me off and asked me to be seated. We went across the way to kill 10min when we came back she was chatting with a hostess. She seated everyone else who came AFTER us then seated us. We ordered.. my food was given to another table by accident.. Chef came out and apologized said it would be out in a minute.. 15min later I get my plate with a HAIR in the middle. Asked to speak to the manager all she said was &#34;oo sorry&#34;
Excellence food very nice atmosphere good service nice out side setting mall view always busy

I love cheesecake factory but this place sucks. We had to wait for an hour before we can be seated and when it was time to be seated they messed that up too instead of sitting us outside on the padio they sat us down inside i had to ask them numerous of times to be seated outside. Then it took them 45 to an hour to bring our appitizers and another 1 hour for our food which was cold like alaska

I rarely ever come to any Cheesecake Factory because the temptation to get an entire cheesecake is just too high and I feel that the food is just mediocre. Bad on both fronts. But on this day, we needed to fill our bellies before we went without food and water for 6 hours for the entire duration of Dancing with the Stars (Standing in line, going through security, seating, etc;).  This was the only joint that we were feeling and luckily there was no wait.<br><br>We shared the Hot Spinach and Cheese dip that had garlic and artichoke hearts and warm yummy cheese. It was an absolutely comfort food. I don&#39;t order this often (for obvious reasons) but man, I&#39;m so glad that we ordered this. It totally hit the spot. <br><br>For lunch, I ended up ordering the lunch sized Chinese Chicken Salad but I was amazed when it came out...it was huge. It wasn&#39;t the best CCS that I&#39;ve had but it was pretty good and did the job.

My Berkeley friends are going to have my excommunicated for favorably reviewing a chain. A large chain. A successful chain. Oh, the humanity... But my retort... Oh, the red velvet cheesecake. Seriously. Had it as an appetizer. Our mothers weren&#39;t watching and that&#39;s one of the things you tell yourself you&#39;ll do when you&#39;re a kid, yes? So be it.<br><br>Red Velvet Cheesecake? Insane. Seriously, it was just so so good. Also highly recommend the bistro shrimp pasta and the hula chicken salad. Really, the food here is just consistently good, the service as well... and we were outside at The Grove on a 70 degree afternoon. It was just an A+ all around.
Jimmy our server rocks! He&#39;s super friendly and made us feel like we were the only ones in the place. I&#39;d definitely come back to this location just so I could have him as my server.

Here with a friend and some visitors from the bay area.  Everyone really like their food, and the cheesecake.  I had the classic burger here, medium rare.  The patty was huge, and quite good with cheese, red onions.  I couldn&#39;t even eat more than a third, so I wanted to box it up when we were leaving. The waitress offered to box it, and she picked up my plate and then proceed to stack the other diners plates on top of my plate squashing my burger!  She apologized and offered to bring me a new bun.  I took the plate from her and told her to bring the box to me instead.<br><br>I should have immediately went to look for the manager, so she could be reprimanded in front of the whole table who witnessed this. She clearly despised her job, my friend remarked that she was a phony, just what I was thinking.  She brought over a box and a new bun, apologizing again.  I enjoyed the food here more than I expected, though 3 stars is good enough for this place. Minus one star due to the ill-mannered waitress.

I&#39;m literally only giving this restaurant 1 star because the food is good but the service sucks! Yesterday my Dad who was visiting from Ohio, his girlfriend and my wife went here to eat. The waiter was so rude. He brought 4 waters only 3 of them had straws. It took 20 minutes to get the waters when I asked for another straw he never brought it. I asked him when we could put in an order he said he&#39;s serving a ton of table when there was only 3 table including my own that he was serving then when more people sat down he took there order. He continued to avoid or serve us hell I even apologized to him for being so busy and asking for a straw. The service was so bad that the validation they gave us ran out. That&#39;s how long it took to be served by this horrible server. I literally wanted a nice last meal with my father. I got a huge F you send off dinner from the Cheesecake Factory. Prior to this time there are 2 other occasions that the service was horrible but I love the food! The food is always so good but I can&#39;t see myself eating at this place again

I got the Mac n Cheese burger. It was okaaayyyy, but I&#39;ve had the spicy chicken chipotle pasta and that&#39;s so freaking good. Of course the cheesecake is good, but make sure you order at the front instead of at the table because you get a bigger slice for the same price ;)

If there&#39;s ever a time where you want total assurance that you&#39;re going to get great food, decent prices, and a superb waitstaff, save yourself the trouble and go to the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>The location at the Grove get busy, so plan ahead. Go in and pick up a buzzer before you&#39;re starving and by the time you get called, you&#39;ll be ready to eat. The buzzer has a fairly long range (from water fountain to the Farmer&#39;s Market entrance near Marmalade Cafe), so you can shop/window shop while you wait. Last night I showed up at 9:30 and waited 55 minutes for a table for 2! They don&#39;t take reservations so BE PREPARED!<br><br>The seating can get crowded indoors, so opt to sit outdoors and take in the sights from the balcony. <br><br>The waiters are always great. Well versed in the menu, helpful when you&#39;re indecisive, never pushy, etc. <br><br>TIPS:<br>+ Don&#39;t order an appetizer unless you aren&#39;t getting an entree. They bring out fresh rye and sourdough bread for every table. <br>+ There are lunch portions available for many of the entree&#39;s - always ask!<br>+ Dessert portions are ALWAYS big enough for two or three. The Lemoncello Cake is my fave but the Strawberry Shortcake is always a winner as well.<br>+ There are a couple of televisions above the bar. Last night they showed football and a Jeopardy rerun. :)<br><br>One thing about this location that gets under my skin: there are only 4 stalls in the ladies room. Yep. That means that while there may be an excess of 70+ women here at any time, there&#39;s only room for 4 bums at a time. Madness! lol!

Cheesecake Factory gets a five star for the great experience I&#39;ve had with them for the past years. Yes, I am a regular at this restaurant because of their great service, legit food and their toothsome DESSERTS such as the CHEESECAKE! This restaurant gets super crowded every night. WHY? Because there are plenty of tourist people here at The Grove and Farmer&#39;s Market is just across the street.<br><br>Whenever I go to this restaurant, I usually just go straight to the high stool tables near the bar. Yes, I  do sit in front of the bar with two sport tv screens and the desire to buy a drink looking over those YUMMEH alcoholic beverages. Well, I like these tables more because luckily we never wait for the table. <br><br>Once you&#39;ve settled in, a server will immediately give you the menu, talk about their specials for today and ask for your drinks. Then they leave and come back to serve you some warm nicely toasted bread with a side of BUTTER(Ohlala!). After you&#39;ve eaten your bread, you will definitely feel full from all those bread they have served you. So, I say slow down on the bread and wait for your entree. Plus the entree portion is generously big, that could be shared for two. As for myself, I can never finish a full entree from their menu which is why I only order their snacks or appetizers instead. And through out your experience, the servers and even the managers will check up on you and ask you about your meal. But make sure you have enough room for the DESSERTS, I mean why go to a Cheesecake Factory if you are not going to get CHEESECAKE(*DROOL!)! <br><br>My boyfriend and I can honestly say that we have explored almost all of the cheesecake selections. But my all-time favorite and what I&#39;m super addicted to are their Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake with a side of Vanilla Bean Ice Cream(MUST TRY) and their 30th Anniversary Cheesecake(SWEETGASM). The Red Velvet Cheesecake is great too but I&#39;m a CHOCOHOLIC, so I gotta have CHOCOLATE on them. hehe.<br><br>Dang, just thinking about those Cheesecake fus making me crave for a box full of cheesecake. I wish it&#39;s my birthday all over again, so I can get a box(as seen on the picture). Now, I gotta hit up a Cheesecake Factory this weekend to satisfy my sweet tooth&#39;s desire.

This was a horrible Tuesday evening experience.  My husband and I decided to take our kiddos here for a special midweek treat. We arrived at 6:20 and ordered food for our family of 4 immediately. It took 53 minutes to get to our table. When it finally arrived the Carbonara my daughter ordered had 2 dime size pieces of bacon and 8 peas.  I mentioned it to our waiter who apologized and offered to bring us a side of each. I said yes to the peas and he brought us a dish of peas which he recommended we toss in our pasta. To our dismay the peas were nearly frozen so we had to pick them out one at a time. We ate as quickly as possible and got out of there.  I remarked to the waiter that the experience had been less than stellar and he mumbled that he was sorry.  The bill came and the pasta was still on there.  The rest of the food was pretty average. We paid and walked away completely appalled.  The Cheesecake Factory is not exactly fine dining, but it should be a fine place to take a family on a Tuesday. This is easily the worst Cheesecake Factory in LA. Go elsewhere.

I&#39;m a sucker for a pulled pork sandwich and it&#39;s funny, I&#39;m not really a fan of pork other than when it&#39;s pulled, put in a sandwich and smothered in BBQ sauce. However, I may have problems ordering my beloved pulled pork sandwich if I get flashbacks to this experience.<br><br>First of all the pork was not pulled, it was cut... badly. I&#39;m not sure how fresh it was but another in our party who had the same thing was unwell for hours after eating it. I myself thought that the fast was a bit &#34;funny&#34;. <br><br>The service was average at best, clearly the servers are over stretched and while friendly when dealing with us they were hard to get a hold of when we needed something... like the bill.<br><br>We didn&#39;t stick around for the cheesecake and it&#39;s unlikely that we&#39;ll ever return to a cheesecake factory in the future. S

The Cheesecake Factory is always great. One of my favorites.  Come here at least once or twice a week. <br><br>Great menu selection, great drinks, cheap prices, and the staff is always upbeat and friendly. It&#39;s always busy, so if you want a table you better get there early or you&#39;ll be waiting for awhile.<br><br>One of my favorites so if your in the area check them out!!

I enjoy dining here it doesn&#39;t matter it&#39;s Tuesday or Saturday they are always busy you have to wait more than 30 minutes some times. The food was always good also the mode. Tonight I ordered pasta Alfredo, spinach dip and tortilla soup and quesadilla everything was good except the pasta I don&#39;t know why but it was very salty I think this kind of thing some times happen I have to say they don&#39;t charge the pasta by the way like always I give 4 stars to them I will come again but maybe don&#39;t order pasta :D

My friend and I decided to go to The Cheesecake Factory because she&#39;s never been to one before!  We had a good time.  The food was good, but we spent quite a bit!  The Cheesecake Factory is very consistent in terms of quality of food and service throughout all the ones I&#39;ve been to.  I had a rumor that food is premade somewhere, but an inside source told me that throughout the chains they have a specific and meticulous way to make the food and that is why the food throughout the chains taste about the same.  Well, the cheesecakes are premade though.  They have a ginormous menu and often times I don&#39;t know where to begin!  What you can expect from the servers is quality service and they pretty much memorize the menu.  I&#39;m sure they all try many things from the menu and have good suggestions on what&#39;s popular and their personal favorites. <br><br>To start, my friend and I had the pomegranate drinks--the mojito and and margarita, which was pretty good.  I liked the mojito better. <br><br>We started with the crabcake appetizer.  There&#39;s about three of them and it&#39;s served with mustard and tarter sauce laid on a garnished plate.  My friend likes ordering crabcakes and she said this was pretty good and it&#39;s a lot better than the ones we normally have.  <br><br>I forget what my friend ordered, but I know it&#39;s a shrimp pasta.  I haven&#39;t had enough of it to tell you what I think, but one bite was good.  <br><br>I ordered the Char-grilled cutlet steak made with USDA prime sirloin steak, crispy onion rings, steak butter, and fries for $17.95.  It&#39;s one of their affordable steaks and I didn&#39;t feel like going all out because we ordered a bunch of food anyhow.  I like my beef cooked medium rare and that&#39;s what I got and it was good.  <br><br>For dessert, we could decide on the cheesecake, but the server brought out the BIG menu they have up front so we could see it.  Actually, my friend wanted to get a cheesecake for her family--she decided on a 7 inch original.  We tried a slice of the Red Velvet Cheesecake, which was pretty big  At that point, we were already full and only had a couple of bites.  I was not going to eat the whole thing because that&#39;s about 1500 calories!  I took the cheesecake home and ate bites throughout the whole weekend!  It was delicious...the cake was moist, cheesecake was good.  Yum.  <br><br>In general, The Cheesecake Factory has good food and great presentation and the food is good and it is consistent throughout the other chains I&#39;ve been to.  I like the ambiance and the decor and the dim lighting is a nice touch.  I like how it&#39;s busy and the servers still pay attention to us and make sure we have everything we need.  I like this location because it&#39;s at The Grove.  In general, food is overpriced and it doesn&#39;t really stand out for me.  I like how they have a small plates and snacks menu if you&#39;re not up for spending too much.  I still like it.  I like the cheesecakes at least!

I had a great time with friends last night.  Dinner was great the wait was long but it was worth it!!!!!!!!!!!i love to sit overseeing the grove lights:) my service was good like always. I Don&#39;t know how your host i believe the guy working next to her last night called her (Michelle?) downstairs does it but she knows what she&#39;s doing people can be so rude at times when they saw her busy but she did accommodate all of us with all that pressure she was under good job!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I made a quick trip to the Grove and stopped in just for some desserts to go.  I had to get the limited edition pumpkin cheesecake and the peppermint bark cheesecake along with my favorite carrot cake.  The cheesecake slices aren&#39;t real large for $6.95 a slice, but I think they are worth it since they are so rich and taste sooo good.  As I was waiting for my order, I was admiring the many other flavors in the display case.  It would be fun just to try a slice of each of the various unusual/unique flavors that you can&#39;t get anywhere else!<br><br>Since it was early, there wasn&#39;t much business and I was the only one at the counter.  The service was efficient and there was a friendly guy holding the door open and greeting people.
I love the Cheesecake Factory at the grove. they have a selection for everyone. even the pickiest diners with their low calorie menu. this place has the best ambience, food and service.

You guys should come to this place,because besides their amazing variety on cheesecakes,they have really good food too.Their menu has so many choices. <br>All the people who work are vey attentive and nice. My girlfriend and I ordered a chicken and steak plate and it did not took too long to be served on our table.<br>We definitely we are going to keep coming back at this restaurant,because every time that we ado, we enjoy it.

Parking - you should just park in the structure. Don&#39;t forget to bring in your ticket for a parking validation. Have the maitre d validate your parking.<br><br>Wait - Waited 25 minutes to be seated. Came at 5pm on New Years Eve.<br><br>Esthetic - as all Cheesecake Factories, the place is dimmed lighted. The restaurant dining is on the 2nd floor. Maitre D and waiting is on the 1st floor. It seems small, and was packed, as all other locations are.<br><br>Food - The boneless buffalo wings were delicious and severed crispy. For the main course, ordered my favorite....meatloaf. However the taste was off. It was saltier than usual. The mashed potatoes and succotash were very good. <br><br>Service - I know it was a busy night but the waiter wasn&#39;t as attentive as I needed him to. Had to flag him down several times for drink refills. After asking for a to go box, I decided to have another slice of bread. As I was eating, the waiter removes my plate under me which I thought was a bit rude, since he saw that I was still eating. No, this wasn&#39;t my meatloaf plate, but the little platter for the bread. The waiter himself, I didn&#39;t catch his name was a bit arrogant, not as friendly as other staff in other locations.

Definitely a nice seen for a date night if you ask me. Food was good, I got the herbs salmon fillet, combination of sauce and herbs really gave it a really good balance of favors. I would definitely get this dish again if I&#39;m trying to eat something not so heavy. Service was okay, server did his job, no more, no less.

The Cheesecake Factory was one of the greatest dining experiences I have ever had. It had great service and all the employees were nice. When I wanted to box up my food, they did it no problem. The Cheesecake Factory is a great restaurant, I highly recommend it. Anna, our server did an excellent job. She was funny and very kind.

Horrible wait and disorganized had people that checked in after us go ahead . ...finally got to table and were in a row with 5 empty tables that seat 4 just made us more mad ..better off checking out other italian restaurants on beverly blvd  waiter was ok just chg out that front staff or get them trained and orginized cause in this town we are on run and need good service and not be told 15 mins and wait 45 ..

Not quite sure why we go there.  I suspect because there is something for everyone in your party with the large varied menu.  Wife called two time to make reservations for the 4th including a request for a piece of birthday cheesecake.  Got TWO different answers as to when one could begin making reservations on two different calls.  Finally, we were told just to arrive at 11:30a to put name on a list.  Arrive at 11:30a to find the CF had been seating folks since 11:00a!   Obviously no one there knows what is going on.<br>The kids had a cheese pizza, only to find it was burnt.  Had the three tacos.  Salad (escabeche vegetables) had no dressing.  &#34;Spicy chicken&#34; had no flavor.   Chicken pasta was &#34;ok&#34;  Club sandwich was &#34;ok.&#34;<br>       Wife had to ask the waitress about the slice of cheesecake with candle for my birthday   twice (when she made reservation) and at reception, a third time.  Waitress did not know any request for a birthday cheesecake.  To the credit of the waitress, she did an excellent job, but the rest of the experience did not go well.   <br>       Find someplace else folks
Great service good food always fresh, not first time the appetizers are delicious some time have to wait as up to an hour...
I hv been to cheesecake factory many times already! This time, I went w my friend n she ordered fried mac&amp;cheese! i never tasted it b4 but its rilli yummy! i would totally recommend it!

When you head to the Cheesecake Factory, let&#39;s assume their specialty involves cheesecake.<br><br>So, needless to say that I had no interest in 80% of their menu.  I looked around  at the surrounding tables and saw people feasting on large portions of pastas and salads and sandwiches.  I sat there flabbergasted.  Shouldn&#39;t the focus be dessert?<br><br>I can safely give this place 4 stars because I only sampled their desserts.  I chose the chocolate coconut cream cheesecake with coffee and my boyfriend decided on having the warm apple crisp.  Both desserts were presented to us in ginormous portions and 2 extra plates for sharing.<br><br>We engorged ourselves in delicious refined sugar.  The cheesecake was fantastic.  The balance between chocolate and coconut was juuuuuust right.  Not too sweet, and yummy enough to make you crave an extra bite even though you already busted a button.  <br><br>The warm apple crisp was also good, especially since it was served toasty and a la mode.  But for some reason, I wasn&#39;t exactly dazzled by it.  I guess it&#39;s because the flavors are so traditional and expected.  It&#39;s hard to be pleasantly surprised by something that was essentially an apple pie.<br><br>This is a great place to go for a sweet treat.  Some may think it strange to go to lunch/dinner in one restaurant and then dessert someplace else.  But, I think it&#39;s always better to go to an establishment based on their strengths.  If you go to a steakhouse, don&#39;t order the chicken.  If you go to the cheesecake factory, don&#39;t order the sandwich.

Last Saturday I went to this particular Cheesecake Factory, because it was between my horse and the venue that I  had just left.  My food was pretty decent, although I was damned near starving. I was really feeling a Hemingway Daiquiri, they don&#39;t serve them and what killed the evening was that bartender didn&#39;t even attempt to find out what the ingredients were so that he could look it up and make it. Learn something new.  Lazy bastard.  Really POOR customer service.

came here with my friend for lunch - great lunch menu. There was a small wait because it was Sunday and packed but got seated pretty quickly. Our waitress was nice but not as attentive as I usually get but no biggie. Love this location, will return. The only problem was that the food was NOT piping hot like how I normally like it - just warm - I got the pasta with shrimp and sausage. I was going to ask them to reheat it but being 8 months pregnant and hungry, I just ate it as I couldn&#39;t wait lol other than that, great time!

Just ate here today for my early bday celebration. For appetizer, we got some buffalo wings and We got the factory combination which is steak diane and shrimp scampi as the main course. The buffalo wings took forever before they gave it to us so our server Kelly was very sorry for the very long wait and gave us a comp for that. Not only that, the manager and server Kelly gave us a comp for whatever dessert we would like. I didnt really get mad foe qaiting becuause I understand that they are always packed. But shoutout to KELLY for she was the best server ever. :)
