A friend and I came here on Black Friday. The wait wasn&#39;t too bad because it was just the two of us and during the wait we were able to walk around and shop in the surrounding stores. By the time we came back we were told to go upstairs to be seated. That&#39;s one thing I did not like about this Cheesecake Factory, the layout. The check-in area is too crowded for the number of people going in and out and having to go upstairs to be seated is odd, but I guess that&#39;s the only way to have a restaurant in the space given. Once we got seated our waiter was quick to take our drink orders and even our food order. But once we placed our orders we never saw our waiter again. I ordered a house salad and the spicy ahi tempura roll. My salad came without dressing so I asked for my dressing and I asked for chopsticks for my tempura roll but when I asked it was another waiter.<br><br>But the good thing about this place was it was very quick at bringing out our food.

It was at lunch time took my laddie to eat and we had fun. They were not checking up on us very much to the point I had to ask for the check and then tell them to pick it up. But over all it was nice.

For the most part, I like this place.<br><br>It just seems lately everytime I go something makes me hesitant to come back.<br><br>The food is good, but inconsistent.  Sometimes it&#39;s made absolutely amazing and other times you find yourself wishing you had make another decision.<br><br>Speaking of decisions, they&#39;re menu is absurdly large.  Yes, I like options but not 15+ pages worth..  It takes me longer to look through the menu than to eat my dinner.<br><br>The wait staff as always been good.  No complaints there.<br><br>The parking consists of a structure outside the grove.  The Cheesecake factory will validate.  I do appreciate that.<br><br>The tables can be very close together.  Meaning you can often hear the conversation at the table next to you.  Even once had my water knocked over by a large gesture from a man at table near me.  <br><br>The wait is going to be long if you go there during the peak hours.  Weekends are going to be the worst but they allow you to walk around the grove while you wait.<br><br>The cheesecake is fantastic!  Can&#39;t deny that!

I got the country french salad and it was descent.  Our server Allison was fantastic and very attentive!  They do have a bunch of stuff to choose from but They do not have a ton of vegetarian options.  It is a good crowd pleaser place to go when you have a group of people with different preferences.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a safe bet when you have family in town. Good food, appealing atmosphere, reasonable prices and stellar service from Diana. Diana is preggo and still providing great service with a smile.

When we arrived at the restaurant they told us to wait time would be 15 minutes but we had to wait 35 minutes. When we asked the receptionist how much longer we had to wait we got flat out ignored. When we finally got seated we got a table outside that was very shaky. It felt quite unsafe and uncomfortable to cut our food and eat at this table. Also the glasses to surf the water and seem to be very dirty. The quality of the food was all right

Probably the nicest cheesecake factory in the area. You might have to wait to get a table sometimes if it&#39;s packed, but the food is just as good as all the other cheesecakes, and they have a balcony overlooking the grove. Love this place!

I asked for ketchup, the waiter said he&#39;ll get me one. Didn&#39;t get me one. I just wanted to eat my spam and eggs with some flavor, y&#39;know?  At least I got water, so there&#39;s your two stars. And the utensils were pretty dirty.
Bad management. Expect 1 hour wait if the host tells only 20 minutes wait. Disaster !!!

When I worked at The Grove, I came here practically every day I worked with other co-workers on lunch. It&#39;s a easy place to go to, and always an okay choice for quick, moderately priced food.<br><br>The happy hour is awesome, $5 Long Islands that will knock you on your tooshie, and the appetizer menu is great. Tons of stuff on it, and some even pass as full meals. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had any issues with the waiters of waitresses, which is nice, but I did have a bad experience once with one of the managers who acted like a complete child after our food hadn&#39;t arrived in 45 minutes. The guy sitting next to us had ordered the same thing, and got his food after 20 minutes. The manager said that our item was taking a little bit longer because it was a different variation. It wasn&#39;t, they forgot the order, it happens, whatever. The guy tried lying to me to make up an excuse, which was annoying and even ruder when he was called on it. The situation was taken care of with his manager, and I was happy with the solution by the time I had left.<br><br>I see a lot of the managers also seating people and even taking orders at times, which I really like. The atmosphere is nice, but if you&#39;re looking for somewhere quick to eat on a weekend, don&#39;t even bother. I have seen the wait time at two hours before.<br><br>The Ahi Carpacio is my favorite item on the menu.

I frequent this Cheesecake Factory frequently with a girlfriend of mine, you could consider us regulars here and it seems like each time we pretty much know what to expect.  Good food, great dessert. Every now and then we&#39;ll get a table with a horrible view of the bright white building across the way blinding whoever stars at it, (only at lunch time) but generally speaking you can count on a crowd, lots of chatter - so don&#39;t come here to have a quiet meal, but also you can count on generally nice servers and decent service. They get busy, so I kind of have to cut them slack if there&#39;s a wait or slower service but you can&#39;t down a place for doing something right to draw in a crowd all the time.  <br>Their Red Velvet cheesecake is a must.

I haven&#39;t eaten at Cheesecake Factory in years. Well I was disappointed this time. I ordered the Chinese chicken salad. It was overdressed and very wilted. My husband ordered the broiled Gish tacos. These were really bad. The soft corn tortillas were hard and the fish was tasteless. Our cheesecake was delicious. Service was very slow. Super nice guy just he just seemed to be overwhelmed and struggled with our order.

Another one of those bad reviews. The primary reason for my bad experience was the wait to be seated. I gave my name to the hostess and was quoted 15 minutes for two people. So we went upstairs and found a couple seats at the bar for a couple drinks (great bartender). Roughly 25 minutes later, I receive a text indicating that our table was ready and to head over to the hostess booth. We did that and found ourselves standing in a crowded area around the booth with several other different parties waiting. I tell the hostess that I received a text and she tells me to wait a moment. So they began seating some of the other parties but 10 minutes later, I ask again and they tell me to wait (I didn&#39;t even mention my name). I&#39;m normally not the one to complain but at least acknowledge me (with eye contact) and make the impression that my inquiries matter.<br><br>Probably 25 minutes after I received the text, we finally got our table. Our server was great but there was a period where we had to wonder when our order was coming. That and my food kinda seemed like it had been sitting awhile. Other than those things, my usual experience at Cheesecake is pretty good.

Found everything we wanted there. Food is pretty standard. Hey, they r a chain. Why the 4*?Took my mum there for a girls night out dinner. Our server- Mercedes made the experience superb. She was super attentive, very polite, and always drop by to check on us. I have never had a server in any other CF locations who can ensure that my iced tea is consistently filled. Thumbs up on that. We even get to sit on the patio overlooking the crowd below. Another plus.

First off dont lie to guests and give them a false time. 15 and 50 dont sound alike. I asked him how long twice and he said 15 and 30 mins later he said he said 50... what a liar. Forget you!!!!  I hate places that have poor food service and this just pissed me off big time.. I would rather eat at Burger Kings. ..

Everyone LOVES the Cheesecake factory and I don&#39;t know how you couldn&#39;t! Yummy! The food is amazing and the cheesecake is super yummy along with the rest of the deserts.  Last time I came I think I had salmon and it was BEYOND perfection.
They showed me great service. They gave me the star treatment and I would recommend anyone to go and eat there. They are friendly and the food there is amazing.

I&#39;ve been coming to The Cheesecake Factory for as long as I can remember, and for the past 10 years my family has been coming here to celebrate birthdays. I might even go so far as to say that this is my favorite restaurant. <br><br>This visit was no exception. We arrived in the evening with a group of twelve expecting the wait to be 4 hours or something really long, but we were told that the wait time would be 2 hours. To be honest, I expected this to be the case, but Sarah (the manager), John and Yvette (the host and hostess) were super nice and helped us get seated earlier. <br><br>I would discuss the service and food, which was great, but the main reason I wanted to post this review was to praise the staff.

Every Sunday I would be here with my faintly. This is my favorite location, however the wait on a Sunday is crazy long. But hey once you get in you should be fine. Try the pasta jambalaya it&#39;s the only thing I order! Bread is yummy, drinks are good as well. If you have room for dessert there are several cheesecakes to choose from. I personally order the apple crumble and it is fantastic. I&#39;ve also tried the red velvet cheese cake before and it&#39;s delicious

Cheesecake review (not restaurant)<br><br>Holy hell. When it comes to cheesecake they have it down. They should with their name and all, lol. I&#39;ve tried multiple cheesecakes they offer with different people. My favorite has to be the Reese&#39;s one. So much flavor, if I could eat every savory morsel I would (the slices are giant). Whenever I&#39;m hanging out at the Grove with a friend or family we always have to hit up this place after dinner. It&#39;s always worth the price, at least to us.<br><br>P.S. Would it kill them to turn up the lights even like 5%?

I&#39;ve frequented several Cheesecake Factory restaurants from various locations in and out of the state.  Typically, the food and service is good.  However, my family was in town and we were meeting family at the CF at the Grove, where we had never been, since I am fairly new in town.  Beautiful facility.  However, the service was less than average. They took forever to seat us and refused to sit us outside as we requested because as they told us we had a party of seven and it was a fire hazard to connect the tables.  We looked out and saw several tables that were close enough together in the same vicinity that still would have worked, but yet they continued to fight this.  Fortunately, a server came out, after close to 30 minutes of sending us back and forth, and told us it would be okay to sit there. She then actually pulled our tables together.  Another server came out to take our order.  He was nice.  It appeared that everyone ordered their food successfully..except me.  I was feeling under the weather and had a migraine, so I simply ordered a Chicken Caesar salad.  The salad came out soggy like it had been sitting for a while somewhere.  The dressing on it did not taste like a typical Caesar salad dressing.  It was also very bland and quite off putting and there wasn&#39;t much on the salad,  The chicken was definitely flavorless.  I eventually told another server who replaced the original guy I placed the order with.  He took it back and brought out another supposedly fresh salad.  At this point, everyone else had finished their food, so I asked for a to-go-box.  Initially, the lettuce appeared to be fresher and crisper than before.  Therefore, I took everything to go before eating again.  However, the chicken was rubbery, hard, and flavorless.  The dressing was lifeless and he only gave me one small container full, so it basically was only enough to cover a few top pieces of lettuce.  Also, the croutons were stale. Wow!!!  $17.99 for this salad?  Very disappointing!!!!  And really....How in the world can any restaurant mess up a simple Caesar salad?

I generally am a fan of Cheesecake Factory. I love the location of this place. They have always a delicious food. I came here twice for lunch last week and it was really great. The service was good too. I&#39;m happy yelper for this place and I will come back soon.

I like this place because it has everything on the menu and they make it good and descent.  From a simple burger to tuna salad to salmon dish, they are all very good and reasonably priced.  It is not excellent quality, but for the price your paying, you are getting the best you can.  Recommend it if your around fairfax and want some descent food....

Attn: HQ Team Calabasas<br><br>Where do I start with this beyond unsatisfactory performance and review? <br><br>First, a bit of history.  I have been a cheesecake factory customer for just about the beginning of time. I have spent countless birthdays, anniversaries, and special occasionss with family and friends. This includes multiple locations in Las Vegas (Caesar Shoppes) and Calfornia (The Grove, Americana, Sherman Oaks etc.).<br><br>Although customer service has rarely been up to par, I have remained a loyal and devoted guest. Up until a recent visit @ their Grove location, I have decided to part ways and take my business to oher eating establishmens that will serve me or any other party as they should &#34;A guest.&#34;<br><br>I am not VIP or claim to be more special, but I was not aware I needed to be to receive the fundamental purpose of eating out which is to have an &#34;Experience&#34; and a great social gathering with great food amongst love one&#39;s and friends.<br><br>The reviews before me are consistent, and definitely show insight as to how broken processes, operations, and talent management are. <br><br>It took 1 hour and 15 minutes to be checked in, 30 minutes after check in to be seated, 20 minutes to get a waiter (rude, bad demeanor), 20 mins to get our drinks, an interval of 45 mins to order,  and I can go on.<br><br>Beyond that, management requested my wife to move so &#34;Other guest could be more comfortable!&#34; Wait... I&#39;m not a guest? <br><br>This was by far the worst experience to the point that we didn&#39;t finish our meals amd requested the check early.<br><br>In closing, I feel trends and history are great tools to understand behaviors, and can be utilized to strategically implement efficiency measures.<br><br>Please take it from a long time customer, there are far more better choices out there that will deliver a consistent experience.
I love love love cheesecake factory, I think this is my favorite restaurant. I have the jambalaya it is good spicy and tasty.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, but had a poor experience at this location. The waitress was inattentive and brought out the wrong dish than the one ordered. Obviously the person didn&#39;t want to wait for a whole new meal to be brought out and was trying to work with her by asking what the price of the wrong dish was and she said a couple of dollars more. When we got the bill it just so happened that the wrong dish was twice as much as the originally ordered dish. Not okay.

This was our first time being here and everyone was very polite with us. We ate outside, in which the view was beautiful!  Our waitress was very kind and every time she passed by us, she made sure we were doing good. However, I did not like the fact there are only two stalls in the restroom .. I had to wait in line... it&#39;s a pretty big restaurant,  I&#39;d assume there be more. It also seems to get really busy, which causes waiting for us to be seated. But aside from that it was a good experience.

Great lunch, over the top service from the manager Ernesto. Lunch started out little rough, and there were a couple of issues. Ernesto stepped in, made everything great. So much so, that it isn&#39;t worth remembering why lunch started out rough.

We came here for National Cheesecake Day, when all cheesecake was 50% off, and apparently the rest of LA had the same idea! The place was beyond packed. We were told the wait would be an hour and a half. Fine. We went to the Farmer&#39;s Market and grabbed a drink to kill some time. Instead of giving out buzzers so you know when your table is ready, they took cell phone numbers and said they&#39;d call or text when the table was ready. I had my phone on and out in front of me the whole time. After about an hour and 40 minutes, we still hadn&#39;t heard from them so we walked back and they told me that there was a mix-up and they couldn&#39;t reach us. I was annoyed because we had been waiting for them and they had just given our table to someone else. But they realized it was their mistake so they did the right thing and gave us the next available table right away. We sat outside on the upstairs patio. You can&#39;t really complain about The Cheesecake Factory menu - it has literally anything and everything you could possibly be in the mood for. I love their bread, too. I tried the fish tacos because in all my years of coming here I never had those before. They were pretty good, but just like everything else on the menu - the portions were huge. Service was okay, the food was pretty slow to come out (probably because they were so slammed with a gazillion people that night). I probably will avoid the extra touristy locations from now on, but I still love this place. Who doesn&#39;t?!

Love this place. Great customer service. Food is awesome as always. I love their bang bang chicken. Make sure you add the shrimp to make it delicious. The only issue is there is always a long line so the wait is usually at least 30 min to an hour

This is a good place to eat after shopping at the Grove. The food is always good, and I have never had a problem with it when I go here. Beware, that this place can get really busy and that you might want to put your name in before you start shopping.

Came here with my boyfriend last night and I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in a while. We really enjoyed it, the Pineapple Moscow Mule was bomb. Unfortunately don&#39;t remember our servers name but she was pretty cool and didn&#39;t get annoyed with me wanting to substitute beans for chicken in the Thai Lettuce Wraps. It wasn&#39;t that busy so obviously everything came rather quickly. Don&#39;t get to The Grove very often but we had fun.
The food is consistent and great portions. I eat here at least once a week.

This is a Cheesecake Factory.  Been to one you have been to all of them except the ones that have unique location like the Cheesecake in Redondo Beach.  This one is crowded and you feel like you are stuffed in a small place compared to most Cheesecake Factories where ample space is the norm.  If you are hungry and you want to wait for a long time for the same damn food then go for it.  My choice is to go the Farmer&#39;s Market area and have a little culture and pick your own foods and chill outside.
I was not a fan but after trying a taste of the miso salmon and the spicy chicken sandwich, I was forced to reconsider.  Well done.

Always have a great time when I go to this location. There is a good variety of food and you can always find something. They usually have good service but when it gets really crowded be aware that you will be ignored at times. <br><br>Overall, great place to eat with a very good selection.

I love coming to this Location.... My food is always Good and the staff is very friendly and welcoming.... Just remember if your going during &#34;happy hour&#34; it gets pretty busy and you might have to wait awhile for your food, but it will be delicious! :)

This place... I went there with my friend for lunch and first off the receptionist was so rude and cold.  After we ordered the waiter came back with the bread and it was freaking cold and stale.  Then I found a used butter wrapper. WTF they obviously recycle their bread basket.  Now he only impression I get is they probably recycle their foods too! Disgusting. So I calmly told my waiter so others wouldn&#39;t hear but guess what he says &#34;uh ok&#34; and takes it and brings back the same effin basket without the wrapper.  He was so damn rude.  No apologizes what so ever and gives attitude. I wish I could give this place a damn 0 star.  I even wrote to corporate but nope they didn&#39;t feel like my opinion was important.  Overall, people watch what you eat here.

Last year I dine with my family party of 5. Waitress showed a small table next to the kitchen and seat us down. I asked her that the table was too small and wanted to move to the larger table next to the esclater which was empty then. She said the large table is for party of 7 so we can&#39;t be moved. But right after then 4 caucasian people were seated at the large table So I asked the waitress they&#39;re only 4 she told me that 3more people will come sooner or later.<br>I trusted her and went to my table.<br>We were waiting for the food at the table next to the kitchen. Few minutes later I saw something crawling around the table...it was a ROACH!!!!! I call the manager and tell him that there is A Roach on the table. He grab the roach and take it away. So I went to the counter to complain...then what I saw was there are still 4 people sitting on the large table! The waitress lied to us cause we were ASIANS!!!<br>I was so upset and never go to cheesecake factory at the grove anymore. disgusting roach and horrible experience.<br> It&#39;s been about 6month ago but still get mad when I see the cheese cake factory at the grove
Herb Crusted Fillet of Salmon<br>Avocado Egg Rolls<br>Those damn mashed potatoes!!<br>Huge portions<br>Great view!<br>Love the wheat bread.

This review is about my first time here. Got there around 10pm and wasn&#39;t sure how to ask for a table because the hosts were NOT helpful at all. One of them finally gave me one of those &#34;beepers&#34; that flashes and vibrates when your table is ready. We asked him if it would be okay to go to the Barnes and Noble nearby and he said yes. Our wait was 35 minutes. So about 45 long minutes later we made it back to the restaurant. I was STARVING and I asked the host if our table was finally ready. He said that he had called but we didn&#39;t show up. Now, either the beeper thing had to be broken or he didn&#39;t call because I was so hungry that I didn&#39;t let that thing out of my sight and I know that as soon as the thing flashed I would have run over there to get some food. <br><br>So after waiting 5 more minutes, we get sent up and again the hosts are not helpful. I tell another male host I got called for my table and he said in a condescending tone &#34;oh your table CALLED? you WANT a table or you&#39;re here for a reservation?&#34; WHAT?!?! That jerk. It&#39;s not my fault I&#39;ve never been to the place and I&#39;m a little lost.<br><br>Our waitress was very nice and helpful, the food was REALLY good. I had the fettucine alfredo with chicken. I&#39;m a fatty so a couple more chunks of chicken would have been good, and the servings were huge, big enough for two. I noticed though that the pasta I took home was drenched in oil when I microwaved it. <br><br>Drinks were awesome, especially the sour apple martini. <br><br>The food is great but I feel like it&#39;s way overpriced. I wouldn&#39;t consider this place fancy, seeing as people show up dressed in their jeans and hoodies (myself included) but the prices sure are over the top.<br><br>It&#39;s alright, over all.

The food was great! Our waitress was very good. There was some mess under the table so she had to call a busboy to clean it out and we had to get up from the table. Our wait was only 20 min to get a table.

I give it 3 stars. The food is always great, but, they do not take reservations and often times it takes forever to get a table. I recommend going here if you have a lot of time to kill and if you don&#39;t mind waiting. Sometimes it&#39;s best to just take it to go and enjoy the food from the comfort of your own home.

I come here just once in a while and the service is great. The waitress that helped us was amazing although I felt like she was a bit intimidated my boyfriend because she could look at him. She would only talk to me which was kind of funny.. Anyway she was amazing and I felt sorry for her because she was trying to help so many people at the same time. The only down fall was that the table next to us couldn&#39;t stop staring at our table. It was very uncomfortable.. Other then that I could say that my waitress was great. That I recall she had cute little orange hair..

The waiter paid us no attention, put chicken on our pasta when we said no, brought our appetizer with the entree, and never offered us cracked pepper.  The chicken tasted frozen in our pasta with no seasoning.
I love the ambiance and the waiter&#39;s are attentive to your needs checking up if you need anything else. I enjoy coming here with friends!  always have a great time.
Hot spinache and cheese dip...it&#39;s good but I got so full off of the squaw bread and butter. Very good.
Customer service was bad , but the food was good . But I didn&#39;t get my bread and butter ..

I love their Sunday Brunch. It&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve come by for this, but wow I was delighted today. I LOVE the Eggs Benedict! They added spinach, tomato, and bacon to the mix! The hollandaise sauce was creamy and very flavorful. The hash browns were as dark and crunchy as I ordered them. I didn&#39;t feel like a mimosa this morning so I went w something a little stronger. Passion Fruit Mojitos!!! Delicious! I&#39;ll probably be back for a redux next week!! <br>I highly recommend their Sunday Brunch! It&#39;s less than $50 for everything before tip.
the service was very nice<br>we got a text msg that our table was ready<br>the food was great<br>recomended to be seated in te balcony

If I can rate the service at this location a zero I&#39;d gladly do so. I&#39;ve always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory but our server &#34;Kevin A&#34; was just so slow!! Talk about turtle slow! He seemed utterly clueless about the scope of his job. Several people on our section was just as annoyed as we were because he was lingering around and not being attentive to any of us! I&#39;m appalled that a fine establishment like this will hire incompetent servers like him!
Never had such bad service. Our waiter never came to check on us. He never gave us a refill. We waited over 20 min for our check. Watch out if you get a waiter named Demetri.

though I&#39;ve been there for only once, I hear about the restaurant all the time, I was really impressed by the food there, I love it! <br>Parking is very convenient in the parking structure of The Grove, and luckily we sat outside on the balcony which has great vision and fresh air. The pasta that I ordered was tasty and I like the source, also the cheesecake was really delicious!<br>The atmosphere is kind of romantic and makes you feel really comfortable, a great place for lovers~

I suppose you don&#39;t come here looking for small portions, or anything healthy, but I was surprised that they did have a few &#34;small plate&#34; options for people who aren&#39;t looking for a ton of food. I split an order of tamale-style corn cakes with my husband which were very moist and delicious. We also had an order of orange chicken which was crispy and flavorful, but greasy. <br><br>As for the service, we were seated pretty quickly (within 10-15 minutes or so) even though it seemed very crowded. Our waited wasn&#39;t overly friendly, but efficient. We asked for waters along with our cocktails, but had to ask twice for them. He was so busy, I almost felt bad for asking for anything.. <br><br>Its probably best to come here during a non-high peak time, as I can see where the wait might get crazy and the service quality would dip down as well.

Been sitting here forever &amp; they still haven&#39;t brought me my food! They also waited 15 mins before even asking me if I wanted anything, the bus boy got me service and the best part is it&#39;s 11:00am, so it&#39;s empty &amp; I&#39;m still waiting!! Def not coming to this Cheesecake Factory again!!

A friend convinced me to go. I don&#39;t know how she does it, but every time I go to LA she insists on going to a chain restaurant instead of something local.<br><br>The food is what you expect from a chain. The service is what you expect. The drinks are what you expect. Why are you even reading this? You know what to expect.

I like the Cheesecake Factory. I have never had a bad experience here. The menu is very extensive so there is something for everybody. The food is great, the drinks amazing, the place is clean and the staff is friendly. Great place to come with the family or with your friends. The only thing I don&#39;t like about the Cheesecake Factory is the long wait but since I already know its busy I always give myself time to do a little shopping or just walk around the beautiful Groove enjoying a nice sunny day.

I&#39;m generally okay when my waiter needs to have someone take over their tables, but not in this case. The replacement waiter had only 3-4 tables on the small patio to take care of. I was with just one friend and she LITERALLY IGNORED US; I was trying to get her attention for a refill and she tended to the table of four the most, maybe because they generate more money or tip...idk. She kept asking the other tables if they were doing ok and failed to even make eye contact with us!! <br><br>When we were ready for our check, she gave us the wrong one and TOOK OFF FOR 10-15min!!! We just sat there, waiting...eventually she gave us the correct reciept after we told her. It took a total of 25 minutes just to pay.<br><br> BOTTOM LINE: DONT SIT ON THE TABLE OF TWO AT THE PATIO. POOR SERVICE.

The Cheesecake Factory is usually a great choice for lunch or dinner but not worth an hour and a half wait at the Grove. With so many choices in that area that do take reservations make a smarter choice and look for alternatives.

The worst experience, almost 1 hour and 30 mins waiting to just to get a plate of food. Just to find out they give you some ugly section of the restaurant where people are always walking and bumping into you. The hosts are okay and host in charge of sitting people ignored me when I asked to be switch to another table. Sarcastically, tell me that I looked very hungry and simply walked away. I took off after waiting 30 more minutes just for the person to take my order. Never coming back to this place again!!!

Two and a half hour wait?!  I love Cheesecake Factory, but every time I have tried to go to this one, the wait has been over an hour long.  The last time I went, we were told the wait would be over two hours, so we left.  I&#39;m sure she was just stressed from the sheer volume of people, but the hostess was not very friendly.<br><br>On the upside, the food is delicious.  I recommend the red velvet cheesecake and the sweet corn tamale cakes.

Stay away on the weekends! It was my choice to wait an hour for a table then another 15-20 minutes for a booth. My friend and I both knew what we were ordering. From the time our order was taken it took 1 hour 20 for our food to hit the table! We were offered comp salad or soup at 58 minutes which we turned down. Her food was fine , my  pork chop was over cooked and dry but I wasn&#39;t sending it back!they need to hire more cooks to get the food out if they are going to seat that many people. When I lleft I discovered I had to pay $8 for parking because even with validation I wasn&#39;t covered. The server was embarrassed and when he came and told us he was taking his dinner break I recommended he eat elsewhere!

Piece of shit place I will never eat there ever in my life worst service ever manager is a piece of s*** don&#39;t go there I waited for a fucken over 2 hours and a half I feel it was racism f*** them they are a piece of s*** a place with nasty food and I am calling their corporate office

I had lunch here the other day and ordered the grilled salmon glazed with BBQ sauce.  It was really good!  This dish was my favorite dish at the Grande Lux Cafe, which sadly  shuttered.  It&#39;s not on the menu here, but our waiter gladly urged me to order it anyway explaining the kitchen will recreate it for me.  Although it wasn&#39;t 100% the same, the salmon was really good anyway.  My lunch could have been a 5 star experience but it became rather unpleasant when another waiter brought food for us that we didn&#39;t order and then asked us 5 times if we were sure. When we told him firmly that we didn&#39;t order it, our waiter came over and those two started fighting in front of us totally ruining our lunch.

I&#39;m not sure many really need a review of CF at this point. You know what to expect: decent/good food, gigantic menu/selection, and a 45min wait for a table. But I wanted to give a heads-up to my gluten free people:<br><br>Your waiter will likely get a manger for you to come by and explain what they can offer you in terms of GF food. The only issue I ran into was that this manager wasn&#39;t aware that cooking veggies in pasta water would give a celiac a reaction. I politely informed him of the danger and I didn&#39;t end up getting sick from my chicken (without marinade, which has soy sauce) and sauteed  veggies. <br><br>(Also, apparently, they&#39;ll be rolling out a GF menu at all locations before the end of 2011.)

I went here the night Deathly Hallows: Part 2 opened to kill some time before the midnight showing. Since the Cheesecake Factory is open an hour later than most other restaurants in the Grove, it was packed.<br><br>It took about 50 min to get a table, but the service was very friendly and almost inappropriately quick. Like, too fast for people trying to burn two hours before a movie.<br><br>Unfortunately, I can only rate the food here as &#34;meh&#34;. Cheesecake has a huge, diverse menu, but I feel like they never really nail anything perfectly, minus the cheesecake. Everything is just &#34;good&#34; or &#34;ok&#34;.<br><br>Still, it&#39;s cheaper than the other options in the Grove (once the market is closed) and there&#39;s bound to be something you like on the menu.
What&#39;s better than stopping at Cheesecake Factory for coffey and cheesecakes on your shopping break when your at the grove in Beverly Hills! And they validate your parking!

Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food is excellent, no matter where you go. This is a guarantee. <br><br>I usually order the grilled chicken avocado club sandwich with sweet potato fries and it is always made to perfection. My wife orders either the miso salmon or their luao salad and swears by them both. Our favorite appetizer is the avocado egg rolls that come with some delicious dipping sauce.<br><br>As for the service at The Grove location. Terrible.There was a party of 8 of us and we were told 105 minute wait for lunch. After 120 minutes we started to get fussy and irritable. Still no table. After 130 minutes, we decided to find out what is going on. Turns out, they were readying tables to sit our party, but someone sat down a couple at a table and to their right was our tables and to their left, our tables. So basically, they sat down this couple that divided the tables that were being held for us. They didn&#39;t want to move the couple and instead were waiting for them to eat their orders, deserts etc. Well, that wasn&#39;t happening for us. We walked over to the couple and asked if we could move them over so we can get the tables together and they agreed. We explained to the Manager and the people doing the seating that making us wait was a terrible idea, silly at best and could of been resolved 30 minutes ago by asking the couple to just allow us to scoot their table over and let us bring the other tables around them so they can be consolidated. To make us wait a total of 143 minutes what plain crap.<br><br>No one apologized, comped us anything or tried to make us feel better for such a long wait. Too bad it was my wife&#39;s birthday celebration and we wasted almost 2 1/2 hours just waiting for Cheesecake to get our tables ready.<br><br>When we asked for a cake for my wife&#39;s birthday, they couldn&#39;t even have the common sense to bring a piece of cake with a candle on it! Common guys.<br><br>I&#39;ve never had any problems with any other location, but I think the volume of customers at The Grove along with the small Cheesecake Factory location was a bad combination.<br><br>Really disappointed.

This is one of my favorite cheesecake factories. The food and service are both great. I love sitting on the balcony at night because there is a nice view. It does get a little crowded on friday nights, but I think that&#39;s to be expected. I have been during the day, at night, and later in the evening and I always have attentive service and good food.They handled the crowds well and we did not wait any longer than they told us we would. You are given a pager and you can shop a few stores down while you wait. I love their lunch menu. <br>You can go upstairs to order take out, and their tea is fantastic if you want to get something quick to drink.

went here on a weekday after work to have appetizer&#39;s and a drink.<br><br>Fork on my table was dirty. Not wanting to cause a scene or bother a waiter/waitress I replace the fork with the one on the next table. Next thing I know I was getting screamed at by this waitress on another table &#39;to just giver her the fork.&#39; First of all, you don&#39;t scream at a GUEST. Too bad, I didn&#39;t get her name. Second, whoever did the table preparation FAILED by not checking the utensils.  <br><br>Uncalled for and unacceptable.
Ok i&#39;m not really stingy when it comes on giving good reviews the food was good but that bloke was an arse.

Hard to be positive about Cheesecake.  The things that I used to enjoy or at least accept just aren&#39;t that acceptable anymore:<br><br>1) The bathroom&#39;s are very small.  This is ordinarily a small part of a restaurant experience, but consider the following: a large portion of the people at the Grove are families with small children.  Just go ahead and try washing your child&#39;s hands at the single sink in the men&#39;s room which they can&#39;t reach from the ground, so you have to hoist them up onto the counter.  <br><br>But wait!  <br><br>The counter is sopping wet.  So you have to spend a few seconds grabbing handfuls of paper towels to dry it off, or your child will have a wet bottom and things will really go downhill.  So you dry it off, only now the line of men waiting for the sink is growing by the minute.  <br><br>So I madly try to wash my child&#39;s hands, but the only way to do this is one hand at a time, which basically doubles the time it takes.  The line grows longer, with silent looks of annoyance.  So you do the best job you can, a little hurried, but whatever, its ok, kids have dirty hands all the time, right?<br><br>2) The restaurant aisles are pretty narrow.  You live in constant fear that a waiter carrying 4 plates of steaming pasta is going to spill it all over your child in the high chair.<br><br>3) The food isn&#39;t that great.  The menu has about 400 items on it - common sense would dictate that no one can cook 400 items well.  So what you end up with are a bunch of pastas, salads, or deep fried items that are all pretty mediocre. <br><br>The only positive here is that the portions are large enough to give an elephant a heart attack.  So you&#39;ll have leftovers to feed your child the next day while you try and recover from eating at Cheesecake.  When I was younger I used to like this - but now, I really don&#39;t need all the extra mediocre calories.<br><br>The bottom line - there is no reason to dine here, when the Farmer&#39;s Market is right around the corner, is cheaper, and just as noisy.

Even when it seems there&#39;s a crazy long wait you can get in at the bar in under 15min. Solid food. Servers are always efficient and friendly. What more could you want from this tried and true business? Take your leftovers to the movie next door.

Not one to visit a Cheesecake Factory, per say.  That is until a few weeks back some friends and myself agreed to meet here. <br><br> So we come an there is a huge line of people holding the little beeper thing waiting to be beeped and called to sit.  So we too stand around, not quite in the sam line, but we wait around until we get beeped.  <br><br>We are seated upstairs on the balcony and everyone orders drinks and we are brought bread basket and everyone eats the bread.  <br><br>We order food some 30 min later.  We were taking our time with ordering; no one could decide what to eat.  <br><br>Food comes out about 30 min later.  We are cool with that.  We were too busy chatting.  <br><br>Servers come to take our plates.  No one is done with food.  So server leaves.  <br><br>Servers come around again about 20 min later to refill our drinks.  No one wants to let go of their plate.  So we sit and chat some more.<br><br>An hour passes.  Waiter is leaving for the day.  A new waiter is serving us.<br><br>He comes to our table every 20 min.  We still don&#39;t want to give up our plates. <br><br>Finally, about another hour passes.  This waiter wants us out.  Brings us boxes.  <br><br>We order dessert. <br><br>Needless to say, I don&#39;t  know why we didn&#39;t want to leave but we over stood our welcome.  <br><br>We took our time eating dessert and paying our bill.  The bill was pretty high, so whats the rush? <br><br>Again-What&#39;s the rush, Cheesecake Factory?<br><br>Geesh!

My friend took me and a friend  here for our birthdays. I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in a few years. My joke is I never actually get cheesecake because the portions are so huge that there is no room for dessert and today was no exception.  <br><br>Fried Zucchini was yummy but the zucchini seemed a little undercooked.<br><br>One friend had ice water but it was way more ice than water so we had to remove the ice and put it on the bread plate and remind whoever was refilling to chill (ha! get it!?! I made a pun) on the ice.<br><br>I had the chicken enchiladas...they were just &#34;meh&#34;. <br><br>I was drinking soda water with lime and one of the staff just assumed I was drinking Sprite so that was gross when I tasted my watered down Sprite expecting plain soda water.<br><br>My friend seemed to like her salad (can&#39;t remember which one she got) and my other friend liked the samosas.<br><br>They sang happy birthday to us (which is horrifying to me but my other friend loved it) and gave us a wee little dessert which was unexpected and nice.<br><br>Spencer was a great server but overall, the experience didn&#39;t knock my socks off.

Busy. Busy. Busy. That can be good or bad news depending how you view it. Make yourself more than enough time as you will probably be waiting for a table, like everyone else. <br><br>There is a solution: inform the host that sitting at the Bar is a acceptable option. <br><br>My friend and I do it. Great advantages:<br>Fantastic service from the Bartender. <br>View the vast shelves of liquors. The designs on some of the bottles is artwork. <br><br>No need to feel frustrated with that familiar experience patrons dislike: &#34; where is the waiter/ waitress?&#34; <br><br>Bartenders are customer service friendly. <br>We had no complaints. <br><br>Sometimes it is possible to walk in and make for the stairs straight to the bar yourself. <br><br>Sometimes the host will say the bar seats are filled. <br><br>That restaurant and bakery are busy due to good food and desserts. Repeat business is a good sign it is worth the visit. <br><br>Bad side? Waiting during busy hours.<br>At those times it can sound loud with all the surrounding talk. <br><br>It is to be expected. Worth repeated visits. Their bakery has take outs. They have a busy line there. Some good choices sell out fast. <br><br>Try to call in advance to inquire if it is possible to make reservations. <br><br>Additionally, ask when they have off peak hours to make a trip there to eat. <br><br>Yummy.

I made the mistake of going here on a Saturday night at the grove which also happened to be the first week of the Christmas light set up etc. Cheesecake was packed- 1.5 hour wait for 2 people so we sat in the bar. But we fortunately had an awesome server - ALLISON. She was working her ass off to accommodate all her tables and all the special requests. She was so polite and professional even when there were cranky guests testing her patience. We might not be back on Saturday night but will still come for the awesome staff here! Thanks Allison:)

This rating is solely based on &#34;To Go&#34; orders. I work at the Grove so I order fairly regularly from this location.  I love this restaurant chain and they have delicious food, but this particular location seems to have issues when you place an order to go. More times than not, my to go order is missing something that wouldn&#39;t be missing from a dine in customer. My particular issue is when I order the Factory Nachos. On past occasions, I&#39;ve added chicken and not received it or it&#39;s been something simple like they forgot the guacamole and sour cream; which is a special order for the nachos! They come standard! I haven&#39;t order the nachos in a while because of my poor luck with that particular item,  but I gave it another shot tonight. And, not surprising, they forgot the sour cream and guacamole.  I have always been taken care of when I have brought my complaint about missing items from my orders, but the frequency in which I have to do this is too often.  My advice would be to check your orders BEFORE leaving the restaurant.

Very bad service. Wait time is too long. Staff is rude and unprofessional. Its almost as if theyr doing you a favour by serving you food, a service im paying them for.Not to mention they are always crazy crowded and the staff seem incapable of handling so many customers at once.<br>This is ok for brunch or carry out (cheesecake)<br>Save your money and go to the cheesecake factory in Glendale in americana.

We went there for my fiancée&#39;s birthday, and most decent restaurants give/offer something for the birthday guest, well don&#39;t expect any niceticites from the money grubby bastards at the cheese cake factory. We had a large party, which no doubt would cover anything for a birthday guest. The only reason this review has two stars is I am in love with the ahi tuna tapa. The waitress was not attentive to our table, and we had to ask passerbys for assistance. Ugh!

Okay, unless you&#39;re getting the cheesecake or have friends who lack taste buds and wish to have dinner, go elsewhere. By all means, you won&#39;t get sick or anything, but I would venture elsewhere given the price and quality of the food. <br><br>I arrived with a rather large group of semi-family visiting from the areas around Los Angeles, presenting the Grove as a midway meet-up. We all ordered what sounded like wonderful dishes, taking the advice of our server when needed. After a reasonable wait, our dishes came out, a seeming panoply of American gluttony (and steaming goodness). Now, as a large group, one might decrease their expectations of the quality of the food, given that it&#39;s difficult to serve big masses. But, given that we were paying for entrees in the upper teens, I expected a bit more than monotony. Specifically, everything somewhat tasted the same. My dish of the chicken madeira ($17.50, recommended by the server as &#34;the most popular chicken dish&#34;) failed to please. It was extremely salty, and after about three bites, nearly everything tasted the same--my chicken, the potatoes, the asparagus, etc. So, I nibbled off my neighbors&#39; plates to try to cut the monotony and found that their food (lemon herb roasted chicken, $16.95, and four cheese pasta, $13.95) was quite mediocre and homogeneous in flavor as well. <br><br>The ambiance, however, was fine. A bit loud, but bustling with energy and surrounded by a fun outdoor area (the Grove). And, as mentioned, the cheesecake is good. Not as amazing as the cheesecake I got growing up from this little hole-in-the-wall in upstate New York, but better than most places on this coast. So, at least they put their money where their mouth, living up to their name--and almost making me bump my rating up to a 2... almost.

food is so overrated and not worth it<br><br>ordered the Chicken Milan or something; huge plate came out with 2 large flattened pieces of chicken, breaded and pan fried, a huge mound of steamed broccoli, and i asked for sweet potato fries instead of mashed potatoes.<br><br>the chicken was bland, lemon was sour, cream was meh<br>broccoli had no seasoning or flavor whatsoever, sweet potato fries were good tho<br><br>service was lacking too; our first server disappeared, had 3 different servers ask if we ordered drinks, then a 4th to take away our plate...and no this wasn&#39;t a group serving thing, this was each server not knowing which table belongs to who<br><br>1 star for having good cheesecakes from previous experience

My family come here very often but the last experience we had at Grove Cheesecake factory was a disaster.  My daughter got very sick after she ate mac&amp;cheese.  She was vomiting the whole night and day lost few pounds in few days.  My kids said they would never got to that restaurant again.

How can I ever turn down Cheesecake Factory?  It&#39;s impossible really - there&#39;s something for everyone on that ginormous menu, and it&#39;s all good.  Plus, their desserts are AWESOME!  The only thing is that the wait is usually an hour or more at all the locations.<br><br>However not when I came to this location for the first time late on a Monday evening.  We walked in and requested a booth, and one magically opened up for us immediately!  Nice!<br><br>We both knew that we wanted a ribeye, and STAT because we were starving.  So instead of searching through the book that is their menu, we asked our server for a recommendation when took our drink orders.  She pointed out the ribeye on the menu, and we were SOLD - that was easy!<br><br>Or so we thought.....<br><br>A few minutes after we placed our orders, she came back to tell us that they had just sold out of their last ribeye.  Seriously??  On a Monday night??<br><br>What we ended up getting was fine, but after anticipating a ribeye, this was somewhat of a booby prize:<br><br>Filet Mignon - served with steamed broccoli and a couple of onion rings (not strings, as it originally says) it was fine.  But to me, this cut is just not as flavorful due to the lack of marbling.  It did satisfy my need for meat though!<br><br>Carne Asada Skirt Steak - served with rice, beans, choice of corn or flour tortillas, and sour cream/salsa/guac.  The steak was tender and flavored with a slightly sweet marinade, and my friend liked it a lot.  I ate the sour cream and guac : P.<br><br>We couldn&#39;t resist dessert, so we got:<br><br>Key Lime Cheesecake - really good, limey tart-sweet cheesecake!<br><br>Pineapple Upside Down Cheesecake - OMG YUM!  A pineapple-y cheesecake layer between layers of Pineapple Upside Down cake - texturally SUPER moist and creamy all together, and separately delicious.  This was a dessert that I could have eaten a barrel full of had my thighs not screamed for mercy!  <br><br>We had also ordered decafs with dessert, but when they never arrived we asked our server if we were getting any.  She looked at us without so much as a hint of recognition and said, sure - she&#39;d bring some.  By that point, we were done with dessert so we changed our minds an declined as soon as we asked for it.  It still would have been nice to see a flicker of a memory of our order however : /.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory in general is very good - so yes, I&#39;d come back if seating happened this quickly again.  I just hope they have more ribeyes next time!

I see fat people. This place would scare M. Night.<br><br>Story: Years ago when I was working myself through school I bartended at a little joint in Chicago that had a very small kitchen. We made great burgers. The guys from Second City frequented it for the cheap drinks and burgers. But we didn&#39;t have bacon. If I had a dollar for every time someone wanted a bacon cheeseburger, I would be a rich woman. I finally got smart and kept a secret stash of bacon in the fridge for the &#34;valued&#34; customers. So Oscar Meyer basically put me through school.<br><br>The Cheescake Factory must have put a million health clubs into business by the look of the patrons. Or cardio surgeons. And the food? Passable. But an hour wait or longer for deep fried fat fried in fat is not my idea of a good time.<br><br>Also, I am Pavlov&#39;s puppy when it comes to cheesecake. But this shit does not ring my bell. Overly processed, chemical tasting. Nothing to sit up and beg for.
Oh! By the way! This is the first time I&#39;m writing Yelp review after using Yelp for so many years! And I&#39;m a waiter myself too! This restaurant&#39;s service is no accepted at all!

Worst experience ever. Very disappointed with the way our table was situation was handle. We check in to be seated out in the patio, we were told that the wait time would be 40 minutes. We agree and waited to be called. Once we where called in to be seated the hostess gave our table to another party so we where ask to wait additional time. We waited 15 additional minutes and where told that our table was ready. As we went in to be seated they tried to seat us inside, we said &#34;no, we want a table in the patio&#34;. We where told we would have to wait some time for a table in he patio. We waited another 20 minutes and was told. It was a system error and that we had not register for patio seating. I said, that&#39;s not true we waited 40 minutes for a patio table and you gave out our table to another party. Finally 1hr and 20 minutes later we got our table and just a simple sorry. To top it off when leaving I asked for validation in the front counter and the gentleman in the counter took my ticket and didn&#39;t validated, so to my surprise when driving out I had to pay full parking fee. Thanks a lot cheese cake factory for giving me and my family a not so wonderful 17 wedding anniversary dinner. Never again are we going back.
We had filet mignon and shrimp scampi. No resent action, greasy shrimp, ...<br><br>The quality is okay but not worth the money. It is becoming a high end fast food!<br><br>Not happy :(
You can get anything it seems at this restaurant. The red velvet cheesecake is to die for.
I can&#39;t say enough about this restaurant.The food was delicious and the service was fast.The great atmosphere added so much to the experience.Thumbs up!
Steak Diane and herb crusted salmon. Along with arugula salad. Mmm, mmm!

I guess it must be a sign of my palette, general appreciation for food and restaurant tastes improving under the expert tutelage of Dawson S, because had I written a review of this place before I met her, I would have probably given Cheesecake Factory 5 stars!<br><br>Now it is nothing more than a place to catch a quick bite at the bar (providing of course you can get a seat at the insanely small said bar)<br><br>Lets face it, Cheesecake Factory is more of a place for families and tourists, and that is not necessarily a bad thing, but it ain&#39;t for me anymore. I find the food ok to good, but the fact that it is so generic has become a turn off for me.<br><br>So yes, quick drink / bite at the bar - Yes. Full on meal - there are better places, which is nice.

How the AMERICAN IDOL judges might critique The Cheesecake Factory...<br><br>RANDY: Yo, dawg. I wanted the Jambolaya to be hot, but yo... keepin&#39; it real... it wasn&#39;t off da hook or nothin&#39;. I mean, when I was workin&#39; with Mariah I had some of her Jambolaya and that was da bomb... But this one... the paprika was all over the place... there just wasn&#39;t consistency... and I had to add Tabasco... it was just a&#39;ight for me... Paula?<br><br>PAULA: I think I have to agree with Randy... I think the Jambolaya looked very pretty... It was a good-looking plate of rice and chicken and shrimp... and it had such a great aura about it... and it had such a fantastic attitude...<br><br>SIMON (rolling his eyes): Paula, did you like it?<br><br>PAULA (shooting him a look):  I... don&#39;t... like.... you...<br><br>(RANDY &#34;woofs&#34;)<br><br>SIMON: That&#39;s a &#34;no.&#34; <br><br>(PAULA hits his arm) <br><br>SIMON: Listen Cheesecake Factory... The Jambolaya was, like, when you go to a second rate all-you-can-eat-buffet or w&#39;o&#39;evah... Some of these other restaurants have set the bar... Maggiano&#39;s...  Wood Ranch Barbeque.... They&#39;ve upped their game... They&#39;ve set the bar... but you, Cheesecake Factory... you might as well pack your bags, because we&#39;re looking for that &#34;X&#34; factor and with you, I don&#39;t see it... and all those ads in the menu... I mean, is this a restaurant because if I&#39;m paying for a meal at these prices, I don&#39;t expect to be bombarded by ads for Palm Trios or w&#39;o&#39;evah...<br><br>RYAN: But you chose to come to this restaurant...<br><br>SIMON: Ryan, why don&#39;t you just go kiss a boy or w&#39;o&#39;evah...<br><br>RYAN: Why don&#39;t I just kiss you?...<br><br>PAULA: I need a drink... which I won&#39;t drink... because I don&#39;t drink... but what the hell?...<br><br>(Randy &#34;woofs&#34;)

I love coming to this Cheesecake Factory. On my recent visit which was on Monday Sept. 29 my service was amazing we got a table in less than 10 minutes and our server was amazing he kept checking up on us and he even gave me a small sample of a new cheesecake they were adding to the menu. I got the avocado egg rolls which were delicious, my dad got the chicken teriyaki which he said was a great choice and my cousin got the Alfredo fettuccine pasta which he loves. Overall I love this place.
Went there on Dec 2012, the first dinner when arrived in LA. With a group of Chinese student from CUC. The best memory.

It&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory, so if you&#39;ve been to one before, you already know about the food choices and the cold-case of whole cheesecakes available near the front of the restaurant.<br><br>This one is no different so far as the food selection goes -- you get moderately sized dishes at moderate prices  -- with nothing on the menu being particularly outstanding and worthy of making a specific trip out there. Even the vaunted cheesecakes, supposedly so delicious that the restaurant itself is named for their sake -- aren&#39;t anything to write home about.<br><br>Basically, if you&#39;re already at The Grove, tired from shopping (or holding someone else&#39;s purse while they try on stuff) and aren&#39;t in the mood for something quick and cheap (such as a Wetzel&#39;s Pretzel or just eating in the food court in the Farmer&#39;s Market), The Cheesecake Factory is an okay choice if you aren&#39;t planning a romantic date or don&#39;t mind the sound of screaming children and metal and ceramic dinnerware being plonked down onto kitchen counter tops by the staff.<br><br>Once you get into the restaurant and ride the escalator (yes, an escalator) to the second-floor dining area, you will sort of feel a &#34;cafeteria&#34; or &#34;Hometown Buffet&#34; type vibe to the place, which, depending on your particular mindset, could be a good or bad thing. Even though you&#39;re on the second floor, don&#39;t expect any sweeping views of the scenery outside. Yep, blocked!<br><br>Compared to other Cheesecake Factory locations (such as Sherman Oaks or Beverly Hills), The Grove location has rather middling service that is hit or miss, not that ANY Cheesecake Factory is all that great anyway, though: at The Grove, sometimes your server will be great, sometimes he or she doesn&#39;t want to be at work, and their expression and service shows it.<br><br>Did you finish off your Coke? Yeah, well, expect to wait ten or fifteen minutes for it to get filled up again.<br><br>If you&#39;re planning a more grown-up style outing such as a date or dinner with other grown up friends and would like a more mature atmosphere, Morel&#39;s French Steakhouse or Wood Ranch BBQ and Grill (both within the same outdoor mall as Cheesecake Factory) are much better choices. <br><br>Ironically, Anne Morton&#39;s and Wood Ranch BBQ aren&#39;t much more pricey than Cheesecake Factory, and will usually serve you more quickly and more pleasantly -- in a pleasanter (is that a word? No? Well, it stays) atmosphere to boot.<br><br>Overall, this Cheesecake Factory feels like a factory, where you, the customer, are on an assembly line waiting your turn to get pushed around and annoyed for a while, before finally leaving a bunch of money behind to thank them for the favor.

Something happened to me last night, at this particular branch of The Cheesecake Factory, that I thought was un-possible.  I received a bowl of macaroni and cheese that was (...wait for it...) too cheesy.  It was actually a disgusting oily blob of melted cheese.  <br><br>Now, I like me some cheese.  In fact I consider cheese to be its own food group and it is generally at the base of my personal food pyramid (base is bigger, meaning more portions per day, even though one would think that the top of the food pyramid would be better, it is not, but I digress).  What I do not like is to see my cheese all melted into its component parts and to recognize that the delicious food item that I am consuming is heading straight into the arteries surrounding my heart.  <br><br>Anyway, back to The Cheesecake Factory.  Their food just isn&#39;t really that good.  At some point in my life, when I didn&#39;t mind the idea of consuming an entire 1000 calorie slice of cheesecake, I enjoyed their desserts.  Sadly those days have passed.  The fact that their &#34;diet&#34; salads only promise to be less than 600 calories should really tip off anyone who wants to remain below 250 pounds that this is a dangerous place.  <br><br>Also, no happy hour specials at all.  That&#39;s just plain bad business practices.

5 star because of one awesome server named Rene R.  He was absolutely fabulous!  He was so good, I went home &amp; wrote Corporate to tell them the following:<br><br>&#34;I am contacting you to let you know of exceptional service we received tonight at The Cheesecake Factory located at The Grove in Los Angeles, CA.  It&#39;s my birthday tomorrow and my cousin, her boyfriend and my mom decided to have dinner with me a day early.  We decided on this location as it was the closest &amp; we love the menu.<br><br>Rene R was our waiter tonight (Check #0583 - Table #51 - SvrCk #6 @ 19:04 on 8/2/10).  He is one superb employee!  He greeted us with a smile.  Friendly &amp; knowledgeable.  Helpful and attentive.  My mom ordered hot water w/ lemon.  On his own, half way through the meal, he brought another mug of hot water w/ lemon wedges on the side.  We didn&#39;t even ask for a refill.  Same for the waters.  Same for the bread.  He was busy but never too busy to keep checking in on us.<br><br>He recommended the lemon herb roasted chicken for me &amp; it was delicious!<br><br>Just the way he served us as well as the other tables around us, I turned to my mom &amp; said, he could be a waiter at a 5-star high end restaurant.  Don&#39;t get me wrong, we love The Cheesecake Factory.  But the last time I got that kind of service @ any of your locations was...never.  And I&#39;ve been going to this chain for over 15 years now.<br><br>If anything, he reminded me of Stu @ Bix in San Francisco.  Or Mrs. Dwyer @ Lawry&#39;s Beverly Hills.  I remember servers&#39; names if they impress me with their great service.  If possible, I&#39;ll definitely be asking to be seated in his area again.<br><br>I hope you guys keep Rene for a long time and move him onto the Managerial track.  A lot of your other waiters/waitresses could do with a bit of training of Rene style service!<br><br>Thank you for hiring him and making my b&#39;day dinner a very pleasant surprise!&#34;<br><br>Yeah yeah - so I gushed - but hey!  If management ever needs to check his personnel files, here&#39;s one nice customer compliment in his favor, right?

I prefer quality over quantity, and when it comes to Cheesecake Factory they overwhelmingly prefer the latter.  Even their &#34;smaller portion&#34; lunch specials are ridiculously large!  It&#39;s a whole trough of mind-numbingly boring, bland food.  <br><br>One star for corn fritters and good cheesecakes.  One star for friendly-enough service.

I came to Cheesecake Factory for my mom&#39;s birthday with my family. After a ridiculous 45 minute wait on a freakin Thursday, we were finally seated. <br><br>It took an extremely long time for the waiter to take our order, but it seemed like he tried his best to give us some attention. This place looked very busy. So after a 45 minute wait, we waited 20 minutes for our order to be taken, and then another 25 minutes for our food to come out. So an hour and a half wait to eat.<br><br>Most of my family and I ordered pasta. I ordered the special jambalaya, which was decent. My fatty side loves all of the meat in it and it was huge. The downside of the pasta was it&#39;s lack of spice and flavor. There wasn&#39;t as much flavor I&#39;d hoped for in the pasta. Some of the other pastas I tried had the same exact problem. A lot of meat, a lot of pasta, but not much sauce. The appetizers were okay as well.<br><br>All in all, it was a decent dinner, with a ridiculously long wait. Without the wait, I&#39;d probably give it 3 stars, but the wait was so atrocious especially on a Thursday, that I can not see how people think Cheesecake Factory is worth it for the price and wait. Don&#39;t come here unless you&#39;re forced. Like I was. Fatty in me loves the serving size, but hated almost everything else.

I called and asked them how much a 11 person wait would be right now. They said I had to come in. I understood but I wanted to get an idea. I personally came in after I valet and they told me 4 hrs. No one is going to wait four hours. THey should of respectfully told us that  over the phone when I called.

I came here with my 5-yr old daughter twice in the past month.  She liked it very much -- I suspect a major reason was that the long wait for our seats would allow her to play with the iPad for a full hour at the Apple Store nearby. <br><br>The food was Ok, but on the bland side.  I had the jambalaya pasta the first time --- it was a major disappointment.  I had been expecting a cajun-flavored dish full of flavor, but it turned out without any flavor --- and the pasta was way overcooked.  I had a steak the second time --- that was Ok, the meat was tender, juicy and cooked to the right doneness.  <br><br>The service was very good.  The waiter was very friendly.

Went here yesterday with the bf for lunch.  <br><br>Normally, I really like their food, but I made the mistake of trying something I hadn&#39;t had before.   I usually stick to the hot dishes, but I decided to try one of their sandwiches, since it was lunch time.  I ordered the Navajo, which is a grilled chicken sandwich with avocado, two kinds of mayo, lettuce, tomato, and red onion on a flatbread.  Served with fries.  I thought it sounded appealing, but it was really bland.  While I would normally shudder at the thought of ketchup on grilled chicken, it was the only way I could get some flavor on there.<br><br>3.5 stars.

Ok, so usually i avoid Cheescake Fact and other similar chains like the plague. I always seem to be only mildly satisfied with my meal after a 2 hour wait, and then i give into the expensive indulgent cheesecake at the end to cheer myself back up and make up for the weird chicken i had. but, this time was different. this time, it was Happy Hour! <br><br>I am a Happy Hour Hora. Their happy hour is from 4-6 and everything was $5 bucks!  Me and my fellow unemployed friend were just in time to start it off! (Isn&#39;t it sad and ironic that working people can never really enjoy happy hour hours?). <br><br>I digress, the food and drinks were delish. Bar section only. Service was solid. <br><br>Drinks: I had the J.W Pink Lemonade and it was GIGANTIC.  I also tried to change it up with the cosmo but it was too late.  My friend had the Long Island and it was strong. <br><br>Food: Huge Menu! Fried Calamari (big portion, delish!), Corn Croquettes (goodness, i can&#39;t stop thinking about them), wild mushroom pizza (small and just &#34;ok&#34;), chicken samosas (well flavored with a nice side dip). <br><br>The food was on point and the drinks were even sharper. This one experience could actually get me to return willingly to Cheesecake. who knew?!  <br><br>Total bill: 7-8 drinks (dont judge me, full disclosure for your sake!) 4 apps : $60 bucks. not bad for killing happy hour.

This location is a great place and it&#39;s even better for brunch...my gf and I visited this location today and I have to say I wasn&#39;t surprised with the customer service except with the girl at the front on her phone which I don&#39;t really mind but still makes her look unprofessional to other customers...service was great and food was awesome...the only thing that ruined the date that I had with my gf was the customers there...stare much! Completely rude people who think they&#39;re upper class but overall this place was great...would give 5 stars but waitress was more focused on my gf than the fact that she was serving two people

I had eaten at the Cheesecake Factory exactly once in my life prior to Saturday night - and I wasn&#39;t impressed. Yeah, they have everything, but if everything is only done in a mediocre way, what&#39;s the point???<br><br>Fast forward to Saturday and the boy and I have to go pick up catering for a family party. To be honest, when he told me that his dad went with Cheesecake Factory, I was pretty disappointed, but free is free and I wasn&#39;t gonna complain.<br><br>The Grove on a beautiful Saturday night right before the Holidays is a scene. There&#39;s no way around it. We managed to find parking and fought our way thru the crowds (there was some sort of holiday show going on which made it even MORE crowded) but once we found our way into the Factory they made sure it was smooooooooth sailing.<br><br>Once we gave the clerk our name and told them we had a catering order it was Mr. K this and Mr. K that. They were practically falling all over themselves to make us happy. They went thru the contents of each box with us, provided us with help out to the car and the manager made an appearance as well, making sure we had his business card to call him if we ran into any issues. I mean, it was all just a little over the top - in a good way.<br><br>When we got the food home, I was surprised! It totally didn&#39;t suck and to be honest I actually liked the Chicken Madeira alot. It was pretty damn tasty. And the Avocado Eggrolls were pretty good too! Oh and the Pumpkin Cheesecake.... um. yeah. <br><br>I don&#39;t see myself saying, I really want Cheesecake Factory tonight! But if someone else does, I won&#39;t whine or pout. I&#39;ll just order the Chicken Madeira and smile!

I used to like eating at this place, but NEVER AGAIN!<br><br>The wait time is ridiculously TOOOOOOO LONG for the amount of people I come in with. My boyfriend and some friends took me here for my birthday in January (it was on a Sunday also--LAST YEAR 2008). A party of 8, our wait time was 3 freaking hours! We put in our name at 6 and got to sit down around 9, and didn&#39;t get our food until close to 10pm! Everyone in my group was angry and talked to the manager because people with a larger party number were seated before us even when they put their names in after us!!! Horrible. Service is extremely slow on a regular weeknight, and service in the weekend: lunch, dinner is even worse!<br><br>I do not recommend this place or any other Cheesecake Factory here in Los Angeles. SAME THING WITH THE AMERICANA LOCATION (Glendale)!

This place is the best! Once you enter, the place is really elegant. The stairs, the tables and just the environment itself is absolutely gorgeous. The server is not too shabby. He checked on us a few times, gave us refills, and made sure we are not left out. The only reason why I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is because of &#39;first impression&#39;. The host and hostess look a bit irritated which is not a big deal, but still, they should at least try to be happy.

First time coming to the Cheesecake Factory ever. <br><br>So much food to choose from it&#39;s incredible. It all looked SO good too. I ended up going with a Chile Relleno Burger which was delicious. <br><br>There was a long wait but service was great, food came pretty quickly and our waiter was awesome and constantly keeping track of us. The cheesecake selection is out of this world, I&#39;ve never seen so many things I want to try  (similarly to the menu!). <br><br>Overall it was great. You can&#39;t go wrong coming here.

Seriously the waits for Cheesecake Factory are insane!   I refuse to wait an hour to indulge in this high end TGI Fridays.  Still for a chain, Cheesecake Factory is bomb.<br><br>Good salads, cocktails, desserts -obvi-, etc.<br><br>Wait staff at this location is highly attentive and fairly attractive as well.<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t wait longer than 20 minutes to eat here but the food exceptionally good for a chain and thus, very relaible.  <br><br>Plus, when you&#39;re done you can easily head to the shops or check out a movie.

This place is a disgrace to the cheese cake factory franchise .. My food was ice cold , and the waitress could care less... If you don&#39;t like working with people why are you a waitress again ? Money and time waisted smdh.

I like Cheesecake Factory.. I love this particular one.<br><br>Everyone knows the quality of the food at The Cheesecake Factory - if you don&#39;t, well get on up and get&#39;cha some.. Most everything on the menu is great, and the portion sizes are HUGE.<br><br>Never waited more than 20 minutes for a table here.  (I think their trick of telling you it&#39;ll be 30 minutes, then getting you seated in 15 is fantastic psychology!!)  Their outdoor seating is great, and a little quieter than inside. (They stay busy, and the sound echoes, so you gotta talk pretty loud to hear the people at your table here.)<br><br>Their beer is ICE cold..  I mean, so cold I imagine they probably have ice crystals all over their tap.  Fat Tire freezing.. yum.  Seriously, it&#39;s not usually the place I think of when I want a beer, but they pour perfectly!<br><br>The staff here has been incredibly wonderful. I&#39;ve had the wrong dish delivered to me once, and it was corrected almost instantaneously. Hey, when you&#39;re as busy as they are, mistakes are bound to happen - it&#39;s a matter of how you correct it that makes a difference, and this place just shines.

I love the Cheescake Factory! A lot. Like, A LOT.<br>However, this location always seems to be crowded and busy, which causes a huuuuuge line and the service to take forever. The food? Excellent.<br>I always order the same dish just because I know it&#39;s delicious.<br>Four cheese pasta with chicken. Yum. <br>Is it a little pricey? Not too bad. I&#39;m 16 and pay my own meals and it&#39;s around 17 dollars once I split the cost with my friends. That&#39;s decent for good food.<br>We ended up waiting 45 minutes to get in, and then around 30 for our food to come. That&#39;s why I deducted 2 stars.

The best Cheesecake Factory in LA area in terms of great service and the food! Food is always consistent. I usually order the calamari and in some other locations it comes out a bit over cooked or not as fresh. Then grove location always does it right.

As soon as I walked in to the cheesecake factory I already felt descriminated by the hosts (or whoever the girls are that take you to your table).They were looking at me and my bf from head to toe they didnt great us properly as they did to the others. It only got worse the waitress was not polite, as soon as we got our food she kept coming to our table every 15mins asking if she can put the food in a box we kept telling her &#34;no thank you we are still working on it&#34; out of no where she placed the bill on the table and said &#34;whenever your ready&#34;. <br>The food was not worth the wait the chicken alfredo pasta was dry as fuck it doesn&#39;t hav that creamy texture nor taste. It was a really big disappointment because that day we were celebrating our 3yr anniversary with my bf, I was expecting it to be a relaxing and romantic lunch instead it was very displeasing and it made us feel out of place. When I thought all this racias crap was put behind us.<br>I thought it was only this location so I gave cheesecake factory another chance so I went to the ones in Pasadena and americana ordered something different each visit and the same situation happened I felt rushed and descriminated.<br>The only goood thing about this place is the cheesecakes the oreo one is to die for mmmmmmmmm.

Something about Cheesecake Factory activates my short-term memory loss because I can never remember what I have eaten there.  I&#39;ve always found their food blah and unexciting.<br><br>But last night I came here for a birthday and decided to try something other than a ho-hum salad or burger.  First, I ordered the Well Mannered Martini, which was a dirty Ketel One martini that was made perfectly.<br><br>Our party of 15 was already talking about the avocado rolls before we got there so we ended up ordering 3 plates of it.  They turned out to be pretty fucking amazing if you like big tasty chunks of avo.<br><br>For my main course, I split a bowl of the Thai Chicken Pasta.  It could have used some kick, but I enjoyed it so much that I finally now have a reason to return.<br><br>We were quoted a 2-hour wait for dinner at 7, but were seated well before that.  Our server took very good care of us and right now I&#39;m wishing I had leftovers.

I don&#39;t think the cheesecake factory is the best place to go.  But it&#39;s a very good mix of what you need if you are in a group of people with varying tastes.  All the entrees and appetizers are a very good size.  THere&#39;s always a wait, no matter what time of day you want to go.  My personal favorite is the chicken madeira.<br><br>Try all these cheesecakes, they&#39;re all very good.  A bit on the pricey side, but the portions are relatively big.
