This place is super popular.  This translates into a really long wait time.  Once you get past that, the menu is certainly an effort, as there are so many choices!!  You can have just about anything you want from fish options to omelets.. and everything in between.  It is a bit stressful trying to decide!!  Once you order, the food is fine... portions are large... you will probably end up taking some food home.  The service was OK as well..  The Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t my first choice... but it does the trick when you are hungry.

Came here on a double-date. Typical as other Cheesecake Factory locations except this one is located in the date-oriented central The Grove. Perhaps this is why the lighting inside was particularly dim I assume. The beeper they gave us works well within the radius they informed us of. We got paged whilst meandering in Barns and Noble.<br><br>Service was good despite having been seated in a far off corner/nook. I always enjoy their pasta dishes. Had the one with farfalle, garlic cream sauce and chicken. It was delicious. Could only eat half and saved the rest for hubby&#39;s lunch for next day. Ordered the hot artichoke and spinach cheese dip as an appetizer per usual for us. This has been the most consistent dish of all the Cheesecake Factories we&#39;ve been to. Booths were cozy, as they always are as well. My favorite cheesecake is their key-lime pie one. <br><br>I would love to return here again for another date-night since I love the Grove.

Two hour wait is extremely ridiculous. I end up spending more money than expected to just because of the two hour wait! The waiters are so polite and always on top of your orders. The food is always delicious. A little pricey but not too bad. I don&#39;t mind going there on a casual movie night.

I ve been to here on friday early evening.( there was still 25 minuts waiting)<br><br>Now I clearly see why there is always a long waiting everytime I pass this place.<br><br>Portions huge, and delicious food that includes thai, Japanes, and chinese( of course American and Mexican cuisine)<br><br>Our server was really nice and cared whether we liked our food and were enjoying our time there.( We sat at the booth looking towards the bar)<br><br>we had: <br>avocado eggroll: hot, and a lot of avocado in there<br>Endive salad: deliciously tossed endive and pecans, blue cheese<br>Mai Tai: huge cocktail.. almost like a glass full with orange juice. full of flavor and enough rum<br>Gin and Tonic: strong enough and so fragrant<br>Louisiana pasta(?): We ordered this after seeing the next table got this. such a huge dish with breaded chicken. Two people can share. <br><br>Great experience and we were glad that we didn&#39;t go to Morels or Il paci something right under the parking structure.
Huge menu and large portions of good food. Service is always excellent. This is a busy location so plan ahead for a wait. highly recommend!
Today is very bad service shy said 2 hour Waiting list and get me the Table aftr 3 hour

I had the best pasta here... The server was so sweet and the service was fast. I love coming as much as I can,family restaurant indeed. Of course you can&#39;t leave without having a piece of their famous cheesecake... My fave is the banana cheesecake.

I went here with my 2 month old and my 4 year old before taking pictures with the Easter bunny and it being a Friday had us waiting for a good half hour.  The hostess was really sweet which seems to be getting to be a rare thing.  Brandon was our server and he was great!  We were greeted by him within a minute of being seated and had drinks in no time.  I got the lemon garlic shrimp off the skinny menu and it was so good.  I wanted to compare the nutrition to my usual pick which was more then twice the calories.  Brandon was kind enough to bring me a nutrition menu.  Simple things like a smile can go a long way when you sit down at such a busy restaurant and the food and service were the best I&#39;ve ever had at any TCF location!

I gave this restaurant a five star review for the overall experience that I had in the past years. The service + the decor + the food + the ambiance + cleanness + the price + the location + the access = excellence. I would accredit the success of the restaurant to the manger/owner, who really have kept it up nicely. I especially enjoy going there with my young kid. The staff make sure to accommodate the family with stroller. For the singletons, there is the bar area, where the cool and young hang out. In this busy town, this place continue to provide a decent dining experience at an affordable price for people of all ages.  I recommend it!

Came here with a few friends to grab lunch. this cheesecake factory is located in the grove so there is plenty of parking since u park in the parking garage. on top of that, if u eat here, u get validation (which is good for 2 hrs of parking). <br><br>i really like the initial feel of this cheesecake factory because when u enter this cheesecake factory, the host/hostess greets u and then u go up the escalator to go to the desk in which they go ahead and seat u. just the fact that you go up the escalator just makes u feel like a little high class. haha.<br><br>anywayz, we got the pasta de vinci, the bistro shrimp pasta, this one hamburger (unfortunately i totally forgot the name of the hamburger my friend got) and this new shrimp dish they have on their specials menu here. along with that, we decided to try out their new warm crab and artichoke dish.<br><br>for starters, the crab and artichoke dish was quite tasty. like when it first comes out, ure kind of like, that&#39;s it? because its pretty small but the actual crab in the dish is very good. kinda tastes like a crab salad. and then they give u some crostini bread pieces to eat with the crab dip and the bread pieces are like crisped perfectly. i would definitely say to try this new appetizer. <br><br>man i forgot how good the pasta de vinci is here! this is a penne pasta that comes with this light brown wine sauce and it just makes the dish so darn savory. on top of that, it comes with nicely cooked mushrooms and small juicy pieces of chicken. yum! i couldnt try my friends shrimp dish that he got cuz he was sick, but he told me that it was pretty darn tasty. along with that, the bistro shrimp pasta is tasty as well. just a hint for u with that pasta though, ask for some lemon and squeeze it over the pasta and it just makes it taste amazing. lemon just makes seafood taste so good :-)<br><br>on top of that, the waitress we had was quite friendly as well. its always nice to get good service.
Great service and friendly staff. Delicious sangria!! Food is always amazing!!! Favs include chicken piccata, tacos, text next rolls, and all of the seafood plates.

As always cheesecake factory did not disappoint. I enjoyed the club sandwich and my kids had pizza and a shrimp sandwich and the eggs rolls. Everything was delicious and service was prompt and courteous.  The best part of the meal was of course the cheesecake!  This time we had the smores and it was one of the best I have ever had!

Been to cheesecake more than I can count.<br>This time, my boyfriend and I went to the one at The Grove. <br><br>Same menu, same very delicious bread, and same decoration as every other cheesecake factory out there.<br>The one nice thing about this restaurant is that it is on the second floor of the grove so on a very nice day, you can sit outside the patio and overlook the whole place.<br><br>I ordered the BBQ chicken salad. <br>I expected the salad to be pretty heavy because... well, it&#39;s bbq sauce and ranch. But to my surprise, the ranch was very light and was perfect with the crisp salad. I wouldn&#39;t say this is the best salad but it was good enough.<br>And, the portions are HUGE so it&#39;s always good to share a plate with someone else you know.
Miso Salmon is my fav. And for desert I love the strawberry shortcake. Its a big biscuit with vanilla icecream in the middle, topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream. Yummy!!!

Deal with the wait, every time I come here (not just this loc.) there is no way that you can sit and eat right away.   When it comes to food at least 2 person can share it. Complimentary breads are serve while waiting for your order. Love their STEAK DIANE, CHICKEN MARSALA AND MUSHROOMS, CHICKEN PICCATA and Oreo milkshake

I love coming to eat here with my family. The food is extremely delicious. They have such a diverse menu that I always have trouble choosing. Obviously they specialize in cheesecake, but they also have a large selection of soups, salads, sandwiches, and a little bit of everything in between. And their portions are nothing to scoff at, either. Although they do have healthy menu options, I would be hard pressed to show self-control if I came here and  was on a diet. Other than that, though, I can find nothing wrong with place. And the staff and waiters are also very friendly and attentive.<br>If you&#39;ve never been here before, (and aren&#39;t counting calories), I suggest trying the Kahlua Chocolate Cheesecake. It is decadence on a plate. Or if you&#39;re coming here for breakfast or brunch, you cannot go wrong with a Monte Cristo Sandwich. It&#39;s the strangest, yet most indulgent sandwich I&#39;ve ever tasted.
Go during happy hour which is 3-6. 5 dollar drinks like long island Ice teas and an extensive food menu with items ranging from $5 to $7.  I always enjoy myself and I invite friends quite often.

Every time I come here it literally takes them 15 min to bring us our drinks and that means water or anything else. We even timed it once. Same with checks, the waiters are no where to be found and when we finally hunt them down it will still be another 20 minutes until we are waking out of the door. And this is anytime, not just weekends

Cheesecake Factory is a pretty consistent restaurant. I wish they would narrow down their menu and really work on the flavor and quality of their dishes. Two entrees,  two drinks,  and two appetizers came out to about 90 bucks..pretty hefty for the quality of food you get even though the portions are big. I ordered the cajun pasta but it was just a brickload of pasta w.nothing but olive oil and overseasoned chicken and shrimp thrown on top..supposedly one of their best dishes.I highly disagree. It was a great dissapointment.  The wait here was about an hour and from being here before,  I know the wait is usually that long.  Its an okay place to come when your w.a group and looking to find a chill place where you can be loud. But dont come here if you&#39;re looking for affordability.

I came here for dinner with a group of friends on St. Patty&#39;s Day. They seemed really busy but we were seated right away. I was really impressed with how well staffed they were.  It seemed like all the workers helped each other out. Our server was great, even with all the chaos she was so professional and took her time to make sure she got everyone&#39;s order right. We had some tough orders, as one of my friends had to make sure everything she got was gluten free and most of us wanted substitutions!  Nice thing is that they have several gluten free options for those with restrictions.  The interior design of the restaurant is impressive. They have a tall escalator to take you to the seating area, and they have booths by glass windows that give you a great view of the Grove. I saw them, but unfortunately we didn&#39;t get seated there. The food was tasty, I got the Crispy Shrimp Sandwich which was good. The portions are large as well. The only bad thing was that the lighting was so dark we couldn&#39;t really read the menu without using our phone flashlights. Other than that this is a great place for dinner. I guess the low lighting might set the mood for a romantic date.

We were there last night and I had shibashi steak food was very good<br>But our problem was with service no waiter to clean the table he was on brake for half hour he brought the food and was gone nobody came to check <br>On us most of the time we were looking for a waiter to ask for something <br>For me and family last time cheese cake factory in the grove.

The only bad thing I can say about this restaurant is the wait times. Every time I come here is absurdly long even if there are only a few people ahead of us. The food is pretty decent; can&#39;t say I&#39;m in love with it though. Decent dining experience though it&#39;s not exactly my place to go.

The Grove is very busy tonight, as Katy Perry is here. It wasn&#39;t hard to get a table at all. Our service was quick, as we were immediately brought our drinks and bread. The ambiance is nice, though not very private.  <br><br>The terrific thing (in my opinion) is the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu. They offer everything from cocktails and appetizers, to entrees. It&#39;s full menu as opposed to many places which offer only a few items.<br><br>I ordered the skinnylicious burger with a green salad.  The burger, ordered medium well, was juicy and flavorful.  It was very filling. I also got a skinny cosmopolitan, which was really... Well... Skinnylicious! :)<br><br>I highly recommend this cheesecake factory. Even on busy days, it is nice and pretty relaxing.

A lot of people have complained that the wait for a seat was long, and that is true on Friday Saturday &amp; Sunday when The Grove is the busiest.  But that is what you have to expect when you want to dine at a popular restaurant. <br>My wife and I were there yesterday; it was a cold Monday night, 7:30 pm.  The place was busy, yet we got a seat in one minute.  The food came quickly, and the service was very nice.

*ELEVATOR ISSUE*  This morning my wife and I took our 5-month old child to the Grove for brunch.  We used the elevator from the lobby because we had the baby in a stroller.  When the elevator reached the second floor it abruptly jolted, made a huge bang and dropped about 5-10 inches.  The elevator repeated this sequentially about 7 times.  It then got quiet for a second - I told my wife i thought we were stuck - and then the doors opened.  We were not injured, the baby was not hurt but it was scary (SERIOUSLY).  It frightened me enough that when I got off I couldn&#39;t control my laughter mostly because it really scared the crap out of me.  My wife was not amused.  For context: I&#39;ve had the misfortune of being stuck in an immobilized elevator for about three hours in college and it didn&#39;t bother me one bit.  I am not claustrophobic and am generally a calm person.  Whatever this elevator was doing was no-joke scary.  My issue however; is not with the elevator - it is with the nature of which our reporting it was summarily dismissed as if it were not to be taken seriously.  I am no elevator expert but it could be a serious safety concern and it needs to be checked by a licensed elevator service repairman.  My wife reported it to the hostess who seated us.  To be fair, I was laughing becuase I was relieved that I didn&#39;t do a Final Destination into the ground floor but I, too, reiterated to the hostess that something was really wrong with the elevator and nobody should be using it until it gets checked.  The hostess was young and may have not fully grasped what we were relaying so we, again, reiterated to her that this was not funny and needed to be addressed.  She immediately acknowledged this and took it more seriously when we insisted we weren&#39;t joking and she began to report it to her manager (I think it was the manager) who just dismised her entirely and said something to the effect of, &#34;yeah I will check it just get these people seated.&#34;  The manager&#39;s dismissal was wholly unprofessional for the following reasons:  1.  We were complaining to a hostess of probably 18 years old who was clearly not the person to handle this complaint and when she escalated it to her manager - the woman (a blonde in her mid to late 40&#39;s) did not say one word to us.  She was more worried about getting the brunch crowd seated than a potentially serious safety complaint.  At the time there was nobody else waiting.  She had time to address us and chose not to.  2. We had a baby in a stroller on the elevator.   Nobody said, &#34;hey we are sorry, let us check that out&#34;.  It would have at least been small comfort that the next person wasn&#39;t going to get demolished by a broken elevator.  3. The manager could not have cared less and never asked us to specifically describe what happened.  Just usher us on to the table and back to work.  I did see the manager go get on the elevator, I think ride it down and back up.  She got off and that was that.  Never a question about specifically what went wrong, what was she looking for, etc...<br>We sat for the next few minutes discussing how sad it would be if someone got seriously injured on the elevator because nobody was listening.  We relayed the information to the couple who joined us a few minutes later and eventually got on with our meal.  I&#39;d like to make sure whoever reads this understands that my complaint is not with the hostess or the elevator problem itself - but with the casual dismissal that the manager gave in not caring the least about a potential safety issue.  Unless she is some kind of qualified elevator technician - her riding it up and down once hardly counts as checking it for a safety issue.  Please have someone that checks this kind of thing (probably have one that works for the Grove, it&#39;s a huge place) look into this ASAP.<br>As an aside - about my dining experience:<br>1. My coffee was luke-warm when I got the first cup.  Whatever, it tasted fine, I drank it and usually finish a cup of coffee by the time it&#39;s reached room temperature anyway.  I do have my doubts as to whether or not it was made this morning.  It&#39;s been in a mug or pot overnight and was slightly warmer than tap water.  When it was refilled it was the proper temperature of a fresh cup of coffee.  This it NOT a complaint as I really don&#39;t mind, just an observation for Quality Control.<br>2. When seated my table was greasy with butter streaks.  It&#39;s not likely someone already had a meal since this location only opens 25 minutes before we were seated so whoever wiped the table down did not go a good job.  I had to use my napkin to wipe off the butter streaks.  It was clear someone with a seriously dirty table cloth had wiped it off but was still super gross to set my arms in butter streaks.  This was the only uncool part of my actual dining experience. I did not complain to anyone about this and wiped it up myself - also not a huge deal as I am not a little baby.<br>3.  Our waiter was great.  A young guy, super cool.

You know what you&#39;re getting with The Cheesecake Factory and The Grove deliver well enough. No complaints. The Luau Salad is big enough for my girlfriend and I to share and feel full which makes for a great cheap eat at The Grove.

I was very unhappy with my last visit here. I went for my sister&#39;s birthday recently and got a big fat disappointment handed to me. Our server sucked. At first, he was on break so this other girl was covering for his tables, so she didn&#39;t care if she gave good service or not. Who cares right? She&#39;s not getting the tip. Then he came back acting like he&#39;s been our server the whole time. Oh, and everything took so damn long. I think we were in the restaurant for over 2 hours. Oh wait, we were. I paid $3 for parking on my way out, even with validation. Anyway, seated on a table too small for a party of 5, this is how the whole night went...<br><br>No real server.<br>No good service.<br>No good food (the one in Beverly Hills is better).<br>No refills.<br>No birthday dessert.<br><br>No, no, no. I will not go back. Me no likee...<br><br>***I gave this place an extra star because I&#39;m nice and because our &#34;servers&#34; sang my sister Happy Birthday.*** They still suck!!

if you never been a server at a busy cheescake factory like this one...dont complain. Its busy and most people in LA need there &#34;emotional banks&#34; filled by other people they and want everything and anything at once. Sorry a server is only one person that has 5 tables at once, so stop complaining. Management sucks. You don&#39;t want to know how the food is handled or prepared, or how much butter is in that bistro pasta ( lets just say its a lot more then one whole stick.)  Not a fan. <br><br>The restaurant used to be good, almost formal dinning, it is now another fridays
Simply just the best <br>Amazing food, great drinks, and good service.<br>If you think of food and can&#39;t decide where to go its easy Cheesecake. <br>Love it

Tonight, I went to The Cheesecake Factory at The Americana in Glendale, CA and I was shown three poor tables.  Finally, I asked for a booth.  I was told that there would be a 15-minute wait, even though no one else was waiting, and there were dozens of empty tables.  I talked with Ashley, the Manager, who turned matters around instantly.  I was seated properly and promptly, and was told about their newest entrée, Chicken &amp; Lemon Couscous.  After a salad, the chicken was divine.  I was most impressed what a great job that Ashley and Dimas did tonight to ensure the finest in customer service.  They saved the day.  Thank you.

Love the cheesecake factory, I get the four cheese pasta every time and it&#39;s literally to die for! <br>My only drawback is that due to its locations it&#39;s a tourist trap and for that reason is usually very boisterous and loud-- still love it though!

hmmm  not sure how this place could improve other than the always long wait on the weekends.  I usually get the burgers but the wifey gets shrimp scampi.. the scampi is quite good.  I had the kobe &#34;style&#34; beef... it had grilled onions but the sweet taste ruined it for me... i don&#39;t like sweet burgers. <br><br>nothing beat the cheesecakes though but you have to run 4 hours to burn it off
The best place to try a cheese cake. My favorites ones: Mango (It has mango, passion fruit, coconut in the base, lemon pay), Oreo and Banana. Delicious.

The two stars above are for the cheesecake and that alone! I guess when you go to a restaurant named for its desserts the rest of the menu is kind of superfluous but inedible?? But I&#39;m getting ahead of myself here...<br><br>I&#39;ve only been to the States a handful of times and never experienced this place so I was super excited when some friends brought us. It was extremely busy and the staff were disorganized to say the least. After waiting downstairs we were then called and sent for some more waiting upstairs where the staff gave our table to some one else. After some half hearted apologies we were led to our table and given a menu the size of a book, is there really a need for it to be that long? Not to mention the fact that the lighting is so low I had to squint to read any of it. <br><br>Our waitress returned and took our orders, lemon herb roasted chicken for me. All the dishes came out at different times, around 10 mins between first &amp; last. My chicken was dreadful, overcooked and dryer than the desert. The potatoes were delicious at least. I wished I had ordered the chicken marsala which my companion had and I tasted. It was delicious, moist and tender. The difference astounded me, it&#39;s the same bird!! <br><br>Moving on, our waitress returned and removed the dishes and presented the dessert menu to us with so much enthusiasm I thought her head might explode. Three of us ordered cheesecake, lemon raspberry for me. It was the best dessert I&#39;ve eaten in a long time, so creamy and packed full of flavour. I also tasted the red velvet, heavenly, and the mango key lime, a little sweet for me. <br><br>Our super smiley waitress came back and delivered the bill while we were still eating, a little rude I thought. Ruder still was when she attempted to take it before we&#39;d had a chance to look at it. Very subtle love, next time just say you need the table. I know it&#39;s LA but some people appreciate honesty.

Is it lame to admit that I don&#39;t hate this place? Despite the 1+ hour wait to be seated, the fact that it&#39;s always too crowded and too loud, the fact that there&#39;s always a happy birthday song be sung off-key by the waiters, and the mediocre food, I still go back. Why? Five words: white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake. <br><br>Their salmon firecracker rolls ain&#39;t bad either. But I digress...<br><br>This particular location sucks. I hate that hideous escalator that takes you to the top. So ugly!<br><br>Addendum: I reluctantly went back here with my family and I ordered the lemon herb chicken which came with carrots, watercress, and mashed potatoes. It was okay but at $14.95 and the nearly 2 hours I had to wait to get a table, I really think it should have tasted a whole lot better. But, the pumpkin cheesecake was fantastic.
I have only one thing to say: their Garlic Noodles (with shiitake mushrooms, tomato, parmesan sauce...) are A M A Z I N G.

This chain of Cheesecake Factory&#39;s just may have redeemed the restaurant. I was pleased with my visit. Although, I still do have a few minor complaints. First issue was that it was 11pm and the wait was about 30 minutes, second the seating sucks I literally was right next to two other tables and felt like it was just one big table, and third the restrooms were disgusting; I am not even over exaggerating!<br><br>I ordered the bang bang chicken which I thought was good. Friend ordered the mac n cheese burger and it tasted like a giant big mac with extra salt!! His dish was disgusting. It was a big salty disaster! The strawberry lemonade was the best that I&#39;ve had. The latte was yummy after the meal. Mmm...<br><br>Waiter was very tentative. Although our table sucked, the restaurant appeared to have pretty nice seating for booths. Loud music however, even with that it still didn&#39;t drown out the other tables conversations. <br><br>I think I&#39;ll give this place one more shot. Just because the restaurant was nice and food was good. Ambiance of the restaurant was nice as well.

I&#39;m forever a fan and today&#39;s visit wasn&#39;t that bad. Besides the random guy asking different tables for money... (I know random) my experience was ok. <br><br>I waited about 15 mins for a table. BUT it was so cramped... seating is too close. I was pretty much sitting inbetween 2 parties but I felt like we were all together. Service was fast, food was great. <br><br>I come here for their frozen ice mango drink! yummm!!!! I like their ahi roll and frozen ice mango drink... that was my choice for today. I also like their pastas, sandwiches, soups, salads. Lots to choose from. So it&#39;s good for groups, since there&#39;s variety. As for the cheesecake, I&#39;ll just stare at it in the window... unless I want to walk out 5 pounds heavier.<br><br>Parking sucks! Parking in the building was hectic today... the bathrooms here are nice and roomy. Love the enterance of this location... never been to a CF where you go up to the main floor. This is probably the best place to eat at The Grove.<br><br>The wait and seating arrangment is the only bad thing about CF. Prices is reasonable and their portions are huge. Other then that their food is always yummy, so it&#39;s worth the wait.<br><br>4 stars from me!

Yes, there&#39;s a long wait for dinner, but it&#39;s usually less than the estimated time when I go. Plus you could always wander over to the Apple store or Barnes &amp; Noble while you wait.<br><br>The last time I went, there was a really nice hostess. She had a really bright smile the whole time she was talking to us, and she even asked how our night was going on the way up the escalator. When we left, she said bye and thank you, still with her face lit up.<br><br>The food is kind of hit or miss. It&#39;s either really good, or just eh. Their pot pie and omelet were weird. Nachos are okay. Their sweet tamale appetizer is DELICIOUS, probably one of my favorite things there. Salads are good, pastas are good, and of course their CHEESECAKE is heavenly. It&#39;s okay to come here just for that.<br><br>The times I&#39;ve been to this location, the service has been pretty good. Servers are usually really nice.

I would&#39;ve given this place 5 stars, if they took reservations and the wait weren&#39;t that long. For a pretty popular place, I think they should take reservations, so that people wouldn&#39;t have to worry about a ridiculous long wait if they were to bring a big group. <br><br>As for the food....the only two things I order when I come here is the thai lettuce wraps and pasta da vinci! The thai lettuce wraps are appetizers, but they give you a lot so I eat it as a meal! The vegetables are fresh and I love the sauces that they have! Not exactly sure what the sauces are, but it tastes good :)<br><br>Pasta da vinci....YUMMY. love mushrooms in my pasta. It&#39;s not creamy like some pastas, so you can eat a lot of it! The last time I was there, the pasta was cooked al dente. SO SO GOOD :) I&#39;m craving some right now!<br><br>The portions are huge, so I can never finish it...so I take it home and it&#39;s my lunch for the next day!<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is conveniently located at the Grove, so you can walk off all the calories afterward!

Three reasons why Cheesecake is worth going to occasionally:<br><br>(1) cheesecake - duh<br>(2) their portions are ridiculous. one plate can feed 2 generously.<br>(3) their brown bread whatever it is is delicious!<br><br>Two reasons not to:<br><br>(1) mediocre over spiced/salted/marinaded food<br>(2) their 500 pg menu with advertisement is ridiculous and unnecessary.

EXCELLENT!!! The last time I was at this Cheesecake Factory, it was a perfect dining experience. The weather was warm and I was seated at the outdoor 2nd floor patio overlooking the shops. <br><br>The waiter gave us the best service I had have at any restaurant so far.<br>He was extremely professional, fast, friendly, efficient, and right on cue. <br><br>The menu is a mind-boggling 20 or so pages - which is half advertisements. It&#39;s OK, I dont mind them, they distract my hunger pains.<br><br>I was actually pretty surprised at the prices... most dishes are $10-$20, and they give you a pretty big portion. <br><br>I ate the strawberry cheesecake. It has just the RIGHT AMOUNT OF STRAWBERRY GLAZE and three huge strawberries on it. With lots of whip cream. Oh yeah, baby.
Never disappoints.  Great service and food.  Reasonable price for the amount if food.  Don&#39;t look at the carbs.  1 meal is enough for 2 days.

Service was great but food was horrible! The Cajun chicken was bland and lacking spices and salt. Chicken biscuit was tasteless and not worth the price. Only good things were the appetizers we ordered which were the wings and Thai lettuce wrap. Was very disappointed with the food. Expected a lot more from CF.
Be sure to call in and make a reservation; it gets extremely busy, especially on the weekends. But it was worth the wait; great food and service. Also a surprisingly thorough wine selection.
Food is amazing!!!!! Can never complain!!! Great customer service! So many selections of food!
Deqorrie took great care of us all of our order came out with out any mistake food was amazing we had to culinary chefs in our group no complaints what so ever thanks cheesecake factory
If you can wait awhile to be seating, the food is yummy :0

I&#39;m sure there are better places to eat in Los Angeles. <br>But, this place worked while we wandered around The Grove. <br>Standard food, standard prices...except for my $4.50 lemonade. What a joke!

What can one say about the Cheesecake Factory? It is, indeed, a factory, but not just of cheesecakes - of every other kind of food imaginable, in inexpensive, massive quantities, served in massively sized restaurants that always have a long wait. Surprisingly, given the fact that this place turns over god knows how many customers, their food is very good. I&#39;ve never been dissatisfied with a meal here. Some of my faves:<br><br>Avocado egg rolls (that I shared with Ewa M. last time, yum yum)<br>Factory burger<br>Grilled portabella sandwich<br>Fettucini with chicken and sundried tomatoes<br>Chocolate mousse cheesecake<br>Peanut butter cookie dough cheesecake (hello? delicious anyone?) <br><br>But seriously, there isn&#39;t anything you wouldn&#39;t like. It might not be gourmet, but you will get FULL and you will have LEFTOVERS and you won&#39;t break the bank. Your pants, on the other hand, might be a little tight when you leave. Good for groups.

Love it here, one of my favorite places eat. The wait can sometimes be a bit long...but don&#39;t fear. You can walk a long the Grove and enjoy window shopping. A lot of high end shops. Also during the holidays the tall Xmas tree is gorgeous to look at. I gave it 4 stars because the one at the marina gets the five because it&#39;s by the ocean.

Here&#39;s another location that I love eating while I&#39;m at the Grove.  Portion sizes are huge and not too pricey either.  Food selection is so much better than Grand Lux.  Try the steak thai salad.  All the cheesecakes are to die for.  I took off 1 star since they did bring my the wrong dish that I ordered and didn&#39;t realize it until I was 1/2 through.  They could have offered me something free or at least brought me the correct dish since it was their fault for not bringing me what I ordered.  Also, the 1 less star includes the wait time since we usually have to wait awhile and they don&#39;t take reservations either.

Spiderwick chronicles is a great movie. Dinner after was FABULOUS!<br><br>We had the fried macaroni balls for the appetizer and it was to DIE FOR! it wasn&#39;t too cheesy cuz they have this sauce to balance it out. its just. u have to try it.<br><br>The jambalaya is way to overrated here. it doesnt even taste like jambalaya! its not even the same color as jambalaya! ew and dry shrimp: it was so dry it tasted like chicken.The pomegranite margarita was mm delicious. <br><br>David spade was also dining there as well as that mtv host guy with the hugee hat with the dredlocks? O and we saw that euro guy from &#34;a shot at love&#34; too. ahha<br><br>but obviously, like any other cheesecake factories, it has a longgggggg wait...

Had dinner here last night with the bf. We came around 7, but there was no wait! It was awesome to just walk in and get seated.<br><br>The service is great. The decor and ambience standard of any Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>The food was good too. We started off with the chicken samosas appetizer and bf ordered a Blue Moon while I got the iced green tea. The chicken samosas are good (especially the first bite), but they get too salty after a while. They come with a dipping sauce that was pretty good. I was expecting samosa wrap, but it was more like a wrap on an egg roll. It was still good. The iced green tea is amazing! It&#39;s so refreshing with a sprig of mint. It feels so fresh and clean!<br><br>The bf ordered a chargrilled steak medium rare plus while I got the cajun jambalaya pasta. The steak was delicious. It melted in your mouth. The pasta was good as usual. The pasta was cooked a little more than al dente, but it was good. I liked how it wasn&#39;t all dry-- some cheesecakes make this dish a little dry. Instead, the chicken was so moist and the whole dish was not dry at all! So good!<br><br>Coming back soon!

We lucked out! The wait was not as long as it usually is on a friday night (out the door) so we finally decided to try this location after all these years.  We waited for a table in the bar area with all our friends.  We were told it would be about 45 min wait,but it was only about 30 mins. The service was friendly, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was clean and romantic.  I will be back to this location again IF the wait isn&#39;t too long.

Meh. It&#39;s a cheesy (no pun intended) chain restaurant where tourists go.  Don&#39;t go in with any expectations, and you won&#39;t be disappointed.<br><br>Normally, we would never even go to a place like this. But, after a tiring afternoon of shopping at the Grove, I wanted to pick something up to take home for dinner. <br><br>You have to fight the massive crowd of idjits downstairs to get upstairs to the dining room. I made my way to the take out area and placed my order. That part was fine.<br><br>The bad part? The order took FOREVER and there was nowhere to sit. Nothing. Nada. Not even a counter to lean on. I&#39;ve got a really bad back. So by the time my order was ready, all I wanted was a good pair of orthopedic shoes, a chenille robe and a goddamned nap!<br><br>The only good part? The food. My boyfriend had the Pasta Bolognese and I had the Shrimp with Angel Hair.  Both were pretty tasty. <br><br>But the cheesecake? MAJOR disappointment. The guy who took my order recommended the Key Lime Cheesecake. Not. Good. Kind of bland. Nothing special. Which was shocking, since the only thing you really expect to be awesome at the friggin&#39; &#39;Cheesecake Factory&#39;? Is the friggin&#39; cheesecake.<br><br>I&#39;d probably try this place again. But ONLY if: I&#39;ve called in the order ahead of time, AND I picked a different type of cheesecake AND I went during an off-peak hour to avoid the retards lined up downstairs.<br><br>FYI: gave it 3 stars instead of 2, because the pasta was good.

I have always enjoyed the Cheesecake Factory, until recently. I have been to MANY Cheesecake Factory restaurants MANY times (including the grove location.)  Last night our food was not AND service was not up to their usual standard. The service was SLOW. It was 40 minutes from when we ordered to when we received our food.  We ordered appetizers and they arrived AFTER our meals arrived and remember, the meals themselves took 40 minutes. They explained that there was a shift change which I&#39;d allow some give but this was not acceptable. The manager was nice enough and the waiter tried to smooth it over (I even gave him the full 20% tip, since it&#39;s Christmas) but, our dinner was just not that enjoyable. Even the food seemed kinda lame. There wasn&#39;t enough sauce for my dish and the food just generally didn&#39;t seem very fresh. And now the next morning I&#39;m feeling kinda queasy from it all. Next time I visit the Grove, I&#39;ll be trying a different restaurant and I certainly am not going out of my way to visit any Cheesecake Factory anytime soon! Ask the saying goes... &#34;all good things must come to an end...&#34; seems to now be true for the CF.

I love cheesecake factory. It is a great restaurant for any occasion. Great food &amp; great drinks.. The wait on the weekends can be long. They have like a million and one type of cheesecake if you are in the mood for dessert. :)
By FAR the best service I have ever had. Literally. Deqorrie was our server. Great guy!! Definitely will be back.

The food was excellent and the service was great! I loved our server, though I forgot her name. I don&#39;t have any special menu choices to recommend, because there were so many choices on the menu; just go and experience it :-).

OK, I seriously need to stop eating at Cheesecake Fac.&#39;s but I love them so...<br><br>BUT, this time it wasn&#39;t my decision to come here (surprisingly enough).  I mean we were at the Farmer&#39;s Market, endless eating options, and yet there we were, perusing the million page menu, pretending as if we all didn&#39;t pretty much have it memorized!<br><br>i found this particular location to be one of the nicer looking ones.  Two stories, roomy, but the service...was pretty crappy.  Still I give it 3 stars because the food never disappoints me.  <br><br>However, next time I am at the FM, I will MAKE everyone eat somewhere ELSE!!

This establishment is punishing cash paying customers by shorting the coinage and rounding down the change to dollars.  When I asked the server about it, I was told &#34;it&#39;s customary&#34; for them to round.  The Asst. GM (Robert Hester) couldn&#39;t sheepishly talk their way out of it, mumbled that it&#39;s not policy (but clearly he&#39;s turning a blind eye to it and therefore condoning it), and no one I spoke with asked to see my bill or offered me the change they shorted me.<br><br>If it were a couple of pennies, I really wouldn&#39;t care, but it was $.35, and if they do this enough times in a day the restaurant is reconciling it&#39;s books with an additional couple hundred dollars a day of undeclared cash.  <br><br>The food is not horrible, but remember to pay with plastic if you go here.

Nah. Didn&#39;t like this place.  Silverware was missing. Drinks took too long to bring. Watered down. We had to ask for the bread and that also took too long to bring. Waiter seemed inattentive.  just didn&#39;t like it there and won&#39;t be going back.  Food was so so.

The Cheesecake Factory=Happy times. :-) Does it ever differ? Not really. <br><br>This is a plus for the chain. As far as I&#39;ve seen, there isn&#39;t one &#39;shady&#39; CF &amp; another dripping w/ glitz. They are--to the chain&#39;s credit--uniform; service is friendly across the board. <br><br>Petit Filet Mignon is well-prepped, &amp; the accompanying french fries are duly soaked in culinary juices. Mmmm. ((stomach growling))<br><br>Dessert? Who has room? But it&#39;s a MUST. <br><br>You just don&#39;t go to a place like the CF &amp; not get the obligatory hunk o&#39; cake. It defeats the purpose; you could&#39;ve gone to a steakhouse if you merely wanted tasty chops. <br><br>You came here for the extensive cake menu! <br>You know... the Reeses Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake, Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake, Snickers Bar Chunks and Cheesecake, Craig&#39;s Crazy Carrot Cake Cheesecake. (I can&#39;t breathe!)<br><br>Just get your lard-laden buns to the CF, &amp; worry about booking a double appointment w/ your trainer tomorrow. Your midsection won&#39;t kill you! (It&#39;ll just turn into a cheesecake-muffin top. *Cute* O_O)<br><br>This place is popular: wait times can be 40-50 minutes. Bring your Nook. ;-)

The place was full of people on Saturday night so we sat and ate at the bar. My friend kept annoying the bartender Aaron who politely put up with his constant nagging. Anyways, we had a plate of the factory nachos which, if people still said &#34;da bomb&#34;, that plate was da cheese bomb! <br>Unfortunately by the time I was done with the massive plate of nachos and jalapeño war with my friends I had absolutely no room in my stomach for the beet and goat cheese salad. <br><br>......you can never trust a person who doesn&#39;t like goat cheese because they&#39;re lying. With that said, good times are an always at Cheesecake Factory

The reason for one star:  waiter was inattentive.   Although not busy at 2 PM other tables were getting serviced except ours and others seated at the edge of balcony. Our bread was given to the next table since theirs was dropped.  Finally got the bread minus butter after cold food arrived.   The food was good but minimal.  Complained to manager who apologized profusely. They took my number because they wanted to talk to me.  No phone call.  I guess they don&#39;t care.

My husband and I grab dinner at the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove. I order a Pineapple Mojito and the waiter that night took forever to place our orders! When my Mojito came out I saw something dark and weird on the mint garnish. I thought it was fake and when I looked closer, I saw a huge slug crawling on the mint leaf! Our waiter wasn&#39;t coming around, so we got the attention of another waiter and had him take it back. The manager came to apologize and told me that they&#39;re produce and herbs all came fresh from the farmer&#39;s market. Does that mean they don&#39;t wash it? I mean this slug was huge! I don&#39;t know how they missed it.<br><br>They gave me a replacement drink, this time with no slug, but when we got our bill they charged me for the drink! I should have complained, but I was too tired and didn&#39;t want to deal with it.
It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory.  The menu&#39;s too big, the place is too loud and the wait is always too long.<br><br>I don&#39;t eat there unless I have to.
XLT Santa Fe Chicken Salad. I love this Place.

Food outstanding!  Service, way below average.  <br><br>It&#39;s been awhile since I&#39;ve dined here.  I remember the food always being great, and it was great again.  However, on this visit, I took note of how the restaurant took special care to label items on the menu like &#34;Gluten-Free&#34;, &#34;Contains Dairy&#34; or &#34;Nuts&#34;.  There&#39;s even a special, separate, low-cal menu.  For a restaurant like CHEESECAKE FACTORY, which has such an extensive menu anyway, to include extra touches such as these is, well, impressive.  I&#39;m a diner with more than one serious allergy and it&#39;s nice to have a well-known choice in my wheelhouse, so thank you Cheesecake Factory!  You even had a piece of cheesecake I could eat.  I&#39;m still smiling.<br><br>Unfortunately, our server, was aloof when he was taking care of us but mostly not there at all.  He greeted us with, &#34;I&#39;m going on my break.&#34;  I&#39;ve worked in the service industry for over twenty years and I understand breaks need to happen and there&#39;s never a good time for them; however, his opening line was terrible and the service was worse.  About ten minutes later, we received our water and bread (we were ready to order and he still hadn&#39;t gone on his break) but he didn&#39;t ask, he just dropped the water and bread and left, not making eye contact.  Finally, another server took our order.  Our food came (and it was amazing thank goodness).  I had to ask for more ketchup from three different people.  Finally, our server brought it to me after he came and went to the table right next to us about four times.  We had to ask for iced tea refills and struggled to actually find someone to ask.  When we finally received more iced tea, we were finished with our meal.  We had to ask for dessert menus and then only my friend received one, I had to ask for one too, again.  When the cheesecake arrived, we had no silverware.  Our server dropped the cheesecake and disappeared for about five minutes saying he would be back with silverware &amp; napkins.  I&#39;m not sure why we needed a new napkin for dessert.  When he returned he presented a mis en place filled with silverware, indicating for us to grab our own silverware, but never actually speaking to us.  Really?  Is that sanitary?!  What if I had the flu?  And I&#39;m digging into the mis en place where ALL the other guests are also grabbing their silverware?  It seemed rather odd to me.<br><br>One thing I was grateful for regarding our server, he asked if I had a parking ticket to validate.  I did.  And if it weren&#39;t for his reminder, I would have forgot.  This one little gesture is how I know our server didn&#39;t mean to give bad service.  Maybe he was new, still working out his procedure, his style, I&#39;m not sure.  I don&#39;t write reviews often unless I feel someone can learn something.  In this case, I think it might be important to review the basics with some of the younger wait staff.  MAKE EYE CONTACT.  No silverware, no food!  Communicate but don&#39;t share information your guest doesn&#39;t need to know (find a mature delivery).  Go out!  Be a diner at least once a week, it creates empathy for your guest.  But the most important thing, ASK FOR HELP WHEN YOU NEED IT.<br><br>I love The Cheesecake Factory.  It&#39;s my parent&#39;s favorite restaurant.  I send them gift certificates all the time!  I&#39;m not trying to be harsh, just trying to help.

This is absolutely the worst cheesecake factory experience I ever had. I thought the grove would be a nice place too but the experience her was dampened, first, by the rude greeter upstairs at the check-in. I ordered Cajun &#34;littles&#34; and I need more sauce shortly after 3 strips and no one came to check on us for 20 minutes. We had to scavenge to look for someone walking by. No one was paying attention. Our server could have gave us a quick check-in but he didn&#39;t. But I think they are extremely short staffed. And the server stopped by each neighboring table to serve drinks and take over and didn&#39;t once look up to see if we might need something. I understand he has his hands tied but management needs to have additional people walking by to check on tables for him or better train their servers. My sister&#39;s water cup is empty and no one offered to refill it yet. And my chicken strips are cold for waiting to get someone&#39;s attention to get my another dipping sauce. I&#39;M SO ANGRY about it that I&#39;m sitting her writing this review instead of eating the rest of my meal. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE! No one has checked in on us even once!! We are still looking around for people so we can even grab the check. Never ever coming back here ever again! TRASH service

The Cheesecake Factory is usually hit or miss in some areas, but the one in The Grove is always excellent! My friend &amp; I went for a quick lunch &amp; were seated quickly even though it was busy :) Got a few appetizers &amp; the S&#39;mores cheesecake to share, and it was amazing! We sat in the bar area and even though it was happy hour it wasn&#39;t too over crowded. If ever back in the Fairfax area again we&#39;ll be going back :)
I was there yesterday , I loved their steak and baked potato . Our server was very nice and friendly.

I&#39;ve eaten here so many times! Love the happy hour because i can get avacado rolls! Soo good! And a drink for 10 bucks! It can get really busy here through so I wouldn&#39;t come with a big group unless you wanna wait a while. I just go sit at the bar because waiting takes too long.

They give big portions here but you need to know what to order because sometimes the food comes out soggy and disgusting.  I advise fried foods when coming here and the pasta is really good too.  I never went here as a kid but again the fried food is very good.
The server Paul was nice. Also the food was very delicious. Recommended for any cheesecake lovers...

Brought my mom here for valentine&#39;s day , didn&#39;t wait at all we got there around 3. Our server was Jimmy at the beginning , worst swevice ever .  First of all He leaned in on our table as if we knew him didn&#39;t write down our order and when we asked questions he answered with a rude tone . We decided to move tables because we sat in the first table and my mom couldn&#39;t get up with out bumping into someone his answer was &#34; we are getting a rush it&#39;s going to be loud an people will be everywhere &#34; I&#39;m a server my self and never have I ever answered anyone like this it&#39;s your job to make sure we have a great experience and make people comfortable.  I mean we did spend over 200 dollars . Anyways once he said we were getting another server I was so glad . I forgot her name but she was a lot better . She could have been a bit more welcoming but her service was wayyyyyy better than Jimmy&#39;s.  Ohhhhh an once I got my food they had given me mashed potatoes instead of French fries he came over an said &#34; I got everyone&#39;s order correct!&#34; I said no I asked for French fries not mashed potatoes , his answer was &#34; well u have French fries there so u got them so everything is good &#34; not even a apology maybe write down ur orders next time and try being a little nicer!! Doubt I&#39;m coming back here I honestly rather drive further for better service .

Me, my husband and  four others family members total 6 of us, were there to celebrate family reunion ON SUNDAY DEC. 11, 2016. After over 2 hours of long wait we finally being seated. We were so hungry and can not wait to have our dinner. We ordered 2 appetizers, drinks, beers, margaritas and 6 main courses. One of the appetizers the buffalo wing was so salty, the thai lettuce was ok, out of the six main courses four was owful, 3 ribeyesteaks should be medium rare but came as one was badly dark burned, one was taugh, 2 salmon dishes, one was ok, the other salmon thai glazed salmon was not came in whole, but there was big missing huge piece at the corner like some just took bite of it, which I pointed out to the waiter and he was ignoring me st first but I insisted to be brought back, even though I was hungry, I will not eat something like that. We are talking about gygiene issue here and it was really gross. Finally he took it back but the chef did not make a new dishes, there were new salmon but the rice and vegetable was all cold and I was really loosing my appetite now after long wait and had disgusting with my fish. The other family member was not happy too, not only the ribeyesteaks was not good like the other cheesecake, the angel hair pasta was saugy and really not a pleasant experience for the whole family. I wrote a letter on the online cheesecakewebsite on Monday a day after the dinner took place, to cheesecake corporate office, but still have not heard anything. This is unacceptable and the Cheesecake management should train their restaurant employees to follow a good HYGIENIC MANNER, BECAUSE IT WILL EFFECT YOUR PROSPERITY AND ESPECIALLY CUSTOMER HEALTH.

While we ate the bread, we needed more butter and asked a waitress for butter. Her answer was wait a few minutes and never showed up with it. But our regular waiter came after about ten minutes and was great. I had the white chile which was fairly good. My wife has the salmon salad which was also good. Nothing was great except for all the cheese cake. I think I&#39;d rather come here for desert.

I don&#39;t like the food at the Cheesecake Factory.  I like their cheesecake.<br><br>My friends hold the same sentiment, but I think it was the desperate gurgles of our empty stomachs that compelled us to eat here, instead of looking around for better food &amp; returning to CcF for dessert...  yeah, we should&#39;ve done that.   But alas, when we left, we were too full to even ruminate the thought of their amazing cheesecake.

Because its at The Grove, this Cheesecake Factory is always busy.  You will certainly have a good shot of seeing a celebrity or two as well.  Even though they are busy (and with their expansive menu), the food is always prepared well and the service is great.  Portions are big and you certainly get your monies worth.
This restaurant is great. Awesome food, pleasant atmosphere, and excellent service everytime.

I have been to the Cheesecake Factory a million times but this was my first time at the one at the Grove. <br><br>I have to say that the food at CF is pretty consistent and solid.<br><br>I had the Jambalaya and it was good.  The dish was piping hot with noodles cooked just right with a very thin layer of sauce/seasoning to coat the noodles so they weren&#39;t dry.  It was nice and spicy with lots of chicken and shrimp.<br><br>During the dinner, they dimmed the lights so it got kind of dark which was a little weird  - maybe they were setting the mood for couples ;O)

Don&#39;t care for Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>When you grow accustomed to unique, home-cooked style food, a place like Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t cut it anymore. But in comparison to my other Cheesecake Factory experiences... It seems to be a place that&#39;s all about how much you get rather than what you get. I got a Chicken Caesar salad that seemed quite bland. <br><br>The decor of this place and placement of tables in this place appears to be lacking. It feels more about stuffing people in than letting people relax as we were seated right next to the escalator where people go up. Anytime there&#39;s a spot for people who aren&#39;t eating to watch you eat... that&#39;s a big turn off for any restaurant. <br><br>It&#39;s not bad enough to qualify as two stars, but it&#39;s not great either. Three star mediocrity for me.

This location at The Grove is very crowded and the wait very long. We got a great table for 2 on the outside patio which was great. I ordered off of the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu which was a mistake. The Chicken Salad Sandwich was mediocre at best with a very small portion of chicken salad on dry toasted bread. The celery was abundant and very few almonds. Nothing like they described on the menu. It came with a side salad which was lettuce with vinaigrette dressing. I originally ordered the turkey burger but the waiter said the turkey meat was not good and they could not serve it. Ok weird!  They redeemed themselves with the cheesecake though. I ordered the lemon meringue pie cheesecake and it was awesome. I got it to go and had to stop myself from finishing it when I got home. Service was adequate and server friendly. Go for the cheesecake and order an appetizer instead of anything on the skinny menu!

The grove location is convenient, but hate the long lines here... Anyway, on to the dishes...<br><br>Chinese chicken salad<br>Fried Mac and cheese with marinara sauce appetizers<br>Crab cake appetizers<br>Miso salmon<br>Chicken Madeira<br>Shrimp scampi<br>orange chicken<br>Crispy beef<br>Chicken Marsala<br>Louisiana chicken pasta<br>Chopped salad<br>White chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake is my absolute favorite<br>I just tried their key lime cheesecake and it&#39;s delicious.<br>I used to eat the carrot cake on Beverly dr, and it&#39;s the best carrot cake and frosting I&#39;ve ever tried. Yums!<br>Oh I used to like their white chocolate raspberry latte but it&#39;s not on the menu anymore...<br><br>I like their food even though it&#39;s like chain restaurant.<br><br>Oh, last time, they forgot our crab cake appetizers and the manager gave it to us for free. So nice right?<br><br>But then another time, their service was super slow and like practically non existent.<br><br>Oh and another time I forgot to print out the coupon for free cheesecake for every $30 spent, and the manager came and said it&#39;s ok cos I showed him the email on my new iPad haha.<br><br>So basically, the service is up and down, but the food is good. I wish they would open this franchise in hong kong, cos i&#39;ll be moving there soon. And. I mean, they have cpk there, which I would say is this restaurant&#39;s competitor, but I understand that rent is super high there.<br><br>Anyway, yes, love cheesecake factory. Both at the grove and Beverly drive. :)<br><br>Oh and also, I always get birthday cakes from here for my friends, and myself haha. White chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake!
Good food HUGE portions!  Service is alright.  Takes forever and a day to get a table since it&#39;s at the grove.  Be prepared to wait 45 minutes to an hour for a table.
I had take out and it was just as good as if I had dined in... I had the herb crusted salmon with mashed potatos and broccoli... sounds simple but it was simply delicious!!!
I&#39;m disappointed. Meatloaf was salty!  The cups of hot water for the tea I ordered stank like sewer water!
This place is awesome ,the food is good ,the service is great ,I like the chicken pasta really good.i highly recommended this place to anyone.

People who complain about the wait time are just flat out stupid. This place is always pack. All the cheesecake factory&#39;s I have been to always have a long wait time. Obvious the food is good that&#39;s why is always packed. The food is really good and people complaining about the prices are just flat out cheap. This place has big portions for pretty good prices. So good that I always take food home and have a lunch for the next day. Good food and great cheesecake. Why complain?

One of my fave restaurant of all ----<br><br>Good fried calamari, their strawberry lemonade is unbelievable good, nothing can beat it. Food is great, the servers are always professional and very accommodating. <br><br>Will always be a fan.

When my family goes here, there would be a lot of people on the waiting list which sometimes gives us second thoughts. But one time we went here as a family of 7, we were tabled right away. I liked that. The food is very good and large. Its worth the money!

Cheescake is always cheescake!!!  You can bet on them with quality and standard they have over the country. My family really enjoy coming to Cheesecake no matter anywhere we go in States then we have to visit one of their branch. Make sure you finish up with tons of selection in cheesecake otherwise you are not there yet!!!

The Cheesecake Factory is centrally located inside of The Grove outside shopping experience. The restaurant has a terrace area which they seem to turn tables more quickly than inside, which is a tip if you are in a bit more of a hurry. That&#39;s a relative term as there are always a lot of people waiting to eat here. The chairs outside are slightly smaller and not that great for those of us who have skipped a few visits to the gym. They do offer a buzzer, but it only works slightly outside of the door and definitely not at the book store next door. The wait time is fairly accurate, so when they tell you an hour and a half, go for a walk.<br><br>The biggest difference about this location over others, is that you are escorted up escalators to get to your table. There are no tables on the first floor. There is an elevator in case you need it. The bar is on one end of the restaurant but unfortunately drinks do take extra time to get refilled and delivered.<br><br>I&#39;ve been coming to this location over the past eight years plus and each time I have had a different experience. Sometimes, I go for a quick snack down the way at Farmer&#39;s Market to deal with the long wait times. Once you&#39;ve finished with dinner, don&#39;t forget to get your parking pass validated.

The food was fantastic but the service was painfully slow.  We were treated and seated by a friendly hostess, and then left to ponder that kindness for about fifteen minutes.  Our waiter finally stopped swirling through the isle long enough to take our order.  Eventually our delicious food came out and luckily we didn&#39;t need anything else, because who would be there to help us?  Ordered our cheesecake to go because we were falling asleep. Fifteen minutes to pay out.

This location is extremely busy but the service is still awesome. They are attentive and even have someone helping your main server to make sure drinks are filled and bread is plentiful. The portions here are large and the cheesecake is rich and delicious.
5 stars just for its consistency of awesome food, bread, service.

Big delicious meals and nice environment (but noisy). Make sure to make a reservation before you go because it was very crowded. But if you didn&#39;t make one... You may still go and try out as I did, and I got a table for 8 people after some waiting.

The Cheesecake Factory at The Grove was a very nice and beautiful restaurant to hang out with my friends. Although there was little long waiting time, it didn&#39;t matter, because their services and foods were absolutely fantastic!  I had four cheeses pasta that has very creamy sauce with cheddar cheese. After having this dish, I became a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends when they ask me about the restaurant!

Parking at The Grove on the weekend, oi vey!!!  The food is outstanding and the service was excellent!! They were able to accommodate my crazy food request. I wanted a veggie burger but with a combination of other burgers&#39; toppings and no bun, lol!  The veggie burger was made out of black beans, brown rice, beets (which gave it its reddish color) and a few other ingredients.  I added avocado, mushroom, and yes, a slice of bacon!!  It was AMAZING!!!  The cheesecakes are pretty amazing, my favorite being the Kailua Coffee Cheesecake...OH.  MY.  GOD, it is sooo sooo sooo good!!!!!  I liked that the wait wasn&#39;t long at all even though it was pretty busy and they will validate your parking downstairs!

I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factorys all across the country. Some things are the same, some different. Here&#39;s my review of this one (at the Grove).<br><br>One thing, which astonishingly is the same at every Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to: Don&#39;t go here if you&#39;re in a hurry. In fact, if you have any time issues that day at all, don&#39;t go here. Go only if you have a good half day to kill and can laze around eating good food.<br><br>And I&#39;m so serious about that.<br><br>I can&#39;t tell you how many times I raised my own blood pressure when I forgot that about the Cheesecake Factory. If you&#39;ve waited less than a half hour at any Cheesecake Factory, you are doing amazingly well. Plan on an hour before you even get seated. I&#39;m so serious.<br><br>At the Grove, they also have the added hassle of not enough seating while you&#39;re waiting. So, even before you get to the main seating guy, there&#39;s a pre-seating guy outside. You leave your name with him/her, and wait.<br><br>Then, you go inside, and wait some more. If you&#39;re lucky, after about half an hour, maybe you can grab a seat on the one bench they have there.<br><br>Just about the time your skin is crawling and you are thinking: &#34;GOD, screw this! The food isn&#39;t THAT good...&#34; they&#39;ll call your name, or your buzzer will blink and vibrate, and up the long escalator you&#39;ll go.<br><br>Where you&#39;ll be greeted by another seating person. (sigh) And wait. Sigh.<br><br>Finally, finally, you get to your table. Do yourself a favor, immediately. Order an appetizer with your drink, as soon as the wait person gets there. I recommend the firecracker rolls. You will thank me for this later.<br><br>You do this  because you have a long wait ahead of you until you see food, or possibly a server again. Plus, the menu is GIGANTIC. It&#39;s seriously like twelve pages long. The first two pages are drinks. A couple pages of appetizers. Then six pages of entrees. All of them are amazing. Trust me, I&#39;ve had a lot of stuff on their menu.<br><br>This is why you deal with the excruciating, wanna slit your wrists wait. THE FOOD. The food is mind-blowingly astonishingly incredibly awesome. In fact, whenever anyone has said, &#34;Hey, let&#39;s go to the Cheesecake Factory!&#34; there has never been a time I said No.<br><br>One of my most frequent choices is the popcorn chicken, served with yummy mashed potatoes and corn on the cob. But there is everything from Thai choices to pizza to pasta to great salads. Incredible food. And I always always always end up taking it home because there is so much of it.<br><br>Well, that and the fact that you most often want to save room for dessert. Because after all, it is the CHEESECAKE Factory. And when I say they have cheesecake, sweet Lordy, do they have cheesecakes.<br><br>Pumpkin and chocolate and strawberry and hazelnut and peanut butter whatever flavor you crave. Cheesecakes for the holidays. Cheesecakes that you only dream of. Every cheesecake you can imagine. They are all fantastic.<br><br>I have actually gone in there a couple times and NOT ordered any cheesecake, and endured the withering glances from the waiters. Because really, you HAVE to have the cheesecake here.<br><br>There is really no other restaurant that I would endure such a nail-bitingly long wait for, but the Cheesecake Factory redeems itself every single time with their food.

This my go to spot for my girlfriend and I when we want to have a nice dinner at a restaurant with good food, service, and atmosphere. This place will get packed on Friday Saturday &amp; Sunday evenings so expect a wait. The food here is delicious but somewhat pricy but not overpriced because their plates are pretty big that you&#39;ll miss out on their great cheesecakes if you eat your entire plate so make room! Service is great and they validate your parking ticket if you park inside the grove structure. I recommend the lemon-herb roasted chicken or the chicken costaletta... Mmmmmm!
Love the Cheesecake Factory. Staff is always pleasant and friendly. Great menu options. However, I&#39;m a little bombed that they don&#39;t accept reservations.

I&#39;ve gone to many different Cheesecake Factories.  This one was certainly more fancy looking with stairs, escalators and elevators taking you to the second floor to where all the tables are.<br><br>Upon coming inside, my friend and I were greeted with a friendly staff who immediately seated us although there was a wait for those who had a bigger group.  Our waitress was also very friendly, coming over and introducing herself to us, as well as telling us items that were not specifically listed in the menu.  My friend ordered a Jambalaya, which she thought was seafood, but it had chicken in it too...and I ordered the Pecan Crusted Catfish with Mashed Potatoes and and a Corn and Zucchini salad.  This dish was not on the menu and was referred to us by our waitress.  I have to say, it was really really good!!! I enjoyed this dish and so did my friend who ended up sharing with me.  <br><br>Overall, we had a good time at the restaurant.  Liked how the staff was friendly and the service was up to par.  Definitely come here if you have the craving for something from Cheesecake Factory.
Waited 2 hours for a table and were given the shittiest table in the place with no opportunity to wait for another. Wow. Just... Wow.

I&#39;ve been here before and the food is pretty good but I think the menu is a little overwhelming. The most disappointing thing is they don&#39;t make their own cheesecake. It&#39;s made at a bakery and distributed to them.

I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in probably 10 years, but I must say, I was pleasantly surprised by this one.<br><br>First of all, it is beautful inside.  The decor is really nice and the staff was quite friendly, even though the place was super busy.<br><br>I went with 2 other people, and we all tasted each other&#39;s dishes. Everything was very good, and served hot.  The waiter was very attentive and accommodating.<br><br>I recommend going on a weekday if you can, judging by how busy it was on a Thursday afternoon.  <br><br>BTW, the lunch special was great, and you get so much!! I think it&#39;s a good deal for the money.

Cheesecake Factory is simply a standard all over the nation. Everyone likes it, they always have something on the menu that sounds good and they pump people out pretty damn fast, since they always draw a crowd. I really prefer to eat something more one of kind, since i live in such a food mecca....but sometimes the only thing i can think of is Pasta Da Vinci. <br>Pasta Da Vinci. <br>Pasta Da Vinci. <br>Pasta Da Vinci. <br>Pasta Da Vinci. <br>Pasta Da Vinci. <br><br>be still my heart.

Love Cheesecake Factory. Don&#39;t love the long ass line as the Grove to get in! Every time the same story: walking around with that stupid beeper or waiting aimlessly in front of the restaurant where tons of people are passing by and bump into you. <br><br>But fortunately the food make it all up! My absolute favorite are the appetizer avocado rolls!!! This stuff is so good that I might just stop here. But I won&#39;t. They have huge menu selection and their portions are huge as well! I recommend sharing some stuff and leaving space for dessert, cause who does not wanna try their famous cheesecakes? And remember: sharing is carrying:) <br><br>ps. if you don&#39;t wanna wait in line you can hang out in the bar area and if you lucky you can snap a table!

So we went Monday afternoon.<br>Not crowded but a good deal of people for a Monday. But it is the Grove.<br>My Buffalo Blast were a little over cooked which made me sad. I live for those damn things. <br>She and I shared a Double BBQ Bacon Burger.<br>She was smiling and licking pickle juice from her fingers. <br>She seemed so pleased as she dipped her fries back and forth from the  ketchup and buffalo sauce. I love to see her smile.<br>She makes working worth it just to spend money on her.<br>I did not have my usual beer. I did not order my cheesecake. I just took in the beautiful mosaic decor and how the sun from the window glistened from her lips.<br>It was another day for the books.<br>I love the CCF.

My two girlfriends and I went here for dinner last night. Normally CF is pretty solid in terms of their consistency, but this time was a miss for the most part. <br><br>The food was alright, but the drinks were horrible. I had the Chicken Caesar Salad. Our server suggested I get the half order and she was right on. It was huge, it was delish and still at a half order, I ended up taking half of it home. My two friends both ordered the Chinese Chicken Salads. Both were unhappy and agreed that the salads were dry and bland; the dressing had no flavor to it, and would NOT recommend. I took a bite and actually agree, the salad was pretty gross. <br><br>As for cocktails, order doubles if you wanna get your buzz on, otherwise you might as well save the $12 per drink. Our drinks were completely watered down and it took our server over 20 minutes each time to get our drinks out. I could semi-understand if we ordered a Mojito or something blended, but we ordered your basic 2 ingredient cocktails. STAY AWAY from their Long Island Iced Tea. Licking the floor of an adolescent boys locker room would&#39;ve tasted better. Most definitely the worst I&#39;ve had anywhere. <br><br>Other than the Chicken Caesar Salad, everything else, including service, was a bust this time.

The service was good, but there were still problems. My husband ordered a chicken caesar salad with dressing on the side. It came without dressing and without chicken! He had to wait for them to fix it, so he watched me eat :(

Great food. Large portions. Friendly staff. Nice decor.  Lots of selections. <br><br>The one notable problem is that it do darn noisy. <br><br>It is a safe bet if your party has diverse food preferences. The menu is quite diverse.

Food 3 Stars - Service NO Stars<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is the Cheesecake Factory.  Their food will always be solid(depending on your taste that is).  But you would think at a location like The Grove, they would have their sh*t together?  <br><br>SERVICE SERVICE SERVICE<br><br>30 minute wait - Fine<br><br>Five minutes for 1st hostess to seat us - Table not bussed<br><br>Sent back<br><br>Five more minutes for 2nd to hostess to seat us - 2nd table not bussed<br><br> . . .<br><br>20 minutes for us to get the check<br><br>Contemplating DINE &amp; DASHING <br><br>. . .<br><br>Chickened out :/<br><br>. . .<br><br>20 more minutes for them to get my card<br><br>. . .<br><br>Really?

Fantastic lunch today. Started out with Mac and cheese balls that were so creamy and delicious and had one of the best burgers I&#39;ve had in a long time. BBQ bacon cheeseburger with fried onion rings cooked medium rare. Tough to get a burger cooked to perfection but this was indeed! Our waiter was extremely accommodating and knowledgable.
been here a few times, everything I&#39;ve tried is good, and everyone is really nice. but the waiting is the only downfall.

Besides the sometimes long wait times, I cant complain about this place. Food is always good, nice waiters and staff. If the food is bad or wrong just tell your waiter, and they will get it taken care of.

I won&#39;t lie. Our squad can be somewhat difficult to please at times but Sarah straight Steph curried every order we placed. I ordered like 2 dozen of those little blue cheeses and she got every one delivered on point. Respect. Sarah, you the real mvp.

My experience at the cheesecake factory was groovy.  The instant I sat down I was greeted by a beautiful perfectly square napkin which is good because I dislike the normal napkin fold ( i find triangles distracting) I had the privilege to try the smoke house BBQ burger which had wonder full beef (I&#39;m very proud of the cow who produced my burger) along with bacon and a generous helping of onion rings I was stuffed like like a ham... Or turkey which ever you prefer to stuff in your free time. Oh and don&#39;t even get me started on the bread whenever I tried to <br>It squished down which led to me stabbing it repedly and torturing it telepathically.  After that I was thrown out for defacing their bread well let me tell you I will never go back there again!

I wasn&#39;t a fan of Cheesecake Factory until I dined at this particular location at The Grove. I love their menu because it offers homey favorites and finer dishes for a fair price.  Alongside that, I could order the White Chicken Chili one hundred times, and each time, I can almost guarantee that the chef will prepare and cook the dish precisely the same way. As a chain, Cheesecake Factory relies on this sense of menu familiarity with their patrons. For me, this kind of consistency is key when deciding on regular dining spots, as in, I am confident that everything on the menu tastes just as I expect it to no matter what day of the week. Not only that, the outdoor balcony seating is terrific and the staff is always very accommodating and friendly.  I do sometimes get annoyed by the cover artist music selection and the indoor lighting is sometimes TOO dark to see the plate in front of you. This place is always popular, so if they could develop a reservation system in the future, that may be helpful. Regardless, the food is the main component for me, and for that, I enjoy dining here.
Good food ......but long wait time dfntly worth it.....red vlvt chscake is the best
really tasty food in Cheesecake Factory, had a great night with friends, the waiter there can remember everything we ordered without taking any notes, but there were 10 of us. Amazing!

I think the only reason I come here is to get a reminiscent feeling of the days when I thought Cheesecake was the finest dining experience in all of Los Angeles (HA! Boy, was I wrong!) and I loved eating unhealthy &#39;cause I just didn&#39;t care -_- <br><br>Cheesecake is known for their huge portions and you&#39;re really paying the price for the ginormous portions here. I&#39;m talking enough to dine-in and eat for lunch the day after, and in some plates, a mid-day snack. Huge..<br><br>Nearly everything I&#39;ve had was delicious and filling. Pizzas are cooked to the perfect crisp and steaks are grilled to desired perfection. But they seem to all have one thing in common and it&#39;s how heavy these foods are. The salads give off this feeling too. Seriously, after I walk out of here, I don&#39;t feel like going back for another month or two.<br><br>Service is on some days and then back off most days.<br>One time, the kitchen ran out of fuel (Yeah, I know..) after we&#39;d ordered our dinners and received our drinks. As if that wasn&#39;t bad enough, our server made us pay for our drinks, although we explained how ridiculous it was. So ridic.<br><br>As you can tell, I have major mixed feelings about this here, Cheesecake Factory, at the Grove or anywhere else. It&#39;s just somewhere I&#39;d be seen eating once in a long while.<br><br>Oh, my latest experience was the bistro shrimp pasta. It&#39;s delicious, but you know just how bad it is for you when you discover the huge amounts of oil in the pasta sauce at the bottom of the plate. Hidden calories!<br><br>*Free Wi-fi from the Apple Store available :D
will definitely come back, love the shrimp, love the alfredo, love the service, just looooove it!!!!!!!!!!!!
